advanced state of decomposition, with parts of the blade
completely corroded and worn. Despite the decrepit
appearance, its blade is magically sharp and able to cut
meat or steel as if it were hot butter.

this weapon, your Constitution
score is reduced by 1.

it causes you pain. You
must succeed on a DC
11 Constitution check
to avoid dropping
the weapon

The Tajak are a tribe of desert walkers from the Rajas
people. They keep the border of the Volstok Empire safe
from the savage Tuli people sandwiched between the
empire and the the dwarven kingdom of Ungar. The
Tajak have served as the last line of defense against the
Tuli for generations, many kingdoms have employed the
devastating might of the Tajak’s swordsmanship cross-
bred with their ease with the arcane.

name: The weapon’s last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the scimitar
description:
In spite of its obvious
lack of eyeballs, this old
yellowed skull seems to
be constantly judging
you.
eFFeCT
As an action, you can
animate this old skull,
lighting up its eyes with
a pale blue light. Once
animated it must speak
with you and answer
any questions to the best
of its ability. The skull
is well versed in most
topics, and may be able
to give useful advice and
insights, at the DM’s discretion.
The skull also has limited insights into the near future.
This ability effectively works like casting the augury spell,
except that the skull delivers the omen of the spell and can
only be used once per activation.
Each time you animate the skull roll on the table below to
see its current mood. It stays animated for 10 minutes, and
will keep talking even if you have no further questions.
Once used, this ability can’t be used again until you finish
a long rest.
d6     Mood     d6     Mood
1      Wrathful      4      Chatty
2      Sullen      5      Pleasing
3      Suspicious      6      Overjoyed

name: Within 30 feet of you cannot be frightened while you are
type: VERY RAREWondrous item, requires attunement by a warlock
description:
Wrapped in black velvet cloth and bound with glistening
silver twine is a blue leather-bound book imprinted with a
white hand.
eFFeCT
When attuned to this item you gain the following benefits:
• You gain the level 3 warlock Pact Boon feature Pact
of the Tome (PHB p.108). If you already have this
feature, you gain it again but must choose the cantrips
from a different class spell list.
• You learn the misty step spell if you do not already
know it.
Curse
This item is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends
the curse to you. The curse can be broken with a spell
such as remove curse or wish. In order to attune to
78
this item, you
must place your
hand over the
imprint of the
white hand
and complete
a short or
long rest
as normal.
When
attunement
is complete
you suffer
1d10 cold
damage and your left cheek
becomes scarred with the image of a white hand.
By attuning to this tome you have made yourself known
to the Lady of the White Hand, a powerful archfey. If
the curse is not broken within 3d10 days, your warlock
patron changes permanently to archfey if it is not already.
You lose all features associated with your previous patron
and gain the equivalent features of the archfey patron.
From this point on you are bound to the Lady of the
White Hand. Exactly what has happened to your previous
patron is unknown. The Lady may have purchased your
“contract” legitimately or she may have dispensed with
your previous patron in some other manner. If you break
the curse after you have become bound to the Lady, you
will need to seek out a new patron and may very well draw
the ire of the Lady herself.
TrinkeT oF elemenTal
proTeCTion
VARIABLEWondrous item, requires attunement
These trinkets of metal, bone, or wood hang from the
neck or wrist by a leather strap. The element in question
is always represented as a lightning bolt, flame, etc., or a
foreign rune for the element etched into the trinket.
eFFeCT
Each trinket is aligned to one single element: cold, fire,
lightning or thunder. Activation requires one word spoken
softly to the trinket itself. Once the trinket is activated it
will absorb a number of points of damage of the elemental
type the trinket is aligned to. The trinket will absorb either
20, 40, 60, or 100 points of elemental damage of its aligned
type, depending on the quality of the trinket. When the
trinket absorbs its maximum amount of damage it breaks
and can no longer be used.
• Elemental Protection Trinket: Absorbs 20 points of
elemental damage. (common)
• Greater Elemental Protection Trinket: Absorbs 40
points of elemental damage. (uncommon)

name: Troll Claw
description:
This grisly item is a large, green-skinned, leathery hand
suspended from a thick iron chain. The long fingers end in
yellowed claws which flex periodically of their own accord.
eFFeCT
Once attuned, you gain a
regeneration rate of 1d6 hp
every 10 minutes provided
you have at least 1 hp. The
regeneration ability ceases to
function for 1 hour if you are
damaged by fire or acid. The troll
claw does not allow the owner to
regenerate lost limbs.
The troll claw grants you
advantage on Constitution
saving throws against effects that
alter your physical body, such as
polymorph or petrification.
Attunement to the claw requires eating a portion of the
flesh on the item (which promptly regrows). The act itself
is nauseating, and most creatures find stomaching the
flesh difficult. While stomach acid will keep the flesh from
growing, it is never fully digested. Each morning at dawn
you must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or suffer
the poisoned condition for 24 hours. On a successful save,
you feel mildly queasy but suffer no adverse effects. The
poisoned condition can be alleviated via magic, but while
while attuned to this item it can never be permanently

name: Avoided. Three consecutive failed saves causes the creature
description:
The shaft of this arrow is carved from the snow-white
bark of Kelemvor’s Yew, a famous tree in the middle
of Kelemvor’s grandest temple. It is fletched with the
midnight-black feather of a raven that has nested in the
graveyard of the Raven Queen’s first sanctuary for as long
as anyone can remember. The arrowhead is carved from the
grey spine of a long-dead titan. Runes in ancient celestial
are carved into the shaft, and glow lightly when nocked.
79
It has been used to slay tyrants and revolutionaries,
dragons and demons, gods and mortals. No one knows
the entire story of the arrow, as it stretches back for
millennia. The arrow can only be shot once. Upon
landing, it vanishes, to reappear at some other place, in
some other time.
eFFeCT
The arrow is a +1 arrow. When you successfully hit a
creature that has 100 hit points or less with this arrow,
it must make a DC20 Constitution saving throw. On a
failure, the creature dies and it cannot be brought back to
life by any means other than the wish spell. If the creature
has more than 100 hit points, it takes damage as though
this were a simple +1 arrow.
Immediately upon use, whether it hits the target or not,

name: Cast the spell is wasted. In either case, you can’t use
description:
A powerful wizard created this magical weapon in
exchange for power. Using the magic at his command, he
summoned powerful elementals, demons, and celestials
to use in his dark experiments. Extracting the blood and
essences of these beings, he used them to create items that
could topple the heavens. This dark steel longsword was
forged with the blood and soul of a celestial, thus binding
them to it. Over the years the spirit inside has grown
twisted by its rage and now seeks to exert its power to end
those that were the cause of its imprisonment.
eFFeCT
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with
this magic weapon.
Sweet Revenge. When a creature is reduced to 0 hit points
by a hit from this sword, it dies and its soul is drawn into
the weapon. While a soul is trapped in the sword, it deals an
extra 1d6 necrotic damage. The sword can hold 4 souls in this
manner, dealing a 1d6 extra necrotic damage per soul. At the
end of combat, the souls trapped in the blade are released.
Unholy Might. While attuned to this blade your Strength
increases by 2, to a maximum of 24.
Sacrifice. You can use an action to anoint the blade with
your own blood, empowering both yourself and the
sword. You suffer 1d8 necrotic damage and one point of
exhaustion, but gain an additional action every turn for
80
one minute. This
feature can only
be used once. You
regain its use when
you finish a long
rest.
Sworn Enemy.
As an action you
can cast bane on
a singular target
within 30 feet of
you. You can’t use
this ability again
until you complete
a short rest.
Sentience. Vengeance
for the Desecrated
is a sentient, neutral
evil weapon with
Intelligence of 15, a
Wisdom of 14, and a
Charisma of 18. It has
hearing and darkvision
out to a range of 120 feet.
The weapon communicates
telepathically with its wielder
and can speak, read, and
understand Common.
Personality. Whatever the weapon crafter’s original intent
was has long been twisted to meet its own ends. It wishes
to destroy magic users and bring them low for their
hubris. Destroying magical items or tomes also satisfies it.
This purpose is an obsession, one which will become your
fixation as well.
Curse
The desire to kill wizards is so great that upon being near
them, the sword will attempt to force you to do so. If you
are within 30 feet of a wizard and do not attack it within
one minute, you must make a DC 15 Charisma saving
throw. On a failure you suffer 10d6 psychic damage or half
on a successful save. This repeats once per minute until
the wizard is dead or the wielder is more than 30 feet away
from the wizard.

name: Personal Flaw. You gain the flaw: “Shall not suffer a
type: VERY RAREWondrous item, requires attunement by a fighter or
description:
ranger
This quiver makes any bow into a powerful, magical
weapon. The quiver is short and wide, allowing the arrows
to spread out like a fan. The quiver has highly decorative
cross-straps on the front held by circular fittings, and a
triangular bottom plate. One side of the quiver is colored
an ice blue with the other side is a fiery orange. The two
colors meet in the middle into a gradient of purple.
eFFeCT
The quiver appears to only hold 20 arrows, but it can
actually hold 40. The arrows in the quiver are +1 magical
arrows. 20 of the arrows are fire arrows, which deal an

weapon. The quiver is short and wide, allowing the arrows
to spread out like a fan. The quiver has highly decorative
cross-straps on the front held by circular fittings, and a
triangular bottom plate. One side of the quiver is colored
an ice blue with the other side is a fiery orange. The two
colors meet in the middle into a gradient of purple.

name: A number of charges at dawn equal to 1+ the wearer’s
type: Wondrous item, requires attunement by a spellcaster (RARE)
description:
A dark story follows this small spellbook, which is little
more than a collection of pages bound with willow bark.
Rumor has it that the owner of the tome unlocked its
foulest secrets and used them to take the lives of children.
Some say the perpetrator was caught and hanged by a
mob of townsfolk; others say some wandering adventurers
slew the culprit. In either case, the book was left behind.
Full of rituals and notations in no known language, much
of its secrets may remain hidden forever. Those who have
borne it swear it whispers from time to time, as quiet as
wind rustling a willow-tree.
eFFeCT
The tome has 10 charges, which can be expended to create
one of the following effects:
Hex. While holding the book, you can use an action to
expend 1 charge to cast hex on a target within range that
you can see.
Psychic Lash. While holding the book, you can use an
action to expend 3 or more charges and force a creature
within 60 feet to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw,
taking 4d6 psychic damage on a failed save, or half
as much damage on a successful one.You can expend
82
additional charges to increase the damage dealt by 1d6 per
charge expended in this manner.
Curse of Sleep. While holding the book, you can use your
action to expend 1 charge to cast sleep as a 1st-level spell.
You can expend additional charges as part of the initial
action, increasing the spell’s level by 1 for each additional
charge.
The dark tome regains 1d6+1 charges daily at dawn. If
the tome’s last charge is expended, the DM rolls a d20
in secret. On a 1, the book’s notorious original owner is
returned to life, its body reforming in the nearest space to
where its remains were buried. If the owner’s remains were
destroyed, it reforms in a location within 1d4 miles of
you. The DM determines who or what the original owner

name: Of the book was. The owner is always aware of the tome’s
description:
This white club is perfectly smooth and wrapped with
a simple leather strap for grip. The unusual shape is no
doubt due to the fact that the weapon was fashioned from
a huge wishbone and enchanted with cockatrice feathers.
Exactly who thought it was a good idea to create such a
weapon is anyone’s guess, but it is useful nonetheless.
eFFeCT
When you hit a creature with an attack with this weapon
it must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a
successful save, nothing happens and the target is immune
to this effect for the next 24 hours. On a failed save, the
creature is restrained and begins to turn to stone, and it
must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. If
the target fails the second saving throw, they turn to stone
and become petrified for the next 24 hours, after which

type: Wondrous item, requires attunement by a dwarf (COMMON)
description:
“I lost me father an’ brother to tha’ wretched gas. I swore it
would ne’er happen again.”
—Balor Battleaxe
In their traditional mountain homes, dwarves dug deep into
the mountains. Occasionally, as the clans grew larger, they
would branch off and establish new settlements, or undertake
speculative digging in areas that showed promise. Both such
tasks were dangerous work. To help protect his brethren, the
dwarven mage Hjarsson created devices small enough for
them to wear. A wooden canary is a small wooden token,
commonly worn as an amulet or brooch.
eFFeCT

within 30 ft. of the wearer. The canary will emit a low-pitched

name: Weapon reverts to its original form after one hour or when
description:
This wooden broom, which weighs 3 pounds, seems
poised to fly away at any moment.
While partially-sentient, Zephyr wasn’t created with the
capacity for independent thought. Zephyr’s weakness is
its complete inability to fly without a direct command.
Characters may discover the broom resting underwater
near the corpse of its former rider. Arvilla Te’nar was
once a wealthy wizard with a passion for ancient history.
During an expedition deep beneath his home city, Arvilla
failed to outrace the flooding corridors, leaving his broom
trapped beneath a stagnant pool for decades.
eFFeCT
You may mount or dismount Zephyr as a free action. It
then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air.
Zephyr has a flying speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to
400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes 30 feet while
carrying over 200 pounds. When not being used, the
broom hovers near a belt or backpack, instinctually
moving with its owner as if it were physically attached.
While attuned to this item, you gain the following benefits:
Defensive Flying. Anyone riding Zephyr during combat
receives a +1 to their Armor Class as the extremely
defensive broom attempts to dodge incoming attacks.
Sentience. Zephyr is a partially-sentient neutral good
magical broom with an Intelligence of 8, a Wisdom of 16,
and a Charisma of 8. It has hearing and low-light vision
up to 120 feet. Once attuned to a rider, Zephyr cannot be
flown by another creature.
The broom understands spoken Auran and will respond
to commands of flying in any language spoken by you.
While Zephyr cannot communicate, it often makes its
feelings known through more physical means.
Personality. Zephyr has two important personality quirks
which become noticeable to any attuned rider: the broom
loves to fly and strains to reach higher speeds; it is also a
bit of a coward, refusing to get within 30 feet of anything it
perceives to be dangerous.
Whenever Zephyr is commanded to approach an enemy
or dangerous scenario, the broom zig-zags wildly, forcing
you to succeed a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or lose
your turn holding onto the broomstick.

Uncaged is a collection of myth- and folklore-themed
adventures written for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.
Each original adventure subverts tropes around a female
mythological creature or monster including hags, harpies,
medusas, and much, much more.
The digital edition of Volume I includes:
• Full-color, 238-page PDF
• ZIP file with printer-friendly versions of the modules
• Printer-friendly PDF with player versions of the maps
• A special foreword by Jasmine Bhullar, star of Relics
and Rarities
available now on The dmsguild
monsTers oF The guild
is a DMs Guild community driven project which includes
100+ incredible monsters for your Dungeons & Dragons 5e
game, from 40+ of the Guild’s most talented and exciting
monster creators.
This product is availble as a PDF, Hardback Book and
Fantasy Grounds Module
FEATURED FOREWORD by Chris Lindsay (WotC)
“It is extremely humbling to see just how many folks are
excited to participate in this creative community, and to
watch them come together within that community and
assemble such products of wonder and imagination is
magni cent to behold. Herein are the labors of 40+ creators
who’ve come together to provide a plethora of new creatures
for your D&D game. I don’t know about you, but as a
Dungeon Master, I never seem to have enough monsters to
choose from. I personally look forward to jamming as many
of these new creatures as I can possibly manage, into my
personal D&D games.”
flavor:
This wooden broom, which weighs 3 pounds, seems
poised to fly away at any moment.
While partially-sentient, Zephyr wasn’t created with the
capacity for independent thought. Zephyr’s weakness is
its complete inability to fly without a direct command.
Characters may discover the broom resting underwater
near the corpse of its former rider. Arvilla Te’nar was
once a wealthy wizard with a passion for ancient history.
During an expedition deep beneath his home city, Arvilla
failed to outrace the flooding corridors, leaving his broom
trapped beneath a stagnant pool for decades.
eFFeCT
You may mount or dismount Zephyr as a free action. It
then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air.
Zephyr has a flying speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to
400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes 30 feet while
carrying over 200 pounds. When not being used, the
broom hovers near a belt or backpack, instinctually
moving with its owner as if it were physically attached.
While attuned to this item, you gain the following benefits:
Defensive Flying. Anyone riding Zephyr during combat
receives a +1 to their Armor Class as the extremely
defensive broom attempts to dodge incoming attacks.
Sentience. Zephyr is a partially-sentient neutral good
magical broom with an Intelligence of 8, a Wisdom of 16,
and a Charisma of 8. It has hearing and low-light vision
up to 120 feet. Once attuned to a rider, Zephyr cannot be
flown by another creature.
The broom understands spoken Auran and will respond
to commands of flying in any language spoken by you.
While Zephyr cannot communicate, it often makes its
feelings known through more physical means.
Personality. Zephyr has two important personality quirks
which become noticeable to any attuned rider: the broom
loves to fly and strains to reach higher speeds; it is also a
bit of a coward, refusing to get within 30 feet of anything it
perceives to be dangerous.
Whenever Zephyr is commanded to approach an enemy
or dangerous scenario, the broom zig-zags wildly, forcing
you to succeed a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or lose
your turn holding onto the broomstick.

Uncaged is a collection of myth- and folklore-themed
adventures written for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.
Each original adventure subverts tropes around a female
mythological creature or monster including hags, harpies,
medusas, and much, much more.
The digital edition of Volume I includes:
• Full-color, 238-page PDF
• ZIP file with printer-friendly versions of the modules
• Printer-friendly PDF with player versions of the maps
• A special foreword by Jasmine Bhullar, star of Relics
and Rarities

game, from 40+ of the Guild’s most talented and exciting
monster creators.

FEATURED FOREWORD by Chris Lindsay (WotC)
“It is extremely humbling to see just how many folks are
excited to participate in this creative community, and to
watch them come together within that community and
assemble such products of wonder and imagination is
magni cent to behold. Herein are the labors of 40+ creators
who’ve come together to provide a plethora of new creatures
for your D&D game. I don’t know about you, but as a
Dungeon Master, I never seem to have enough monsters to
choose from. I personally look forward to jamming as many
of these new creatures as I can possibly manage, into my
personal D&D games.”
details:
This wooden broom, which weighs 3 pounds, seems
poised to fly away at any moment.
While partially-sentient, Zephyr wasn’t created with the
capacity for independent thought. Zephyr’s weakness is
its complete inability to fly without a direct command.
Characters may discover the broom resting underwater
near the corpse of its former rider. Arvilla Te’nar was
once a wealthy wizard with a passion for ancient history.
During an expedition deep beneath his home city, Arvilla
failed to outrace the flooding corridors, leaving his broom
trapped beneath a stagnant pool for decades.
eFFeCT
You may mount or dismount Zephyr as a free action. It
then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air.
Zephyr has a flying speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to
400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes 30 feet while
carrying over 200 pounds. When not being used, the
broom hovers near a belt or backpack, instinctually
moving with its owner as if it were physically attached.
While attuned to this item, you gain the following benefits:
Defensive Flying. Anyone riding Zephyr during combat
receives a +1 to their Armor Class as the extremely
defensive broom attempts to dodge incoming attacks.
Sentience. Zephyr is a partially-sentient neutral good
magical broom with an Intelligence of 8, a Wisdom of 16,
and a Charisma of 8. It has hearing and low-light vision
up to 120 feet. Once attuned to a rider, Zephyr cannot be
flown by another creature.
The broom understands spoken Auran and will respond
to commands of flying in any language spoken by you.
While Zephyr cannot communicate, it often makes its
feelings known through more physical means.
Personality. Zephyr has two important personality quirks
which become noticeable to any attuned rider: the broom
loves to fly and strains to reach higher speeds; it is also a
bit of a coward, refusing to get within 30 feet of anything it
perceives to be dangerous.
Whenever Zephyr is commanded to approach an enemy
or dangerous scenario, the broom zig-zags wildly, forcing
you to succeed a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or lose
your turn holding onto the broomstick.

Uncaged is a collection of myth- and folklore-themed
adventures written for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.
Each original adventure subverts tropes around a female
mythological creature or monster including hags, harpies,
medusas, and much, much more.
The digital edition of Volume I includes:
• Full-color, 238-page PDF
• ZIP file with printer-friendly versions of the modules
• Printer-friendly PDF with player versions of the maps
• A special foreword by Jasmine Bhullar, star of Relics
and Rarities
available now on The dmsguild
monsTers oF The guild
is a DMs Guild community driven project which includes
100+ incredible monsters for your Dungeons & Dragons 5e
game, from 40+ of the Guild’s most talented and exciting
monster creators.
This product is availble as a PDF, Hardback Book and
Fantasy Grounds Module
FEATURED FOREWORD by Chris Lindsay (WotC)
“It is extremely humbling to see just how many folks are
excited to participate in this creative community, and to
watch them come together within that community and
assemble such products of wonder and imagination is
magni cent to behold. Herein are the labors of 40+ creators
who’ve come together to provide a plethora of new creatures
for your D&D game. I don’t know about you, but as a
Dungeon Master, I never seem to have enough monsters to
choose from. I personally look forward to jamming as many
of these new creatures as I can possibly manage, into my
personal D&D games.”

name: Ring of Druthwid’s Defense
description:
**Appearance:** Itis a band of solid iron, wrought witha simple scale pattern. It was clearly made for someone 7 Ts with very large hands. When worn, the ring stains the ff 0 wearer's skin a deep green. E 0

**Enchantment:** The Ring of Druthwid's Defense allows (E 7 the user to summon a circle of large, magical kite 2 J] shields that rotate slowly around the user, creating a Nay, JY solid barrier and protecting them from all attacks for = 10 minutes. Can be used once per day.

**History:** Druthwid was a paladin, born more than five hundred years ago. Not much is known about the mysterious man, but legend says he died in battle, giving his life to protect the head priest of his church. The priest, in honor of his fallen friend, created the Ring of Druthwid’s Defense, which was passed from one head priest to the next until it was stolen.

name: Ringblade
description:
**Appearance:** A simple ring of black metal. A small ‘X' has been carved on the inside of the band.

**Enchantment:** When slipped onto one finger, the ring grows into a knife, short sword or longsword, depending on the users preference. The sword is the same black metal as the ring, and a low hum seems to emanate from the blade. Unless the ring is taken from their finger, the user cannot be disarmed.

**History:** This ring once belonged to a well-known royal who had a hobby of moonlighting as an equally well-known highwayman. He would wear this ring on a necklace during the day, and spill blood with it by night. However, the royal rogue was killed when an operation went wrong, and his belongings were auctioned by his shamed family. 2

name: Penelope's Ring of Time Reversal
description:
**Appearance:** A slightly discolored and dirty ring made of intertwining silver threads. The ring feels fragile and old, as if it could fall apart at any moment.

**Enchantment:** This ring allows the user to turn back time five minutes. Only the user is aware of the magic, and only they retain memories of the time that was overwritten. The ring disintegrates after one use.

**History:** Saint Penelope was a wizard who dedicated her life to her research of the arcane. Legend says she found answers to immortality and time-reversal, but she died before she could share her research with the world. Her artifacts are highly sought-after, as they always contain strong - if delicate and disaster-prone - enchantments. pm Tt NL Gas

name: Ring of the Martyr
description:
**Appearance:** A delicate golden ring with a clear diamond setin the center. Inside the gem 3 is a roiling cloud of mist that swirls and (£222; presses against the barriers of the diamond, #2” struggling to escape. 1 A dainty band of silver etched with flowering vines.

**Enchantment:** A living soul is sealed within the gem. Whenever the wearer is dealt a ‘mortal wound, the spirit inside of the ring dies in the user's place. The spirit in the gem can be replaced, but only by a willing soul. This ring is possessed by the spirit of Paracelcius the Wizard. This wizard, though resigned and somewhat depressed, is capable of identifying any magical artifact as long as the user can accurately describe it.

**History:** This ring was created for Lile Erstwhile, a fearsome mercenary known for her cruel and merciless ways. In a legendary battle between Lile and her estranged sister Mile, Lile was defeated and the ring cut from her hand. The ring was lost for many decades before turning up in an auction house. 3 5. Possessed Ring (Paracelcius the Wizard) Paracelcius was a court wizard in the service of the king for many, many years. As he grew older, Paracelcius grew bored with his day-to-day tasks and decided to experiment with immortality, which resulted in his spirit being sealed into a ring he was wearing at the time.

name: Ring of Elemental Charge
description:
**Appearance:** A set of three interlocking rings, each set with a small ruby, sapphire and amber.

**Enchantment:** When worn, this ring imbues any weapon held in the same hand with either fire, frost, or electricity damage based on the user's preference. Once per day, the user can change the elemental effect.

**History:** This ring was once split into three separate parts - each one belonged to a high knight of the Circle of the Oak - a world-renowned mercenary guild. When the guild was disbanded, the rings were scattered throughout the realm. A historian spent much of his career hunting down the three rings and joining them together once again before selling them to a collector.

name: North-South Ring - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** A gold band etched with two opposing arrows.

**Enchantment:** When this ring is worn, the wearer fully believes that north is to the south. Nothing can be said or done to convince the wearer otherwise. Once donned, the user becomes very possessive of the ring - they will not willingly take it off. 4

**History:** The exact history of this ring is not known. Legend has it that a hedge mage, tired of her cruel husband coming home from work every day, crafted this befuddling ring. She slipped it on her husband's finger and he became so lost that he never came home.

name: Ring of Uncomfortable Odds
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy brass ring with a large, \ pyramidal citrine set in the center. |

**Enchantment:** The large gem in this ring XR seems to glow, absorbing light and heat throughout the day. When the gem is full, the user can summon a burst of magic, causing a / random magical effect from the table below. Can be used once per day. Do Effects -1d100- 1-50. The ring glows warmly. The user is healed 1d12+10. 51-70. A shield of orange light surrounds the user, absorbing half of all damage taken for one minute. 71-95. The ring lets off a concussive blast. Everyone within ten feet of the ring takes 2d6 damage. 96-99. The ring glows brightly, and the wearer is immediately dropped to 0 hit points. 100. The ring explodes. Everyone within twenty feet of the ring takes 10d6 damage.

**History:** Many years ago, a warrior commissioned a ring of healing from alocal wizard, The ring turned out poorly, with a bad habit of blowing up instead of healing its user. The ring was sold and passed from hand to hand, as no warrior would risk wearing the ring into battle. i ml He RE 5

name: Ring of Stolen Years
description:
**Appearance:** A solid black band with a __ ~~, humanoid molar set in the center. ae Lu

**Enchantment:** This ring allows the user to 7 absorb 2d12 hit points from any creature ‘within ten feet. Can be used once per day. J] [

**History:** This ring belonged to Rindle Irontail, the leader of a large bandit fort near the border. She went on a legendary quest to pull the tooth from the mouth of the most powerful sorcerer in the region, and had the grim relic forged into a magical ring. Some say she crafted the ring because she feared death, others say she was looking for a way to heal her ailing sister. “= ~ Se

name: Ring of Detachment
description:
**Appearance:** A ring in the shape of a tiny blade, ~~ bent back on itself to form a band. rg

**Enchantment:** This ring allows the user to easily \ and painlessly remove and reattach the hand that \ wears the ring. The user retains complete control of the hand for up to 60 feet. If the ring is removed, the hand acts as if it has been severed and is unable to be reattached.

**History:** This ring was created by a court wizard who enjoyed pranks a little too much. A legendary thief saw the potential in the ring, and stole it for her own nefarious purposes. When the thief died, she passed it on to her daughter, who followed in her mother’s footsteps. 6

name: Ring of Apparent Death
description:
**Appearance:** A ring molded in the shape of two clasped hands.

**Enchantment:** The wearer instantly falls into a magical sleep. Their heartbeat slows, their skin grows cold and, for all intents and A purposes, the wearer appears dead. While in ZS this state, the wearer does not need to breathe, eat or drink. The user can exist in this state for thirty days before they begin to die. The wearer is not capable of removing - the ring themselves.

**History:** No one knows exactly where this ring came from, or why it was created.

name: Ring of Unnecessary Introductions
description:
**Appearance:** A simple silver band, stamped with the letter ‘M.

**Enchantment:** Allows the wearer to magically and instantaneously know the name of any humanoid within eyesight.

**History:** This ring was crafted as a joke gift for a young noble with a habit of forgetting names. A few years passed, then he pawned it to repay his gambling debts.

name: Headache Ring
description:
**Appearance:** A golden band set with a cloudy green gem.

**Enchantment:** This ring gives the wearer the appearance of being ill, with the severity of the illness completely up to the user. The effects are entirely aesthetic, and disappear the moment the ring is removed. However, there is a 10% chance the user will truly fall ill, and that the illness will remain after the ring is removed.

**History:** This ring was created by a court wizard who hated attending social gatherings. She would slip the ring on, fall ll, and refuse to join the celebrations. On one such occasion, however, the ring backfired and she contracted a terrible disease that ended her life. 7

name: Ring of Alarm
description:
**Appearance:** A copper wire ring with a green stone nestled in the center.

**Enchantment:** The user can set the ring to let out a loud sound, alarming them whenever certain conditions are met. Such conditions can include: at a certain time of day, whenever a living creature gets within a certain distance, when a specific door is opened, etc. A maximum of three conditions may be set.

**History:** A young warlock created this ring after he slept through many of his morning classes. The ring soon became a popular commodity, and he went on to make dozens of these rings for his fellow students. n Po T —_—— fi) 1 EPs aw warty L =

name: Ring of Perseverance
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy iron band, wrought in the shape of a wilting rose.

**Enchantment:** When this ring is worn, the wearer becomes incapable of feeling pain.

**History:** Twelve of these rings were created for pal 9 the twelve Knights of Palagius, a secretive circle £~- ria of warriors put together by the queen to perform)? Si: dark and cruel operations on her behalf. After ten years, one knight rebelled against his fellow knights and assassinated the queen. Without a leader, the group was disbanded and the rings \, scattered over the kingdom. Reac 8

name: Ring of Useful Objects
description:
**Appearance:** A wide, plain band of stained copper.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the wearer can disgorge one random item from their mouth at will. It is an unpleasant experience that has a 30% chance of causing the user to choke. -1d20- 1.1420 gold pieces. 11. A small knife in a leather : sheath, 2.1d20 silver pieces.

name: A bottle of lantern oil 18. Aloaf of bread.
description: **History:** This ring was worn by Olivia Fleetfoot, a famous rogue and scoundrel known for getting herself into tricky situations. Her luck ran out when, instead of coughing up a set of lockpicks, she choked on a bottle of wine and perished. ye RES WEISS RN Ny TER NO poe - ANS Tr ET pk H " 1 1 9

name: Backlash Ring
description:
**Appearance:** A slender silver band with a small mirror setin the center.

**Enchantment:** For 1d10 minutes, any magic cast at the wearer is reflected back on the caster. Must be charged under the light of the full ‘moon between uses.

**History:** This ring was created by famous duelist, Matthew Strongeye. After being thrashed repeatedly, his rivals gathered together and ambushed him in the road, stealing his Backlash Ring and leaving him beaten and bloodied in the ditch. Since then, the ring has been a coveted artifact by many spellcasters over the years.

name: Ring of Light
description:
**Appearance:** A silver ring with a large white stone set in the middle.

**Enchantment:** When activated, the gem emits a bright beam of white light in a 60ft. cone.

**History:** This ring was given as a gift to the TR kingdom's most prodigious explorer, Onisha SS Steadyfoot. A few years ago, Steadyfoot went missing after heading into a newly unearthed cave that was later discovered to be infested with goblins. Her body was never recovered, but her = maps, journals and belongings were discovered a ‘hidden away in a goblin den.

name: Ring of Forgery
description:
**Appearance:** A golden ring wrought in the shape of a delicate quill.

**Enchantment:** Allows the wearer to perfectly emulate another's handwriting. The user must first see an example of the handwriting they wish to copy, but the end result is nearly infallible.

**History:** This ring was owned by Hillicus Forge, a famous forger known for tricking the bank out of thousands of gold pieces. His ruse was eventually discovered, however, and he was killed when the city guard raided his home. His possessions were sold in auction. 10 er Necklaces sgw==%" Rd -1d20-

name: Amulet of Magic Detection
description:
**Appearance:** A circular golden pendant es with a teardrop-shaped hole in the center. The edges of the amulet are etched with N strange runes. “AN

**Enchantment:** Peering through the center fa \ of the amulet allows the user to see magical /* ©) auras, as long as the magical object or [t él creature is within eyesight. 0 Kg hes

**History:** Hundreds of years ago, there was ~~~ a brief period of time when magic was 4 1 outlawed. Twenty of these magical I pendants were created for the Anti-Magic J Guild, a task force dedicated to hunting / down and eradicating all traces of magic. A

name: Amulet of Breath
description:
**Appearance:** A rough piece of teal sea glass on a simple chain.

**Enchantment:** The user can simply pop this amulet in their mouth, and the magic will allow them to go without breath for thirty minutes. The amulet must be charged for thirty minutes in clean air between uses.

**History:** Once upon a time, there lived a beautiful maiden destined to be married to someone she did not love. Instead of marrying, she threw herself off the cliffs and into the sea. Legend has it that the sea found her too beautiful to drown, and so slipped a magical stone under her tongue 50 that she could swim safely to a faraway land. — === — TT [75 N v. oN "> 1"

name: Amulet of Thrumar’s Navigation
description:
**Appearance:** A small glass orb dangling from a rusted brass chain, with a small ball of moss rolling around inside.

**Enchantment:** When activated inside of a cave, mine, dungeon or similar underground structure, the ball of moss inside the amulet will roll around in the sphere, leading the user towards the closest accessible exit.

**History:** This amulet was created by a dwarven miner named Thrumar. His fellow dwarves laughed at him for carrying such a bauble. A few months later, Thrumar was the only dwarf to escape with his life after a tunnel collapsed.

name: Sooth-Song Amulet
description:
**Appearance:** A wide band of carved bone, threaded onto a necklace of braided twine.

**Enchantment:** When swung in a fast circle on its chain, this amulet emits a high-pitched sound that has a calming, soothing effect on those that hear it. It reduces anger, fear and other forms of agitation, magical or natural. The stronger the emotion, however, the less likely the creature is to be calmed.

**History:** This amulet was created by a farmer, many hundreds of years ago, to sooth her animals during thunderstorms. Her cattle loved her dearly, and some say she even had a touch of druidic magic.

name: Amulet of Warmth
description:
**Appearance:** A small glass globe on a leather strap. A small flame flickers gently inside.

**Enchantment:** This amulet keeps the wearer at a comfortably warm temperature, on even the coldest nights, and the user is not affected by frost-based spells.

**History:** This amulet was crafted by the Arch-Wizard of the Mage College for her wife, who always seemed to be cold. 12

name: Amulet of Clear Breath
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy golden torc, wrought in the shape of an elegant, twisting vine.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user cannot be choked, strangled or suffocated by physical or magical means.

**History:** Once, many years ago, there was a young noble man named Flavio Olgard. After he nearly died choking on a piece of salmon, he had this necklace crafted so he might never experience that again.

name: Amulet of Rest
description:
**Appearance:** A small crescent moon amulet, set with glittering gems on asilver chain.

**Enchantment:** Once per week, the wearer can summon this amulets magic and instantly gain the benefits of a long rest. This amulet must be charged under the crescent moon between uses.

**History:** This amulet was created by a student of the Mage College who needed more time to study. After she passed all her classes, she gave the necklace to her apprentice who, in turn, gave it to his apprentice.

name: Necklace of the Wolf Moon
description:
**Appearance:** A large canine tooth stained with age, dangling from a rough leather strap.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to polymorph into a wolf at will However, there is a 5% chance the user will forget themselves and become feral, in which case the user must be forcibly returned to their original shape or remain a wolf forever.

**History:** Legend says this tooth was pulled from the mouth of Olric Stoutfur, a famous werewolf who terrorized the countryside hundreds of years ago. A powerful paladin finally took Olric down and pulled the tooth from his mouth, fashioning it into a pendant without realizing the magic it held. When the full moon came, the paladin was transformed into a wolf, and his mind was lost to madness. 13

name: Amulet of Distracted Gaze
description:
**Appearance:** A large, spherical ruby set in a golden clasp. (0)

**Enchantment:** This amulet distracts all those that look upon the wearer. As long as they are strangers, X no one the user interacts with will remember their i! face. \

**History:** This amulet was created by a monk, who wished to walk the world as a stranger. For five years the monk lived without friends, family or relationships of any kind, and meditated on the meaning of interpersonal connections. When his | pilgrimage was completed, he gave the amuletto his temple and published a very profound book on his a findings.

name: Pendant of Feline Friendship
description:
**Appearance:** A large feline claw etched with geometric designs, dangling from a rough leather strap.

name: Amulet of Silence - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy golden pendant, carved with the image of a finger pressed over hushed lips, threaded on a black ribbon.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the wearer loses the ability to speak. The user cannot make any sort of sound including speaking, singing, sighing, laughing, and so on. Once donned, this cursed item can only be removed by the last person the wearer spoke to.

**History:** Once there was a noble woman with a terrible secret - a terrible secret that was witnessed by her young serving boy. The noble woman gave to him a necklace that took away his voice, so that he would never speak of what he saw and, being illiterate, he had no way to betray her. The necklace remained on the boy's neck until he grew old and finally perished, the noble’s secret dying with him. To this day, no one knows what he saw.

name: Amulet of Easy Return
description:

**History:** There was once a wizard named Odwin Marks, who had to walk very far to work each day. Eventually he tired of his daily treks, and he crafted two Amulets of Easy Return. One would teleport him to ‘work and the other would take him home. Eventually the wizard grew old and retired - so he sold the amulets.

He choked to death and, upon finding his body, the assassin immediately swore off killing and sold her tools.

**History:** This amulet was created by a potter, who was often traveling away from his family. name: Cuffs of Hell's Strength

**Appearance:** A pair of wide cuffs made from shining steel. The metal is etched with rows of geometric triangles. This bracelet causes the veins in the wearer’s hands to glow faintly red.

**Enchantment:** Greatly increases the wearer's strength, allowing them to perform great feats of physical ability. Such feats include bending iron bars, lifting impossible amounts, and throwing objects huge distances

name: Bracelet of Dexterity
description:
**Appearance:** A simple bracelet of gold, set with six circular garnets.

**Enchantment:** Greatly increases the wearer's dexterity. The user becomes adept at instrument playing, lockpicking, acts of sleight of hand, and so on.

name: Molgmar’s Phantom Limb
description:
**Appearance:** A simple bracelet made from shining black stone, etched with golden runes.

**Enchantment:** This bracelet creates a fully-functioning phantom replacement for the user's lost limb. The ghostly appendage functions as normal and feels fully solid, even though it appears faintly pale and transparent. The phantom limb is icy to the touch. If the user has no missing limbs, this bracelet has no effect.

**History:** Long ago, there was a renowned dwarven warrior named Moglmar. When he lost his axe-brandishing arm to a goblin captain in a ferocious duel, he begged the gods to give him back his fighting prowess. When he awoke the next day, this bracelet was around his wrist.

name: Cuffs of the Dual Duelist
description:
**Appearance:** Two wide cuffs made from copper. The metal is covered in simple chiseled lines.

**Enchantment:** Makes the user's off-hand just as useful as their dominant hand - the user becomes truly ambidextrous, and takes no disadvantages for duel-wielding.

**History:** These cuffs were created by Titania Sharpsteel - a renowned dualist. She became iconic for her unique duel-wielding fighting technique, which she used to take the pride and purses of many who wished to challenge her.

name: Bracelet of Less Loss
description:
**Appearance:** A narrow bracelet made of interlocking silver bands.

**Enchantment:** While wearing this bracelet, nothing can be removed from the user's person without their explicit permission. This includes clothing and items such as coins, jewelry and weapons. 22

**History:** This bracelet was created by a mad hedge-mage named Herman, who insisted on carrying his secret recipes and spells on his person at all times, so his “valuable” inventions could never be stolen and copied. His fears were realized when his spell books were stolen while he was in the bath.

name: Cuff of Covert Passage
description:
**Appearance:** A stained bracelet of braided leather with a brass buckle.

**Enchantment:** While wearing this bracelet, the user leaves behind no footprints, fingerprints, scent trails, or other signs that could be used to track them.

**History:** This bracelet was hastily created by Dewford Hillhorn, a ranger who was forced to flee the country after poaching many of the King’s prized hunting stock.

name: Cuffs of Connection

**Appearance:** Two golden bracelets, inlaid with twin rubies.

**Enchantment:** These bracelets are clearly designed to be worn by two people. While worn, each person is always aware of the other's exact location and well-being.

**History:** Long ago, there was a young a lord who was forced to leave his newly-wedded wife and fight on the front lines of war. He commissioned these bracelets so that she would always know that he was alive and safe. When the war was over, he returned home to his wife and the two lived a long and happy life together. This cuff was worn by Olfred Direstone, a man who was in prison for life after killing his wife. He spent months training and when the time came, he was able to escape, hauling the immensely heavy handcuff with him.

He took the creature's vicious teeth as trophies, and wore them for the rest of his days.

name: Circlet of the Sturdy Mind
description:
**Appearance:** An elegant circlet of silver with a triangular emerald set in the middle.

**Enchantment:** While this circletis worn, the user's mind cannot be read and they are not affected by magical enchantments such as fear, charm, sleep, or any spells that would alter the user's mental state.

**History:** Many years ago, there was a mercenary named Gulmar Ol'Gresh. A local town hired him to slay an enchantress responsible for burning their fields, so he set off in search of her. He found her but, before Gulmar could even draw his sword, the enchantress laid a spell over his mind. Crazy with spell-induced madness, Gulmar returned to the town and killed half the town before his mind cleared. Seeing what he had done, Gulmar fled the kingdom and commissioned this circlet. He wore it until the day of his death.

name: Dahlia’s Halo
description:
**Appearance:** A shining golden circlet that glows with holy light. When ‘worn, it hovers over the user’s head like a halo.

**Enchantment:** While worn, this amulet gives the user an intense holy aura. Once per day, the user can release the circlet's energy in a holy blast that does 3d12 damage to all evil-aligned creatures within thirty feet.

**History:** Once there was a paladin named Dahlia Thorn. She was an honorable paladin loyal to the goddess of the sun, Faelin. Dahlia spent her days roaming the kingdom, giving aid to those in need and spreading the good word of Faelin. The goddess, seeing Dahlia’s pure heart, descended from the sky and bestowed upon her this golden halo 50 that no evil could stand before her without quaking. 36

name: Circlet of the Invisible Hand
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate, tasteful crown of silver. A wicked-looking crown made from wrought iron.

**Enchantment:** Gives the user telekinesis. The wearer can use their ‘mind to manipulate twenty-pound objects at a distance of thirty feet. When this circlet is donned, it cannot be removed unless the soul possessing the circlet, King Dawnthorn, allows it. During the day, the user can jump higher, run faster and has improved physical strength. Once per day, the user can also cast a powerful ray of frost that does 2d12 damage to all creatures within a thirty-foot cone. Atnight, however, the user has a 50% chance of being possessed by the soul of King Dawnthorn, who will attempt to retain control over the players body, and return to his kingdom to get revenge on the man that killed him.

**History:** Once there was a prince named Lord Dwindle. He was a gentle man who often fell ill, so he was often seen wearing gloves. Finally, he had this circlet created so he could interact with the world without risking illness. 84. He spends \ his days bitterly making plans to find the man that killed him, and take back his kingdom. 37

name: Circlet of the Crow Queen
description:
**Appearance:** A rugged crown made of black feathers and copper wire.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to polymorph into a crow at will.

**History:** This circlet was worn by a druid named Shara Rootheart. She ruled over a small colony of followers, deep in the forest, where they worshipped Amek, Lord of the Crows. She often led her followers in sacrifice rituals and gave as much of herself as she could, cutting off fingers and toes in honor of the dark lord. To show his pleasure, Amek blessed Shara with this rough crown, allowing her to turn into a crow and fly whenever she wished.

name: Circlet of the Expanded Mind
description:
**Appearance:** A golden circlet set with seven rubies. When the circlet is fully charged, the rubies glow faintly from within.

**Enchantment:** Once per month, the user can use this circlet to completely and immediately refill their spell-slots for the day. Must be charged under the full moon between uses.

**History:** This circlet was worn by Amauris Laurantis, a famous sorcerer known for hunting down and Killing dozens of dark-magic necromancers. After he died, this circlet became the prized possession of every magic user that wore it.

name: Circlet of Illusion
description:
**Appearance:** A silver crown with a crystalline orb set in the center.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to create illusions at will. The illusions can be up to a twenty-foot cube in size, and can perform simple sounds and movements, though they are not solid to touch.

**History:** This amulet was worn by a thief named Darry Wilder, who would use illusions to lure his enemies into traps. However, one of his own illusions became too tempting and, after a night of heavy drinking, he followed his own illusion over a cliff to his death. 38

name: Circlet of Stone
description:
**Appearance:** A copper circlet set with a sphere of polished granite.

**Enchantment:** When worn, the user can meld into any stone surface at will. The wall shows no signs of the user inside; however, if the stone is damaged, the user will also take damage. The user cannot see while melded with the stone, though they retain their sense of hearing, albeit abit muffled.

**History:** Hundreds of years ago, there was a famous sculptor named Lin Tyler. He created hundreds of stunning marble statues in his lifetime, though he was known for being a little eccentric. He commissioned this circlet, so that he could meld with his marble and ‘read its vibrations’ before starting a sculpture. Eee

**History:** This circlet was forged by Emil Mayhem, a legendary battlemage who sealed the soul of a fire elemental into the gem on this crown. 39

name: Circlet of Wooden Limbs
description:
**Appearance:** A circlet of woven vines. Every spring, flowers sprout out of the crown and, every autumn, the leaves turn brown and fall away.

**Enchantment:** Once per day the user can transform into a tree, though the type of tree is unique to each individual. If the tree is injured in any way, the user will be damaged. The user cannot see, move or speak while in tree form, though they retain their hearing.

**History:** This circlet was created by a druid who was tired of being a "human. She decided to spend some time as a tree on the riverbank, and so she donned the crown and stood for four hundred years as a cherry blossom tree. Every spring, she would drop pink petals into the river and people would travel for miles to see her lovely visage. Finally, when she'd decided she was done being a tree, she returned to her human form and threw the circlet into the stream. A HER ie Clow at tty, yp ” Col wl ally, Yoo | or by ~ CL. name: Glasses of Unobstructed Sight
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of glasses with large, circular lenses made from pink glass.

**Enchantment:** When these glasses are worn, the user can see through walls up to a distance of sixty feet.

**History:** A famous treasure hunter, Leon Graves, wore these noteworthy glasses on his adventures, using their magical abilities to see secret doors and hidden treasures. Leon went missing just a few years ago and was never seen again, though rumors of rival adventurers and a brutal murder swept through the town when his iconic pink glasses were found circling the black market.

name: Glasses of Metal Detection
description:
**Appearance:** A rather old and scratched pair of glasses with thick, smoked lenses.

**Enchantment:** While worn, all metal within sixty feet appears to glow slightly, even through walls. The color of the glow will change depending on the type of metal.

**History:** Many of these glasses were created for the dwarves in the mountains, who used them to tunnel towards valuable metals. Some were stolen to be used by thieves to scout victims, and others were used by smiths to ensure perfect metal ratios. This pair was owned by Gronan Stoneskin, a dwarf who was trapped and eventually killed by a cave-in while mining gold. “

name: Glasses of Clarity
description:
**Appearance:** A set of circular golden frames without any lenses.

**Enchantment:** These glasses allow the wearer to see through all charms and illusions.

**History:** Once there was a legendary illusionist and enchanter named Theresa Falseweaver. These glasses were worn by his apprentice, Blaine Stoke, so that he would not accidentally fall into his master's illusions. FONE ATTN I Po EN ===) y [4 a J . MA N=

name: Glasses of Daysight
description:
**Appearance:** A set of wire-rim glasses with oval lenses.

**Enchantment:** Gives the user perfect dark vision, though colors are slightly distorted.

**History:** These glasses were worn by David Arkanov, a lamplighter in the capital city. He lit the streetlamps for thirty years until, one fateful evening, he was killed by a pair of thieves and his glasses stolen.

name: Vin's Telescoping Monocle
description:
**Appearance:** A silver-rimmed monocle with three lenses layered over one another.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to ‘zoom-in’ the vision of one eye, allowing them to clearly view things a mile away.

**History:** This monocle was worn by Vin, the captain of the King’s Watch. The King's Watch patrolled the castle walls, monitoring the surrounding countryside, guarding the king and keeping the townsfolk safe. When he retired, he passed the monocle on to his successor. 42

name: Nose Ring of Magical Scent
description:
**Appearance:** A septum ring set with a shining emerald. Vz RD

**Enchantment:** This nose ring gives the user the ability {1 ) to smell magical auras, and track the scent left behind | Ji by magical items or spellcasters. ©

**History:** This nose ring was worn by Arkarian Vogara, a mystic who specialized in fortune-telling and tarot reading. Her peculiar techniques included sniffing the visitor and examining what magics clung to their body.

name: Nose Ring of Noxious Breath
description:
**Appearance:** A brass nose ring. When worn, the user's rises become streaked with green.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to exhale poisonous gas that does 1d6 damage to all those who breathe it in.

**History:** This nose ring was worn by The Nightmare Orphan, a mysterious assassin who killed their victims quietly and covertly with poison gas. Their identity was never discovered and so, when this ring was discovered circling the black market, the kingdom read it as a sign that the assassin was dead and they took a collective sigh of relief.

name: Samantha's Archaic Taste
description:
**Appearance:** A smal silver barbell, designed to be worn in the tongue.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user can lick objects to learn their past. For example, the user could lick a coin and know who had the coin last, what it was used to buy, where it was made, and so on.

**History:** This tongue piercing was created by Samantha May, a talented and peculiar enchanter who had an interest in historical artifacts. No ones sure why she chose licking as the method of her investigation, and 50 very few people chose to use this particular piece of jewelry. 43

name: Jack Loper’s Firebreath
description:
**Appearance:** A small golden barbell, designed to be worn in the tongue.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can breathe a thirty-foot cone of fre that does 2d12 damage.

**History:** This tongue piercing was worn by Jack Loper, a world-famous tightrope-walker and firebreather.

name: Lip Ring of Smooth Words
description:
**Appearance:** A simple, silver lip ring.

**Enchantment:** Increases the wearer's charisma.

**History:** This lip ring was worn by Oscar Bidesh, a silversmith who had a way of smooth-talking his customers into buying his wares. After being seduced into making a particularly large purchase, a local warlock reported Oscar's magical methods to the city guard and the silversmith was thrown into jail | Das oa RY & AL Rm, NES) [Day ANID Qa VSN = a = TO Pas SY QD - NEE ~ ay /. - oN Al “ a BY = ~//[<~

name: Ever-Fresh Blouse
description:
**Appearance:** A simple, finely-made blouse of white silk.

**Enchantment:** This shirt cannot be dirtied or stained, and always carries the faint scent of soap. Any damage done to the shirt slowly heals over the course of 1d4 hours,

**History:** Once there was a man named Dor'Orrin, who was a talented tailor and enchanter. His clothing, which perfectly mixed style and practicality, was highly sought-after by nobles and peasants alike. Now, after his death, his clothing is even more highly valued.

name: Shirt of Steel Wool
description:
**Appearance:** A loose long-sleeved shirt made from grey wool.

**Enchantment:** This shirt acts as a solid-steel cuirass.

**History:** Three of these shirts were created for each of the princess's bodyguards. One day while traveling across the countryside, the princess and her bodyguards were kidnapped and held for ransom. The bodyguards were stripped of their weapons and armor but, through sheer ferocity and force of wil, they managed to fight their way to freedom with nothing but their bare hands, and spirited their princess away to safety.

name: Shirt of Dragon's Bane
description:
**Appearance:** A long-sleeved shirt made from red linen.

**Enchantment:** This shirt is completely fireproof. 46

**History:** Many years ago, there was a paladin named Dai-Lin. She lived peacefully at the local temple, helping the townsfolk when she could. One day, the peace was disrupted by a horrific and cruel fire dragon named Sif, who enjoyed nothing more than burning the fields and eating the people of the town. Dai-Lin, seeing what she must do, began to prepare herself for battle. She monks of the temple enchanted her this shirt, which protected her from the worst of Sif blazing breath. The battle was won, and Dai-Lin became a hero. A ate

name: Shirt of the Tailor
description:
**Appearance:** While unworn, this shirt looks like a simple white tunic.

**Enchantment:** When the user puts this shirt on, it automatically shrinks or expands to ensure a perfect, tailored fit. The fabric also slowly fades to a color that flatters the wearer.

**History:** While expensive, these shirts became a trend among the noble families of the capital city. This shirt was owned by Dilbert Corn, a noble who quickly lost it to a barkeeper in a game of dice.

name: Tunic of Average Appearance
description:
**Appearance:** A poorly-fitted tunic of i beige cotton. A ~N

**Enchantment:** This shirt is so average \ A that it helps the user blend in with a \ i crowd. The wearer becomes hard to | vy No notice and less likely to be remembered. | i 7 ING \

**History:** This tunic was commissioned | pa \ oy by Prince Simon, who wanted nothing / NS more than to be able to walk through \ I V town without being doted upon. \ DT— © a7

name: Tunic of Strength
description:
**Appearance:** A long-sleeved button-down made of red flannel. Smells faintly of freshly-cut lumber.

**Enchantment:** Improves the user’s strength.

**History:** This shirt was woven by Merida Coldwell for her husband, who was a lumberjack. She was not an enchanter or spell-caster by any normal standard, but everything she did seemed to have a touch of magic.

name: Tunic of the Archer
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy tunic of waxed leather.

**Enchantment:** This shirt cannot be pierced by arrows. Though the user is protected from piercing damage, the impact of the arrow will still leave a hefty bruise.

**History:** This tunic was owned by Lydia Arwhile, a legendary archer and rogue. She spent her time hunting down bandits and taking their loot for her own. One day her luck failed her, and she was hit in the leg with an arrow. While not immediately fatal, the wound festered and she died alone in the forest.

name: Blouse of Lordly Aura
description:
**Appearance:** An opulent shirt of cream silk.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user gives off a lordly aura. All who encounter the user will automatically assume they are of noble blood. AIR

**History:** This shirt was worn by Zyph A | f Leatherfoot - a rogue and scoundrel who fo wished nothing more than to be noble | v | 4 blood. He often wore this shirt, using its 0A ‘magic to worm his way into parties and / \L N royal events, where he would schmooze le Ji I J wi with the other lords before making off {2 BE with their golden candlesticks. $F 48

name: Tourniquet Tunic
description:
**Appearance:** A long-sleeved shirt made of heavy blue cotton.

**Enchantment:** This shirt is made of heavy cotton that constricts when it senses a fatal wound, helping stabilize the dying user and give them advantage on death-saving throws.

**History:** Many of these shirts were created for the soldiers of the king's army, but few soldiers could actually afford them. This tunic was owned by Belmont Grey, a high-ranking officer who was beheaded by a cannonball on the battlefield.

name: Tabard of Subtle Armor
description:
**Appearance:** A tabard of purple cotton, embellished with a dragon insignia.

**Enchantment:** When worn over armor, this tabard completely disguises the fact that the user is wearing armor. All armor, including helmets, seems to disappear completely.

**History:** These tabards were created for the King’s Knights, the royal bodyguards. These were worn during celebrations, social dinners and parties, so the Knights could appear at case while remaining ready to defend the king at a moment's notice. £7 aa A 3 (EZ SE), =) teen — J pi Al § 4 : | GE @ \ IN ~ \w/ \v 49 fi) Pants f522) Log -1d10- i:

name: Pants of Levitation
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of bedraggled pants made of brown cotton.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to levitate at will, even if it is a bit uncomfortable.

**History:** No one is sure who made these pants. A laundry-woman found them discarded on the riverbank, and brought them home, only to sell them after she discovered their hidden power.

name: Pocket Pants
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of pants made of heavy, olive-green canvas. It is covered in ten pockets of varying sizes.

**Enchantment:** Each pocket can hold up to 20 pounds, regardless of the size of the items.

**History:** These pants were owned by Leon Graves, a famous treasure hunter. Leon went missing just a few years ago and was never seen again, though rumors of rival treasure hunters and a possible murder swept through the town when his iconic pocketed pants were found circling the black market.

name: Leggings of Balance
description:
**Appearance:** Stiff leggings of dark leather.

**Enchantment:** While worn, it is very difficult to knock the user down.

**History:** Once there was a tumbler by the name of Crystal Highwire. She toured with a band of traveling circus performers. She wore these leggings while performing for the prince on his birthday. He was entranced by her beauty and talent and, years later, the two were married. 50

name: Leggings of Silence
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of black leggings.

**Enchantment:** Increases the users stealth. Their movements become utterly silent, and they seem to blend into the shadows.

**History:** So many of these leggings were made that they became a standard part of the common thief’s uniform. This pair was owned by Sylvia, a serving girl who used them to sneak off and visit her secret lover. When the two were discovered, they fled the city and were never seen again.

name: Trousers of Speed
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of loose, soft, drawstring pants 0 . made from dark-grey wool. iB A

**Enchantment:** These pants increase the user's |. || speed, allowing them to run great distances ioe quickly. They also double the user's jumping | | distance. | | Bi

**History:** These pants were part of the uniform of \ the Queen's messenger, who would spend their \ 1 time running around the castle delivering Bi messages. u 13 \

name: Leggings of the Contortionist
description:
**Appearance:** Grey leggings of soft grey cotton.

**Enchantment:** When these leggings are worn, the user becomes incredibly flexible.

**History:** These leggings were worn by Fillion Tenor, a performer who was desperate to escape his abusive master. Using the trousers’ magic, he folded himself into box and was smuggled out of the city by his friends. 51

name: Leggings of the Earth
description:
**Appearance:** Leather leggings that seem to be perpetually caked in mud.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can stomp firmly and draw upon the power of the earth, causing stone spikes to shoot out of the ground, doing 2d12 damage to all creatures within thirty feet.

**History:** These leggings were worn by Merriweather Jasper, a druid known for their mastery over the earths power. After they passed, these leggings seemed to retain some of the druid’s magic.

name: Leggings of Ease
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of leggings made from well-oiled leather.

**Enchantment:** While these leggings are worn, the user's movement cannot be impeded by vegetation, webs, ropes, or anything that may try to entangle them.

**History:** These leggings were worn by the North City Rangers, a guild of adventurers responsible for patrolling the kingdom's heavily- forested border.

name: Donkey Kick Trousers
description:
**Appearance:** Heavy leather trousers, studded with metal plates.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user's kicks become devastatingly powerful.

**History:** These pants were worn by Tom ‘Baldy’ Baldwin, a legendary kick-boxer who made his mark with an iconic spin-kick that floored every opponent he went up against. After one hundred wins, Baldwin ‘was floored by a young boxer who knocked him out with a single punch. Baldwin, amazed by the young boxer, retired and became his tutor. eZ J % XE N 52

name: Trousers of Height
description:
**Appearance:** Black trousers with grey pinstripes.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to become five inches taller or shorter, depending on their preference.

**History:** These pants were commissioned by Princess Galia, who wished to be a tall and intimidating presence in court. She was a well known business woman, who confidently made many beneficial land deals with neighboring kingdoms during her time in power. 1 |i J | / I \

name: Belt of Sudden Skill
description:
**Appearance:** A leather belt inlaid with six large rubies. When at full charge, the rubies emit a gentle glow.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can bolster one ability score by 1d6 for ten minutes.

**History:** This belt was crafted by Borok Einstein, a legendary dwarven craftsman. He gave it to a noble warrior who was prophesied to save the world. No one was quite sure what became of the warrior after he fled town.

name: Grounding Belt
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy belt made of iron and leather. Two chains hang down the back and drag along the ground.

**Enchantment:** User is impervious to electricity, and all electrical-based magic.

**History:** This belt was worn by the king's sorcerer a very long time ago. They say he was quite mad, and could often be seen screaming on the castle's highest tower during thunderstorms.

name: Belt of Large Size
description:
**Appearance:** A simple belt with an ornate silver buckle.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, the user grows to become one category larger in size.

**History:** This belt was worn by Smith Hammerstrike, a common soldier who quickly became famous for using this belt to grow large during battle. He rose quickly through the ranks, and was known to his foes as “The Hammerstrike Giant’. 54

name: Belt of Small Size
description:
**Appearance:** A simple belt with an ornate golden buckle.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, the user grows to become one category smaller in size.

**History:** This belt was worn by Lorelai Ji-Ho, a thief who was known for her ability to sneak in and out of impossibly small spaces. Her secret was only discovered when her belt slipped off in the middle of a heist, and she grew to her original size. She became stuck in a ventilation shaft, and had to be rescued.

name: Belt of Instant Travel
description:
**Appearance:** A purple sash woven with golden beads.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can teleport to a location they have been to before.

**History:** This sash was the uniform of the Merchant Mages, a guild of traveling mages who would go out and gather rare magical artifacts and spell components, then sell them at the yearly mages’ market.

name: Belt of Delayed Death - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** A cruel leather belt with shallow, sharp spikes along the inside.

**Enchantment:** When worn, this ___ommememeee belt can only be removed by the (Sea 9.0 2-55 : P i Woo i = ‘i person who put it on. A certain ~2.9 0 © 0 7, {|¢o|l command word must be spoken ~A near the belt once per day. If the command word is not spoken, the belt will begin to poison the user, killing them slowly.

**History:** Artifacts such as these were often used to keep servants, criminals or other unfortunate people from escaping, as they would die without daily contact with their handler. This belt was worn by a woman named Linnella Stride, who was imprisoned for stowing aboard a merchant vessel for unknown reasons. However, the womsn escaped and she was never seen again. 55

name: Belt of Healing
description:

name: Belt of Dana's Shield
description:

The shield has the appearance of an ominous ghostly woman, who catches all attacks on her outstretched hands. Anything hung from the belt, such as weapons or pouches, weighs half as much.

**History:** This belt was worn by Dana Southerland, the leader of an ancient village along the coast. When her town was raided by pirates, she died protecting her people. Her sense of motherly instinct was so strong that her spirit was sealed into her belt, continuing to protect people even after her death. 129, Half-Weight Belt This belt was worn by a traveling merchant, who bartered it away in exchange for a new horse after he was robbed on the road. 6

description:

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, this belt uncoils and transforms into a black snake. This snake will obey simple commands, and has a bite that does 1d6 damage.
