name: Delicate Walk Boots
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of soft leather boots with red laces.

**Enchantment:** When these boots are worn, the user walks two inches above the ground. They can walk with ease over tangled vines, quicksand, broken glass, and can easily ignore difficult terrain, though they cannot walk across water.

**History:** These boots were commissioned by a prince who wished to walk through the world without dirtying his hem in the filth of the commonwealth. The royal family was soon thrown out of the palace for their cruelty and wasteful resource management.

name: False Print Boots
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of nondescript leather shoes, with strange runes burned into the soles.

**Enchantment:** These boots leave behind footprints that do not match the character's weight, stride or shoe size. The print changes every one- hundred steps, making it very difficult for the user to be followed.

**History:** Once, there was a famous poet named Daniel Kindried. His works became so widely known that he was stalked by fans at every turn. He wore these boots as part of an effort to slip into anonymity.

name: Boots of Magnificent Leaping
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of tall, black boots with a springy two-inch heel.

**Enchantment:** Twice per day, the wearer can take a running thirty-foot leap. 58

**History:** These boots were worn by well-known acrobat and daredevil, Leon Carminkle. He traveled the country, running across the rooftops and leaping across dangerous heights. Ever seeking the spotlight, Leon announced one day that he would jump across Harehide Canyon. ‘Thousands showed up to watch this amazing feat, only to see Leon misjudge the distance and fall to his death in the river below.

name: Boots of Cat's Creeping
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of soft boots made from black wool.

**Enchantment:** The user's footsteps are perfectly silent and unnoticeable, even if they step on broken glass or squeaky floorboards.

**History:** Once, there was a noble woman who had a very difficult time sleeping. She would awaken at the slightest noise - she had these boots created, so her handmaid could walk through the room without waking her.

name: Boots of Wall-Walking
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of thigh-high leather boots, with two sets of laces on each shoe.

**Enchantment:** Allows the wearer to walk up vertical surfaces.

**History:** These boots were commissioned by the current king, so servants could scale the outside of the palace and clean the windows.

name: Dan's Impervious Boots
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of seemingly average black ankle-boots.

**Enchantment:** These boots are indestructible.

**History:** These boots were worn by a warrior named Dan Harbor, who was a notable adventurer. One day he decided to challenge Sif, the fire dragon of Spark Canyon. Many days passed and he never returned, so the local village sent out a search party. The only thing they found were these boots in a pile of melted armor. 59

name: Sentient Shoes of Dancing
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of delicate, red silk shoes.

**Enchantment:** These boots are sentient, and prefer to go by the name Bianca. She is capable of leading the user through every dance imaginable, however pe = she is a very stubborn pair of shoes. She will ~~ __f 3 throwa fitand refuse to moveif the user's feet smell, or if the road conditions are muddy. ===?

**History:** No one, not even Bianca herself, can remember how these boots came to be, though her nature is very noble and lady-like. She was owned by a noble woman named Delilah, who quickly abandoned the boots after growing tired of Bianca's particularly stubborn nature.

name: Boots of Trekking
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of worn leather boots with copper beads woven into the laces.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to walk for long distances without growing weary.

**History:** These boots are a common artifact, seemingly available at every shoe store in the capital. This pair, however, was owned by Avery Linden, the legendary cartographer responsible for mapping the entire west side of the kingdom.

name: Half-Speed Boots - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** Heavy and rather uncomfortable leather boots with wooden soles.

**Enchantment:** Once worn, these boots can only be removed with the command word. The user becomes incapable of running. If they attempt to sprint, the boots immediately cause them to trip.

**History:** These boots were worn by the household servants of Lady Erella, who wanted to keep her servants from running away. Her plan backfired when she choked on a chicken bone and died when none of her servants could reach her in time. 60

name: Druid Step Sandals
Water-Walk Boots
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of blue canvas boots embroidered with a simple wave design.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to walk on water.

**History:** Once upon a time, there was an infamous pirate who went by the name of Water-Walker William. William and his cruel band of brigands traced the northern coast, raiding and pillaging as they went. One day, while burning down a small village, William met a beautiful woman. He kidnapped her and wooed her and the woman slowly began to fall for him. Eventually he revealed to her his . biggest fear ~ he was terrified of the very her water he sailed upon, and he wore magic { boots to keep him from drowning, So, the Vee woman brought William on deck in /*- y nothing but his nightclothes, lured him ~~ § g- close to the edge, and pushed him into SAAN the water. William was never seen again. ee] 61

name: Heavy Boots
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy set of boots, studded with iron plates.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, these boots suddenly and magically weight 500lbs.

**History:** Once upon a time, a wind elemental broke free of a wizards bindings and ran rampant through the capital city. The wizard hastily crafted five pairs of these boots, so the king's best warriors could battle the elemental without simply blowing away.

name: Boots of Shadow Jump
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of mahogany leather boots with cork soles.

**Enchantment:** Allows user to jump from shadow to shadow at will, teleporting from one shadow to another within 60ft.

**History:** These boots were crafted by Ida Grey, for her grand plan to assassinate the duke of her homeland. The duke was a cruel man, responsible for high taxes and terrible living conditions. He employed cruel soldiers who took advantage of the townsfolk and, when one careless soldier burned down Ida's tavern, she began to scheme.

name: Boots of Water Agility
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of lightweight thigh-high boots made from a thin, blue, scaled material.

**Enchantment:** While these boots are worn, the user becomes a talented swimmer. They can swim at high speeds, hold their breath for long periods of time, and can swim great distances without growing tired.

**History:** Long ago, rumors of a magical sea-monster rippled through the little fishing town of Bass Bay. Lucian Balmer, a young fisherman with ambitious dreams, saw the opportunity for fame and fortune and went outin search of the mythical creature. After years of searching, he finally caught sight of the sea-serpent and gave chase. After a battle that lasted three days, the sea-serpent was slain, and its magical hide was forged into a pair of boots. 62

name: Boots of Planar Travel
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of black ankle : boots. The soles are made of a strange K J material that glows with a shifting = purple light. These boots leave behind ro faint glowing footprints that fade | \_ quickly. Us < ‘ paw "ANTS

**Enchantment:** Once a month, after © tz { ——=e-) being charged under the full moon, the ir user can step from one plane into another. zHistory: Once upon a time, there was a warrior named Dylan Apopmos. When a necromancer took up residence in the forest, Dylan was sent to slay her. But, instead of killing him, the necromancer banished him to the ethereal plane. He spent years in the ethereal plane, searching for a way to return home. When he finally did, he threw his Planar Travel boots into a canyon so he would never be tempted to return to the ethereal plane again.

name: Shoes of Invisible Step
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of grey shoes with strange runes inked into the wooden soles.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can walk across air as if there was a solid 30ft. walkway or staircase.

**History:** Many of these shoes were commissioned by the Carpenter's Guild, for the use of the bridge-builders. fe Cn NR

name: Boots of Skating
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of white leather boots with blue silk laces.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, the user floats one inch above the ground. Frost forms under their feet and the boots begin to slide, allowing the user to skate across the ground at high speeds.

**History:** These boots were worn by Artorius Icepalm, a prince who enjoyed ice-skating in the northern reaches of the kingdom. When he married the princess of a distant land and moved to the desert, he commissioned these boots so that he could continue to skate, even when the sun blazed above him.

name: Boot of Motion Sense
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of red leather boots with thin soles.

**Enchantment:** While wearing these boots, the user becomes highly sensitive to ground vibrations. They can sense any movement within 60ft., and it becomes almost impossible to sneak up on them.

**History:** Many of these boots were created for the scouts and watch- men of the king's army. They would sneak ahead of the army and report back, or keep watch over the sleeping soldiers. This pair was owned by Oria Mallone, a scout who fell asleep at her post. She did not hear the enemy approaching, and the army was taken by surprise.

name: Boots of Flora-Sense
description:
**Appearance:** Boots of patched green leather.

**Enchantment:** The user can detect and identify any plant within 120ft. The user can also sense when fresh water is nearby. With every step, plants suddenly grow up around the user’s feet and, when they leave, the plants slowly wilt away back into the earth.

**History:** These boots were worn by Dora Mamora, the queen's head gardener. She would use the boots’ magic to sense the health of the plants, the moisture in the soil and the weeds that would sprout and strangle the queen’s flowers. 64 oy — Fra LE os JIL Ca STP “Lr, -1d20- A J B

name: Cloak of Camouflage
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy woolen cloak with a simple silver clasp. An olive-green cloak with a silver shield clasp.

**Enchantment:** The fibers of this cloak slowly fade to match its surroundings, giving the user advantage on all efforts to blend in with their surroundings. This cloak is sentient, preferring to go by the name Oscar. He is a noble soul and, if he is fond of the wearer; he will keep an eye on them and pull them out of harm's way when he can.

**History:** These cloaks were worn by the North City Rangers, a guild of adventurers responsible for patrolling the kingdon’s heavily-forested border. 152. Sentient Cloak (Oscar) Oscar was once a knight in the king's army. His life as a human was a long, long time ago, and his memory of i all is very vague. He remembers being sent out on a secret quest for the king, but he remembers nothing about life after his return.

name: Parasail Cloak
description:
**Appearance:** A light-weight, billowy cloak of white silk woven with dove feathers. The hem is embroidered with silver wind imagery.

**Enchantment:** The user can slip their arms into loops inside the cloak and leap from high places, gliding efficiently to safety. If the user is skilled, they can catch updrafts and glide for huge distances. If the user takes an accidental fall this cloak will parachute out and deliver them gently to the ground.

**History:** Once, there was a young girl who 1 '\\Y) wanted nothing more than to fly like the |< birds she loved so much. She spun silk from | silloworms, weaving in feathers and the | 0% quiet charms her mother taught her. When | YN}, the cloak was finished, it allowed her to | 2} 2° glide among her pigeons and doves, untilit | (CJ 270) = was taken by the king's tax collector to | ZF) Ze repay the family’s debt. tee Se a E

name: Cloak of the Bear
description:
**Appearance:** A huge cloak, made from the entire skin of a grizzly bear, clasped with rough iron hooks.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to freely polymorph into a grizzly bear, however the user has a 5% chance of forgetting that they were once human.

**History:** Once there was a battlemage mercenary - he was a huge hulking man who was renowned for his battle prowess. He enjoyed spending his free time as a bear, away from the ferocity of combat, wandering the countryside in peace and living a quiet life. But, one day, after a particularly gruesome battle, the man changed into a bear and ran away into the wilderness, forgetting who he was. Years later, hunters took the powerful mage down with bows without realizing his true nature. 66

name: Ghost-Walk Cloak
description:
**Appearance:** A shimmering, semi-translucent cloak made of a mysterious lightweight material.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can use the cloak’s magic to become a spectral form for one hour. The user becomes intangible, and they cannot interact with the material world. They can pass through walls and cannot be seen by most living creatures, though some can sense their cold presence.

**History:** Only six of these cloaks were ever made. They belonged to a group of necromancers - The Spectral Six - who specialized in bringing peace to those mourning their dead. They would wear these cloaks and communicate with the deceased, passing along messages to the living.

name: Cloak of Magic
description:
**Appearance:** A cloak made of deeply violet silk, hemmed in gold and royal red. The collar is high, and lined with golden beads.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can summon the cloak’s magic to increase the strength of a single spell.

**History:** This cloak was worn by Erika Belittle, the archmage of the Royal Magic Academy. A new student joined the school and, oddly enough, the cloak disappeared and was never seen again.

name: Cloak of Intimidation
description:
**Appearance:** A cloak of tattered black wool.

**Enchantment:** At will, the user can cause the cloak to billow. Smoke issues out from under the cloaks hem, and the user's eyes seem to glow faintly red, giving the user an incredibly intimidating appearance.

**History:** This cloak was first worn by Qui-Han, a bouncer responsible for keeping the patrons of a high-collar bar civil. He moonlighted as a novice enchanter and, when the public realized his abilities, soon became one of the most renowned enchanters in the city. 67

name: Cloak of the Sun's Grace
description:
**Appearance:** A bright yellow cloak with a huge, golden sun emblazoned on the back.

**Enchantment:** Solar healing. The : wearer heals 1d4 damage every ten JAN minutes spent standing in strong PP daylight. pie

**History:** These cloaks are given as a sign x Y, Ay of passage to all paladins of Faelin, 8 <( Ww, goddess of the sun. This cloak belonged AN 74%, to a paladin named Dahlia Thorn, who /= © = spent her days traveling the kingdom <7 AY PES and spreading the word of the goddess. W PT After she died, Faelin raised Dahlia’s = spirit as an angel of light.

name: Cloak of the Wind
description:
**Appearance:** A simple grey cloak that billows with an eternal breeze.

**Enchantment:** This cloak contains a sealed wind elemental, and the user can freely change the direction of the wind. Once per day, the user can summon a huge blast of wind to knock over all creatures within a 30ft. cone.

**History:** Out in the southern planes, there was a little village named Windlet. It was an apt name, as the city was raked with an ever-present gale that burned the skin of the townsfolk and kicked dust into their eyes on a daily basis. Finally, a young enchanter moved to the village and created cloaks for each of the villagers. The cloaks were sealed with wind elementals, who could protect the townsfolk from the natural, brutal winds of the plains. 68

name: Cloak of Impervious Skin
description:
**Appearance:** A cloak of dark, waxed canvas.

**Enchantment:** This cloak is fireproof, waterproof and windproof, keeping the user at a dry, comfortable temperature at all times.

**History:** This cloak was worn by Amadeus Lei, a mailman in the kingdom's capital city. It was given to him as a gift by one of his clients, butthe cloak was stolen from him by a ruffian after the king raised taxes for the winter.

name: Cloak of the Sea
description:
**Appearance:** A thick cloak of strange, smooth leather thathas ~~ A ° a faintly blue hue. vy - Sg

**Enchantment:** Allows the user 7 \Me SNOW i to polymorph into a shark at | 2=<] {/ will. L ov A

**History:** Legend has it that, once upon a time, there was a woman who lived ina lighthouse near the sea. Every day she gazed out into the ocean and her husband, secing how she longed to swim forever amongst the cold, quiet waters, made her this cloak so that she could follow her heart.

name: Cloak of Disguise
description:
**Appearance:** A cloak of grey wool with patterns that seem to shift and change.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can summon an illusion that disguises them as any creature they have seen before, including bears, undead, goblins, etc.

**History:** This cloak was used as a prop in the capital city theater, where talented actors would perform shows for the rich nobles of the land. This cloak was thought to be lost after the theater burned to the ground, but rumors of arson and robbery began to circulate after the cloak was discovered on the black market. 69

name: Cloak of Attention
description:
**Appearance:** A cloak of bright red wool.

**Enchantment:** The bright colors and subtle magics of this cloak draw the attention of all those who see it. Enemies are more likely to attack the wearer.

**History:** This cloak was worn by Inka Sternshield, the bodyguard and handmaiden of the princess. When the seaside castle was raided by pirates, Inka was cornered while the princess made for safety.

name: Cloak of Invulnerability
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy cloak of oN canvas with panels of thick leather. a)

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the a Sart Bs user can become invulnerable for / » 10 seconds. J EE

**History:** Legend has it that the x 2 leather panels on this cloak were ~~ / ; 3 made from the hide of Belmier, the. ie = six-legged horse of the gods, who / ha fi i 7 was the fastest, toughest steed to Silty aN ever roam the mortal planes.

name: Cloak of Spell Resistance
description:
**Appearance:** A pale yellow cloak, hemmed with runes embroidered with blue beads.

**Enchantment:** This cloak absorbs half of all magical damage inflicted on the wearer.

**History:** This cloak was worn by Matilda May, a famous warlock duelist who traveled the world, challenging all dark-magic users to battles in an effort to reduce the number of evil magicians. The kingdom eagerly followed her progress, reading about her triumphs in the newspapers until, one day, she simply went missing and was never heard from again. 70

name: Cloak of the Imposter
description:
**Appearance:** A dark indigo cloak with a tattered, golden hem.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the F user can create an illusionary double that looks, sounds and smells identical i to themselves, however the illusion is not solid and will disappear if touched. i

**History:** This cloak was worn by i Olberic, alegendary mercenary who was 7 1 | A known for his flawless battle strategy | if!’ hi that involved illusion, deception and |, 1; 5/ dial skill. After a spotless mercenary career, /v~ MAYS Olberic was offered the position of Gd She strategy master in the king's army. 3 d

name: Cloak of Protection
description:
**Appearance:** A light cloak made of green linen.

**Enchantment:** This cloak carries a magical enchantment, casting a simple magical shield over the user for four hours.

**History:** This cloak was crafted by Marold the Mage, a washed-up hedge-mage who was mugged in an alley after a long night of drinking, He went on to discover his passion for enchanting, and opened a small enchanting business.

name: Cloak of Invisibility
description:
**Appearance:** A lightweight, billowing cloak made from loosely-woven cashmere.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can become completely invisible for ten minutes.

**History:** This cloak was worn by Sonella Wildflower, a lovely noble ‘woman known through the kingdom for her beauty and shyness. She commissioned this cloak so, if cornered during a party or dinner, she could simply turn invisible and scurry away. kal

name: Cloak of Iron Feathers
description:
**Appearance:** A simple black cloak thatis covered ina layer of long, silky feathers.

**Enchantment:** When a feather is removed, it hardens and can used as a 2d6 projectile weapon, though the feathers shatter after one use. 16 feathers regrow overnight.

**History:** This cloak was an ancient artifact of Dailla, goddess of the moon, passed down from one head priest to the next for hundreds of years. After the king banned the worship of Dilla and burned her temples, the cloak was lost.

name: Cloak of Entanglement
description:
**Appearance:** An olive-green cloak, \ pinned with dozens of long yellow N ribbons. MIEN CAN

**Enchantment:** One command, the Jan cloak will fly off the user's shoulders AN and attempt to entangle and distract Vy iL \ an enemy within fifteen feet. - au MRR

name: Razor-Brim Hat of Returning
description:
**Appearance:** A gray paperboy cap with razor blades roughly sewn into the brim, almost as if they were an afterthought.

**Enchantment:** If lost, the hat re-appears on the user’s head in 1d4 minutes. It appears someone has sewn blades into the brim, turning this hat into a dangerous projectile that does 2d6 damage.

**History:** Hats with razors sewn into the brim were the trademark of The Alley Boys, a gang of ruffians who patrolled the northern roads of the capitol city. This hat was worn by the boss, Deadeye Samuel, who lead the gang for many years before being stabbed in his sleep bya rival. SS a] ee V3 Po — a ~ ne th BY

name: Hat of the Prankster
description:
**Appearance:** A rather cheap-looking black bowler hat.

**Enchantment:** Clearly designed as some sort of prank, this hat changes the hair color of the user for 1d6 hours. Color -1d6-

name: Olive green. 6. Deep violet.
description: **History:** Many years ago, the archmagi of the Royal Academy of Magic had a son. She began teaching him magic from a very young age and, at ten years old, he enchanted this hat to prank one of his many teachers. 73

name: Hat of Anti-Displacement
description:
**Appearance:** A wide-brimmed hat of olive-green felted wool.

**Enchantment:** This hat will never fall off the wearer's head, even in the most extreme of circumstances.

**History:** This hat was commissioned by a high-born ranger who was tired of his trusty hat being knocked off his head during shoot-outs.

name: Hat of Concealment
description:
**Appearance:** A black wide- brim hat with a red silk band. / =X

**Enchantment:** This hat always 4 j— ho casts a dark shadow over the = user's eyes, completely and subtly concealing their face at all times.

**History:** This hat was wom by Pickapenny Delores, a traveling merchant legendary for her mysterious ways. She always seemed to turn up when her cryptic advice was needed, selling adventurers just the thing they needed without being asked.

name: Hat of Storage
description:
**Appearance:** A soft, slouchy cap knitted from red wool.

**Enchantment:** This hat can contain up to 2001bs. of items.

**History:** This hat was knitted by a hedge-mage for her son, who was striking off across the country to seek his fortune. The young man, being A curious in nature, climbed into the hat 7%” SATE to see what was inside. He was trapped (i= ~~ Trios within the wretched hat for two weeks Rao before he was rescued by a surprised No nas stranger, and would have died if his as mother had not filled it with food and Rt) water for his journey. h 74

name: Hat of Versatility
description:
**Appearance:** A slouchy cap of knitted grey wool. A floppy hat of grey felt, with a long feather tucked into the leather band.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, this hat will morph into any other kind of hat or headwear. From wide-brimmed hats to golden crowns to steel helmets, this hat is limited only by the user's imagination. This hat is a possessed by the soul of FZ Arnold the Wizard, a curious == and outspoken man who is a 3 master of history, legend and a ie geography. He will freely Pat — : offer the user advice, but he is NS ===", a rather shy and introverted man, who will refuse to speak if there are too many in strangers around.

**History:** This hat was created by Gallia Bert, a powerful and rather fashion-forward sorcerer who was known for her ‘unique’ outfits. 177. Possessed hat (Arnold the Scribe) A long time ago, there was a legendary library in the city of Donella. It had copies of every book imaginable, and it held all the wisdom of the world. Arnold was a scribe who spent his days making copies of the most valuable books. He was working late one night when agroup of anarchists blew up the library with magic, taking Arnold with it. The magic was so powerful that, instead of sending him to the afterlife, his soul melded with the hat he was wearing. Bf <2 28 75

name: Hat of Shelter
description:
**Appearance:** A wide-brimmed hat of cream-colored wool.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, this hat grows into a sturdy three-person tent.

**History:** This hat was worn by Daniella Beauregard, a cartographer who spent her days roaming the kingdom and crafting maps. Her maps were so detailed and accurate that they became highly-sought luxuries, and she was eventually offered a position in court, making maps for the royal army.

name: Hat of the Fisherman
description:
**Appearance:** A loose-fitting canvas hat, pe studded with fishing lures. \ 5 [3 8 Bo

**Enchantment:** When the command word ~~ gp — 70 is spoken, this hat grows into a decent 15ft.  ¢~. vi} ~ok Ea 4 dingy with oars. 2m ==

**History:** Once there was an elderly man, who was known in his community for his kindness. He would spend his free time out on the water catching fish. Any fish he didn’t need, he would give to the hungry people in town. Thanks to him, many folks were spared a hungry evening. As a thanks for his generosity, the town came together and gifted him this hat, so he would never be without a boat.

name: Hat of Arcane Knowledge
description:
**Appearance:** An ancient, tattered, grey wizard’s hat.

**Enchantment:** While this hat is worn, the user gains a thorough knowledge of the arcane arts.

**History:** Almost a thousand years ago, this hat belonged to a wizard by the name of Alia Hawthorne, who worked with the kingdom to create the first Royal Academy of Magic. This hat was exposed to so much magic that, even after Alia passed away, her knowledge of magic lived on, woven into the very fibers of the wool. 76 Gloves -1d10- f & == X — N NL ND

name: Gloves of the Thief
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of black leather gloves.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user becomes adept at lockpicking.

**History:** These gloves were worn by Jethro Jules during the famous Capital City Museum Heist, during which dozens of priceless artifacts were stolen.

name: Gloves of the Pianist
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of clean, silk gloves.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user becomes adept at playing the piano.

**History:** These gloves were commissioned by the king so his son, a young lad who wasn't interested in anything besides bug-catching, could play the piano and impress the delegates at court.

name: Gloves of Electric Touch
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of heavy leather gloves with iron fingertips.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can electrocute anything on contact for 2d12 damage.

**History:** These gloves were worn by Odelia Olonia, an orcish bounty- hunter who would use them to subdue her victims. mn

name: Gloves of Healing Touch
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of soft, tan leather gloves. A sun has been painted on the back of each glove in thick, golden paint.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can touch an injured individual and restore 1d12 HP.

**History:** These gloves were part of the uniform of The Priests of the Sun, a collection of paladins and clerics who would travel across the world, camping outside of disaster-stricken towns and lending aid.

name: Gloves of the Archer
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of archer’s gloves.

**Enchantment:** Greatly improves the user's aim, allowing them to shoot and throw objects with great precision.

**History:** These gloves were worn by Gauche Elfman, a famously talented archer who roamed the kingdom in search of the legendary Bow of Song. After searching for decades and never finding what he was looking for, Gauche retired to the countryside where he lived the rest of his life in peace. II — ee

name: Gloves of Blind-Sense
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of red silk gloves.

**Enchantment:** The user can identify and sense the dimensions of any object they touch. If the user touches a wall or floor, the user can sense the floorplan of the structure within a 60ft. circle.

**History:** These gloves were bestowed upon Genevieve Ingvar, a legendary paladin who lost her sight after traveling to the Seventh Plane and looking directly upon the God of the Sun. 78

name: Gloves of Returning
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of brown leather gloves, hemmed with red thread.

**Enchantment:** After 1d10 minutes, anything thrown by the user reappears in their hands.

**History:** These gloves were created for Sir Stahl, a legendary knight who rose to fame after defeating the king's best in the annual jousting tournament.

name: Gloves of the Climber
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of heavy brown gloves dusted in a fine coat of chalk.

**Enchantment:** Improves the wearer's strength and agility, allowing them to scale difficult walls without falling.

**History:** No one is sure when these gloves were created, but they were found on the corpse of an unfortunate adventurer who had been crushed by a boulder while searching for treasure.

name: Gloves of Remote Reach
description:
**Appearance:** A set of two right-hand gloves made from beautiful red leather.

**Enchantment:** When one glove is worn, the user can telepathically control the second. The empty glove can levitate 10ft. off the ground at a distance of 60ft, and is capable of lifting 10lbs.

**History:** These gloves were worn by Simone Shaw, a princess who was wheel-chair bound since birth. They were created for her by a local enchanter and, touched by the thoughtful gift, the princess summoned the enchanter to the palace. They were quite smitten with each other, and the two were wed before the year was out. v § WE 79

name: Gloves of Hellish-Might
description:
**Appearance:** Heavy, elbow-length gloves of dark brown leather.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, gloves can transform the user’s hands and forearms into large stone fists, chiseled with arcane runes and geometric designs. The user is capable of powerful punches, casting a 60ft. cone of fire, and performing feats of incredible strength.

**History:** These gloves were crafted from the hide of a demon, after it was slain by the famous warrior ligand Ilova, who unfortunately died of his wounds after the fight. fv dd f Jos A : 4 CAA ” 1 Rx £ ES cil - I< = = ery | 2 GER ) IE : > | ¥ ~~ : / B bs As 4 1 3 80 Miscellaneous -1d10- Ye. — Ties RC EI Fo Ea =6\%  % 2.13 2 = 3 3 Z0\% a \: H RS go\z if, ELE Zs Zaz Zo" - %

name: Scarf of Strangling
description:
**Appearance:** A red woolen scarf with tassels.

**Enchantment:** On command, the scarf will fly from the user's neck and strangle any creature within 15ft.

**History:** This scarf was worn by Celeste of Withywoods, a duchess who was known for her quick and vicious temper. At the drop of a hat, she would fly into a murderous rage, and accidentally killed many servants before the kingdom realized how troublesome she was, and removed her from power.

name: Cowl of Bees
description:
**Appearance:** A loosely woven cowl of pale-yellow cashmere.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to polymorph into a swarm of bees at will.

**History:** This cowl was woven by Lorraine Hive, a quiet woman who kept a little farm on the outskirts of the kingdom. She spent her time tending her garden, caring for her bees, and spinning yarn from her sheep's wool. Everything she did was touched by a little magic that was only discovered after she passed away. sb 2 eye Cw LI ER ER a. < Rs Ai - ) 81

name: Chaps of the Horse-Tamer
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of worn leather chaps. The name Dan is inscribed inside the belt.

**Enchantment:** The user becomes more adept at handling, taming and riding horses.

**History:** These chaps were worn by Dan Daniel, a world-famous druid who tracked and tamed wild horses for the king. He traveled the world, scouring the plains and forests for the most beautiful and majestic horses to add to the king's stable. One day, many years ago, he went out in search of the legendary Tamutamu, the massive horse of myth. Dan never returned, but his corpse was found trampled into the mud.

name: Chef's Apron of Ease
description:
**Appearance:** A light-green apron embroidered with lovely little artichokes.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the apron’s pockets fill with the ingredients for a different recipe. While worn, the user instantly knows hundreds of recipes, and becomes very adept at cooking.

**History:** This apron was worn by the owner and head-chef of a little restaurant named Popillo’s. It was a popular restaurant, with food so good that even the royal family would visit the restaurant from time to time. However, one day the chef washed his magic apron and hung it outside to dry. To the chef's horror, the apron was stolen. Without its magic, the restaurant soon closed.

name: Goggles of the Killer Glare
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of leather goggles with tinted glass lenses

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can scowl and shoot a beam of bright red light from their eyes, causing 2d12 fire damage to a creature within 60ft.

**History:** These goggles were worn by Omar O'Malley, an adventurer who fainted at the sight of blood and refused to use any weapons that would cause his enemies to bleed. 82

name: Overalls of the Farmer
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of worn brown overalls with tarnished brass buttons.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user gains a complete understanding of farming, including the care of fields and the keeping of animals. User can also communicate basic information with common barnyard animals, such as chickens, cows, sheep, and so on.

**History:** No one is sure how these overalls came to be or why they are magical, but they were passed down from father to son, through generations of farmers until one day, the farmer's son decided to become an actor and moved to the city. Zar NY

name: Storyteller's Mask
description:
**Appearance:** A blue silk mask that covers the wearer's nose and mouth, with golden beads lining the hem.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user can alter their voice to mimic anyone they have heard before. The user can also mimic simple sounds with great accuracy. i i hy

**History:** This mask was 4 commissioned by Darnel Bywater, a & legendary storyteller who traveled b i the land, telling stories in stables, Bo El a taverns, and even by the king's own \ § ee 2) fireside. When Darnel was robbed e— and her mask stolen, the king was rh furious and offered a huge reward to IN / anyone who could bring him the = 74 head of the thief. The mask was soon 2 = returned, anonymously showing up o, on Darnels doorstep. 83

name: Mask of Item Inspection
description:
**Appearance:** A mask made from painted leather. It covers the upper half of the users face, and has lenses of heavy red glass.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user can examine someone and see, as if with x-ray vision, everything they are carrying. Objects in pockets, purses, or tucked in belts or sleeves can be easily seen by the wearer.

**History:** This mask was worn by the Pickpocket of South Street, an infamous thief who hid his iconic mask under a heavy black hood. One day, the wind blew away his hood - he was immediately recognized and killed by a furious mob.

name: Samfier’s Mask of Anonymity
description:
**Appearance:** A porcelain mask, painted with blue flowers and fastened with a blue ribbon.

**Enchantment:** User cannot be recognized ~ even by the people they know best

**History:** Once, there was a great warrior who was powerful beyond all belief; no enemy could stand before him with a chance of victory. He chased fame and fortune and challenged every legendary warrior in the kingdom, and all fell under his blade. Finally, he challenged the greatest warrior of all, Samfeir, God of fighters and mercenaries. Samfeir won the duel and, as punishment, cursed the warrior to wear this mask, so that no one would recognize him for the legend he once was.

name: Mask of the Shadow
description:
**Appearance:** A cold, black mask that drips with shadow. Whispers seem to fill the air around it. A set of boiled leather armor, dyed a deep brown with brass rivets and suede cord.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user appears to be a living, semi- translucent, amorphous shadow being with bright white eyes. The user gains advantage on all intimidation checks. While this armor is worn, the user's weight is reduced to half, allowing them to move quickly, quietly and easily.

**History:** No one is sure where this mask came from, or why it was made. It simply appeared on the statue of the king in the city center. Three days later, the king died of a heart attack. 84 Chapter 3 - Armor Ju <5 NYE BN \ AIA AMM L \ = | Light Armor E -1d20- = | y r al \ 3 201. Air-Step Armor [i This armor was crafted by an ambitious thief named Dillan Dollarhyde, who used the armor to sneak over the castle moatin winter, his light steps causing nary a crack in the ice. He robbed the treasury, taking as much gold as he could carry but, as he was fleeing back over the moat, the heavy gold he was carrying cracked the ice and he fell through, His body was not discovered until spring.

name: Amelia's Unfolding Armor
description:
**Appearance:** A common belt with a circular buckle. After unfolding, it becomes a suit of burnished leather armor, dyed a deep mahogany red with black iron buckles.

**Enchantment:** When activated, this common leather belt grows and expands, magically unfolding over the user's body until they are clad in a full suit of leather armor. The whole process takes less than twenty seconds.

**History:** This armor was worn by Amelia Curthgard, a mercenary with a specialty in bounty-hunting. She would stalk her prey through the cities, leaping over rooftops and racing along walls until she captured them. Sad B= <&. RE CR. 86

name: Dragonhide Armor
description:
**Appearance:** A set of red 6-yoroi style armor, with black laces and gold detailing, Instead of leather or metal, the armors scales are actually small dragon scales.

**Enchantment:** The scales on SNE RAP this armor flex and flutter, £0 3 9) Prag caressing attacks as they land. SY LR ras AZ This armor absorbs 1d6 FAR (GERRI, damage of all physical attacks. ~~ & Coty te No Eih% ee va SAD Jo rr eR

She raised the at f [Ee dragon and became a legendary rie Speen dragon-rider. MARGE ARAN

name: Chainmail of Felnor’s Fire
description:
**Appearance:** A set of black chainmail. Runes have been woven into the hem with golden wire.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can utter the command word to cause the armor to burst into dangerous violet flames that will burn any creature that dares to get too close. The flames last for one minute, and smell of sulfur and sandalwood.

**History:** This armor was enchanted by Felnor Besuvius, a necromancer wholived ina tower hidden in the heavy western forests, where he kept to himself, devoting his time to dark experiments. When strangers wandered too close to his home, he would use the armor to frighten them away. Legends of a flaming terror spread through the kingdom, and Felnor was eventually slain by a group of adventurers who came to investigate. 87

name: Nature's Armor
description:
**Appearance:** Strange yet incredibly light armor, woven from layers and layers of moss and plant fiber. In the sun, the armor flourishes and grows and, in the darkness, the armor wilts slightly.

**Enchantment:** In the daylight, this armor grows lush with greenery and flowers, granting the user a higher defense bonus. Must be watered on a weekly basis.

**History:** This armor was created by a novice druid, who grew it from the ground with magic and care.

name: Armor of the Snake
description:
**Appearance:** A set of peculiar leather armor, made from speckled- green snake skin.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to polymorph into a snake at will.

**History:** Once, there was a ranger named Tessa Snurf who roamed the world, writing a book on mythical creatures. After a terrifying battle with Athmos, the legendary and monstrous snake of Athmos Lake, the ranger turned her hide into a suit of armor.

name: Milly's Armor of Strength
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of grey leather armor, painted with blue flowers along the edges.

**Enchantment:** While worn, this armor grants the user enhanced speed and strength. However, every day, the user has a 5% chance of being possessed by the spirit of the knight who died in this armor. The knight has gone quite mad after so many years of being trapped, and will attempt to free her spirit from the armor in any way she can.

**History:** Once there was a knight named Milly. She was a scout in the King’s army, a talented woman who was known for her speed and strength. One day she was sent forward to scout out a necromancer’s tower. The necromancer’s spies saw her coming, however, and he cast aspell on her. Milly's soul was bound to her armor, where she remained trapped for hundreds of years. 88

name: Armor of the Porcupine
description:
**Appearance:** A set of dark brown leather armor, painted with lines wl \ i that resemble woodgrain. AN J

**Enchantment:** When the se ~ | command word is spoken, a layer TRA : of thorns sprouts from the iL TAN N armor’s surface, damaging ATR WN ™ (RN anyone who touches the wearer. A ) A) AOA . b ASIN

**History:** This armor was worn by ZONIN i) RK a druid named Balia Bernard, a { —x AS N/ fl) fl quiet woman who liked to keep to i" iil lil! herself. Aftera life of adventuring, ¥__ % iia A she sold her weapons and armor {|} a A and spent much of her time as a bl) 5 porcupine, wandering the quiet \\(( e) forests and writing poetry. | he

name: Unholy Armor of Speed
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of leather armor dyed a deep, burnished blue, with iron reinforcements at the knees and elbows. A large gash runs across the cuirass from shoulder to hip.

**Enchantment:** This armor enhances the user's speed and agility, allowing them to run quickly and jump great distances. However, whenever the user lays eyes on a cleric or paladin, the armor will take over the user's body and force them to attack the holy warrior.

**History:** This armor was worn by Ollion the Unholy, a thief and assassin responsible for the murder of a dozen of high-ranking church officials. Orphaned ata young age, Ollion was taken in by the temple of Tiana, the goddess of charity. After learning of the deep-rooted corruption and cruelty, Ollie left. The church's leader, Master Houston, attempted to kill Ollie to keep him silent, but Ollie fought back and decided to take things into his own hands. 89

name: Armor of Disguise
description:
**Appearance:** A set of leather armor, made from panels laced together with red braided cord.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can polymorph into inanimate objects such as chairs, bottles, potted plants, and so on. The user cannot move or see; however, they can hear and have a basic sense of motion around them.

**History:** This armor was given to Ginseng Howe, an assassin hired by the king to spy on courtiers suspected to be traitors. Ginseng would disguise themselves as a chai, and remain hidden in guest rooms, listening for any signs of rebellion.

name: Madge’s Chainmail
description:
**Appearance:** A glistening chainmail shirt, made from delicate white- gold rings.

**Enchantment:** This chainmail is so light and finely made that it cannot be seen under the user's clothing.

**History:** This armor was made for Madge, the young princess who loved to explore the town, climbing across rooftops and running through alleyways and generally getting herself into trouble. Her mother, the queen, commissioned this light chainmail so Madge would be safe, no matter how far she roamed.

name: Bularma's Hide
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of red leather armor, Pipa made from the entire hide of a terrifying Ho 65 demon. The helmet resembles the demon’s ~KY head, with the users face peering out from sez: bel between the demon’s open jaws. Canal)

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user is >= fireproof and they become fluent in the pe \ abyssal language. The user can also survive Cra comfortably in any of the layers of hell, VAR where the demon originally lived. V, ~~ 20

**History:** Once upon a time, there was a demon named Bularma, who roamed the layers of hell for thousands of years. Finally, he grew bored of walking the same lands, and traveled to the mortal plane. He was hunted by paladins for hundreds of years until he was finally killed after betting his life in a game of poker.

name: Armor of the Spirit Dancer
description:
**Appearance:** A set of glowing, . / slightly translucent chainmail. ~~ 5 Long lengths of transparent silk 0 2 4 drape from the user's shoulders, as Zein billowing elegantly in an unseen X= SAR A breeze. fi ie gd { Seid,

**Enchantment:** While worn, the | b (AEE user becomes slightly intangible, £/ QING All attacks have a 10% of phasing ffi 4 N through the player.

**History:** This armor was worn by Toriel, a legendary and mysterious dancer. No one knows where the elegant and talented woman came from - only that her beautiful dancing caused the most hardened of warriors to weep. When the war came, legend has it she was seen fighting on the front lines alongside the soldiers, wearing this chainmail over her bloodstained dress.

name: Deepswim Armor
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of lightweight, skin-tight armor made from tiny blue scales that glitter in the sunlight.

**Enchantment:** While wearing this armor, the user's swim speed is doubled. They also gain the ability to breathe underwater, see in darkness up to 60ft, and survive the intense pressure of deep water.

**History:** This armor was created by Daniella Donovan, a sorcerer and scribe who dedicated her life to unlocking the mysteries of the deepest depths of the ocean. She wrote dozens of books on the subject and went on to teach a course in marine biology and it's technical and arcane applications. 91

name: Armor of the Eagle Master
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy leather eagle-master’s coat, with thick leather panels along the back, shoulders and arms.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user can sense all birds within half a mile. They can also communicate simple information to birds, and ask them to do simple tasks such as carry messages, retrieve small objects orattack a designated target.

**History:** This coat was worn by Darius Featherfall, who was known for his masterful keeping and training of birds. The king was a frequent customer, and offered Darius a position as his master birdkeeper many times; but Darius refused, preferring to live in the open country in his precious aviary.

name: Armor of Druid’s Blessing
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of leather armor, etched with leaves and covered in autumn-colored ribbons.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to communicate basic information to animals. The user can ask them to do simple tasks, such as carry messages, retrieve small objects or attack a designated target.

**History:** This armor was worn by Melanie Bearpaw, a druid who spent ‘most of her time as a bear, roaming the countryside and helping those in need. Once, she stumbled across a woman being attacked by bandits. Melanie charged the thieves and the thieves fled, terrified. Rumors of a goddess who helped the helpless while disguised as a bear circled the land, though Melanie was eventually killed by hunters.

name: Dragonhide Armor
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of thick leather armor made from violet, scaly dragonhide.

**Enchantment:** When this armor is worn, the user grows scales over their cheeks and arms. A long scaly dragon's tail grows from their tailbone, enhancing the wearer's balance. The user also grows long claws that do 1d8 slashing damage, and the ability to breathe a 15ft. cone of fire three times per day. 92

**History:** Once there was a farmer named Jedediah Heartwrench. He spent his time tending the fields and caring for his wife, but his life was interrupted when a dragon flew overhead, landing in the middle of town. Without hesitation, Jedediah picked up his scythe and ran into the street. After a harrowing battle, Jedediah stood miraculously, impossibly triumphant over the corpse of the dragon. He made its hide into armor, and was hailed as a hero.

name: Armor of Cloud Form
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of rough grey leather armor, lined with heavy wolf fur.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can turn into a sentient cloud of gas

**History:** This armor was created by Luther Barmockle, a thief who would use it to sneak into locked homes. He met his demise when, one day, he turned into a gas and sneaked into a safe, which was full of diamonds and gold. When he reverted to his dwarven form, he was crushed in the small safe and suffocated. TN rl) LE Peas AN = SIR CR Se SYR)

name: Voidstep Armor
description:
**Appearance:** A seemingly simple set of leather armor that flashes with a holographic sheen under strong light. A suit of black, tight-fitting armor made from thin leather, A set of intricately detailed plate armor, with gold-gilded edges.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user can teleport up to 15ft. away at will, as long as itis within eyesight. This armor is sentient, possessed by the soul of Arman Quicktongue. He grants the wearer enhanced speed and dexterity, but he has a passion for heckling enemies. He will yell insults and goad enemies, and he will sometimes heckle the wearer if they are acting cowardly. Once per day, the user can kneel and offer a prayer to their deity. There is a 25% chance the god or goddess may offer the user something in return. Blessings -1d10- 1. The user is healed 2d12 HP. 6. The user's equipment is fully ohm ) repaired.

**History:** Once, there was a warlock named Pat Lyra, a sorcerer who was known for her research into planar travel. One day, her plane-hop spell went wrong and she was lost for hundreds of years in the void. Finally, she popped back into the mortal plane, but she was never the same. Her body and everything she carried seemed to retain the magic of the void. 9 220. Possessed Heckler’s Armor (Arman Quicktongue) Once, there was an enchanter who was trying to craft a set of armor that would grant him skills in the stealthy arts. He tried to summon the soul of a great thief, but ended up binding Arman into the armor instead. While Arman was a fine thief, his outspoken ways made the armor nearly useless. name: The user is given 2d12 gold d
The user is cured of all single yes ck no question
description: **History:** Legend has it that this armor was worn by Saint Ultaria of the Sun, a legendary warrior known for giving his life fighting for the temple. The armor was displayed in the temple as a holy artifact for hundreds of years. One night, the church was broken into. Nothing appeared to be taken, however soon it was discovered the armor was a fake. The real artifact had been stolen and sold on the black market. 95

name: Armor of the Holy Aura
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of silver plate armor. A large golden holy rune is inscribed on the breastplate

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user cannot be possessed by spirits or ghosts. The armor also gives off a strong holy aura, damaging all ghosts, undead creatures, or evil-aligned beings that get too close.

**History:** This suit of armor was worn by the head paladin of the temple of Lorraine, the goddess of honesty and truth. When it was discovered that the paladin was a liar, using the temple to further her own wealth, she was banished and her name scrubbed from the annals of history.

name: Armor of Blood
description:
**Appearance:** A set of dull, iron plate armor. Intimidating, yet beautiful detailing can almost be seen underneath the all tarnish.

**Enchantment:** Any blood spilled on this armor is absorbed, temporarily enhancing the user's strength and defense.

**History:** This armor was found buried in the dirt of an ancient battlefield. Legend says it belonged to Feronious Bloodgaze, the fearsome captain of the opposing army, who would drench himself in his foe's blood during battle.

name: Armor of the Wind
description:
**Appearance:** A set of blue-tinged plate armor, detailed with simplistic wind imagery.

**Enchantment:** A wind elemental is sealed inside this armor. This armor does not affect the user's dexterity, allowing the user to move freely as ifunencumbered by a full suit of plate armor. Once per day, the user can summon a 60ft. cone of gale-force wind.

**History:** Once upon a time, there was a young girl who loved to run with the wind. As she grew older, the wind grew fonder and fonder of her and never wished to leave her, and so it sealed itself into her armor, so the wind could protect her and travel with her for the rest of her days. 9%

name: Armor of Weapon Mastery
description:
**Appearance:** A set of old-fashioned plate armor.

**Enchantment:** This armor is possessed by the eternally sleeping spirit ofa knight. While worn, the user gains proficiencies in all weapon types.

**History:** Once there was a fearsome knight, who was known across the kingdom for his weapons master and skill in combat. However, the knight grew tired of the constant fear and death of battle, and he wanted nothing more to sleep for eternity. He made a pilgrimage to the lost Well of Wishes, where he begged the goddess to let him rest. The goddess, seeing his torment, granted his wish. She sealed his soul into his armor, where he will rest until the armor rusts away. ANT / HB hi s ap J x SEZ GION A Si 1 I: | Na

name: Armor of the Hammer-Arm
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of heavy steel armor, with hinged supports in the shoulder, elbow and wrist.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the steam-spirit in this suit can be used to bring the user’s arms down in a devastating strike, doubling the damage of melee attacks. Has a 5% chance of jamming and becoming stuck every time the ability is used.

**History:** This armor was designed by Hammer-Arm Mike, an axe- wielding mercenary legendary for his one-hit kills. One day, his suit malfunctioned and the hinges jammed. His enemy seized the opportunity and brought Hammer-Arm Mike down with a single strike of his own. o7

name: Armor of Magic Absorption
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of platinum scale armor. Each individual scale is inscribed with a different magical rune of protection.

**Enchantment:** This armor absorbs half of all magical damage.

**History:** This armor was designed by Morton Boronard, a warrior who had the peculiar quality of being allergic to magic. He created this armor in the hopes of reducing his exposure to magic, which caused him to swell and his throat to close. He did not realize that the magic in the suit would set off his allergies, and he died.

name: Armor of Twin Warriors
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of green-hued half-plate armor.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can summon a double of themselves, who will attack designated enemies until the double takes 50 damage, or until one minute has passed, after which they will crumble away into dust. The double cannot speak, and their physical details seem slightly blurred.

**History:** Once there was a set of twins, who were both talented warriors who fought side by side on the field of battle. One twin was struck down, and the sister refused to leave his side. His dying soul clung to hers, and his spectral image would appear whenever she needed his help the most.

name: Armor of Reflection
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of highly-reflective silver plate armor.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can reflect all the damage of one attack back at the enemy.

**History:** This armor was worn by the great knight Amadeus Silvercoat, alegendary angel who was thrown to earth for his pride. After traveling the world and giving his life to save that of a peasant woman who had been kidnapped by devils, Amadeus’ soul returned to the heavens. 9%

name: Armor of Safety
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of heavy steel plate armor. A single eye is engraved into the breastplate and, while activated, the eye darts back and forth searching for danger.

**Enchantment:** If the wearer loses consciousness or is reduced to 0 HP, the armor will take control and walk them away from the battle to safety.

**History:** This armor was commissioned by the queen for her son, who was leaving to fight in the front lines of battle. She was worried for his safety and, though he wore the armor with great reluctance, it did indeed save his life when he was struck down by a skillfully thrown javelin. Many songs were written about how his unconscious body was seen sprinting back into the city walls.

name: Armor of the Demon Slayer
description:
**Appearance:** A set of silver plate armor, engraved with golden holy symbols.

**Enchantment:** The user gains advantages on attacks against demons, and other evil-aligned beings from the planes of hell. All demons have a 5% chance of being instantly banished back to their original plane every time the user lands an attack.

**History:** Once upon a time, there was BY a beautiful, quiet town. It was a Poe! ° peaceful place and the people there 7 go. were happy until one day, a massive [2 — ~_j, ih portal opened in the town square. Out /= W stepped a massive horned demon, /Z L who ravaged the town until there was | = ISR VAY hardly anything left. Then, just as the | - ; s townsfolk were losing hope, out of the | = : 2 smoke stepped an armored knight. He | & SRE) wore armor of silver and gold, and he bow [a] : faced the demon without fear or [I 3 © hesitation. When the demon was ‘Yom: £20 JA) slain, the warrior disappeared = without even giving his name. 99

name: Armor of Sacrifice
description:
**Appearance:** A set of leather armor, studded with heavy steel plates. Red wax seals are scattered over the armor, dripping down the cuirass like blood. A suit of battered plate armor. The style appears to be that of an old guard's uniform.

**Enchantment:** At will, the user can decide to take the damage from any hit landed an ally within fifty feet. Once per day, the user can activate this armor’s magic to bolster their strength, granting them 50 temporary hit points that last ten minutes. However, this armor is sentient and goes by the name Daniel. If Daniel believes the user is doing something stupid or dangerous, he will attempt to take over the user's body and run to safety.

**History:** This armor was worn by many warriors, though its magic was only used by a few. The stories of those few always end tragically. One of these warriors was named Gavin Teller, a mercenary who fought alongside his wife on the field of battle. When his wife was dealt a fatal blow, Gavin used the armor’s magic to take the blow upon himself, sparing his lover's life. 233. Sentient Armor of Determination (Daniel) Daniel was once a young farmer who wanted nothing more than to be a strong warrior. He trained relentlessly behind his home but, dissatisfied with his progress, he went out in search of a sorcerer who could make him a powerful fighter. He found an enchanter in a cave in the mountains and, after hearing Daniel's wish, the enchanter bound his soul to the armor of an old soldier.

name: Armor of Soul Preservation
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of black jousting armor, etched with gold detailing.

**Enchantment:** If the user dies, their soul is automatically sealed into the armor where it will remain until the body is revived, the soul is transferred to another vessel, or until another person dies in the armor. 100

**History:** The origins of this armor has long since been forgotten. A young paladin stumbled across the armor deep in the forest, where it was slumped against a tree with a skeleton inside. He took the armor back to his temple for an exorcism, so the trapped soul could be freed to the afterlife. The temple then locked the armor away in the catacombs, 50 10 spirit would ever be subjected to such imprisonment ever again.

name: Armor of Focus
description:
**Appearance:** A set of steel plate armor, lined with soft sheep’s wool. A large sigil of a closed eye has been engraved on the breastplate.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user's concentration cannot be broken. An odd side-effect of the magic is that this armor emits a quiet crystalline tone, faintly reminiscent of a small bell, when struck.

**History:** Once, many years ago, the Royal Academy of Magic was sieged by pirates. Many of the pirates were killed by young mages, however many valuable tomes and tools were stolen. Bellam Mythweaver, a young student, decided to dedicate his life to returning the stolen goods. After a decade, he succeeded in finding ever single stolen artifact and, to honor and repay him, the Academy gave him a suit of armor, crafted from the bell that fell from the tower during the siege.

name: Armor of the Elements
description:
**Appearance:** A set of rough iron armor, covered in sigils of binding and taming. The armor is scratched and dented, and appears a little melted on the inside.

**Enchantment:** While worn, all elemental spells cast by the user increase in strength.

**History:** Any human-like being that wears this armor may find that it fits alittle oddly. That's because, once upon a time, this armor was worn by Flame - a gathering of five fire elementals that were summoned and joined together inside this suit of armor by Forgemaster Oina, who wished for aid in the forge. After the Forgemaster passed away, Flame roamed the world until the enchantment trapping them in the mortal plane faded, and they fled. 101

name: Armor of Aid
description:
**Appearance:** Pale silver plate armor with a holy sigil etched into the breastplate. A red silk sash runs from left shoulder to right hip.

**Enchantment:** While worn, all healing spells cast by the user increase in strength.

**History:** This armor was the uniform of the Paladins of Aid, a collection of paladins that were sent by the church to aid those in need. Usually the paladin was sent as penitence for some sin or slight against the temple, and warriors who were ordered to serve time in the Paladins of Aid considered it a punishment. Ry.

name: Armor of Magnetism
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of tarnished — iron plate armor. Small metal items, Af A. ~ such as coins or clips or silverware, Ir he will magnetically stick to the | > armor’s surface, seemingly ANG)! os A regardless of metal type. : Se | Fh — ee

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, (5/ |  : La == the user can cause the suit to So He become magically magnetic. Any @ I= metal weaponry within fifteen feet * [OPQ of the user will fly out of hands, NU 4 pockets or sheaths towards the WN o user, before falling to the ground at N ) their feet. Other metallic objects glo such as armor, coins or jewelry are not affected.

**History:** This armor was invented by Armaldo Tennison, a bouncer for an exclusive tavern who was tired of patting people down in search of hidden weapons. It worked well for a while until, one day, someone smuggled a wooden stake into the tavern and stabbed a high-ranking noble. Armaldo was fired soon after. 102

name: Armor of the Ice Lord
description:
**Appearance:** A set of silver armor that is perpetually covered in a thin layer of frost.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user's skin becomes icy to the touch. The user becomes stronger in cold weather and, once per day, the user can casta 60ft. cone of frost that does 2d12 damage. At will, the user can freeze small bodies of water, and their breath is eternally visible as a cloud of steam in the air.

**History:** Once upon a time, there was a majestic lake. Legend had it that in the water lived a beautiful goddess, who would grant any wish asked of her. A young lord went off in search of the lake, regardless of the snow and freezing temperatures of the deep winter. Against all odds, the lord found the lake. He walked across the ice in search of the goddess, but his armor was too heavy and he fell through into the water, where he froze to death before he had time to drown.

name: Armor of Darnel’s Charge
description:
**Appearance:** A suit of beautifully articulated plate armor, designed for ease of movement over style. A poorly-repaired gash is clearly visible on the gorget.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user gains the ability to Charge. When the user dashes for 15ft. towards an enemy, their terrifying momentum allows them to deliver a devastating blow.

**History:** This armor was S— worn by the king's brother, INE Th Darnel, who loved nothing le RZ more than hunting boars RN N Sx \-/\L on foot. He would trot NN RE through the forest in his SN ATS QD heavy armor, searching for / = OR FAS a hoofprints on the forest A= Q H had - floor. When he spotted his Ray y 3 +, [= prey, he would charge the [3 > S RY boar and impale them on == his massive spear. Prince Darnel was finally gored in the stomach - a wound that became infected and soon ended his life. 103 Helmets -1d10- — 7) ———eeeee A i on ES

name: Helm of Mind Warding
description:
**Appearance:** A silver great-helm with a golden cross hammered into the faceplate. On particularly dark nights and in particularly evil places, a faint halo can be seen glowing above the wearer's head.

**Enchantment:** While this helmet is worn, the user is immune to psychic damage and all magical spells that affect the mind, such as charm, fear, and so on.

**History:** Once there was a pair of talented mercenaries. One was a wizard named Elias, the other was a warrior named Ghelisha. The two traveled together for years, reaping the rewards of the adventuring lifestyle. One day, the two got into an argument and Ellias, out of anger, used her mind magic against Ghelisha. The warrior, terrified and betrayed, fled and commissioned this helmet, so he would never suffer such betrayal again.

name: Helm of Giants
description:
**Appearance:** A tarnished iron burgonet-style helm, with carved stone beads threaded onto the braided strap.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can polymorph into a stone giant for ten minutes.

**History:** Hundreds and hundreds of years ago, there was a was a clan of roaming soldiers called the Northern Giants. They were a ragtag band of deserters, traitors and veterans who, for whatever reason, couldn't obey their captains. They would travel, making temporary camps and taking mercenary work wherever they could. After one year with the group, a soldier would be given a Helm of Giants as a symbol of their new alliance. 104

name: Helm of Ancestor’s Strength
description:
**Appearance:** A silver frog-mouth helm. A red horsehair plume trails three feet from the top of the helmet.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user i = can kneel and call upon the spirits of EE their ancestors to gain 1d100 7 / SEE temporary hit points. The effects last | ETN for one hour. ER

**History:** This helm was worn by a line H of warriors, passed down from mother NT ZL to daughter as they fought as soldiers, 7 mercenaries or adventurers. When aid | was needed, the warrior would simply kneel and summon her ancestral spirits to help her in battle. The tradition was ended, however, when the warrior was slain by a pirate. Her armor was stolen, and her family has been searching for the helmet ever since. 3 $B = QT - =

name: Helm of Telepathy
description:
**Appearance:** A closed knight's helm with a tall plume of speckled quail feathers.

**Enchantment:** This helmet allows the user to communicate telepathically with any willing creature within 60ft.

**History:** This helmet was a symbol of the captain of the Royal Army, who would use the helmets magic to communicate clearly and efficiently with his soldiers on the battlefield. 105

name: Helm of the Deer Goddess - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** A simple iron helmet with huge two-foot long elk horns.

**Enchantment:** This helmet seems ordinary, however once it is donned, it cannot be removed except by magical means. This helm greatly improves the wearer's dexterity, allowing them to Na Q move silently and easily ==. = through rough terrain. The SEAR) user also gains enhanced MN AN sense of smell and precise = Nine i hearing. However, the user a OS feels compelled to make TNT weekly sacrifices to an B Paka ancient deer goddess. **History:** Thousands of years ago, there was a goddess of the deer and elk. She fell deeply in love with a hunter after she found him poaching her children, and the two became fiery lovers for a time. But the goddess was intense and wild and the hunter, realizing the danger, decided to leave her. Enraged, the goddess put this helm upon his head so that while he could leave, he must return to her once every seven days to pay penance.

name: Ghostblade Helm
description:
**Appearance:** A steel bassinet helm with a plume of blue horsehair.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can clap their hands together and summon 1d6 phantom swords that hover in the air around the user. On command, the swords can fly off and attack an enemy within 20ft. The swords last for one minute, or until they take 15 points of damage.

**History:** This helm was worn by Dervish Ghostblade, the Man of a Thousand Swords. He was a noble-born mercenary, known for his unique and deathly efficient fighting style. After he retired, the helm was stolen from his home and was later found circling the black market. 106

name: Yoki Mask
description:
**Appearance:** A men-yoroi style steel face mask, molded in the shape of a snarling face with needle-sharp teeth.

**Enchantment:** This mask is terrifying to behold, giving the user advantage on intimidation checks. Once per day, the user can also cast Fear on one enemy within eyesight, PX causing them to flee in terror. ~~ A 0

He fought off Si net [ more than two-dozen pirates before the en A thieves finally fled in terror, bearing NES stories of the terrifying demon that {Qe § guarded the gates of the Yoki family “Sys ~====" 02 land.
