name: Helm of Head Removal
description:
**Appearance:** A burnished sallet-style helm.

**Enchantment:** While this helmet is worn, the user's head can be freely, easily and painlessly detached from the user's body. The user retains total control over both the head and the body If the helmet is removed, the head will act as ifit has been severed and cannot be reattached.

**History:** This helmet was created by an enchanting teacher, who enjoyed playing pranks on first-year students. yi ed) ’ A LED) ° 44 = ay 107

name: The Dalla Helm - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** A black armet helm, studded with rubies.

**Enchantment:** Once donned, this helmet cannot be removed except by divine intervention. While worn, this user is immune to all magic. Magic simply has no effect on the user, and they cannot cast spells themselves. However, the user constantly bleeds from the eyes and nose, taking 1d4 damage per hour. They are stricken with terrible nightmares, preventing them from getting a good night's sleep.

**History:** Once there was a cleric named Dalla Dorna. She spent her days praying and studying magic until one day, she realized her true power. Her magic was the strongest in the world. Her power took over her mind and she abandoned the church in pursuit of selfish goals, hunting for gold and killing anyone who got in her way. She strayed so far from the light that finally her god cursed her to wear this helm, snuffing out her ‘magical powers and lowering her back to the simple cleric she once was.

name: Helm of Bereavement
description:
**Appearance:** A silver knight's helm. The front plate is molded in the likeness of a human skull.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can exert the heln's magic to appear as a dead loved one to all sentient creatures who look upon them. The effects last for ten minutes, and will deeply unnerve all the enemies that experience the illusion.

**History:** This helm was worn by a crooked cleric who, for a small fee, would ‘summon’ dearly departed loved ones for the recently bereaved. oF o Saf\ 9 r wits -~ “A 7 = \Vip a > y ey REOL® FR SO oo as Arg © adr ® 108 Cuirasses and Breastplates -1d10- : Er i — el 2

name: Unmoving Cuirass
description:
**Appearance:** A lightweight cuirass of hardened leather.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken this cuirass freezes, and cannot be moved from its place in space by any natural force.

**History:** This armor was created for a young warrior who was slight in body and strength. He would often be shoved away by larger foes and, to combat this, he commissioned this cuirass. His agility combined with his expert timing allowed him to become one of the most fearsome warriors in the land.

name: Cuirass of Soul-Following
description:
**Appearance:** A silver cuirass etched with very faint runes. When the magic is activated, the runes glow with white light.

**Enchantment:** After killing an enemy, the user can decide to follow the deceased soul to the afterlife. Within two minutes of the creature's death, the user can place one hand on the corpses head. The user's soul will abandon their body, and follow the dead creature to its specific afterlife, where the user can communicate with the dead soul, explore the afterlife, etc, for one hour or until the user decides to return. The user's body appears unconscious for the duration of their visit to the afterlife. This cuirass must charge under the light of the full moon between uses.

**History:** This armor was created for the purpose of questioning prisoners and soldiers who died before interrogation; however, it was quickly discovered that souls could not be threatened for information in the afterlife. The cuirass was sold to the temple, who would use it when an individual passed away quickly, without the opportunity to say goodbye to their loved ones. 109

name: Rangers Cuirass - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** A plain steel breastplate that is studded with dents and holes from arrowheads.

**Enchantment:** Once donned, this armor can only be removed by magical means. All projectiles, such as arrows, rocks and magical missiles, are twice as likely to hit the wearer. All damage from arrows is doubled.

**History:** This cuirass was given as a prank gift to the newest recruit of the King's Rangers, a group of prestigious woodsmen responsible for combing the backcountry and scouting for danger. The rangers only removed the cuirass from the newbie after he was mortally wounded during a hunting accident.

name: Gestelle's Cuirass of Healing
description:
**Appearance:** An elegant silver cuirass, etched with curving lines that accentuate the form.

**Enchantment:** When the wearer falls to 0 HP, the magic inside the armor blasts the user with healing light, immediately stabilizing the user and reviving them to 1 HP. After three uses, the magic inside the armor fades and the cuirass shatters.

**History:** Once there was a woman named Gestelle. She was a legendary battlemage, who dedicated her life to the temple. She traveled from battlefield to battlefield, fighting beside soldiers during the battle, and healing them after the battle. Her magic seemed to rub off on everything she touched, including her armor, which still carries her healing magic to this day.

name: Poison-Blood Cuirass
description:
**Appearance:** A tight-fitting cuirass made from a strange green metal.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user's blood becomes acidic, painful and poisonous to the touch of other creatures. The enemy has a 25% chance of being sprayed in acidic blood after every attack successfully landed against the wearer. The blood does 1d4 acid damage per round for 1d10 rounds, or until the blood is scrubbed off. 110

**History:** This cuirass was worn by a mercenary known as Lillian ‘Poison-Blood’ Daniels, who became famous for coating her arrows in her own blood before firing them at her enemies.

name: Cuirass of the Angel
description:
**Appearance:** A golden cuirass, with large wings etched on the backplate.

**Enchantment:** One per day, the user can sprout a pair of huge white wings and fly at double their running speed. The effects last for one hour, after which the feathers slowly fall away until the wings are gone.

**History:** This armor belonged to Gnarlotho em Tine, a self-proclaimed angel of the sun. He Nj started life as an orphan of the temple and, //a\ I 4 when he reached adulthood, he wentona J" ==\ F722 pilgrimage to find his ‘true purpose’. After {+ === { J/~T saving a woman from bandits on the road, {> © <\[/% © he took it as a sign that removing thieves \% d and criminals from the world as his godly | i calling. What followed were years of poorly- |= K judged vigilantism, which was broughttoan — SSmmiiees? abrupt end when he was arrested for murder.

name: Yorn's Cuirass of Perseverance
description:
**Appearance:** A somewhat bedraggled cuirass made from heavy leather and chainmail. A red handprint was painted over the left breast.

**Enchantment:** The more injured the user is, the stronger they become. For every 20 points of damage taken, the user adds +1 to their attack roll.

**History:** This armor was part of the uniform of a crew of berserk warriors, who lived on the sea and made their living sailing from town to town, offering their strength as mercenaries. This armor in particular was worn by Yorn Toeface, a berserker who left his life as a sailor, selling his weapons and armor to purchase farmland in the temperate midwest. mm

name: Cuirass of Bella's Hand
description:
**Appearance:** A simple silver cuirass etched with runes. The backplate is tarnished a deep black, where the ghostly arm sprouts from the metal.

**Enchantment:** While worn, a hugely long, grotesque, ghostly arm sprouts seamlessly and painlessly out of the user's back. The 6ft. arm is only visible in dim light. The user Be has full control over the arm, Once ==. per day, the hand has a 3% chance FU AN of rebelling and strangling the ANDER user. EN \J hs SOIR BA NTE

**History:** This cuirass was created 1 3 NY by a potion-maker who needed vq , help with his work after his < 37 — 0 x assistant passed away in an Ca ny explosive magical accident. He 7 summoned the spirit of his k A deceased assistant, sealing her Ww 2 soul into the cuirass. His dL Ta prosperous life was cut short, ~~" 5 N however, when his ghostly ff \(__FT— assistant strangled him to death.

name: Cuirass of Death Warding
description:
**Appearance:** A roman-style cuirass, molded in the shape of a muscular torso.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken the armor is surrounded by a cloud of white light, and the scent of frankincense fills the air. For one minute, the user is incapable of dying. They cannot drop below 1 hit point. After one minute, the spell wears off and the user falls to a stable 0 HP, regardless of the damage they took.

**History:** This armor was worn by Gladion ‘Sixty-Second’ Glorio, a famous gladiator with an all-or-nothing fighting style. If he did not take out his enemy within one minute, he lost the match. His career came to an end when he went up against Isabelle “Bone-Pulper” Desani, who accidentally snapped his spine just as the armor’s magic wore off. 112

name: Cuirass of Micahel
description:
**Appearance:** An old-fashioned knight's cuirass of tarnished silver.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user cannot be magically sensed, followed, seen or communicated with by gods, deities or other holy beings. The user becomes immune to all holy magic.

**History:** This armor was worn by Micahel, a figure of legend who was chosen by prophecy to be a warrior of the gods. Micahel, however, wanted nothing more than to be left alone. For years, he wore this cuirass and evaded the eyes of the gods before he finally shed the armor and gave in to his destiny. {— — ¥ Sg \ SRN SIR SAKES IR AY NEI A HERA hey EN SS er rv, t= Zs 7 a4 HE] fh 2 = = & = EE R =I oh 6 Wo 155 = J 6] == file RM i Ne 13 Bracers and Gauntlets L -1d20- a Cy SE i en Ls NER = =. =

name: Gauntlets of Constitution
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of tight-fitting leather gauntlets, studded on the inside with cobber beads that press into the user's skin.

**Enchantment:** These gauntlets use pressure-points and subtle magic to greatly improve the user's constitution.

**History:** These gloves were commissioned by Wimbleton Farrow, a young farmebr with a weak stomach who desperately wanted to take mercenary work to support his family. After bringing in enough money to carry his parents through several winters, he sold his gloves and returned to the fields.

name: Metallurgist’s Gauntlets
description:
**Appearance:** Heavy gauntlets of steel and leather. The steel is tarnished and the leather is cracked from exposure to heat, but tiny flame-like runes can be seen etched into the metal.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user is capable of bending and molding all common metals with ease. Once per day, the user can touch a metal object and instantly heat it to a red-hot temperature.

**History:** Once, there was a dwarf named Orth Goldthorn. He lived in the Erstwhile Valley, and spent his days crafting swords and axes and farming tools with these gauntlet, selling his goods and making a modest living. Then came the rainy season - the lake swelled and pushed against the dam, threatening the entire town in the valley below. Finally, the inevitable happened and the dam sprung a leak. Goldthorn immediately donned his gauntlets and climbed the dam. He worked for three days and three nights, repairing and strengthening the dam. After, he was praised as a local hero and savior of the town. 114

name: Gloves of the Monk
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of padded leather gauntlets, secured with long RN red ribbons. 2

**Enchantment:** While these gloves (> SS are worn, unarmed attacks do an Pe 5) additional 1d6 force damage. EE)

**History:** Once a year, the kingdom Vie © /) holds an annual boxing competition. NA For ten years, Roderick Huld tried to win first place, but every time he failed. Finally, realizing his career was coming to an end, he commissioned these gauntlets and entered the competition once more. Winning was easy with the aid of his magic gloves, and it was years before anyone realized the truth of his victory.

name: Gauntlets of Demon's Bane
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of solid, heavy gauntlets of intricately forged silver.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can touch an object or creature affected by an enchantment to dispel the magic. The user also gains the ability to touch demons and evil spirits, banishing them back to their native plane.

**History:** These gauntlets were worn by Emeraude Gwen, an exorcist and demon hunter known for her skills, apathetic nature and intimidating appearance. Her dark cloak and trademark silver gauntlets were widely recognized, and her appearance in town was seen as a symbol of bad luck, even if the townsfolk were grateful for her help. After decades of demon-slaying, Emeraude went missing while in pursuit of a particularly dangerous devi. Z Van < J» Zavaa | [77 £ QU NEE: oY ED RN | fir Se = 115

name: Hook Gauntlets
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of heavy leather gauntlets with sharp hooks inlaid in the palms and fingers. Wide straps snake around the user's arm, securing the gauntlets firmly in place.

**Enchantment:** This strange pair of gauntlets allows the user to climb sheer surfaces with ease. They also gain advantage while grappling - the hooks sink into the flesh of the opposing creature, doing 1d4 damage per round and making it difficult to get away.

**History:** These gloves were made popular by the Seven Rangers, a group of rangers and druids who dedicated themselves to keeping the roads free of crime. They would use the hooks to scurry up trees, taking thieves and highwaymen out with their bows from a distance. This pair was owned by Calder Surefoot, one of the seven rangers, who gave them away to a young fan.

name: Godkiller Gauntlets
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of ornate golden gloves. Runes are etched into the metal, and they seem to move and shift, drifting across the gold surface.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user is capable of killing deities, gods and other holy beings that are otherwise immortal.

**History:** No one is sure who made these gauntlets, but they appear to be thousands of years old. First, they were worn by Meus Fleetfoot, a man who wished to take revenge against the god of death for taking his wife. Next, they were worn by Hollie Mountainspear, who wished to take the power of the gods for herself. Then, they were passed to an unnamed girl who used them to defeat Luffie the Imposter. These gloves seem to have a personality of their own, seeking out those who need their power. F wre © b re \\ CCE) SA CEN Gir Se NED = 116

name: Gauntlets of Arrow Snatching
description:
**Appearance:** Leather gauntlets with padding on the palms and fingers.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can catch an arrow that would have otherwise hit them.

**History:** These gloves were common among circus performers, who would snatch arrows out of the air for the entertainment of the crowd. These gloves were worn by a particularly unfortunate performer who failed to keep track of the uses, and died after attempting to catch a second arrow.

name: Fire-Fist Gauntlets
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of lightweight iron gauntlets, tarnished black by smoke and heat. A burned, scorched smell seems to hang around these gauntlets.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can snap their fingers and cause their hands to burst into flames. The user feels no adverse effects, but any creature they touch takes 1d6 fire damage.

**History:** These gauntlets were worn by Xavierra Fire-Fist, a bounty- hunter known for branding her handprint into the skin of her enemies. She was so despised in the criminal circles that, finally, they cornered her in an alley and took her out.

name: Point-and-Hope Gauntlets
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of purple leather gauntlets, studded with colorful gems and strange runes.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can cast a completely random spell on a chosen target. However; the spell has a 25% chance of backfiring on the user.

**History:** These gauntlets were intended to be powerful, spell- enhancing gauntlets, but the enchanter didn’t quite know what he was doing and he created these instead. After some experimenting, he accidentally cast levitate on himself, flying several hundred feet nto the air before falling to his death. 17

name: Circuitry Gauntlets
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of heavy iron gauntlets. The metal’s surface is streaked with jagged, lightning bolt-shaped lines.

**Enchantment:** When the user’s hands are pressed together, it closes a circuit and the user becomes electrified. The user feels no effects, however those who touch the user immediately take 1d6 lightning damage.

**History:** These gauntlets were worn by an enchanter who took an interest in lightning, and its peculiar ability to power his small, simple machines. > A asf i 7ST GAN 5 Ex . we ==

name: Gauntlets of the Archer
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of leather archery gauntlets that stretch up to the user's elbow. Large runes resembling arrows mark both palms.

**Enchantment:** At will, the user can summon magical, ghostly arrows into their hand. The arrow behaves as an average arrow; however, it appears slightly translucent and will slowly fade, disappearing after 1d4 minutes.

**History:** These gloves were enchanted and worn by Marwood Green, a young hunter who was taken as an apprentice by an old wizard who saw ‘the boy's potential.

name: Bracers of Secret Detection
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of silver bracers, embedded with clear circles of glass.

**Enchantment:** While these bracers are worn, the user can place their hand on the wall and sense all hidden things within 20ft,, from secret doors to hidden traps. 118

**History:** Once, there was a king who was hated throughout the kingdom for his high-taxes and lax ruling. Criminals roamed the streets and tax collectors ravaged the towns. After a failed attempt on his life, the king commissioned these bracers from a local enchanter. A servant would wear the gloves and walk in front of the king at all times, sensing for traps and hidden assassins. The servant's family was ruined by the high taxes, and so one day the servant simply let the king walk directly into an explosive trap.

name: Gauntlets of the Spectral Eagles
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of heavy leather bird-keeping gauntlets.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can summon 1d8 spectral eagles. ‘The magnificent birds glow with an unearthly light, and will attack any creature directed. The birds fade after ten minutes, or after they take 25 damage.

**History:** These gauntlets were worn by Princess Ila, a young princess who was known for her love of birds and her legendary aviary. She hated her lessons, choosing to spend most of her time with the birds. When people bothered her, she would simply send her ghostly eagles to chase them away.

name: Gauntlets of Clear Sight
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of gauntlets that seem to shift and change shape. Sometimes they are leather gloves, embroidered with runes. Sometimes they are silver, inlaid with ornate golden sigils. Sometimes they are heavy gauntlets made from a strange, crystalline material.

**Enchantment:** When the user touches their thumbs and forefingers together, they can peer through the formed triangle to see through all illusions, including magical disguise, magical darkness, and so on.

**History:** These gauntlets were worn by the famous illusionist Winnie Baz. She would use her powers for both combat and entertainment, and her spells were so powerful that it was impossible to tell reality from her illusions. Knowing the power such magic held, Winnie wore these gauntlets so illusions could never be used against her. 119

name: Gauntlets of the Necromancer
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of black, intimidating gauntlets. When the magic is activated, the gauntlets glow with a blood-red light.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can touchany ~~ #4, */]| creature that has died within the last 24 hours. When 5 //={N the command word is spoken, the creature suddenly 2 \ comes to life. The creature is fully conscious; \: however, they have difficulty moving and appear to {NAH be in some pain. Its not a truelife, however, and the D lf creature will return to death after one hour. A \ H Fi

**History:** Ignoring the warnings of his advisors, the ~~ 02 [7 ye king hired a necromancer to craft these gauntlets  , J: | § after a criminal in his custody passed away without NY \ giving the king the information he wanted. Both the ANY S\74 body and the gauntlets were stolen from the ZZSNE A dungeons after the king refused to allow the or \{ js criminal’s family to bury him. NY NY v

name: Gauntlets of Fire
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of steel gauntlets, covered in a thin sheen of oil.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, any weapon held by the user glows red-hot and drips with flame, doing an additional 16 fire damage.

**History:** These gauntlets were worn by Lochaise Demure, a legendary adventurer famous for rescuing a long-lost princess from Amuras, the Dragon of a Thousand Treasures.

name: Gauntlets of Rot
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of gauntlets covered in black scales that glitter with a violet sheen in certain light.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, any weapon held by the user is shrouded in a faint black mist, doing an additional 1d6 necrotic damage. Any small plants or animals touched by the user immediately wilt away and die. 120

**History:** These gauntlets were worn by a shoemaker moonlighting as a novice necromancer. He discovered his love of necromancy after bringing his beloved cat back from the dead. The shoemaker was bad at hiding his tracks, however, and he was arrested after stealing a corpse from the grave-digger’s house.

name: Gauntlets of Poison
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of iron gauntlets. The metal is pitted and tarnished, as if by exposure to acid.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, any weapon held by the user is coated in a sheen of bright violet poison, doing an additional 1d6 acid damage.

**History:** These gauntlets were crafted by Shua Tao, an assassin who was known for leaving her victims with huge, sizzling wounds that reeked of burning flesh. If you wanted someone dead in an ugly fashion, Tao was the one you hired. The assassin’s run was cut short after she sliced her hand on her own blade, thus poisoning herself.

name: Gauntlets of Sacrifice
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of tarnished iron gauntlets, etched with images of human skulls.

**Enchantment:** The user can sacrifice their own health in exchange for enhanced strength and accuracy in battle. The more health sacrificed, the greater the bonus. The wearer can make the sacrifice as often as they like, however the effects only last for ten minutes.

**History:** These gauntlets were worn by the followers of Molza, the goddess of blood and battle. She looked fondly upon those that sacrificed themselves to her, and granted boons to those that offered her their blood. Many of Molza’s believers would pass away after offering her too much. 121 Greaves -1d10- a ay — [N

name: Mechanical Greaves
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of peculiar greaves made from brass. There are stiff, jointed supports at the user's hips, knees and ankles, and the occasional puff of steam billows from the mechanisms.

**Enchantment:** These mechanical greaves grant the user impressive leg strength, allowing them to jump huge gaps, deadlift incredibly heavy objects, kick down doors, etc. However, these greaves malfunction when exposed to water. The bonuses return only after the mechanisms have had plenty of time to dry.

**History:** These greaves were made by an enchanter who took an interest in steam, and its peculiar ability to power his small, simple machines. While he never wore this armor personally, he often hired mercenaries to test his new mechanical armor in battle.

name: Greaves of Ease
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of leather greaves painted with golden runes.

**Enchantment:** While worn, the user can move easily through rough terrain, natural or magical.

**History:** These greaves were worn by Debias Crowsight, an apothecary who was known for his rare and powerful medicines. He would disappear into the wilderness for months on end, returning to his shop without an apparent schedule.

name: Greaves of Reverence - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of steel greaves with golden inlay.

**Enchantment:** Once donned, these greaves cannot be removed without holy intervention. These greaves force the user to kneel in the presence of a holy aura. 122

**History:** These greaves were commissioned by Lord Loring Coldcleaver, leader of the most prestigious temple in the capital city. His son refused to follow in his father’s footsteps, choosing instead to become a bard. Furious, Lord Loring forced his son to wear these greaves, so he would always show the church ‘the respect it deserved’.

name: Blade Greaves
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of simple leather greaves. An embroidered line of runes runs along the leather from ankle to knee.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, long, devastating blades appear along the shin guards from knee to ankle, allowing the user to perform deadly kicks.

**History:** These greaves were crafted by Zof Ragspell, a monk who was known for his unique and deadly fighting style that primarily involved intricate kicks and flips.

name: Greaves of Prayer
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of heavy golden greaves.

**Enchantment:** When the user kneels and offers a prayer to their deity, the user gains a +1 spellcasting bonus for ten minutes.

**History:** These greaves belonged to an angel named Hoza, who spent four hundred years wandering the mortal plane while being tasked to learn what she could of the mortals there. She learned of kindness and evil and human nature, and when her time on earth was over, she bestowed her holy armor upon her beloved friends and ascended to the heavens. ee + + x + + + + + = 123

name: Greaves of Dancing
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of tight-fitting leather greaves.

**Enchantment:** These greaves allow the user to dance with great skill

**History:** These greaves were worn by Norman Daiya, a legendary rogue and adventurer who spent his days pillaging tombs, and his nights dancing away in the taverns. As the years went on and Norman grew older, his decades of partying began to take its toll on him. However, he refused to give up his life and, at eighty years of age, he died on the dancefloor.

name: Greaves of Spiderwebs
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of black, lightweight greaves made out of some sort of chitin. They are covered in a thin layer of sticky, shining spiderwebs.

**Enchantment:** These greaves ooze with sticky 4 spider’s silk, allowing the user to climb sheer Z J surfaces with relative ease. 45,

**History:** Once, there wasa town perched upon &¢ 2d il the edge of a canyon. One day, hundreds of So) years ago, a massive spider crawled into a 3 SN cave, only coming aut to prey on the townsfolk. 4/77 NS Then came an unnamed warrior, who ) descended into the canyon and fought the | monster. The battle went on for hours, but the % warrior was victorious. He refused payment tL from the grateful villagers, only taking the A chitin from the great spider's back. NZ /)

name: Greaves of the Mariner
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of greaves made from a light-weight silver metal etched with fish scales.

**Enchantment:** While these greaves are worn, it is very difficult for the user to fall off of things such as boats, ledges, tightropes, ladders, etc. The wearer will also have no difficulty acclimating to life on the sea, and they will not experience seasickness. 124

**History:** Once, there was a young girl who wanted nothing more than to fish tuna on the sea. She was a clumsy girl and so her parents refused tolet her go, fearing for her safety. So, she took a job in the fields, saving her money until she could afford to commission these enchanted greaves that would let her pursue her dream. Ty + SAN = Sd SEES b=

name: Greaves of Deer Step
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of rough leather greaves.

**Enchantment:** After these greaves are donned, the users legs morph into those of a deer, allowing them to run at great speeds and leap over obstacles with ease.

**History:** These greaves were worn by Kafishne Dune, a druid who spent years traveling the world with her beloved deer familiar. After the deer passed away, Kafishne turned his hide into a pair of greaves, so she would remember his grace and speed for years to come. 4g TN

name: Mirror Shield
description:
**Appearance:** A circular silver shield, polished to a brilliant sheen.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can utter the command word and reflect all damage from a single attack back on the enemy.

**History:** This shield was owned by Yirera Tigereye, a skilled battlemage and combat instructor who tutored the royal children for two decades. When the young prince finally defeated her in a duel, she proudly bestowed upon him her shield.

name: Shield of Spell Reflection
description:
**Appearance:** A large shield, made from mirrored silver.

**Enchantment:** For five minutes, any magic spells cast at the wearer is reflected back on the caster. Must be charged under the light of the full ‘moon between uses.

**History:** This shield belonged to Ornec Stonewalker, a powerful magician. He was so powerful that nothing challenged him, and so he roamed the world, joining in any war he stumbled across. He became Known as a legendary angel of battle, whose appearance meant that war was soon to follow.

name: Shield of Insanity
description:
**Appearance:** A steel shield with a shining, crystalline surface.

**Enchantment:** Every time an enemy looks at the shield’s surface, it shows them a terrible vision of their future, giving them a 10% chance of driving them insane. The user must be careful to not look into the shield, or risk going mad themselves. 126

**History:** Once, the goddess of creation looked over the land and wept for all the evil and terror that filled the world. The other gods and goddesses tried to show her the good that existed alongside it all, but the goddess could not be soothed and her tears fell to earth as diamonds. This shield was crafted from these tears, showing those who peer into its surface the cruelest side of humanity.

name: Shield of Terror
description:
**Appearance:** A rough iron and wood shield, decorated with the horrifying face of a beast.

**Enchantment:** The face on this shield is a= terrifying, Three times per day, the user can £ZA°1 "13.53 summon the shield's magic to make the eyes //( W A IWAN glow red and smoke pour out of its mouth. +f wo! } 14 Any creature within 15ft. of the shield hasa [| 4g v2 \ chance of fleeing in terror. 3 EI 0s (\ 7)

**History:** Once, there was a mercenary \'\. gs/»/y \ battlemage who was tasked with killing a \ Ass uo! 1’ ‘wolf that had strayed into the fields and was ed \ \ killing off livestock. Instead of killing the REN" beast, the wizard bound its soul to her shield. pate

name: Bracelet Shield
description:
**Appearance:** In its bracelet state, this shield appears to be a simple golden chain. When activated, it appears as a golden buckler.

**Enchantment:** This shield appears as an average bracelet. When the command word is spoken, it violently expands out into a full-sized buckler.

**History:** This bracelet shield was worn by Daniella Beauregard. She was a council woman who, after surviving many assassination attempts, decided to learn how to fight. She wore this bracelet so she would be prepared to defend herself at all 4 eee —— TR, 127

name: Gummy Shield
description:
**Appearance:** A heavily tarnished steel shield.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can utter the command word. The next attack that lands on the shield sinks into its suddenly Soft surface and sticks there, where it will remain until the user speaks the command word again. - ; NAN

**History:** This shield was a simple, nonmagical __—~~ FARENS shield when it was first created. However, the [fi \\ 2) #71 Knight who carried it was clumsy and dropped | LX it while passing through an enchanted swamp. {3S & Ne The shield stewed in the magical mud for ALY hundreds of years until it was found by a farmer Ne 0,2 /PN harvesting peat for fertilizer. The shields new \ o% magic wasn't discovered until many years later. s NO

name: Tent Shield
description:
**Appearance:** A battered circular knight's shield.

**Enchantment:** When this shield is tossed on the ground and the command word is spoken, the shield grows and morphs into a sturdy four-person tent made of peculiar silver canvas.

**History:** These shields were part of the uniform of the Fighter's Guild, a group of mercenaries that banded together to make the most of the sword-for-hire economy. This shield was owned by Delthar Bilgewater, a mercenary who worked with the guild for ten years before selling his armor and becoming a tailor.

name: Storm Shield
description:
**Appearance:** A tarnished iron shield, padded on the inside with heavy leather.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can summon the storm elemental that is trapped inside the shield. The shield begins to crackle and glow and, for the next ten minutes, any creature that lands an attack on the shield takes 1d6 lightning damage. If the user is outside, there is also a 259% chance that it will begin to rain. 128

**History:** Once, a hundred years ago, a huge storm was threatening the capital city. The royal mage climbed to the highest tower in the city and faced the storm with outstretched arms, spinning her magic and pulling the storm elemental right out of the clouds. She imprisoned the spirit in ashield, so its storms would never threaten the capital again.

name: Shield of the Undead
description:
**Appearance:** A massive silver kite-shield.

**Enchantment:** This shield carries a strong holy aura, repelling all undead that draw near.

**History:** These shields were part of the uniform of the Armored Elites, a group of elite knights who were sent to handle the kingdom's most dangerous problems. Hundreds of years ago they marched out to fight Leeroy Gravedigger, a necromancer who was terrifying the countryside. ‘The knights fought him and his undead army with much bravery, but they were no match for the limitless and cruel power of the undead, and the dead Elites soon joined the ranks of the necromancer.

name: Shield of Shielding
description:
**Appearance:** A silver shield that glows with a magical glimmer. A noble blade of heavy steel.

**Enchantment:** Once per day the user © 3 can summon a magical, spherical shield “5 ZT \N | that surrounds themselves and any ally “773. |: 2 > ‘within ten feet. A EEA A HTN This sword is possessed by the soul of Sir Laurence, an honorable knight who will give the user aid while battling evil-aligned creatures. However, Laurence is proud and will refuse to fight in anything except honorable combat.

**History:** This shield was carried by \lf\ “{. |: |; / I] Davin Hardwing, a member of the \" BHR famous Five Swords adventuring party. \} %\:\: | 4% One day, the Five Swords went out to \ mel EE ' take down a black dragon that was 9 \) :\}}]/* terrorizing the countryside. The \ BZA adventuring party never returned, and Q Ne A If: their armor and weapons were only ug, found after the dragon's hoard was a NX ° uncovered. 129 5S 0 I = LS rl i ! (x | |] \ Swords -1d20- Ng / oem 301. Sentient Sword of the Soldier (Sir Lawrence) Sir Laurence was once a prestigious knight who lived hundreds of years ago. He dedicated his life to protecting the king and stayed by his side always. When the time came for the king to ride into battle, Laurence rode with him. The battle was hard fought, but in the end, they were outnumbered and Laurence perished, with the king following soon after.

name: Wooden Blade of the Seasons
description:
**Appearance:** A long wooden blade that behaves like a normal, living maple sapling.

**Enchantment:** This blade flows with natural magic, its enchantment changing with the seasons. It must be watered daily, or else its enchantment will fade as the blade begins to die. Spring: The blade is covered in Fall: The green leaves fade to pale pink flowers, and does an brown, and the blade does an extra 16 poison damage. extra 1d6 fire damage. Summer: The wooden blade Winter: The leaves fall off, sprouts green leaves and does leaving the blade bare, doing an an extra 1d6 radiant damage. extra 1d6 frost damage. 132

**History:** This blade was carefully sung from a tiny seed by a very patient druid. The process took many years but the druid’s patience was rewarded with a blade that became legendary through the kingdom. When the druid grew old, he passed the blade on to his apprentice so its ‘magic would live on.

name: Queen's Blade
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate, slender longsword with a pommel etched with intricate roses.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can summon a ghostly double of the sword, wielded by the queen who carried it into battle. She will wield her ghostly blade expertly and silently, fighting by the user's side for ten minutes before fading into a cloud of mist.

**History:** Once, thousands of years ago, the J kingdom was ruled by a queen whose name 3 has long since been lost to time. She ruled her IX kingdom with kind sternness, a firm hand bel) nT. that was needed in a time of strife and 5 uncertainty. The kingdom was beset on all sides by rival warriors, hungry for land and power. Instead of giving up her land, she donned armor and took up the blade, marching into battle on the front lines. She protected her kingdom, but lost her life in the process.

name: Blade of Regeneration
description:
**Appearance:** A terrifically ancient longsword. The blade is chipped and dented, though its edge remains razor sharp. A number of strange runes have been etched near the hilt, and they shine brightly whenever the blade takes a life.

**Enchantment:** The blade draws from the enemy's life force - the user regains 1d8 hit points after every kill

**History:** No one is sure where this blade came from, but its ancient designs suggest it was created thousands of years ago. 133

name: Soul Blade
description:
**Appearance:** A silver blade with a golden pommel wrapped in red silk. Alarge ruby is set in the hilt, and it glimmers and shifts as if filled with ‘mist. Runes of spiritual binding are marked on the blade.

**Enchantment:** When a creature is killed, its soul is transferred into the gem in the hilt of the sword. The user can communicate basic information with the soul if the soul is willing. The souls of certain creatures can also give the blade certain bonuses, at the game master’s discretion. For example, a demons soul may cause the blade to grow a ghostly claw that slash nearby foes; a necromancer’s soul may cause the blade to revive slain enemies as enslaved undead, and so on.

**History:** This blade was carried by Autumn Sibill, a paladin who traveled the kingdom, ridding the land from evil. She commissioned this blade in order to say prayers over the souls of evil creatures, blessing them and sending them on peacefully to the afterlife.

name: Blade of the Sun and Stars
description:
**Appearance:** During the daytime, this blade is gold and glistens with heavenly radiance. At night, the blade is silver and cold, glistening with mysterious moonlight.

**Enchantment:** This blade changes form twice per day, at dusk and dawn. Day: This blade does an extra Night: This blade does an extra 2d6 radiant damage, and the 2d6 frost damage. All holy user can cause the blade to glow creatures are affected doubly with light at will. All undead by this blade. creatures are affected doubly by this blade.

**History:** Thousands of years ago, this blade was carried by Annafel Dawnbringer, a strange goddess who was born of the sun and the moon. She was the most powerful magician in the pantheon, and she was quite mad. She razed cities and rebuilt them, she flattened forests and regrew them. She was a powerful cycle of destruction and renewal, until finally the gods imprisoned her on the moon, where she remains to this day. 134

name: Lavastone Sword
description:
**Appearance:** A short sword made from black, glassy obsidian.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, this sword heats to a red-hot temperature, doing an extra 2d6 fire damage to all enemies. When activated, the sword becomes hot enough to melt most common metals.

**History:** Once, there was a brave soul named Tognan Firestone. He came from a family of obsidian carvers and, in a quest to find the world’s finest and strongest obsidian, he delved deep into the volcanic mountain range believed to be the home of the fire goddess. He was gone for three days and four nights and, when he returned, he brought with him a chunk of obsidian larger than any he had ever seen. He claimed it was a gift from the goddess herself, and he carved it into a sword in honor of her. A 3 =~ n ~ o 3 $e y . Vo EA / : ny 2% ~\ yi BL 7s 135

name: Sword of Chance
description:
**Appearance:** A steel short sword, with a hilt wrapped in a length of red silk.

**Enchantment:** This swords magic appears unstable, flickering between enchantments. Whenever an attack lands, the user must roll on the table below to determine its bonus effect.

name: The sword breaks. 93. The user hallucinates wildly
The enemy is forced to oii vemmre
The enemy hallucinates Hep
description: **History:** This blade was an enchanting experiment created by a student wizard. The enchantment didn't quite go as planned, and so the young wizard stowed the blade away with his belongings, completely forgetting about it and eventually pawning it off for a bit of gold. 136

name: Singsong Blade
description:
**Appearance:** A slim katana in a sheath. The wood of the handle and sheath are hollow and dotted with holes at even intervals. At a passing glance, it appears to be a wooden flute.

**Enchantment:** This blade can be held to the user's lips and played like a lovely flute. The notes are loud and pure, and are clearly audible over the most raucous of noises.

**History:** This blade was carried by Sedicus Harper, a traveling bard who made his living by playing his lovely music in taverns and town squares.

name: Soul-Ward Sword
description:
**Appearance:** An elegant silver longword. The face of a beautiful angel is worked into the golden hilt.

**Enchantment:** This sword has a strong holy aura, and does extra damage against all unholy creatures. Whenever an undead creature or a being with an evil aura is within 100ft, the face in the hilt begins to weep. The soul of any creature killed by this blade is immediately banished to the afterlife.

**History:** After her family was Killed by a necromancer, Alana Sari prayed to the gods for the strength to hunt down and kill the murderer. The goddess of life bestowed upon Alana the Soul-Ward Blade and with it, she slew the necromancer. But she didn't stop there, instead choosing to dedicate her life to the goddess, ridding the world of as many necromancers as she could.

name: Necromancer’s Blade
description:
**Appearance:** A black sword with rubies set up the length of the blade.

**Enchantment:** Any creature killed by this blade has a 10% chance of being raised as an undead under the user’s control for 1d4 hours.

**History:** This blade was wielded by Thelna Blackheart, a necromancer who was infamous for preying on farms out in the deep wilderness. She amassed quite an army, but was hunted down and killed by a paladin before she could put it to use. 137

name: Needle Rapier
description:
**Appearance:** A needle-sharp rapier with a simple silver hilt wrapped in blue leather.

**Enchantment:** This rapier is incredibly sharp and strong, designed to pierce the thickest armor. The user has advantage while fighting heavily armored enemies.

**History:** This rapier was carried by Orion Damien, a young, slight duelist who made his fortune challenging huge and heavily armored foes to fight. Eventually his rapier’s enchantment was discovered, but Orion simply retired and lived a happy, wealthy life.

name: Boomerang Sword
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate sword with a slightly curved blade.

**Enchantment:** This sword is slightly curved, and was clearly designed to be thrown, though it can also be used like a traditional sword. After the sword is thrown, it will dislodge itself and return to the user. If the user does not catch it, they risk being struck and injured by the flying blade.

**History:** This sword was crafted by Norwyn Hollie, a rather clumsy adventurer who often lost his grip on his sword. His friends gave him a sword that would return to his hand no matter how clumsy he was. el me pats T=

name: Sword of Sacrifice - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** A tarnished silver blade. Six fire opals are set in the brass hilt.

**Enchantment:** This sword must be used to kill at least one creature per day. If the sacrifice is not made, the sword will begin to feed off the user's life force. The blade whispers terrible truths to the user, but despite all of this, the user feels a strong impulse to keep the blade. They will not willingly give up the blade, even if their life is threatened. 138

**History:** This sword was carried by Cynric Dina, a terrible warrior who was responsible for destroying hundreds of temples in the name of his own dark god. His rage and bloodlust were so strong that it lived on in his blade after he died.

name: Blade of the Canyon
description:
**Appearance:** A rusted blade, with a chunk of red jasper set in the hilt.

**Enchantment:** Once per week, the user can (®), drive the point of this blade into earth. After a — moment, the earth begins to tremble and a H 60ft. long, 10ft. wide chasm will open up in a i direction of the user's choosing. Li

**History:** This blade was crafted by Luther Clyde, an enchanter who loved nothing more than hiking along the canyons and searching £ for precious stones. One day, he stumbled upon IN an earth elemental hiding among the rocks. [ig o Instead of killing the spirit or chasing it away, Luther sealed it into his sword. | i

name: Ghost Touch Blade
description:
**Appearance:** A steel blade that was roughly tipped in silver. A light sheen of frost coats this blade at all times.

**Enchantment:** This sword is cold to the touch. The user's hand will freeze to the hilt if they do not wear gloves. The blade does an extra 2d6 frost damage, and has the peculiar ability to affect spectral creatures such as ghosts, spirits, and so on.

**History:** This blade was enchanted on the fly by a wizard whose tower was suddenly overrun by ghosts. 139

name: Sunblade
description:
**Appearance:** A golden blade that seems to glow with bright daylight. A strangely light longsword, with three bells hanging from the hilt = A ragged, dull blade caked with rust and dried blood.

**Enchantment:** This blade glows with golden light. The blade does an extra 1d6 radiant damage and, once per day, the user can cause the blade to flash suddenly, blinding all creatures within 30ft. Any undead faced with the tremendous light will turn and flee. Once per day, the user can utter J | the command word and release the sword. It | will fly around on its own, attacking enemies for 10 minutes, after which it will fal lifeless to ol the ground. This enchantment will f automatically trigger if the user falls in combat. =) : Any wound inflicted by this blade has a 50% of becoming horrifically infected.

**History:** This blade was carries by Lumar Ominus, an adventurer who spent his days delving into dark caves in search of treasure. He disappeared after delving into a newly discovered cave, and his body was only found after the light from the blade was seen shining from the cave by passing farmers. 319, Dancing Blade This blade was carried by Vistra the A 9 Battlemage, who fought with a graceful mix of E blade and spells. She ran a small combat school | FE in the capital city, and eventually passed her blade on to her apprentice, who ran school after she died. 320.11 Blade This blade was driven into the heart ofa dragon and left there, absorbing the dragon's magic as the carcass festered and rotted away. 140 SAT © Knives PRE PEER Cano, Baa BS rd

name: Shatter-Knife
description:
**Appearance:** A glassy, red knife with a black hilt.

**Enchantment:** This knife is very fragile, and has a 25% chance of breaking off inside the enemy. After that, the shard will do 26 damage per hour until the shard removed, or the creature dies. The blade’s tip regrows every night at midnight.

**History:** A hundred years ago, this blade was carried by Shundriru, the queen's crooked advisor who guided the queen for her own gains. When the queen finally stopped taking her advice and banished her from the kingdom, Shundriru drove the blade deep into the queen's breast, where it shattered in her heart and killed her.

name: Poison Blade
description:
**Appearance:** A tarnished silver dagger that weeps with violet, watery poison.

**Enchantment:** This blade seems to £5, weep poison. The blade itself does little damage, but the poison causes huge ZA amounts of pain and does 1d6 damage SA per round for 1d4 rounds. NN

**History:** This blade was eaten by a i poison dragon, passing harmlessly 3S through its body. When it came out on AUN the other side, it had absorbed some of “hd the dragon's poisonous magic. 141

name: Unseen Wound Blade
description:
**Appearance:** A dull knife with an milky, crystalline blade.

**Enchantment:** This knife . causes horrific internal EH i damage while leaving the a X enemy's skin completely <4 oF untouched. 7 gi JU

**History:** This blade was NU crafted by Inigo NSE Fallentree, an assassin iN 2D yd who specialized in | TRAN blending with the noble ik i) I | crowd. He would subtly GRY [7D inflict invisible wounds, — causing his victims to die Se aslow death. =

name: Torture Blade
description:
**Appearance:** A short knife with cruel-looking runes inscribed on the blade.

**Enchantment:** Any enemy struck by this blade becomes more likely to cooperate with the user.

**History:** This blade was kept in the king's dungeon and used by Frun Sharpbrace, the dungeon master who had a fondness for torture. He was eventually killed when the inmates escaped and took their revenge.

name: Sightless Dagger
description:
**Appearance:** A glass blade. The hiltis wrapped in a length of silver silk.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can utter the command word and become invisible for 1 minute.

**History:** This blade was used by Yonder Sharprock, a rogue-for-hire who would take any job, no matter the task. She was eventually killed when she turned invisible and was run over by a galloping horse. 142

name: Clavicus Scalpel
description:
**Appearance:** A seemingly ordinary surgery scalpel.

**Enchantment:** No one can be killed by the injuries this knife causes. The user can inflict as much damage as they want and the enemy will not die. The user also becomes adept at performing basic medical procedures.

**History:** This knife was used by Doctor Clavicus Tornel, who had this scalpel commissioned so he could perform experimental, life-saving surgeries without endangering the patient.

name: Dagger of Safety
description:
**Appearance:** A long, wickedly sharp dagger with runes etched into the silver blade.

**Enchantment:** This dagger cannot cut, scratch, or in any way hurt its user.

**History:** This dagger was carried by Litlio Toms, a rather clumsy thief who lost several fingers to his own blade before investing in this magical dagger. It could not save him from his intrinsic clumsiness, however, and he perished in a trap some years later.

name: Courtier’s Flute
description:
**Appearance:** A seemingly simple wooden flute hiding a slender, silver blade.

**Enchantment:** This knife is expertly disguised as a small flute, and the blade is impossible to detect by normal or magical means.

**History:** This knife was carried by Seren Elkins, a courtier who spent her time spying for the queen. Her life came to a tragic end when she was accidentally killed by another rogue who had been sent to spy for the king. - —= == = 143

name: Felix’s Dagger of Abilities
description:
**Appearance:** A peculiar double-bladed knife with a stained wooden handle. An opaque crystal has been affixed to the pommel.

**Enchantment:** The user has a 20% chance of temporarily gaining a quality from the creature killed. Abilities are chosen at the game master’s discretion. For example, if a dragon is killed, the user may temporarily gain dragon wings or fire breath; if a goblin is killed, the user may temporarily gain the ability to speak their language, and so on.

**History:** This knife was created by Felix Anderson, an enchanter who ‘wanted nothing more than a pair of raven’s wings. He crafted this knife and killed a raven and, sure enough, he sprouted a pair of glorious black wings. Immediately he took to the skies where he flew for many joyous hours, until the enchantment faded and he fell to his death. Perm (=r f 4 Ny) SS. £1) = { —

name: Diamond Dagger
description:
**Appearance:** A simple dagger made completely of prestine diamond.

**Enchantment:** This dagger cannot be broken by natural or magical ‘means. It is completely indestructible.

**History:** This dagger started life as an average, everyday dagger carried by a mysterious adventurer. The adventurer dropped it in the legendary Diamond Caves of Altmer, where the knife remained for hundreds of years. Slowly, the magic of the cave crept into the dagger, crystallizing the steel until it became solid diamond. It was finally discovered by a farmer who wandered into the cave searching for a lost cow. He sold the diamond knife for a small fortune. ‘ — | Ee A ¥ < A [5 7 144 Bows -1d10- e— LO27G fg.” (27% mS

name: Bow of Plentiful Arrows
description:
**Appearance:** A composite longbow made from lovely, lacquered mahogany with a grip of red leather.

**Enchantment:** When the bowstring is drawn, an arrow magically appears notched and ready to fire. Once fired, the arrows disappear after 1d4 minutes.

**History:** This bow was carried by Rita Janision, a ranger known for selling the finest deer hides in the land. She was eventually arrested for poaching the king's prized deer, though her friends and customers know she was framed by a rival hunter.

name: Underwood Bow
description:
**Appearance:** A brutal, yet elegant bow made of black ebony. The string is made from braided horsehair, with a grip of white silk.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can shoot around an obstacle and hit an enemy that is taking cover. As long as the user has seen the target, the arrow will simply swerve around obstacles to strike them.

**History:** This heavily enchanted bow was carried by Aiden Underwood, a legendary bounty-hunter who was often in the service of the king, hunting down lords who refused to pay their taxes. When he wasn't hunting lords for the king, he was crafting bows in his cabin in the ‘mountains. 145

name: Bow of the Queen's Sniper
description:
**Appearance:** A grey longbow with runes etched into the grip. An ash longbow with a violet leather grip. Red tassels hang from the two ends of the bow, and seem to flutter in an eternal, invisible breeze.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to accurately shoot arrows twice as far as non-magical bows. This sentient bow is named Victoria. She is a quiet, proud bow that will greatly improve the user’s aim, only after the user has proved themselves to be a worthy archer.

**History:** Thirty of these bows were made and carried by the Queen's Snipers, a group of fiercely loyal and elite marksmen who would ride into battle in the name of the queen. They were responsible for taking out many enemy encampments before the battles even started, ending wars before they could truly begin. . T rR EY | on ER 3 i" 7 CE) Ia 25 Hn Pa [ vy v 334. Sentient Longbow (Victoria) Victoria was once an archer, who traveled with a party of four other adventurers a hundred years ago. After being suddenly killed in a ‘magical accident, Victoria's spirit was eternally bonded to her precious bow.

name: Bow of the Spectral Wolf
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy oak bow with a fur-wrapped grip.

**Enchantment:** Twice per day, the user can shoot an arrow that takes on the shape of a darting, spectral wolf. The wolf mauls the target for fifteen seconds before dispersing into a cloud of sparks. This bow regains one charge at dawn and one charge at dusk. 146

**History:** The fur on this bow came from the hide of Anita, the great wolf ofthe northern mountains. She was believed to be a local deity, keeping watch over those who walked the mountain paths. When she grew old and finally passed quietly away, the villagers turned her hide into a bow, an axe and a cloak, so that her magic would be remembered for years to come.

name: Holy Longbow
description:
**Appearance:** A longbow made of ebony, speckled with golden leaves.

**Enchantment:** This bow glows with holy light, doing 1d6 radiant damage and an additional 1d6 holy damage to all undead creatures.

**History:** This bow was carried by Gauche Elfman, a famously talented archer who roamed the kingdom in search of the legendary Bow of Song. After searching for decades and never finding what he was looking for, Gauche retired to the countryside where he lived the rest of his life in peace.

name: Hawkeye Bow
description:
**Appearance:** A compound bow with a magnifying glass hastily fastened above the grip.

**Enchantment:** While aiming, the user can ‘zoom-in’ their vision like a telescope, clearly seeing things five hundred feet away.

**History:** This bow was carried by Hafsa Curtis, a warrior who also considered himself a bit of an enchanter. He crafted this masterpiece by tying an already enchanted magnifying glass to his bow. Surprisingly, the resulting weapon worked quite well, inspiring Hafsa to quit his job as a warrior to pursue a magical career. A

name: Far-Jump Bow
description:
**Appearance:** A short bow made from a strange black wood.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can speak the command word and fire an arrow. The user immediately teleports to wherever the arrow lands.

**History:** This bow was carried by Sofia Yang, an assassin who specialized in quick murders and even quicker getaways. She evaded the law for years until she was finally caught in trap set by an elite group of soldiers dedicated to her capture.

name: Explosion Bow
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy bow made from a strange, flexible metal. It appears to be slightly scorched.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can shoot an enchanted arrow that explodes on impact.

**History:** This bow was enchanted by Fesha Decker, a ranger who had a strong passion for fire and explosions. She carried this bow for years until she was struck by a stray javelin and misfired her arrow, blowing up herself and everyone within fifteen feet of her.

name: Lightning Bow
description:
**Appearance:** An ash longbow stained with a faintly blue oil.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can speak the command word and fire a strange, glowing arrow. A rumbling begins in the sky and, after a few seconds, the target is struck by a large bolt of lightning. This enchantment can be used inside as well as outside.

**History:** This bow was crafted from the wood of the ancient God Tree, an apple tree that stood at the top of the tallest mountain for thousands of years, thriving despite the cold weather. Legend says it was the gods’ first gift to the earth, its apples feeding the first humans. It was eventually struck by lightning and its wood made into many magical artifacts. 148 Maces, Hammers and Clubs -1d10- f To {mroren 8

name: Flower Club
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy, flowering branch from a dogwood tree.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can strike an enemy with this club, causing thick vines to sprout from the ground and grip the enemy.

**History:** This club was carried by a druid named Charlotte Hartley, in the early days of her adventuring career. She took this branch from a tree near her home, so she would never forget her roots. Before she passed away, she planted this branch in the ground in hopes of sprouting a new tree. However, the club was simply picked up by a passing farmer, who kept the flowering stick in a vase in his home.

name: Sentient Hammer - Clarence
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy carpenter's mallet, made from steel with gold inlay. A holy rune is etched | TSA 5 into the side of the hammer. a0 oye Ef]

**Enchantment:** This hammer is sentient, &__ VS < possessed by a holy spirit named Clarence. He is oo] smart soul with a dry sense of humor, who will f offer frank clerical advice when asked. Any evil p spirit struck by this hammer has a chance of 5 being exorcised and banished back to their / native plane. ”

**History:** This hammer was the steadfast = companion of Genevieve Ingvar, a paladin on a & quest to spread the word of her god to the = darkest corners of the world. After her quest 3 was over, she returned Clarence to the temple and retired to a quiet life in the countryside. 149

name: Morning Star
Warrior-Bane Hammer
description:
**Appearance:** A huge battle hammer, with runes burned into the maple handle.

**Enchantment:** This hammer was specially designed to break through heavy armor. The user gains advantage while fighting any heavily armored creature, and the user has a 10% chance of breaking the armor with each strike.

**History:** This hammer was carried by Nettie Atkins, a battle captain who was famous for her giant hammer and incredible strength. She defeated many foes in her career, leading the king's army through many battles before she took an arrow to the stomach and retired to live out the rest of her days in peace.

name: Bell Hammer
description:
**Appearance:** A silver hammer with a long, ebony handle.

**Enchantment:** Twice per day, the user can strike a hard surface with this hammer to create an ear piercing, bell-like tone that does 2d6 thunder damage to all those within 20ft, including the user. 150

**History:** Hundreds of years ago, this hammer was used to strike the magical bell of the ancient capital's bell tower. The sound of the bell would echo throughout the kingdom, passing along messages of summoning or warning or celebration to even the farthest reaches of the land. After so many years of striking the bell, the hammer took on a ‘magic of its own.

name: Orzoco’s Torch
description:
**Appearance:** A large club made from a hardened wood. The tip is wrapped in rune-painted cloth.

**Enchantment:** At will, the user can ignite the club’s end. While ignited, the torch casts gentle heat and light, and does an extra 1d6 damage to all those it strikes.

**History:** This club was carried by a berserk fighter named Orzoco, who was easily recognized by the criminals he hunted by his terrifying war paint. After he passed away, his magical club was forgotten and it was many years before its magic was rediscovered. On 57 A ETE [© ECCT hes I)

name: Birdie’s Blackjack
description:
**Appearance:** A solid blackjack with a red leather grip.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can utter the command word and strike someone. The enemy's head is obscured by a cloud of cartoon stars and birds for 1d6 rounds.

**History:** This blackjack was created as a joke by a young wizard, but it was used with great success by a thief named Birdie Matthams. She would sneak up on her victims and strike them, using the ensuing confusion to steal their valuables and make a run for it. She sold the blackjack to a pawn shop after realizing she wanted to do more with her life. 151

name: Devil's Mace
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy black mace, wrought with many viciously sharp edges. There seems to be a red glow emanating faintly from within. A long wine-colored shillelagh with a golden endeap. +”

**Enchantment:** This mace radiates evil energy. Its strong unholy aura does 1d6 necrotic damage to all it strikes, doing double damage against paladins and other good-aligned holy warriors. Everyone struck with this shillelagh has a 20% chance of feeling incredibly hungover for 1d10 minutes.

**History:** Once, a star fell to the earth in a trail of fire. It burned for seven days and seven nights, reducing the surrounding forest to ash. The local villagers refused to get near, some ancient human instinct keeping them at a safe distance. But one man, a weapon crafter, approached the horrible stone and took what metal he could, ignoring his impulse to run. The mace he created oozed with the same evil aura that surrounded the star. 349, Sherry Shillelagh This cudgel was carried by Teresa Richards, a warrior who loved nothing more than seeing her enemies stumble around in a drunken haze. However, in a touch of ironic fate, she lost her shillelagh after a night of heavy drinking.

name: Porcupine Mace
description:
**Appearance:** A long-handled mace with a tip covered in incredibly sharp porcupine quills. A heavy hooked axe, with an oak handle stained red from years of bloodshed.

**Enchantment:** This mace is covered in slightly barbed porcupine quills that tend to break off inside of anyone unfortunate enough to be on the receiving end of a strike. The needles regrow every day at dawn. This axe radiates a hungry, wicked energy. It almost seems to have a mind of its own, moving in the user's hands to get a better taste of the blood it craves. This axe severs an enemy's limb whenever a critical is rolled.

**History:** This mace was carried by Daisy Price, a druid who spent much of her time on earth as a porcupine. When strangers encroached on her land, she would frighten them off with her quills. If they persisted, she would return to her human shape and threaten them with her mace. 152 Axes Px aw -1d10- \ )) p me neh , EE CE 351. Vicious Limb Cleaver Hundreds of years ago, this axe was carried by The Bane of the North, a berserk warrior who became famous for going on a week-long rampage after his village was attacked by pirates. He woke up in the village seven days later, without any memory of having killed every single pirate that stepped foot in his town.

name: Axe of God's Rage
description:
**Appearance:** A blackened great axe, chiseled with the insignia of the god of war.

**Enchantment:** One per week, the user can summon the power of the god of war and fall info a battle frenzy. Their vision goes red, and they do three times their normal damage for 1d10 rounds. During this time, they are incapable of communication or coherent thought as the war god's fury courses through them. After the rage fades, the user falls to a stable 0 hit points.

**History:** Thousands of years ago, this axe was carried by Lucero, a berserk warrior who many believed to be the mortal incarnation of the god of war. He traveled from kingdom to kingdom, earning his fame as a fearsome mercenary and generally stirring up trouble. Some say he caused the first great war by posing as an enemy prince and kidnapping the king's daughter. 153

name: Axe of Fair Punishment
description:
**Appearance:** A long shepherd's axe made from black cherry wood. The handle and head are decorated with golden geometric designs.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can summon the axe’s power, causing an enemy to suddenly suffer the same wounds that the user bears. The enemy takes an amount of damage equal to that which the user is currently suffering.

**History:** For many years, this axe was a sign of power in the king's court. Whenever someone wounded a fellow citizen, he would be struck with this axe and inflicted with the same wounds he dealt. ES fo Tee rrr bef — T— § TRIES v REsrgryy

name: Axe of Returning
description:
**Appearance:** A worn francesca axe. The rosewood handle is carved with magical runes of summoning and returning, and wrapped in worn red leather.

**Enchantment:** Whenever lost or thrown, the user can summon the axe back to their hand at will. The axe will fly through the air, crashing through walls, furniture, or whatever unfortunate creatures that happen to stand in its way.

**History:** This axe was given as a gift to the prince, after he expressed an interesting in axe-throwing to a lady he fancied. Her father was a duke and, though she was to inherit his land, she preferred to spend her time practicing the magical and practical arts. She crafted the axe with her own magic, from the leg of an expensive chair from her father’s dining room. The two were wed soon after the gift was given. =X _ pe en. 154

name: Shatter Axe
description:
**Appearance:** A peculiar broad axe with a gray ash handle, and a blade made completely of frosted glass. The blade is covered by a permanent layer of steaming frost.

**Enchantment:** This peculiar axe is freezing cold to the touch, inflicting 1d6 frost damage on all those that touch the blade. The blade is also very fragile, with a 25% chance of shattering on impact, piercing the enemy with shards of needle-sharp glass. The broken blade regrows every night, under the light of the moon.

**History:** This blade was crafted by the clever hands of a warlock who spent his days in solitude, on the frozen slope of the northern mountains. He would occasionally craft unique and deadly weapons, and would willingly trade them to travelers who asked for them. He traded this frozen axe for a new pair of boots and two pounds of salt.

name: Lumberjack Axe
description:
**Appearance:** A long-handled woodcutters’ axe. Rune-covered ribbons have been tied around the handle, along with bone beads and strange wooden charms. a

**Enchantment:** Allows 7 v the user to fell trees RN ¥ with one sweep of their ~~ [} axe, and does double [i] Np damage against all ff 2 plant-based creatures. iA) NA ©
