name: Despair Axe
description:
**Appearance:** A large and impressively heavy splitting maul. The blade seems ooze a damp, black mist that smells faintly like water lilies.

**Enchantment:** Any enemy struck by this axe has a 10% of feeling a sudden, soul-crushing despair that lasts for ten minutes. Once per day, the user can use this axe to cast a magical fear over all creatures within 20ft, causing them to flee.

**History:** This axe was crafted by a dark magician, who wanted nothing more than to instill fear and despair in the hearts of his foes. He carried this axe for many years, terrorizing the country until he fell in love with a beautiful herbalist. Immediately he gave up his evil magic and became 2 gardener, eventually marrying his love. He buried his axe in the backyard so that no one could wield fear like he once did. v ~ 1 i A A AY == =” == -

name: Pawn Axe - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** A tarnished war axe with a black leather grip. A strange red stone is set into the pommel.

**Enchantment:** Once picked up, the user becomes incapable of purposefully giving it up. This axe allows the user to create illusions at will, which can be up to 201. in size and can perform simple sounds and movements, though they are not solid to touch. However, the axe has an evil personality of its own, and will create illusions to manipulate the user.

**History:** Once, there was a battlemage named Walter Conley. He was a talented mercenary, famous throughout the land for his ability in battle and honorable business conduct. His younger brother Lenwin, however, was much less successful. He intended to give his brother this battle axe in the hopes of distracting Walter and ruining his perfect record - instead, the axe took hold of Lenwin’s mind, causing him to take the lives of a dozen innocent people before he was finally taken down. 156

name: Bane Axe
description:
**Appearance:** An ebony tomahawk with a grip of brown leather. A crystal sphere is set in the base ~~ IY of the blade - a black mist swirls mysteriously TIENT inside. Ce

**Enchantment:** This axe does an additional 1d6 J necrotic damage, and any creature killed by this 3 blade has a 15% chance of being raised as an 5 undead under the user's control for one hour. b However, this axe is actually the phylactery of a long dead lich. The user slowly grows pale, skinny and progressively more corpse-like as the lich 1 draws upon the user's energy. If the axe is used J for long enough, the lich will return to life. &

**History:** This axe belonged to Herbert Hines, a | warrior who became lich after being seduced by the dark arts. He chose his beloved axe as his phylactery, drawing strength from whoever \ carries it into battle and biding his time before 3 returning to the world of the living.

name: Pocket Axe
description:
**Appearance:** Along silver great axe with a viciously curved blade.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, this axe shrinks down to a cute two-inches in height.

**History:** This axe was enchanted by a noble warrior who wished to take his axe with him everywhere he went. Tired of leaving his axe behind for social and civil occasions, he simply shrank it down and snuck it in with him. The enchantment saved his life when a celebratory dinner was disrupted by assassins - he simply activated his axe and slew the rogues, saving the lives of a dozen royals. ha . PRON SEED RN 157 LEE reem § i i iy Staves LAER) mw

name: Staff of the Sorcery Stealer
description:
**Appearance:** A long, mahogany staff with little golden bells dangling from the grip. A hundred fingerprints have been burned into the surface of the wood.

**Enchantment:** For every successful strike landed on a magic user, this staffhas a 10% chance of stealing a random spell from their arsenal. The user can choose to cast it immediately, but the spell can be stored in the staff for an hour before the magic fades.

**History:** This staff was carried by a bounty hunter who was known to the criminal community as The Sorcery Stealer. She was responsible for taking down a dozen dangerous magic-users, using this staff to steal their magic and render them helpless. IS RG 9 i i ) v

name: Thunder Staff
description:
**Appearance:** A gnarled staff made from blackened ash. Itis simple, but the wood is soft and oiled to a faint shine, with a leather loop tied near the top.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can utter the command word and crack the staff on the floor, sending out a blast wave that does 2d12 damage to all creatures within ten feet, knocking them backwards.

**History:** This staff was made from the wood of an ancient tree that was struck by lightning. Not wishing for the beautiful and ancient wood to g0 to waste, a farmer crafted this beautiful staff without realizing the magic it possessed. 158

name: Khakkhara of Meditation
Scepter of Miracles
description:
**Appearance:** A papal scepter with a holy symbol mounted on the top.

**Enchantment:** This staff allows the user to perform minor ‘miracles’. Once per day, the user can cast a minor 1d12 healing spell, as well as summon a lightning bolt to strike any target within 30ft. This staff also allows the user to cast prestidigitation at will.

**History:** This staff was carried by a crooked man, who went from town to town, convincing the citizens of his holy abilities by summoning doves or striking down sinners with a bolt of lightning. He made a fortune from the townsfolk, who made charitable donations in the hopes of receiving a miracle. His career was brought to an end, however, ‘when the real temples pooled together to hire a hitman. / . OF ath SRY 5 159

name: Staff of Flight
description:
**Appearance:** At first glance, this staff appears to be a tangled mess of fabric, wood and twine. However, when the command word is uttered, the staff pops out into an elegant glider.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, this staff forms into a fully functional glider. A wind elemental has been sealed into the wood and, once per day, the user can summon an updraft to launch them 60ft. into the sky.

**History:** Once, there was a wizard who dreamed of flight. He enjoyed changing into a falcon exploring the skies, but what he wanted more than anything else was to share the joy of flight with his daughter. He spent a decade perfecting the glider’s design to that his daughter might fly with him someday. en ~~ nS - 3 = NSN aw —_—— ~ 3) LOT i 7 ~~ Na! SN ~ fe

name: Life-Sense Staff
description:
**Appearance:** A long staff, blooming with leaves and flowers depending on the time of year. Runes have been marked on the bark with white paint.

**Enchantment:** When planted firmly in the ground, this staff allows the user to sense all living creatures within 60ft. The user can also sense their basic emotions and wellbeing through their connection to the earth. Once per day, the user can hear and see through the eyes of one living creature within 60ft. for ten minutes.

**History:** This staff belonged to Olly Wolf, a young hermit who was wise beyond his years. He spent his time meditating in the mountains, learning what he could from nature before writing his famous book of poetry. 160

name: Poisonwood Staff
description:
**Appearance:** A long, simple staff made from a dark purple wood.

**Enchantment:** This staff is made from a very poisonous wood. All attacks have a 25% chance of poisoning the enemy, doing 2d6 damage per round for 1d10 rounds.

**History:** Once, hundreds of years ago, there was a noble woman with a passion for poisonous plants. She had a huge garden dedicated to the deadly flora, and the Mahogany Poisonwood was one of her favorites. However, one night, the young tree was stolen from her garden. Soon after, an assassin known for his deadly poisonwood staff rose to fame. Co Nh ge cd v 5 J (ig = - 0% yi Ji: v EN 1) 4 4 2 ER BA pt : th de ANGE

name: Winter Staff
description:
**Appearance:** A gray staff that is faintly cool to the touch. The ends glow with a faint blue light.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can slam this staff into the ground, sending out a frozen, 30ft. shockwave. The temperature drops to -10F and all water within the radius freezes solid. All creatures inside the radius takes 1d6 frost damage per round unless properly dressed. The spell lingers for ten minutes.

**History:** This staff was made by a wizard who wished to create a chilly atmosphere for his wife, who was often too warm. His enchantment was alittle too strong, however, and his first test of the staff resulted in both him and his wife freezing solid. 161

name: Staff of Spells
description:
**Appearance:** A gnarled oak staff with a spherical crystal fastened to the top with ornately woven golden wire.

**Enchantment:** The gem in this staffis capable of storing spells. The user can prepare their magic ahead of time, storing up to five spells in the staff at once.

**History:** This staff was carried by Orgroom Oryan, a powerful wizard who spent much of his time studying alone in his tower. He was so reclusive that the locals considered it a sign of danger whenever he would leave the safety of his tower. SEX SISTERS <= =

name: Dryad Staff
description:
**Appearance:** A gnarled length of oak tied with many colorful ribbons and sacred charms.

**Enchantment:** This staff was made from the tree of an ancient dryad. When the user touches the staff to a tree, plant or wooden object such as furniture, the dryad can ask simple questions directed at the spirit of the flora.

**History:** This staff was made from the wood of an ancient dryad, whose tree was felled by carpenters many years ago. The dryad was understanding and, instead of taking revenge against the humans who felled him, decided to help them and give what aid he could. AS o Nona, © BN 2 Zs 5. of 9 RS A § & B Py: SIRI 162 Spears -1d10- aC ANY ad

name: Lightning Lance
description:
**Appearance:** A steel spear that is crisscrossed with jagged, burned lines. When held, electricity courses over the metal and harmlessly up the user's arm.

**Enchantment:** All attacks with this spear do an additional 1d6 lightning damage and, three times per day, the user can summon a lightning bolt to strike down any target within 60ft. If the user is outside during a thunderstorm, there is a 25% chance they will be struck by lightning.

**History:** This spear was carried by the captain of the queen's guard, Mildred of the Glen, before her untimely death during the Battle of the Third Kingdom.

name: Giant's Thorn
description:
**Appearance:** A wickedly-sharp spear made from sturdy wood that has been stained a deep burgundy. A number of needle-sharp thorns are growing near the tip, and it seems to be surrounded by the faint scent of citrus and iron.

**Enchantment:** This spear has advantage against any creature with natural armor. The thorns on this spear are fragile, and have a 25% chance of breaking off inside the enemy after a strike, doing 1d6 damage per round until the thorn is removed.

**History:** Once, there was a giant who lived in the hills. On the top of the hill grew a beautiful and massive and ancient orange tree. The giant wanted nothing more than to pluck a single orange from the tree, but when he tried, the dryad inside the tree chased him away. So, when the dryad was washing her hair in the river, the giant tried again. He reached out to pick an orange, but was rewarded only with a terrible thorn driven deep into his finger. The dryad relented, seeing the giant's sadness, and gave him an orange and sent him on his way. This spear was made from the wood of the long-dead dryad. 163

name: Barb Lance
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy lance with an oak handle, and a tip made from fifteen barbs folded into one wickedly sharp point.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, the fifteen barbs snap out of the spear’s tip, driving into the flesh of the creature it's embedded in. The spear becomes completely stuck in the creature, and cannot be removed without surgical intervention unless the command word is spoken again.

**History:** This lance was the brutal invention of the kings brother, Darnel, who loved nothing more than boar-hunting. He spent much of his time tracking down the massive boars, and would often bring back magnificent beasts for the winter feast. He crafted this spear so that even if he did not strike a killing blow, the beast would not be able to flee far. Prince Darnel was eventually gored in the stomach - a wound that became infected and soon ended his life. 2 Sp)

name: Golden Serpent Lance
description:
**Appearance:** An elegant golden spear, etched with scales along its grip. The tip of the spear is fashioned in the likeness of a darting snake, its emerald fangs bared to strike. A spear that has very obviously been J made from an old shovel. The blade has been cut down i and sharpened to a jagged point. | ) A

**Enchantment:** Any creature struck by this spear takes an additional 1d6 acid damage from the poison that drips from the snake’s fangs. When the command word is spoken, the spear becomes a living golden serpent that will obey the user’s instructions. This spear contains the spirit ofalong © {1} dead gravedigger. Though gruffand a lttle shy, he can ~~ J 3 h give the user advice about undead and necromancy. ff. 3 Once per day, the user can stab this spear into a dead ral =~ creature and transfer the gravedigger’s soul into the \ § body for one hour. The gravedigger will generally help 3 the user in any way he can, though he will attempt to i kill any undead or necromancers he meets. He will not d cooperate if the user is a necromancer. |:

**History:** This spear was the prized possession of Oculus Tenevault, a mysterious and wise woman who lived a hundred years ago in a castle along the coast. No one knows how she became so wise, but many would visit her when they needed answers or advice. One day, she disappeared, leaving nothing but her staff and a pile of clothing behind. 164 375. Possessed Gravedigger’s Spear (Unknown) The spirit inside this spear has long since 3 forgotten his name. He lived many hundreds of years IE ago as a gravedigger for the capital city. He remembers performing exorcisms, banishings and blessings, all part of his wish to give the dead a peaceful passing. When a necromancer began raising up the skeletons in his cemetery, the gravedigger fashioned his shovel into a spear and hunted him down. Oddly enough, he doesn’t quite remember if he won the fight.

name: Firefrost Spear
description:
**Appearance:** An ebony spear with blades on both ends. One blade is silver and covered in a perpetual layer of tinkling frost. The second blade is gold, shining with heat. Small glowing runes run along the grip.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to choose which blade to strike with. The golden blade does an additional 2d6 fire damage, while the silver blade does an additional 2d6 frost damage. Once per day, the user can either summon a freezing blizzard or a blistering sandstorm that lasts ten minutes.

**History:** This spear was carried by Lusenfar, the demigod heir to the god of fire. The other gods were infuriated by the half-god child and banished him to the earth, but his father bestowed upon him the Firefrost Spear so that, even as he walked alone in the world of mortals, he would always be able to protect himself. 165

name: Rose-Thorn Spear
description:
**Appearance:** A gnarled, living spear grown from a strange rosebush. The tip is a viciously sharp thorn, surrounded by a bouquet of leaves and roses.

**Enchantment:** At dawn, 1d4 rosehips sprout off of the spear’s delicate greenery. These rosehips can be eaten to restore 1d8 hit points.

**History:** This spear was carried by a talented florist, who often made bouquets for the castle. She needed a way to protect herself as she made her deliveries, and so she grew this spear. Rumor had it that the florist had dryad blood, because her flowers were more beautiful than any in the kingdom. hs 2 \J 2 = raid o mm CHANG D\ NY NEES © STERN 0 e A]

name: Revenge Spear
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy glaive with a blue rune etched into the blade. The grip is wrapped in blue leather.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can summon the spear’s magic and strike an enemy, dealing an amount of damage equal to that just inflicted upon the user.

**History:** This spear was carried by Liana of the Cold Stream, a fearsome mercenary who was known for taking quick and brutal revenge against anyone who dared hurt her. She retired after she lost an arm in a fight against a dragon, but not before lopping off one of the dragon's legs in return, 1} Ql N= 166

name: Stay-Spear
description:
**Appearance:** A simple hunting spear, etched with rough runes.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken this spear freezes, and cannot be moved from its place in space by any natural force.

**History:** This simple spear was crafted by a spear-fisherman, who was tired of his spear being swept away by the river. After he passed, his family pawned the spear without realizing its true magic.

name: Ghost-Twin Spear
description:
**Appearance:** Assilver spear with a scarf of ghostly blue silk tied around the end.

**Enchantment:** When the user utters the command word and throws the spear, three ghostly, yet fully-functional spears appear alongside the projectile, slamming into the target before fading into mist. This enchantment can be used three times before it must be charged under the light of the moon.

**History:** This blade was crafted by Ofelion Silverhusk, a master craftsman who made a series of ghostly weapons from silver forged with moonlight. This spear was carried by Ofellon’s daughter, who traveled over the sea to seek her destiny. He never saw her again. ~. Nw . a NY OM B A ls e 167 Vez Projectiles le =

name: Pushpin Arrows
description:
**Appearance:** Arrows tipped with sharp silver arrowheads that are marked with little runes and fletched with red feathers.

**Enchantment:** If the target is within 5ft. of a wall, pillar or other large object, the arrow pushes through the target, pinning them to the surface behind them.

**History:** These were crafted a few weeks ago in a magic shop in the capital city.

name: Boomerang Knives
description:
**Appearance:** A set of steel throwing knives with grips wrapped in mahogany leather.

**Enchantment:** These knives return to the user's pocket 1d4 minutes after being thrown.

**History:** These knives were commissioned by Danial Howard, a circus performer known for knocking apples off of peoples’ heads with a perfectly aimed knife. His career came to an abrupt end when he went to work after a heavy night of drinking and inflicted terrible injuries upon an innocent audience member.

**History:** These pebbles were the experiment of an alchemist named Ornstein Fireguard, who lives in a small city along the southern coast. 168 384, Net Stone This stone was crafted by Linola Bane, a bounty hunter who was known for her ability to bring in any criminal alive and unharmed. When she retired, she donated her equipment to a museum that was promptly robbed.

**Enchantment:** When shot, these arrows soar like a speeding sparrow, flying through the air twice as fast and twice as far as average arrows.

**History:** These arrows were crafted by a druid with the feathers of her sparrow companion. She lost her arrows when she transformed into a bear and lost all of her equipment in the forest. 169

Some say he was blessed by these gods, the way weapons seemed to pass through him without harm. He drove the pirates back from the coastal temple and protected the clerics, and was named a saint for his chivalry.

**History:** These seeds were crafted a few days ago by a thief who was planning on using them to scale the castle walls. She was arrested before she could put her plan into action. 170

**Enchantment:** These gloves remain at an uncomfortably warm temperature. Three times per day, the user can ignite these gloves, doing an additional 2d6 fire damage with any unarmed attack.

**History:** These gloves were crafted from the hide of a flame salamander and worn by a chef, who used their magic to cook kabobs during jousting events.

name: Sentient Venom Chain - Rosethorn

She has an explosive temper, and will fly from the user's hand to strangle any creature who doubts her power. All attacks do an additional 1d6 poison damage. The chain will automatically wrap around any enemy she’s thrown at, doing 1d6 piercing damage per round until the chain is untangled. This whip is charged with electricity, and does an additional 1d6 lightning damage to all attacks. Three times per day, the user can crack the whip, letting out a deafening, concussive blast that does 2d12 thunder damage to all creatures within 15ft. **Enchantment:** This garrote contains the spirit of a violent wind elemental, who sucks the air from the lungs of its victims. When used to choke an enemy, the enemy suffocates twice as quickly.

**History:** This garrote was carried by Dawn Fogbreath, an assassin known for her quick and quiet work. She finally perished when the wind elemental inside the garrote turned against her, suffocating her in her sleep.

name: Sunburst Sickle

In the user's presence, all plants grow five times as quickly. Once per week, the user can control | Z—yqCoxx, or summon terrible storms. i

**History:** This sickle was carried by a druid who spent his days in the fields, caring for his crops and singing to his harvest. After so many years of use, the sickle absorbed the druids magic and the enchantment lived on, even when the druid passed away. 397. Storm Trident | This trident was carried by the royal It magician, who often used it to divert powerful - storms and hurricanes around the capital city. TH 174

**History:** This blowgun was crafted by a cleric named Drewin Claire, as an easy way to deliver medicines to unwilling patients.

name: Olimar’s Razor Net
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy silver net, woven with razor-sharp blades.

**Enchantment:** When thrown onto an enemy, this weighted and razor- sharp net becomes nearly impossible to remove. Italso has the peculiar ability to affect ghosts, spirits and other spectral beings.

**History:** Hundreds of years ago this net was carried by Saint Olimar Gnos, a priest who was known for exorcising over a thousand cruel spirits. When his time came, he laid the net over himself and passed away, his soul immediately banished to the afterlife by the holy silver.

name: Automatic Slingshot
description:
**Appearance:** A small, handheld artifact that appears to be a steel tube mounted on a wooden handle with what appears to be a crossbow trigger.

**Enchantment:** After one minute of preparation, the user can aim this device at an enemy and pull the trigger, launching a small lead pellet at incredibly high speeds towards the target. The bullet does 2d12 damage, but has a 10% chance of backfiring.

**History:** This strange device was carried by Captain Brawnston Icewater, a pirate leader who spent his free time inventing and perfecting his automatic slingshot. He carried a dozen of them into battle, firing one after another before drawing his sword and charging into the fray. He would often throw the guns aside, and lost many in the roiling sea. 175 er 1 4h M8) Chapter 5 - Books, Journals and Scrolls -1d100- d wv N © 4 A . s STD TR AAT a FL = EE SEARLS IN - SENN CC NCH wis) A Na § 2, LHe %. > 6 = 05%, A. 5 + 9 << AN el in Zo 177 Nonfiction -1d20- Ce Se ES x 5

name: A Beekeeper's Guide
description:

**Enchantment:** At will, the user can ’ A; summon the carefully painted bees from qe! the pages and cause them to swarm Di around any target within 30ft. The bees will swarm for ten minutes before dispersing, and will immediately wash away when touched by water. 4)

**History:** This book was written by Teresa Olgara, a druid beekeeper who lived along the temperate southern coast. She had hundreds of hives and, while she was a powerful spellcaster, she preferred to make her living selling honey and beeswax candles. Though she is getting on in her years, she still tends to her hives to this day.

name: The Hasty Man's Cookbook
description:

At will, the user can pull the food right off the page ~ however, the picture disappears after one use and cannot be used again. This book allows the user to perfectly create any recipe. No matter the user’s skill, the recipe comes out perfect every single time.

**History:** This book was enchanted by a wizard with a passion for cooking. Instead of illustrating her work, she simply pressed her recipes directly into the pages. 178 403, The Perfectionist's Cookbook No one is sure who wrote this book or where it came from, however it was used in the royal kitchen for a number of years, as the book's recipe for spinach puffs was a favorite of the king.

name: Lamb Stew and Other Recipes - A Beginner's Guide
description:
**Appearance:** Aworn outlittle cookbook bound in yellow linen. The title is stamped on the cover in black ink.

**Enchantment:** For whatever reason, the recipes do not work. Any food the user makes following a recipe in this book turns out terribly.

**History:** This book was passed around the castle cooks, as each of them tried sabotage one another and earn the title of head chef.

name: Iliad Dayes - An Autobiography

**Appearance:** A clearly unread —r \ autobiography. The image of a smiling A woman has been painstakingly drawn  \ oh on the cover in lifelike detail. 3 Wi Ou

She wrote this book, infusing it with her personality and knowledge so that, even after her death, a little part of her would live on. 179

name: A Children’s Guide to Language
description:
**Appearance:** A small children’s book with colorful illustrations.

**Enchantment:** This book contains an incredibly effective language learning program. After reading this book, the user becomes proficient ina new language.

**History:** This book was one of a series of children’s books written by Elise Nickletone, an enchanter and tutor who served the royal family for many years. When her students grew, she retired and spent the rest of her days teaching casual classes in town.

name: Magic for Youngsters
description:
**Appearance:** A small book bound in red leather. The title is stamped on the front in gold.

**Enchantment:** After reading this book, the user gains the ability to learn and use one cantrip, regardless of casting ability.

**History:** This book was written by a sorcerer for his young daughter, who wanted nothing more than to cast little spells to impress her friends. 180

name: Music for Imbeciles
description:
**Appearance:** A thin, saddle-stitched paperback with a picture of a piano on the cover, surrounded by music notes.

**Enchantment:** This book contains an incredibly effective music learning program. After reading this book, the user becomes proficient in a new instrument.

**History:** This book was commissioned by a duke whose son was hopeless on the piano. The young lad improved significantly, and eventually followed his dreams to become a famous bard, known for always toting along his trusty melodica. P= =< pe EE —— = — — A= i 181

name: Phylacteries - A Study
description:
**Appearance:** A thick and dusty book bound in black leather. The title is stamped on the cover in red foil.

**Enchantment:** When read, this book seems to contain a rather dry essay on phylacteries. However, the reader has a high chance of being possessed by the soul of the dead lich that lives inside.

**History:** This book was written by Ortherius Magnor, an author who made a deal with a devil, becoming a lich so that he might live for hundreds of years and continue doing the one thing he loved most ~ writing. Ortherius wrote hundreds of books in the hundreds of years he was alive and, when he gets a new body, he plans on continuing his extensive career.

name: The Woodsman's Handbook
description:
**Appearance:** A simple paperback book with a cover of thick cream paper. An image of a bear sitting under a tall pine tree has been poorly inked on the front.

**Enchantment:** After reading this book, the user becomes proficient at wilderness survival and tracking creatures through all sorts of terrain.

**History:** This book was written by Winston Barbel, leader of the Woodsman's Guild. It was given out to every guild initiate, along with the task of surviving alone in the forest for one week. If the initiate survived, they were accepted into the guild.

name: History of Flame
description:
**Appearance:** A dusty book bound in brown leather. It's covered in a coating of charcoal. A rather charred book bound in scorched red linen. The title has been stamped on the cover in gold, and the word ‘CAUTION has been scrawled just below it in black ink.

**Enchantment:** This book bursts violently into flame when opened, though the book appears to be unharmed. This book explodes when opened, doing 2d12 damage to anyone within 5ft. The book does not appear to be harmed by the explosion.

**History:** This book was crafted by a young enchanter. As a prank, she gave it to her master who promptly burnt his fingers. Though he wore bandages on his hands for the next several days, he was impressed by his student's skills, and took her as his personal apprentice. 182 414.A Learner's Guide to Fireworks This book was supposed to be a guide on the creation of magical fireworks, but the wizard who wrote it failed to realize that drawing exploding runes inside the book would cause some issues. The wizard soon died of his injuries.

name: Hunting Bears - Safety and Methods
description:
**Appearance:** A large, thick book bound in grey leather. The edges of the paper are jagged and sharp. A thin book with blank pages, bound in blue linen. The title is stamped on the cover in silver foil.

**Enchantment:** The user can utter the command word and lay the book open on the floor. The book will violently close on whatever creature touches it next, snapping shut like a bear trap. The sharp edges will cause a painful 1d8 damage, plus 1d4 for every minute the creature remains in the trap. This book neatly records all conversations, along with the names of those speaking, within 30ft.

**History:** This book was written Dolias Gibbins, world-famous bear hunter and legendary fur trader. Though his name isn't widely known these days, he was quite the hero in his day. 416.0n Record Keeping and Eavesdropping This book was carried by the old queen, who often felt as though her serving maids were talking about her behind her back. They were, of course, and they were fired. From then on, however, the queen was considered a paranoid woman. 183

name: The Local's Atlas
description:
**Appearance:** A large, somewhat bedraggled leather-bound book with the title stamped on the cover in large black letters.

**Enchantment:** This atlas gives detailed maps and history on whatever building or area the user may be in at the time.

**History:** This book was carried by Tibbins Baudelaire, an amateur cartographer who soon became famous for her expertly and swiftly crafted maps.

name: The Personal Autobiography
description:
**Appearance:** An elegant book bound in red leather. The corners are plated in gold, and the title is stamped on the cover in gold foil.

**Enchantment:** This book immediately writes a detailed history on whoever last touched the book. When a new user touches the book with their bare skin, the book rewrites itself.

**History:** This book was used by the city guard to determine whether not certain individuals were guilty. It was only in the possession of the city guard for a number of years before the city thieves banded together to steal the incriminating book.

name: An Ogre's Guide to Cooking Flesh
description:
**Appearance:** A huge book written in big, rough handwriting. Inside seems to be a cookbook based solely on the preparation and consumption of humans. The steps are brutal and detailed.

**Enchantment:** After reading, the user is left with a horrified feeling in their stomach. Anyone who reads this book is immediately and violently ill, and wil refuse to eat meat for 1d6 days after.

**History:** This book was written by Dal-Um Stonetoe, an ogre known among his people for his delicate and masterful preparation of human flesh. The ogres were soon chased away after picking off too many villagers from the nearby town. 184

name: Dictionary
description:
**Appearance:** A seemingly average dictionary, though a few words appear to be missing.

**Enchantment:** The user can pull out one physical representation of every word in the dictionary. For example, if the user summons the word ‘sword’, they can pull a sword straight out of the pages. The item cannot be returned to the book. One item can be pulled from the book per day and, once used, the word simply disappears and cannot be used again,

**History:** This dictionary was enchanted by a hedge-mage, who was known for causing trouble in town with his raucous experiments, Excited by his new dictionary, he pulled the word ‘death’ from the pages. name: Telonius Gray and the Talking Finch
description:
**Appearance:** A book bound in gray leather. The title, along with an image of a finch, is stamping on the cover in silver foil. Inside is a story about Telonius Gray, a druid who betrayed his order after being persuaded by a demon disguised as a finch.

**Enchantment:** The reader has a chance of going blind.

**History:** This book was written by Therius Thornstalker, a druid who found himself questioning his own order. He wrote this book as a metaphor for the evils that are disguised as natural progressions.

name: Tome of a Thousand Tales
description:
**Appearance:** A thick book bound in red leather, stamped with golden corners and bindings. The title has been traced on the cover in golden, elegant letters.

**Enchantment:** The pages display a new story every time the book is opened. So far, no story has been repeated.

**History:** This book was given to the king by the Magician's Guild on the day of his daughter's birth. After the princess’ death, the book was stowed away in the vaults along with the rest of her possessions. AD Loge oP 186

name: A Grocer’s Morning
description:
**Appearance:** A children’s book made from thick cardstock paper. It's colorful and bright, and illustrated with lovely pictures. The story describes the day in the life of a grocer, told all in rhyme. When the pages are turned, little cutouts fold up out of the page.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, one paper popup is replaced with a real object that falls out of the book when the page is turned. -1d10-

name: A 25-foot length of rope. 7. A small mirror.
Abottle of milk. 9. A needle and thread.
A dozen eggs. 10. A pencil.
description: **History:** Once, there was a powerful sorcerer named Gwendoline Mane. She worked for the king, riding into battle by his side. After many years had passed, she grew tired of bloodshed and retired to the countryside. She spent the rest of her days quietly writing books and putting her magic to a better use.

name: The Twelve Dragons
description:
**Appearance:** The cover of this book has been painted to resemble a thousand shining dragon scales, each of a different color. Inside is a story about the twelve dragons, and how they changed the cruel and chaotic world into one of goodness and light.

**Enchantment:** When read, the user becomes entranced and cannot stop reading unless they finish the book, or they are physically shaken.

**History:** The Tale of the Twelve Dragons is older than most kingdoms, and not even the oldest of dwarves can remember the time when they flew the skies. This version was created by a legendary scribe - he worked on it for years and years, finally finishing the last page days before his death. 187

name: Robin's Holly
description:
**Appearance:** A small book bound in red linen, with the title stamped on the cover in silver foil. Three berries have been stamped in each corner. Inside, it tells the folk story of a robin searching all over the land for the perfect berries to give to her children. IE's beautifully illustrated with delicate watercolors.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can pluck a berry from the book's pages ~ eating them will cause a random magical effect. The berries regrow every day at dawn. -1d10- 1-5. The user regains 1d12 hit 8-9. The berry has no effect. ints. LE 10. The user gains the benefits 6-7. The user no longer feels of a short rest. hungry or thirsty.

**History:** This book was written and illustrated by Dwen Farmooth, a notable scribe and enchanter who lived hundreds of years ago. Since then, this book has been carried by many adventurers who enjoyed the book for its charming magic.

name: What the Heart Wants
description:
**Appearance:** A small book bound in a deeply burnished brown leather, secured with silver fastenings. The title is printed on the front in silver foil.

**Enchantment:** This book is blank until itis 4775 held. When it comes into contact with a ww Wor living creature, text fills the pages, detailing ph their greatest desires. tA Tot

**History:** No one is sure what happened to a this book. What the Heart Wants is a =m popular love story, and yet this version seems to be blank, carrying only its own po strange enchantment. 188

name: Inside the Fairy Circle
description:
**Appearance:** A colorful, tasteful children’s book bound in pale blue leather. The cover is painted with delicate flowers and little fairies.

**Enchantment:** At will, the user can open the book and climb inside into a harmless little bubble universe. Itis a world full of flowers and picnics, with and fairies to play with, and pristine streams to swim in.

**History:** This book was commissioned by a lord; whose daughter was too ill to play outside. She spent much time in this safe little universe, growing stronger by the day until she was finally able to stray beyond the walls of her father’s castle. — f& ——— EZ

name: Bleak Sorefoot and Other Fantastic Tales - Sentient
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy collection of children's tales. The book is bound .. Sd in green leather, and a dragon's {1 law tone head has been stamped on the {A- cover in golden foil. = J NSS

**Enchantment:** The dragon on the {| (7 . cover of this book is named Bleak a Sorefoot, and he'll often talk to the . et user and give them general advice, 3 near encouraging them to be safe, and FE cheering them up when they need ¢ \ /A it. He is a sweet, caring soul and, if - QJ he grows to love the user, the book a will come between the user and a — life-threatening blow, taking the = damage instead.

**History:** This book was given to the son of a noble. He was a quiet lad who enjoyed getting into trouble by himself, which terrified his parents. They commissioned this book so that even on his most daring escapades, the child would have someone to take care of him. 189

name: Heartshorn and Huckleberries - A Druid’s Poems
description:
**Appearance:** A ragged little book bound in worn leather. Contains handwritten poems and little illustrations.

**Enchantment:** Something about these poems sticks in the reader's ‘mind, and they become quiet adept at identifying plants.

**History:** This book was written by a druid named Heartshorn Holly, a druid who spent her days wandering the eastern forests. After an unfortunate run-in with a poisonous snake, Heartshorn sold most of her possessions for medicine.

name: Tales of Thy End
description:
**Appearance:** A book bound in burnished, dark leather. The title is stamped on the cover in flaky silver foil along with a picture of a human skull. It has been locked shut with iron fastenings. A paperback book with a printed cover. Inside, it tells the story of a hero going on a grand, tragic and wonderful adventure.

**Enchantment:** The story in this book seems normal enough at first - a simple tale of an adventurer. As the user reads on, they soon realize this is their story. If the user continues to read after this realization, they have a high chance of going mad. This is a simple, seemingly average paperback book. However, the user immediately forgets the entire story immediately after finishing it, allowing them to reread it indefinitely.

**History:** No one is sure where this book came from, who wrote it or why, but dozens have been driven insane from reading tales of their own death. Xe 7 TEE INN SN 190 431. Key, Stone and Providence This book was commissioned by a noble woman, who wanted nothing more than to experience reading her favorite book for the first time over and over again.

name: Thief Tales
description:
**Appearance:** A little book bound in black linen. The title is stamped on the cover in silver foil, and one corner has been mended with glue and paper. Inside is the story of a valiant thief, who sneaks into the castle to retrieve an heirloom stolen from his lover. A thin, well-worn paperback with the face of a laughing man inked on the cover. Inside is a hundred pages of jokes, riddles and puns.

**Enchantment:** After reading this book, the user becomes adept at lockpicking. However, once the book is finished, the reader will find that all the gold they were carrying has disappeared. When read aloud, everyone in earshot will be overcome with laughter.

**History:** This book tells the true story of Aloine, the famous thief. No one is sure what magic this book contains, but some say that the spirit of Aloine himself comes to teach the reader his trade for a price. 433. No Laughing Matter - Funniest Jokes from Around the World This book was written by Joheir Loller, a street magician who loved to make children laugh. After growing tired of the same old street tricks, he went on a quest to find the funniest jokes in all the kingdoms. 191

name: The Lover and the Stream
description:
**Appearance:** A book bound in dark blue leather with silver corners. The title is stamped on the front in curling, flowing text. Inside is a story about a man whose love goes off to war. She promises to meet him at the stream where they first met, if she survives. He waits many moons for her, but never sees her again.

**Enchantment:** If the user reads aloud this story in its entirety, everyone in earshot breaks down into tears.

**History:** This book was written by Lilova Saday, an author with a flair for dramatics. This book quickly became a bestseller, though few readers actually make it through the whole book.

name: The Devil's Circle
description:
**Appearance:** A book bound in black leather. The title is stamped on the cover in red foil, in the middle of an ornate summoning circle. Inside is the story of a young lad who summons a devil to aid him in taking revenge against his cruel family.

**Enchantment:** If read aloud, the user has a high chance of successfully summoning a demon.

**History:** This book was written by Penora Leanne, but was quickly banned after dozens of demons were summoned into the mortal plane. Many wondered how Penora Leanne, an author, came across such accurate summoning rituals.

name: Ghost Stories and Other Ghoulish Tales
description:
**Appearance:** A thick book bound in black leather. The title has been stitched into the cover with white thread, along with the spooky forms of ghosts and tombstones.

**Enchantment:** After reading this book, the user becomes adept at handling and identifying ghosts and ghouls.

**History:** This book was written by a gravedigger, who wrote books in his off-time. Many readers wonder if this book was a culmination of his experiences with ghosts, or if it was merely fiction. 192

name: The Silver Sword
description:
**Appearance:** An extremely average looking paperback. A sword has been poorly printed on the cover and inside, it tells the extremely average story of a boy who finds a magical sword. A book bound in grey linen. The title has been stamped on $E\ we I’ \ the cover in silver foil, along witha ¥ a large circular mirror. Inside, this Y Rpernrs = book is full of legends about mirrors, ~ : lakes and other reflective surfaces, NG and the mythical importance placed HN We upon reflection. i Z, 3 *

**Enchantment:** Despite the exceedingly average nature of this story, the user feels compelled to encourage others to read the book. The effects dissipate immediately after the book leaves their possession. Once per day, the \ Zz A user can cast scry into the mirror on A the front of the book. The casting = N process is detailed inside the book, so / = anyone can cast this spell regardless _— of ability.

**History:** This book was written by Alissa Winilla, an aspiring author who was denounced after her readers realized she was using enchantments to keep them interested. 438. Mirrors, Lakes, and the Reflection They Bring This book was written by Daniella Waterspoke, a seer and scribe who was fascinated with the importance and mythical powers placed upon mirrors and reflection, = 193

name: A Friend for Sarah
description:
**Appearance:** A small children's book, with the image of a young boy painted on the front.

**Enchantment:** After reading the simple incantation inscribed in the book, a ghostly child appears beside the reader. He claims his name is Samson, and he was intended to be a playmate for a young noble girl who has long since grown. He is young, but excited to be summoned and ready to learn. The ghostly boy remains visible for one hour before fading back into the book.

**History:** This book was written for a young noble girl named Sarah, who was shy and sickly and had a difficult time making friends. After Sarah grew, Samson fell into the hands of a group of thieves, who would send Samson through small windows to open locked doors from the inside.
