name: A Quiet Step
description:
**Appearance:** A little book bound in gray leather. The title has been stamped on the cover in faded blue foil. Inside, it tells the story of a young girl who must sneak through her father’s castle after it is invaded by pirates.

**Enchantment:** While reading, the user becomes completely invisible.

**History:** This book was created by a young sorcerer, who wanted nothing more than to be left alone. He was a victim of brutal bullying, and so he created a foolproof way to be left to himself, When the boy grew older and left school, he gave it to his younger sister who used it to get up to all sorts of mischief, until she was finally kicked out of school. 194 Journals -1d20-

name: The Journal of Bernard Thesius - Possessed
description:
**Appearance:** A rather ragged old journal bound in soft, if worn, velvet. It appears to be stained and rather scorched - inside are the nearly indecipherable notes on magic and philosophy.

**Enchantment:** Inside this book is the soul of Bernard Thesius - a rather snooty wizard with a superiority complex. He knows much about obscure arcana, and will take every opportunity to show off.

**History:** Bernard Thesius was a rather average wizard who somehow managed to earn a grant from the kingdom to fund his research into possession and enchanted sentience. However, during one of his many experiments, he accidentally sealed his own soul into his journal.

name: Druid's Journal
description:
**Appearance:** A roughly made journal book, £2 VV) with a cover made from polished dogwood |} %, Zr. =) bark. Inside, the paper is rough and fibrous, {7 | ~ == but it's full of careful handwriting and an 3. \<' = 72 extensive collection of pressed flowers. LE TT

**Enchantment:** Any plants pressed inside this |; {Sz journal's pages remain alive and perfectly Yt {ZF | preserved until it is removed. [Pe =

**History:** This journal was crafted by a druid named Batiste Laurel, who wished to have a living collection of every flower in the world. No one really knows what happened to them, and their last journal entry gives no clue as to where they went. 195

name: Journal of Eternal Pages
description:
**Appearance:** A thick journal with a hard cover of burnished leather.

**Enchantment:** This journal never runs out of pages. Whether the pages are written on or torn out, there is always one blank page left.

**History:** These journals were popular among students and researchers, who often needed an extensive collection of journals to hold all their notes. The first hundred pages in this book seem to be written by a girl named Anice Lorelei, a young wizard attending a school in some far-off kingdom.

name: The Diary of Someone
description:
**Appearance:** A black journal with silver embellishments. Inside, there seem to be notes written by a man attempting to find a specific tombstone. No real details are given.

**Enchantment:** A few moments after FEU writing anything in this journal, a faded A:4 y v; reply written in wobbly handwriting will & 1 i appear just below it. The entity in the & 4 pi journal seems to be knowledgeable about Eri //1 undead and necromancy, but seems bitter ~~ &§ Ff about the whole topic. They are hesitant to fous) f answer questions about themselves, and AN will go silent if asked too many personal \EEE——— questions.

**History:** It's hard to tell exactly where this journal came from. It doesn't seem too old, yet no one can place its origins. NX bY : i Ea = 196

name: Treasure Hunter's Journal
description:
**Appearance:** An old journal bound in tan leather; a ribbon with an old coin tied to one end acts as a bookmark. Inside are rows and rows of notes and sketches of caves, treasures and maps.

**Enchantment:** Once per day when this journal is opened, a random item falls out from between the pages. -1d10- 1-3. A handful of sand. 7. A treasure map. 4.1d4 gold coins. 8. A magnifying glass.

name: A precious stone. 10. A mysterious golden key.
description: **History:** This journal belonged to the famous treasure hunter, Hawthorn Hill. She discovered hundreds of ancient artifacts and filled museums across the kingdom, fighting thieves, bandits and graverobbers all the way. After years of danger and adventure, she retired and became the curator of the capital city museum. ay @ [om o ) Bg &° HEY. FQN J

name: Saint Obia’s Haiku Diary
description:
**Appearance:** A simple book bound in thick cream paper, with fine black thread. Hundreds of haikus have been inked inside, alongside simple illustrations.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can pose a question to this diary. ‘The pages will flip at lightning speed, finally landing on a page; the haiku on the resulting page will give the user a vague and poetic answer.

**History:** This was the poetry diary of a monk named Saint Obia, who spent his days meditating and writing haikus. Many believe the saint was a god disguised as a mortal, though no one can say for sure. 197

name: Journal of Research
description:
**Appearance:** A large journal with a cover of hardened leather. It fastens shut with a heavy iron buckle.

**Enchantment:** When an object is pressed into the book's pages, it will slowly sink into the paper before finally disappearing completely. The object becomes a permanent illustration in the book, which automatically analyses the object and fills in notes and details about its origins.

**History:** This book was owned by Finnius Flopp, a cartographer sent by the king to research far off lands. Finnius would often press undiscovered plants and insects into the pages to learn their habits and habitats.

name: Journal of Secrets
description:
**Appearance:** A simple journal with seemingly blank pages.

**Enchantment:** This journal cannot be read by anyone except the user.

**History:** There is really no way to tell who owned this journal before, as it appears blank to every new person who comes across it. It was ‘commissioned by a banker after his safe combination diary was stolen.

name: Journal of Forgetfulness
Dream Journal
description:
**Appearance:** A journal bound in blue leather, with an opal in the center of the cover.

**Enchantment:** When the user sleeps with this under their pillow, it accurately records their dreams.

**History:** This journal was used by Hoover Dislaine, an inventor who claimed many of his most successful inventions came to him in dreams. In an effort to never forget a potential idea, he slept with this under his pillow every night until he died.

name: Copycat Journals
description:
**Appearance:** A set of two completely identical journals. They are bound in burnished green leather, and each is emblazoned with an elegant fish on the cover.

**Enchantment:** Anything written in one journal immediately appears in the other.

**History:** Many of these journals were used as means of instant communication. These journals in particular were owned by a set of twins who were sent to opposite sides of the world to be married. With the use of these journals, they were able to talk to one another and escape, eventually reuniting in a far-off land where they lived out the rest of their days together.

name: Br
description:
**Appearance:** An old leather journal filled to the brim with thousands of drawings and descriptions of treasures, weapons and strange artifacts. It seems to carry an ever-present coating of dust. A small pocketbook bound in black leather. The corners are gilded with gold, and a black bookmark ribbon lays between the pages.

**Enchantment:** When placed near a magical artifact or treasure, this journal will fly . Open, its pages turning at devilish speed. If 5% + | wy the object has been listed in the extensive {1 .\. “2 catalogue, the journal will automatically flip $y _~—-=X 3 open to the correct page. a} ; te Anything written in this journal will automatically translate into the native language of whoever is holding it.

**History:** Hundreds of years ago thisjournal (GT 1 7 was carried by Denise Onestar, a treasure : \ \ wz hunter and researcher. She would hunt VEE) down artifacts and thoroughly document Sey them before either selling them, donating them to the museum or keeping them in her own private collection. 453, Translator’s Notes This journal was used by the kings translator, who suspiciously went missing on a visit to a far-off kingdom. The last few Jines of dialogue in the journal appear to be pleas for mercy.

name: The Historian's Journal
description:
**Appearance:** A simple book bound in dark blue leather.

**Enchantment:** Automatically records the doings of whoever carries the book. The book can record up to ten years of activities before it is full and must be replaced. 200

**History:** The first three years of this book are filled with the activities of one Clodaine Miles, a man who worked as a judge for a number of years. All of the case proceedings have been recorded in detail, and are actually quite interesting to read. His story ends when he is robbed and Killed on the road.

name: Musical Notes
description:
**Appearance:** A thin paperback journal, filled to the brim with sheets of handwritten music.

**Enchantment:** When the book is opened, the music written on the page will gently flow out of the book until itis closed again.

**History:** This was the musical journal of Jillian Stevens, a bard with high hopes. She spent years studying under a talented master, only to be Killed by highwaymen on her way to perform her debut piece for the king. Her tutor, heartbroken, had her journal enchanted so that her music would continue to play even after her death.

name: Wish Diary
description:
**Appearance:** A small journal bound in — white leather. A large star has been Ew Wy printed on the cover in gold foil. % A W\

**Enchantment:** This journal allows the 3% user to sketch out something on the \ \ AN page. When the page is ripped out and | 3 S thrown to the floor, the page morphs & iN and shifts, becoming the object on the \ \ page. The object must be no larger than \ === the page, and only three pages remain i between the covers.

**History:** This journal was crafted by Gooma Star as away to quickly and efficiently summon magical spell components without carrying them with her, However, a thief soon noticed the true value of the book and stole it before summoning as many bars of gold as they could. 201

name: Sheath Diary
description:
**Appearance:** A completely average leather-journal.

**Enchantment:** When opened, it is revealed that this journal isn’t really a journal at all. Instead, it is a magical weapon sheath in disguise. The user can sheath any time of weapon, from axes to swords to spears, in the depths of the pages. When the book is closed, the weapon is completely hidden from view.

**History:** This book was carried by the royal librarian after she was robbed at knifepoint, and all of her most valuable books stolen. The next time she was threatened, she simply pulled a loaded crossbow from the depths of the book and slew the intruder. 9 be N 2 2 > NR ——, N = 2 Za IDE ZN} mY PR AA o a =; g

name: Poison Diary
description:
**Appearance:** A thick journal bound with cream linen. Inside are hundreds of incredibly rare and incredibly deadly plants, perfectly pressed alongside gentle, cursive handwriting explaining the effects of each.

**Enchantment:** Each plant in this book can be used to create a different poison, with instructions on the care and preparation of each.

**History:** This was the diary of Jahilla Palm, an assassin known for killing only with poisons carefully selected for each target. When he was finally cornered by the city guard, Jahilla swallowed his own poison rather than surrendering to the mercy of the king. 202

name: Dictation Journal
description:
**Appearance:** A thick, official-looking journal bound in black leather with silver clasps. An official emblem of some kind has been stamped on the cover in silver foil.

**Enchantment:** This journal automatically copies down everything the user dictates in neat handwriting.

**History:** These journals were popular among the king's council, This one in particular was owned by Councilman Offar Ghan, a sneaky man who was arrested after a servant overheard him dictating his plans to overthrow the king. N Rd . .. id

name: Sketchbook of Storage
description:
**Appearance:** A large sketchbook with rough, charcoal-stained pages.

**Enchantment:** The user can press objects into the pages, where they disappear into the pages and appear as incredibly lifelike illustrations. Objects can be removed whenever the user desires, allowing this book can be used as a means of efficient storage.

**History:** This book was first crafted by an artisan named Jose Meekins - a woodcarver who would store his carvings in the pages. His customers would peruse the catalogue, pulling out the sculptures they wished to purchase. The book was soon stolen by a thief, who used the journal to smuggle alcohol across the border. 203 Spellbooks om -1d20- » ; gn » = ( > nS ° isa (

name: Allura Spellbook
description:
**Appearance:** A thick book bound in blue leather, with silver stamped corners and an intricately carved opal set in the center.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to learn one more spell per day.

**History:** This spellbook was owned by the wizard Allura Highhaven, an adventurer who made a name for herself after killing a ferocious red dragon that had been terrorizing the countryside. With as much wealth and fame as she desired, she sailed away to a new kingdom and was never seen again.

name: The Hard-Hitter Spellbook
Spellbook of Returning
description:
**Appearance:** A pocket-sized spellbook bound in burnished brown leather. The bookmark is a red ribbon with a rusty old key tied at one end. =

**Enchantment:** When dropped, lost or stolen, \}- Wy by this spellbook will magically return to the Yr user’s pocket after 1d10 minutes. aq \

**History:** Once, many years ago, there was a . 1, A rather forgetful wizard named Blighton ¢ Blindstock. He could never seem to keep track 5 of his spellbook, and was always losing it. So, to avoid the teasing of his co-workers, he enchanted the spellbook to always return to him, no matter where he lost it.

name: Holy Bible
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate holy book bound in white linen with gold accents.

**Enchantment:** This book radiates holy light. All spells gain a holy aura, doing an additional 1d6 radiant damage to all undead and evil-aligned creatures.

**History:** This book belonged to the Temple of the Sun, and was carried by their head priest for many years. When the temple was burned to the ground, the book was bestowed upon Delisea Rhidon, a paladin chosen by the gods to take holy vengeance on those who had crossed them. After realizing the fire had been accidentally set by children, Delisea refused to smite them. The gods insisted, yet she still refused. She instead left the church to pursue goodness in her own way. fk # 7 al — va) Fe Ei 205

name: Flesh-Backed Spellbook
description:
**Appearance:** A book bound in peculiar, parchment-like leather. Remnants of ornate tattoos can be seen inked on the skin, and it is latched shut with heavy iron clasps.

**Enchantment:** All necromantic and necrotic spells are twice as powerful.

**History:** Once, there were two sisters named Synnin and Sada. They were both powerful, aggressive magicians, and had high hopes for the future. After leaving school, they were offered a position in the castle as the king's royal magicians however, only one sister would be allowed to take it. A brutal fight ensued and, overcome by rage, Sada killed her sister. She felt no remorse and crafted a book from the skin of her fallen sibling. Years passed and slowly Sada became overwhelmed by grief and regret, and eventually took her own life on the castle tower.

name: ThieP's Spellbook
description:
**Appearance:** A spiral-bound spellbook IE with silver rings to allow the easy addition 2) % and removal of pages. The cover is bound {Q © in dark gray linen with silver fittings. \ YL \

**Enchantment:** When a page is taken from Nf ES another magician’s  spellbook and \ Pg inserted into the Thiefs Spellbook, it vy, BD allows the user to cast the spell once p= before the page disintegrates. <

**History:** This book was designed by Metilicus Dorsei, a powerful sorcerer and bounty hunter, known for stealing the spellbooks of his dead enemies.

name: Monstrous Spellbook
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy spellbook with jagged silver teeth set along the edges. A large glass eye sits in the center of the cover, twitching unnervingly and eerily following anything that moves. 206

**Enchantment:** This book will snap and bite at anyone who dares to get too close - except the user, of course.

**History:** Once, there was a wandering sorcerer who traveled the world with his beloved companion - a dog named Brutus. After the dog passed away, the wizard was too heartbroken to continue. So, he bound Brutus’ soul to his spellbook, so his beloved friend would always be close by.

name: Spellbook Familiar
description:
**Appearance:** A delicate spellbook with a cover bound in soft fur. A twitching cat's tail acts as a bookmark.

**Enchantment:** When not in use, this >=" spellbook morphsintoan elegant catwith jz “= \ e mottled brown fur. She is overly friendly, ¥ rralie and will quickly grow attached to the = @E user. = i RB

**History:** This rather peculiar book is the !, =< 33 result of a terrible accident, in which a % id warlock's familiar sat in one of his volatile Bae —~ experiments, The warlock and the feline, “Wx ~~ remained friends despite the ° Lhe catastrophe. NTE 7

name: Spellbook of Absorption
description:
**Appearance:** A spellbook bound in shiny silver fabric. A large crystal covers the front cover, and its held shut with silver clasps.

**Enchantment:** This book has a 10% chance of absorbing any spell cast atthe user. The user can then cast the spell at any point within one hour, after which the spell fades away.

**History:** This spellbook was created by Finneus Flemming Farthing, a quirky bookbinder who wanted nothing more than to be a magician. One day, after hours of experimenting with little spells and enchantments, he crafted this book. News of his magical spellbook reached the University of Magic, and he was soon hired as their premier bookbinder. 207

name: Spellbook of Solar Might
description:
**Appearance:** The front cover is coated in a layer of shiny black slate, and it radiates a gentle warmth to the touch.

**Enchantment:** After charging under the midday sun, the user can place their hand on the cover of the book and immediately gain the benefits of a long rest, regaining all spells. Must be charged for one month between uses.

**History:** This book was carried by Delphinius Geena, a sorcerer who was 50 busy teaching classes and performing experiments that he often didn't have time for rest. This book would allow him to regain some strength between activities. He maintained this lifestyle for some time before his health failed him, and he took several weeks off to rest in the quiet countryside. x BN =a

name: Spellbook Ink
description:
**Appearance:** A pot of thick black ink that seems to roil and swirl on its own, © E—=3h £ along with a needle with a large ruby set ga on one end.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to tattoo their spells into their skin instead of carrying a spellbook. When the spell is Za cast, the tattoo disappears from their “ 0 body in a cloud of sparks. 0"

**History:** This ink was first used by Delerius Stormcrow, a wizard who was . known for the thousands of tattoos that covered him from head to toe. After he killed a notorious necromancer and rose to fame, the art of tattooed spellbooks became fashionable among the select few who were willing to tattoo themselves repeatedly every day. 208

name: Crystal Spellbook
description:
**Appearance:** A tablet of semi-translucent : crystal that glows faintly in the dark. a

**Enchantment:** Faint words and sigils float I 2 across the surface of the tablet, and the local | B= time and weather is displayed at the top of n- the screen. kes

**History:** This spellbook was carried by Jets Litelion Gore. He found an ingenious way to Ne store several libraries’ worth of information 7 » ina small space, but he died before he could share his secrets with the world. This tablet is the only one in existence.

name: Spellcards of Luck
description:
**Appearance:** A simple setof 62 playing cards, each etched with strange, slightly smeared sigils.

**Enchantment:** The user inscribes their spells on the playing cards, drawing from the deck when a spel is needed. When these cards are used, the spell has a 10% chance of not expending a spell-slot.

**History:** These cards were carried by Liliana Havasburger, a rogue who made her fortune at the gambling tables before they realized she was 5 powerful sorcerer, using her subtle magics to cheat at poker. ° TNO) 0 [Fr 5 Bx), oF 7 x € 4 4 N 5 * 44 ° NS LT [Pee ($= ~~] ® e 8 J 209

name: Watchful Bible - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy bible with a plain black cover inscribed with a golden holy symbol.

**Enchantment:** When bestowed upon the user by a god, the user cannot willingly dispose of this spellbook. The book has a powerful holy aura, and the user becomes incapable of casting necrotic or necromantic spells.

**History:** Once, hundreds of years ago, the kingdom was wracked by plague. It swept through the kingdom, sparing no one. Even the king's beloved daughter was lost to the wasting illness. Devastated by the loss of his sister, the young prince turned to necromancy to bring her back. It worked, for a time. The kingdom rejoiced - their princess was back! But the clerics knew the truth, they slew the undead princess and crafted this bible for the young prince to prevent him from turning to dark magic again.

name: Cantrip Spellbook.
description:
**Appearance:** A common-looking spellbook bound in brown leather, with silver tassels hanging from the bookmark.

**Enchantment:** This book allows the user to learn twice as many cantrips.

**History:** This spellbook was owned by Magnus Ravenwing, a hedge- mage who owned a little grocery shop in the north. He mainly used his magic for shop-keeping - dusting things off, locking small boxes or straightening stacks of papers. One day his store was robbed and everything of value stolen - including this spellbook.

name: Spellbook of Shielding
description:
**Appearance:** A spellbook with covers made of heavy, slightly dented steel plates. Sigils have been etched along the edges of the metal.

**Enchantment:** This spellbook is made of heavy steel, allowing it to be used as a small shield. For every projectile that is caught on the Spellbook of Shielding, the user gains one use of the magic missile spell. 210

**History:** This spellbook was carried by Georgina Vibrava, a battlemage mercenary known for her colorful magic. What she lacked in power, she made up in cleverness and wit, and she took down many dangerous criminals before taking a devastating wound and retiring to the countryside.

name: Flesh-Eating Spellbook
description:
**Appearance:** The cover of his book is split by a long, bloody mouth. Its SE edges are lined in jagged teeth, and PN a tongue twitches grotesquely ABR) inside. JR” or

**Enchantment:** When placed next to i 4 / ) Va the body of a dead creature, this 7 TN book will slowly consume the entire a? 3 A corpse. For each body itis allowed 4f / / [ig 7 to consume, the user's spells NN 4: #7 § ) temporarily grow in strength, # 5 However, the book must be fed & 0 twice per day. If it is not fed, it will begin to feed on the user.

**History:** The soul of a ravenous beast was sealed inside this spellbook by Archer Hive, a sorcerer with a taste for wretched experiments. This ‘was among his final experiments, as soon the monstrous tome devoured Hive while he slept.

name: Mirror Spellbook
description:
**Appearance:** A small folding mirror. Inside are words, runes and sigils that seem to mysteriously float across the mirror's surface.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to magically view the spellbook of any magic-user within 60ft.

**History:** During special occasions and social events, harmful magic was prohibited on castle grounds. The castle guards used these mirrors to scan the spellbooks of all incoming magic-users, to ensure the safety of the king and his courtiers. 211

name: Spellbook of Souls
description:
**Appearance:** This spellbook feels much heavier than it looks, with a cover of deeply burnished red leather. In the center of the cover is a large circular ruby. The subtle sounds of whispers seem to follow this strangely heavy tome.

**Enchantment:** When the wizard carrying this spellbook dies, their soul is absorbed into the pages. The tome is hundreds of years old, and so there are dozens of souls already residing between the pages. The user can communicate with the souls, though many have gone mad from their years of imprisonment. When the user dies, their soul will join the ranks.

**History:** This book was originally enchanted to be the phylactery of an ancient lich; however, something went wrong with her enchantment. Some say the soul of the lich is still in the book somewhere, but if it is, she refuses to communicate with the hundreds of dead wizards who live there alongside her.

name: Popup Spellbook
description:
**Appearance:** A colorful, = masterfully-made popup book QT bound in blue linen. . : g

**Enchantment:** Every spell is [8 stored as a colorful, unique and ey HE expertly-crafted paper popup. B Allows the user to prepare cB spells and cast ritual spells in 3 ZN) half the time. = Wot : SU ENC

**History:** This spellbook was =N\"7 clearly created to be a learning we spellbook for young magicians. ‘This one was owned by Framptus Frote, a young boy who decided to teach himself magic at a young age. He performed his chores and saved up for months until he could afford to buy learning materials. He grew up to become a talented magician, coveted for his unique and effective teaching methods. 212 NES LQ Scrolls, Papers and Charms -1d20-  ~ Xx

name: Tarro's Scroll of Teleport
description:
**Appearance:** A scroll made of heavy parchment, fastened shut with a red ribbon.

**Enchantment:** When the incantation is uttered, the user is teleported to a random location in the world,

**History:** This scroll was made by Tarro Warhammer, a woman who considered herself a talented enchantress. She made many of these scrolls, sending many unsuspecting travelers to their deaths before she finally realized her mistake. ZY V

name: Scroll of Levitation
description:
**Appearance:** A small slip of thin paper, rolled into a scroll and fastened with a silver ring.

**Enchantment:** When the incantation is uttered, the P24 user can levitate for ten minutes.

**History:** This is a rather common scroll, made and Q B sold by the clerics of the temple as a way to make a bit of coin. This scroll was purchased by an adventurer named Wilder Beeth, who intended to use it to scale a necromancer’s tower before his untimely demise at A the hands of the undead. = 213

name: Scroll of Polymorph
description:
**Appearance:** A large scroll, covered in illustrations of strange beasts. It has been rolled into a scroll, and fastened with a strip of leather.

**Enchantment:** When the incantation is uttered, the user polymorphs into a strange creature - a bear with the head of a dragon and the claws of a crab. The user returns to normal after one hour.

**History:** This scroll was purchased by Lord Dagon Dartmouth, a rich noble who enjoyed watching his children play make-believe. He bought many polymorph scrolls so they could pretend to be birds or fish or cats or dogs, and commissioned this scroll so they could play even greater games. However, seeing the horrendous creature illustrated on the scroll, his wife forbade him from giving it to them.

name: Deceiving Deed
description:
**Appearance:** The deed to a house, stamped with official wax seals and stained with age.

**Enchantment:** When the user nails this deed to a wall, it quickly and magically morphs into wooden door, much resembling the front door to a house. Inside the door, regardless of what is beyond the wall, is a lovely and modest three-bedroom home, complete with kitchen and fireplace, washroom, and windows looking out into an idyllic countryside. When the paper is peeled from the wall, the door fades away.

**History:** No one is exactly sure how this magical deed came to be. Many adventurers have dedicated their lives to finding the physical location of this strange house, to no avail.

name: Scroll of Immediate Water
description:
**Appearance:** A large piece of soft blue paper, rolled into a scroll and fastened with a string of blue glass beads.

**Enchantment:** When the scroll is thrown on the ground and the incantation is uttered, a 10x10 pond of water explodes into existence, complete with algae and small, colorful fish. The pond is permanent and this scroll can only be used once. 214

**History:** This scroll was developed alongside many enchantments that offered instant landscaping. This scroll was purchased by Lord Wellington Bell, who had recently bought an old chateau that was in need of a great deal of care. However, the place was robbed soon after Lord Wellington moved in, and many of his landscaping spells were lost.

name: Scroll of Crossing
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy scroll made from incredibly thick paper, fastened with heavy hemp twine.

**Enchantment:** When the scroll is thrown on the ground and the incantation is uttered, a 20ft. bridge slowly sprouts from the ground. The bridge is permanent and this scroll can only be used once.

**History:** This scroll was carried by cartographer and roadbuilder, Angus Shortstalk, who mapped the northern mountains and charted the new road. Years passed before anyone noticed he went missing - search parties discovered that he nearly made it to the other side of the mountain range before his trail simply disappears.

name: Scroll of the Forest
description:
**Appearance:** A sheaf of paper made with fibrous, AYN wood pulp, rolled into a scroll and fastened with a bit iv J yt of twine. ia [i iis]

**Enchantment:** When the scroll is thrown on the A ground and the incantation is uttered, an ancient 0 (' ‘yl sycamore tree immediately springs from the earth. Ih Jy ‘The tree is permanent and this scroll can only be used be) wo once. yr

**History:** Many of these scrolls were commissioned by ~~ /, § i the Southern Lumber Company. They were slowly IS running out of trees to fell, and so redoubled their ff ff, efforts to replant the trees they cut down. {J / i ut ~~ 215

name: Magician's Menu
description:
**Appearance:** A sturdy piece of paper, covered in a list of tasty delicacies and their extravagant prices.

**Enchantment:** This menu lists ten ornate, luxurious and extravagant dishes. The user must simply read the name of the dish out loud. Moments later, the dish will disappear off the menu and appear before the [Er user on a silver platter. Each item can (2 Meny 32] only be ordered once. =

**History:** This menu belongs to a la restaurant in the capital city, called Fee, py pd The Ornate Oyster, known for its Stns 5 delectable delicacies and inane prices. re Del Wanting to eat there without paying ou, TT Tey the exorbitant price, a hedge-mage we tig, from the country stole a menu, ferrying po or) it away before dedicating months to  Y5ep enchanting it. Finally, he found a way; Siig i to summon the food straight from the (62 restaurant, and the hedge-mage mil. Af feasted like a king until he was finally = discovered and arrested for theft.

name: Scroll of Aid
description:
**Appearance:** A scroll made of sheepskin parchment, fastened with braided twine.

**Enchantment:** When the incantation is uttered, all wild animals within one mile are summoned to give the user aid. The spell lasts for one hour, after which the animals will slowly disperse.

**History:** Three of these scrolls were crafted by a druid for her lover, who was heading off to explore the unknown reaches of the north. He used the first scroll when he was freezing to death on a frozen lake - the animals came to him and kept him warm. He used the second scroll when he was injured - the spiders came and weaved shut his wound. The third scroll he gave back to her, when he made it safely home. 216

name: Scroll of Time Freeze
description:
**Appearance:** A wafer-thin sheet of gray paper, rolled into a scroll and fastened with silver twine.

**Enchantment:** When the scroll is burned and the incantation is uttered, time slows to a halt for everyone except the user. Everything is frozen in place, suspended in time for five minutes.

**History:** This scroll was crafted by Princess Lorela, a talented warlock who specialized in time magic. No one can be sure how often the princess stopped or altered time, as it is difficult to be aware of time magic. She went missing after a failed experiment, only to reappear days later as an old woman.

name: Scroll of Clear Weather
description:
**Appearance:** A scroll of perfect white paper, fastened with white braided wool.

**Enchantment:** When the scroll is burned and the incantation is uttered, the weather immediately clears, bringing blue skies and warm weather.

**History:** Many of these scrolls were bought to ensure perfect weather on special occasions such as tournaments or ‘weddings. This scroll was purchased by an aged farmer, just in case it decided to rain on the day of his son's wedding. The skies were clear, however, and so the scroll was sold.

name: Impervious Blotting Paper
description:
**Appearance:** A large sheet of wellused ~~ | > Ta] blotting paper. 3 wl LA

**Enchantment:** No liquids, no matter how ~~ |, ~~ [1 # hot or caustic, are capable of seeping I ,\ / through this paper. TR

**History:** This paper was gifted to a lord by Ce his daughter, after she saw how ink- » 3 stained his desk had become. ol] La 217

name: Scroll of Ages
description:
**Appearance:** A scroll of black paper, fastened with a silver pocket- watch chain.

**Enchantment:** When the incantation is uttered, the scroll vanishes in a cloud of sparks and the user is transported ten years into the past, permanently.

**History:** This scroll was one of many created by Delia Hop during her experiments with time travel. She desperately needed to go backin time to fix some terrible mistake, but she would never tell anyone what that mistake was. When she finally perfected the spell and disappeared into the past, she was never seen again.

name: Radar Map
description:
**Appearance:** A strange map, folded into a square.

**Enchantment:** This map changes every five [~~ minutes, keeping centered on the user's |M-—=' — location as they move. —===7 =e

**History:** This map was carried by Almeo j= 2. Drasa, an adventurer known for finding many {== | Panty) ancient and valuable artifacts. When he [75  SAAA[ retired, he passed it on to his daughter who 5 "aA |. ; SLT AA promptly sold it to repay her gambling debts. + =

name: Attunement Paper
description:
**Appearance:** A scroll of thick brown paper, fastened with a string of opals.

**Enchantment:** When the user is attuned to this paper, anything written on itis delivered straight to the user's mind. Up to ten users can attune to this paper at once.

**History:** This paper was designed primarily as a means of instantly delivering orders to wartime captains, however it was quickly adopted as a way for lords to quickly deliver orders and requests to their household staff. 218

name: Paper Fortune Teller
description:
**Appearance:** An ornately folded and decorated cootie-catcher.

**Enchantment:** Once per day the user can use this simple paper toy to deliver strange and cryptic fortunes. fA

**History:** This paper fortune teller was crafted by Hodem Mandel, a young monk / =. #/{ ¥* and prodigious visionary, who was led “= \L/_V/ over a hundred years ago when the VD ~~ temple was raided by pirates.

name: Holy Charm
description:
**Appearance:** An ornately folded paper charm, fastened with golden thread.

**Enchantment:** This charm carries a strong holy aura - all undead take 1d6 holy damage when they come into contact with the user. However, facing too many strong undead will cause the charm to burst into flame.

**History:** These charms are traditional to a village in the northern mountains, where they are handed out every year by masked clerics. This charm was made specially for Jolten Cuton, a paladin who dedicated his life to hunting down and killing undead after a necromancer killed his lover. 7 J

name: Lucky Charm 7 1
description:
**Appearance:** A simple paper charm, fastened with \ = green twine. \ 12

**Enchantment:** The user becomes abnormally lucky. JY N=

**History:** A young man bought this charm from a Vi EY traveling merchant after his crops were devastated by \ locusts. He carried the charm with him always, and | | soon his crops flourished and his estates grew. \../ 219

name: Beartrap Charm
description:
**Appearance:** A sheet of slightly tacky paper, printed with sigils arranged in the shape of a bear's paw.

**Enchantment:** When this paper is thrown on the ground and the spell is uttered, the paper becomes intensely sticky. The next creature who steps on it becomes trapped in place for 10 minutes, or until they can pry themselves free.

**History:** These papers were scattered all over the lands of Lord Byron, whose prized goats were being slowly picked off by ravenous black bears. While he did not succeed in catching any bears, he did catch a goatherd making off with one of his prized animals. a XS

name: Quickchange Charm
description:
**Appearance:** A small charm, fastened with ornately woven red thread. J

**Enchantment:** When the incantation is uttered, the user is obscured by a cloud of colored smoke. When the smoke clears, their clothes 5 have been swapped for a set of garments designated by the user.

**History:** These charms were popular among knights and bodyguards, who would need to 21) change into armor in a moment's notice. It was /4>%,> also used among actors, who would need to change outfits for scenes, and among nobles, who would change outfits many times 4 throughout an evening of socializing. = 220 Chapter 6 - Potions, Food and Drink -1d100- t \N& \ x 6 - 5 ° , ¢ ) oe : A A RCW —ly WW 2 “. Y (NE 74 AN Ny J by NY Y 0 0 BY - D 221 = El Potions E = -1d20- gue 2) == &) = Nome) oe —t E =

name: Potion of Truth
description:
**Appearance:** A small rounded bottle with a label written in scrolling elvish. Inside, the potion is glittering and golden. It has little taste, with only a hint of sweetness.

**Enchantment:** The user becomes incapable of lying 3 for four hours. m [gE

**History:** This potion was crafted by a talented potion- 4 ran maker named Ormana Leafwind, who owns a little = workshop in the Kingdom across the sea Leatwind ls (27 renowned for her expensive and powerful S=7Y concoctions, and often travels the world to sell her === ‘wares. ° u

name: Sorcerer’s Bane
description:
**Appearance:** A vial with a stained label. Inside, the potion is purple and viscous - it almost appears to be moving on its own. It has a bitter taste that lingers in the mouth for hours.

**Enchantment:** This potion is a powerful magic suppressant. For four hours, the consumer becomes incapable of using magic, and all spells cast upon them are half as powerfu. Euphoria is a common side effect.

**History:** This potion is well-known among the wizarding community, as it has been used for decades to safely capture or subdue powerful magicians. This potion was purchased by Lorraine Pawn, a warlock who suffered terrible prophetic dreams and would often take Sorcerer's Bane for a quiet night's sleep. 222

name: Potion of Endurance
description:
**Appearance:** A rectangular bottle with a peeling label. Inside, the potion is blood-red and transparent, and tastes of iron with a slight fizz.

**Enchantment:** The user feels a surge of strength as they gain 50 temporary hit points. The effects last for twelve hours, or until the user takes 50 points of damage.

**History:** This potion was the staple of Arnold Bwan, a gladiator who would drinka couple of these before ever fight, He was a monster on the battlefield, taking down every opponent he went up against until his heart finally gave out.

name: Potion of Godly Might
description:
**Appearance:** A vial with a clean paper tag, neatly written in dwarvish. Inside, the potion is a teaspoon of blue liquid that has a faint glow.

**Enchantment:** User becomes twice as strong for thirty minutes. When the spell fades, they experience a deep and aching exhaustion that lasts until their next long rest.

**History:** This potion was purchased by Stephan Howl, a young and nervous adventurer who wanted to be prepared for any scenario. He quickly made a name for himself after slaying a frost-giant that had been terrorizing a small northern village. He threw this potion away, realizing that the strength he needed was inside him all along.

name: Potion of Health
description:
**Appearance:** A dark bottle with a neatly written medical label. Inside, the potion is bright red and has a strong, unpleasant taste.

**Enchantment:** This potion cures all common diseases and illnesses. The user sweats copiously for 1d10 minutes, but suffers no other effects.

**History:** This is a common potion, and many noble families have a few of these constantly tucked away in their medicine cabinet. This potion was carried by Filbert Horace, a rather elderly noble who decided to abandon his tobacco farm and pursue his dream as an adventurer, 223

name: Potion of Intelligence
description:
**Appearance:** An elegant bottle with a neatly written label. The stopper has been sealed with red wax. Inside, the potion is green and watery, and has the strong taste of sour apples.

**Enchantment:** When consumed, the users eyes 43 become incredibly bloodshot. They become twice as {[i intelligent for thirty minutes, but pass out after for | ({ 1d4 hours when the enchantment fades. | AL

**History:** This potion was purchased by a young law =\ iN student named Diblus Wisen, who was terrified that ==) \} he would fail his bar exam. The professor saw the R+w~ ‘ bottle tucked away in Diblus’ sock, and immediately {a w:-J confiscated it. Despite his nerves, Diblus passed the ~ {=-=7 test and never asked for the potion back from the “=.= professor.

name: Potion of Snake Hide
description:
**Appearance:** A large bottle with a neat label that is stained with age. Inside, the potion is thick and greasy, and has the strong taste of gasoline.

**Enchantment:** Over the course of ten minutes, the user develops thick, scaly skin. The user gains natural armor bonuses for twelve hours, after which the scales will slowly begin to shed.

**History:** This potion was made by Gwenneth Bign, a battlemage who spent her days roaming the earth, searching for rare potion ingredients. After a stumbling across a monstrous serpent and battling it for two days and two nights, Gwenneth stripped its corpse and brewed it into hundreds of powerful and exotic potions.

name: Potion of Youth
description:
**Appearance:** An elegantly-shaped bottle with a silver stopper. The label is written in sloppy handwriting, and the potion inside is pink and creamy. It smells sweet, and has the faint taste of strawberries. 224

**Enchantment:** Over the course of 1d10 minutes, the user grows five years younger.

**History:** Many of these potions were commissioned by the late king, who took one every morning with his tea. Seeing his own father grow old and frail terrified the king, and so he took every measure to stay young. While it worked for decades, the magic slowly took its toll on the man. His mind began to betray him, until finally his great-grandchildren quietly, mercifully disposed of the last of his potion store.

name: Potion of Tongues
description:
**Appearance:** A cylindrical bottle with a neat, =" RY colorful label. Inside, a severed tongue floats in a or? 0 clear, slightly yellowed liquid. It tastes of strong, ~\7\*"\ burning alcohol. —

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to fluently speak || [%,° ¢\} all languages for four hours. : 1 [o) AY

**History:** The tongue in this vial belonged to ARYA Tonos Rex, a notable adventurer who was known FAVES Nd for his proficiency with every language. His SEE | talents were often requested by cartographers 3 and explorers who needed translators for their ~~ w=" extensive journeys, and Tonos happily complied. After venturing out too far into the wastes, he was kidnapped by a group of cultists who had heard of his extraordinary abilities, and brewed a potion from his tongue in order to gain his power for themselves.

name: Potion of Rest
description:
**Appearance:** A spherical bottle with a simple label. Inside, the potion is asilvery dark blue, speckled with little shining stars. It tastes of damp moss and the night air after a storm.

**Enchantment:** Immediately gives the user the benefits of a long rest without sleeping.

**History:** This potion was created and carried by Grane Belldew, a battlemage mercenary who would often hunt her prey for days without rest. 225

name: Second Skin Elixir
description:
**Appearance:** A clay bottle with a cork stopper. The name of the potion has been neatly written on a tag around the neck. Inside, the potion is clear and viscous, with a strongly bitter, aloe-like taste.

**Enchantment:** This potion removes all scars, scabs, tattoos and blemishes from the user's body. The user shakes and visibly steams for 1d10 minutes - once the fit passes, the user sloughs off a layer of skin, leaving behind fresh, untouched and healthy skin. Exhaustion is common side effect.

**History:** While originally designed for those dealing with debilitating scarring, these potions became very popular among the richer nobility.

name: Iron Stomach Elixir
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy bottle sealed with wax. Inside, the potion is thick and metallic, almost resembling quicksilver. It has a heavy metallic taste that lingers in the mouth for days.

**Enchantment:** This potion coats the users mouth and stomach, allowing them to safely eat anything for four hours.

**History:** Long ago, there were two rivaling houses. The Silversmiths and the Bellinghams. Their hatred began a hundred years ago during an argument over land boundaries, and has only grown since then. Finally, Lady Travone Bellingham decided she'd had enough of the rivalry and decided to broker peace between the two families, and purchased this potion just in case the Silversmiths decided to poison her.

name: Potion of Aura Concealment
description:
**Appearance:** Two vials that have been tied together, (51 Z] with a large label reading ‘MIX. One potion contains a L_tl | % watery liquid, while the other contains a charcoal-black {=== cream. When consumed, the two have a milky, ashy taste. = T ul

**Enchantment:** When consumed, this potion hides all q 7 auras. Holy or unholy, magical, elemental and even body- 25 heat auras. All auras are hidden for one hour, during Gj which the user feels a little overheated. NVA 226

**History:** This potion was purchased by an assassin named Wren Arcana, a turned paladin who was planning on killing the head priest of the capital city temple. She bought the potion to obscure her unholy aura, but she never got a chance to use it. She was struck down by a bolt of lightning before she made it to the temple gates.

name: Love Elixir
description:
**Appearance:** A heart-shaped clay bottle with a label written in a forgotten language. Inside, the potion is pink, thick and slightly chunky. It tastes sickly sweet, like overripe apples left to sit in the warm sun.

**Enchantment:** The user falls in love with the next living creature they see. The enchantment lasts for four hours, after which the user will feel alittle disoriented.

**History:** This potion was purchased by a young lovesick girl who had eves only for the tavernkeeper’s daughter. She never actually used the potion, storing it away in a cabinet while she pursued the girl's affections the old-fashioned way. The two eventually become very close and eloped to the countryside, where they happily ran a small beekeeping business for the rest of their days.

name: Poison Bite Potion
description:
**Appearance:** A small square bottle with a tiny label written in scrawling cursive. Inside, the potion is a thin, black oil that tastes strongly of burnt almonds.

**Enchantment:** When consumed, the user's bite becomes incredibly poisonous for four hours,

**History:** This potion was originally brewed to be an Ld) antidote. A wizard was bitten by a monstrous poison - = centipede while attempting to gather its eggs for 4 \ potion ingredients. As he grew weaker, he attempting { ~ = =“¢*=1 to concoct something to ease the poison coursing H through his veins. He failed to craft an antidote % however, and fell into a coma for several weeks as a | lags result, To 221

name: Liquid Air Elixir
description:
**Appearance:** A spherical bottle with a plug of yellow 2X0 wax. The label is clearly handwritten, and inside the ie potion is so clear that it's hardly visible. It tastes of 2 springtime air, clean and crisp and delightful. A

**Enchantment:** The user does not have to breathe for 1%) four hours, though they feel slightly lightheaded as if \, : _\Z they have been hyperventilating, ~s

**History:** This potion was designed by researcher and spellcaster Valorie Pin, who was planning to dive deep into the sea to investigate a legendary lost shipwreck. She made several different versions of this potion, though she only used one for her expedition, during which she found hundreds of valuable artifacts. Mg Ss +

name: Copycat Potion
description:
**Appearance:** A small jam-jar half filled with a thick =) violet gel. It tastes like grape jelly with a strong, 4 acidic aftertaste. a at ==

**Enchantment:** When the user adds a single hair | - © from their desired target, the mixture fizzles and | Fin smokes slightly. When consumed, the user will | ig a yr slowly morph into an identical copy of whoever or A a 4 whatever creature the hair belonged to. The effects {$27 2 last for one hour, after which the user will slowly {x20 174 return to their normal appearance.

**History:** This potion was originally concocted by the young son of a sorcerer who wanted nothing more than to play a prank on his mother. The original version of this brew didn’t work so well, and when the lad tried to transform into a copy of his pet cat, he turned into some terrible half-cat-half-human abomination, which did indeed frighten his mother near to death. She confiscated the rest of his experiments, and forbade him from trying again. 228

name: Slimeskin Potion
description:
**Appearance:** A pyramidical bottle made from blue glass, with a professionally printed label. Inside, the potion is gritty and faintly green, and tastes faintly of sweat and mint - a rather putrid combination.

**Enchantment:** The user sweats a thick, viscous, jelly-like substance that protects them from extreme temperatures for twelve hours, or until the user washes the gel from their skin with strong soap.

**History:** Many bottles of this foul-tasting potion was purchased by cartographer and explorer Henry Islehoff, who was planning an expedition to the icy islands of the far, far north. Many thought he would die, but despite all of his hardships and losing a foot to frostbite, Islehoff successfully mapped the islands and returned safely.

name: Treefrog Tincture
description:
**Appearance:** A small, half-empty vile with a glass dropper. A little frog has been drawn on the faded label. Inside, the potion is pale yellow and sticky, and tastes of bile.

**Enchantment:** A foul, green slime oozes from the user's hands and feet. The gel is incredibly sticky, allowing them to climb walls and grip surfaces with ease for one hour.

**History:** This potion was concocted by Anne Greenhorn, a talented thief who was hellbent on stealing the crown jewels from the castle treasury. After a long and grueling trek up the tower wall, she actually managed to steal the invaluable jewels. However, her Treefrog Tincture wore off while she was half-way down the wall, and she broke both ankles in the fall. She remains in prison to this day. <4 | i A° fa pu—— = = JE Ee NOES 229

name: Ghost-Walk Potion
description:
**Appearance:** A small clay pot with a large cork stopper. A length of red yarn with a tag has been tied around the mouth. The potion is a thick, cloudy gel that is frigid to the touch, and tastes slightly of dust and old parchment.

**Enchantment:** The user becomes slightly transparent, and gains the ability to walk through solid objects. The user cannot walk upstairs, and will always fall through the floor to the ground level of the structure they inhabit. They are incapable of interacting with solid objects, but remain visible to other creatures. The enchantment lasts one hour, after which the user will slowly solidify.

**History:** This potion was purchased by Torna Dune, a woman who was planning on breaking her husband out of jail. The two of them were highwaymen and thieves who made a living by stealing briefcases off the back of expensive carriages. Her husband was finally caught after climbing onto the back of the prince's carriage, and he was quickly hauled off to jail. The woman was ready with a plan to free him, but soon decided she was better off without him and sailed away to a distant land. Do A Pa Bi 3 = 1 : 1 NE o Rr —-% \ p= 2 230 ~~ ( A Beverages Bi PY JN -1d20- i = = = WY /AN 3] [BS El

name: Never-Drunk Wine
description:
**Appearance:** A bottle of rich red wine with a beautifully illustrated label,

**Enchantment:** No matter how much the consumer drinks, they will never get drunk.

**History:** This brand of wine was crafted specifically by Lady Omar Issel, a noble woman who enjoyed parties but wished to keep her senses about her.

name: Rutheford Champagne
description:
**Appearance:** A lovely rose-gold champagne in an elegant bottle.

**Enchantment:** The consumer becomes incredibly drunk very quickly, but will not suffer any hangover effects the next day.

**History:** While expensive, this champagne is a favorite of the richer nobility, as it allows them to party freely without suffering the next day. A case of Rutheford Champagne was stolen off of a heavily armed delivery cart some weeks ago, and many bottles were soon found floating around the black market.

name: Stomach-Settle Tea
description:
**Appearance:** A twist of delicate minty tea in a folded paper packet.

**Enchantment:** This tea immediately cures motion sickness, food poisoning, and other unpleasant stomach ailments.

**History:** This tea is a popular medicine that can be found in almost every medicine cabinet in the kingdom, and the scent usually brings back fond childhood memories. 231

name: Simon's XTREME Coffee
description:
**Appearance:** A bag of coffee grounds, with the word ‘XTREME printed in large letters on the label. along with a warning that it should not be consumed by pregnant women or the elderly.

**Enchantment:** After one cup of this coffee, the R user doesn't have to sleep for two days. When {77+ ++ ‘14147 the enchantment wears off, they will feel |:YTREME: [ incredibly exhausted until their next long rest. hee |:

**History:** This coffee was roasted by barista and {<8 “> | |° sorcerer, Simon Williamson. He spent years 9.0) i growing highly caffeinated beans and | bw Sy, | : | enchanting them to be incredibly potent. He FAN » owns a large coffee shop in the capital city. =

name: Johan's Specialty Wine
description:
**Appearance:** A bottle of terrible red wine with a hand-illustrated, slightly crooked label.

**Enchantment:** Anyone who takes a sip becomes immediately and violently ill.

**History:** This wine was crafted by novice winemaker Johann Lilt, who left his secure job in the city to follow his dreams. He bought a vineyard out in the country, and immediately started producing terrible wines that, while awful, developed something of a cult following.

name: Dragonsbreath Whiskey
description:
**Appearance:** A square bottle with a bright orange label. Inside is an amber whiskey that smells strongly of cinnamon.

**Enchantment:** This whiskey is very spicy. After each mouthful, the user can breathe one 15ft. cone of fire.

**History:** This whiskey is made in the southern desert islands, where the kingdom purchases the majority of its cinnamon. It can be quite difficult to find a bottle for sale in this part of the world, and enthusiasts will shell out a great deal of coin to get their hands on it. 232

name: Easy Mind Wine
description:
**Appearance:** A bottle of syrupy red wine with an ornate label.

**Enchantment:** After one glass, the user feels euphoric and will start to laugh hysterically. Effects generally last for 1d4 hours.

**History:** Despite its generally harmless effects, this wine is considered sinful, and many look down upon those who drink it regularly. It is highly addictive, and the addicts are easy to recognize by their red- stained lips and teeth. A dozen bottles were ordered by a local duke, though the shipment was stolen before it could be delivered.

name: Granny's Hot Cocoa
description:
**Appearance:** A clay jar full of sweet-smelling cocoa powder. The label was written in an old, shaky hand. A crisp red wine with silver, glittering | 5| specks swirling at the bottom. / =

**Enchantment:** One cup of this hot cocoa warms the user right down to their bones, keeping them safely warm in extremely cold temperatures for four hours. Causes the user's tongue to appear 2 slightly silver and glittery - they become very charming and socially quick-witted for four hours. ak

**History:** This cocoa was made by Granny Ivermore, a sweet and elderly sorcerer who lives in a little cottage at the base of the northern mountains. She often makes hot cocoa for travelers heading up into the cold peaks, using her little enchantments to keep them safe and warm on their journeys. 2) 529. Silvertongue Wine ) # This special wine was commissioned by Lady U NY Netherfield Lock, a woman who was required to \ attend many social occasions despite her crippling shyness. | 4 233

name: Mill Worker's Wine
description:
**Appearance:** A stout bottle of homemade red wine that smells harshly acidic.

**Enchantment:** This wine is very strong - depending on the user's constitution, they will either suffer the effects of the wine and immediately pass out, or gain 20 temporary hit points until their next short rest.

**History:** This is a popular drink in the small mill-town of Norhington. 1's a staple among the millworkers, who use it to fortify their strength and their spirits throughout the day. They also enjoy offering it to the travelers that pass through town, laughing merrily as they choke and sputter and crumble under the effects of the intense wine.

name: Forget-Me Tea
description:
**Appearance:** A pinch of floral tea in a twist of wax paper. Smells faintly of lavender and chamomile.

**Enchantment:** After one cup, the user becomes very calm and relaxed. When they wake up the next morning, they will not remember any of the last 24 hours.

**History:** This tea is considered medical, and is often prescribed for those suffering traumatic events, though some use it for its calming effects as well. This tea was given to Matilda Hawthorne, a woman who was suffering greatly after the death of her husband. She refused the tea, however, and instead took up a sword to seek revenge against the thieves that had killed him, ee I ~) : = <a bull IN ’ Ep) " of J) ==). fe NDI acs QUI 234

name: Iron Mentali-Tea
description:
**Appearance:** A pinch of black tea in a tiny cheesecloth bag. Smells strongly of black tea and citrus.

**Enchantment:** This tea is very calming The user gains advantage on all concentration checks, and is immune to magical enchantments such as fear for four hours.

**History:** This tea was purchased from alittle tea shop on the west coast by a mercenary named Mathew Plum. He was a talented headhunter who specialized in hunting down and capturing wanted magic-users, ‘who would often attempt mind magic to worm their way to freedom.

name: Full Meal Mead
description:
**Appearance:** A rounded bottle of amber mead.

**Enchantment:** One mouthful causes the user to feel as if they've consumed a large, satisfying meal. The user will not have to eat again for twelve hours.

**History:** This brand of mead is popular among adventurers, sailors and explorers who wish to travel light. Though not the healthiest meal, itis enough to keep them strong for their voyage. This bottle was purchased by Davis Flin, an explorer who camped one night in a cave, awakening to find that all of his belongings had been stolen by gnomes.

name: Visionary Tea
description:
**Appearance:** A twist of fungus-based tea in a packet of golden paper. Smells very earthy with a hint of spice.

**Enchantment:** After consuming one cup, the user feels sleepy and eventually passes out. In their dreams, they come face to face with a deity of their choice.

**History:** This tea is very rare - it is a secret well kept by the priests if the northern temples. They often use it as a rite of passage for their apprentices, who will travel into the dream world to meet their god and ask for their blessing. 235

name: Night Blossom Tea
description:
**Appearance:** A pinch of tea in a Bw twist of paper. It's comprised mainly Eo » of dried blue petals, and it smells ~Z=- 0 strongly of the nighttime air. 1

**Enchantment:** This is a very strong sleeping draft. After one cup, the user will sleep soundly for twelve hours. The user cannot be woken until the tea wears off.

**History:** This tea is made of Night Blossoms, a rare species of flower that only grows on the north face of the mountain during spring. Apothecaries flock to the mountain during this time to harvest the delicate bloom, though the mountain nymphs are very protective and will snap at any apothecary that damages the plant.

name: Bronson Coffee
description:
**Appearance:** A bottle of strong, cold coffee with an ornate and fashionable label. I¢s a mellow coffee with a mild taste.

**Enchantment:** The user becomes hyper aware, gaining advantage on all listening, perception and search skill checks for four hours.

**History:** This bottled coffee is crafted in the capital city by a small team of fashionable baristas, and is popular among the younger citizens of the kingdom. c=, [Ee]

**Enchantment:** User becomes ultra-hydrated, and will | 4 sr’ not need to drink water again for one week. f

**History:** This enchanted water is common, if expensive, | ees and often used by the more popular gladiators. It is [I ~~ 3 considered a healthy and somewhat fashionable [33% beverage. pps Su 236

name: Finch Ale
description:
**Appearance:** A light and frothy ale in a brown glass bottle. The label was handwritten, and is peeling slightly.

**Enchantment:** Allows the users to communicate with birds for four hours, though the user feels slightly queasy.

**History:** This ale was crafted by master brewer and novice enchanter, Witting Silver, who figured beer-brewing and potion-making were pretty much the same thing. He was never brave enough to test his enchanted ale however, and it gathered dust on a shelf for many years before it was finally thrown out by his granddaughter.

name: Cat's Eye Cider
description:
**Appearance:** A bottle of deliciously crisp cider. A cat with abnormally large eyes has been drawn on the label.

**Enchantment:** The user's pupils slowly stretch vertically until they resemble those of a cat, allowing them to see in the dark for twelve hours. This enchantment has a 25% chance of becoming permanent.

**History:** This product was originally created on accident, when a wizard's cat coughed a magical furball into the freshly pressed cider. His friends and neighbors greatly enjoyed the strange side effect of the cider, and encouraged the wizard to sell it at the local farmer's market,

name: Mind-Reach Wine
description:
**Appearance:** A small bottle of dry red wine. The cork has been sealed with a blob of wax.

**Enchantment:** The user gains telekinesis, and is able to cast mage-hand freely for four hours.

**History:** This wine was developed by an aged warlock who was tired of getting up to pour himself a second glass of wine in the evenings. With this enchantment, he would simply use his telekinesis to fill his glass. It gained popularity among spellcasters, tailors, smithies and anyone else who wished above all else for a second set of hands. 237 Food -1d20- = ——

name: Sunflower Seeds of Sustenance
description:
**Appearance:** A bag of salted sunflower seeds.

**Enchantment:** When consumed, the seed sprouts and grows in the users stomach, keeping them full and satisfied for twelve hours. These seeds will cause considerable discomfort if the user eats more than one ata time.

**History:** These seeds were enchanted by Delis Strongbone, a wizard who disliked most foods, and had little appetite anyway. One food he did enjoy, however, was sunflower seeds. After living off the enchanted seeds for months, his friends realized how useful the seeds could be for travelers and adventurers, and encouraged him to sell them at the local magic market.

name: Birdseed Bread
description:
**Appearance:** Aloaf of bread, packed with nuts and seeds. Tastes a little woody, and has been sweetened with honey.

**Enchantment:** When this bread is sprinkled on the ground, 1d12 birds fly from the surroundings to peck at the crumbs, after which they will perform a small favor of the user's asking.

**History:** This bread was baked by Darius Featherfall, who was known for his masterful keeping and training of birds. The king was a frequent customer, and offered Darius a position as his master birdkeeper many times; but Darius refused, preferring to live in the open country with his precious aviary. 238

name: Evergrow Loaf
description:
**Appearance:** A loaf of plain rye bread.

**Enchantment:** As long as there is a little bit remaining, this loaf of bread regrows every day at dawn. Remains warm and crusty, no matter how long it has been sitting out.

**History:** Once, there was a hedge-mage named Matthew Tyler Janiro, who was forced to sell his shop after his business failed. With nothing leftto his name, he enchanted the only thing he owned - a crust of bread. To his surprise, the magic worked, and the bread regrew into a delicious, hot loaf. He approached a baker, and the two partnered to create delicious, enchanted bread that became popular all over the kingdom.

name: Spellberries
description:
**Appearance:** A cheesecloth bag, filled with 1d10 ripe and delicious blueberries. —=

**Enchantment:** After consuming one berry, the aa - user feels a rush of magic as one of their spell slots 4 ) N\ is restored. However, if the user consumes more br 4 than two or three berries per day, they will ©: become incredibly ill. These berries rot quickly. sso R

**History:** These blueberries come from the garden of Arian Tikes, a talented herbalist who specialized in propagating magical plants. Their products are highly sought after by wizards and warlocks, though Arian rarely puts their magical produce on the market.

This packet was bought by Nayrons Lil, a noble man who angered a street gang after publicly insulting them. He wasn't poisoned; however, he was stabbed in an alleyway later that week.

**History:** This gum was developed as a security device for the children of noble families. If attacked, all the child would have to do is blow a bubble to protect themselves. The invention never really caught on.

**History:** These candies were developed by Francis Day, a candy store owner in the capital city. These candies took off and became enormously popular among the citizens.

description:

**Enchantment:** Moments after y. & = NN consuming this candy, 1d12 large ES spiders crawl from the user's mouth. It is a rather unpleasant experience, but the user can control the spiders for ten minutes until they disperse.

**History:** These were enchanted by a young wizarding student named Godfrey Fellows. His mother gave him a package of gummy spiders for his birthday. They became quite popular among the younger students, and he made quite a bit of coin selling them before his professor intervened.

name: Gummy Snake
description:
**Appearance:** A foot-long gummy snake, made of soft colorful candy.

**Enchantment:** After eating this candy, the user grows two long fangs and their bite becomes incredibly poisonous. The effects last for four hours.

**History:** This snake was crafted by an apothecary named Penny Simps, who was experimenting with a way to cure the poisonous bite of a rattlesnake. While this gummy candy does not protect the user against poison, it does have some peculiar side effects that became popular among the more imaginative consumers. 247

name: Cantrip Catnip Tart
description:
**Appearance:** A delicate, slightly stale tarte made from sweet catnip and custard.

**Enchantment:** After consuming, the user becomes capable of casting three additional cantrips of their choice for one week, regardless of casting ability. However, the catnip in the tart leaves the user feeling slightly nauseous for 1d4 hours after consumption.

**History:** This tarte was crafted by a wizard named Kennith Belvedere, after his non-magical friend expressed a longing to experience casting magic. While many enjoyed the wizard’s tarts, there were too many complaints from people made ill by the catnip, that the product never gained viral popularity.

name: Super-Sticky Gumball
description:
**Appearance:** A large, bright green gumball

**Enchantment:** When thoroughly chewed, this gum becomes super sticky, and can be used to permanently fuse two objects. The objects cannot be separated, except by extreme strength or magical methods.

**History:** This gumball was created completely on accident, by a wizard who was attempting to make a gumball with everlasting flavor. He was quite befuddled by the strange and unintended side effect, and he tossed the batch after accidentally fusing his fingers together.

name: Jailbreak Sours
description:
**Appearance:** A small paper bag of 1d4, sugar-coated candies shaped like little skulls.

**Enchantment:** These candies are incredibly, incredibly sour. They don't taste great, and the user takes 1d6 damage if they eat more than one per day. However, the user's saliva becomes strongly acidic and caustic enough to erode through all but the strongest metal.

**History:** These candies were invented by a thief, who often found himself in prison. He would simply hide a few loose candies in his pocket and use them to burn the lock whenever he was arrested. 248

name: Super Sugar Bombs
description:
**Appearance:** A small box of colorful jellies covered in powdered sugar.

**Enchantment:** After consuming, the user feels an intense sugar rush. They feel incredibly energized and slightly manic, and moves at double speed for thirty minutes.

**History:** These were given as a birthday present to the young son of a noble family. However, the candies made the boy way too wild and were thrown away, only to be picked up by a thief going through the rich family’s trash.

name: Lock-Jaw Toffee
description:
**Appearance:** A square of thick, dark toffee sprinkled with salt and wrapped in plain wax paper.

**Enchantment:** This candy is incredibly delicious and equally as sticky - the user’s teeth stick together and they are unable to talk for thirty minutes, until the candy dissolves.

**History:** These candies ST were enchanted by a wizard _ No as a way to keep her young ~~ od apprentice quiet and << 7 occupied for a short “em N= amount of time. ~~

description:

**Enchantment:** When consumed, these candies allow the user to communicate and control bees and wasps for four hours.

**History:** These candies were crafted using the honey from the legendary Southern Hives, a collection of bees that collect pollen and nectar from the magical Blue Mountain Flowers. This magical honey imbues all it touches with a delicate natural magic. 249

name: Skylark Bubbles
description:
**Appearance:** Delicate, subtly colored bubbles made from spun sugar, wrapped in a thick layer of protective cheesecloth.

**Enchantment:** These delicate and luxurious candy causes the user to breathe small, fragrant bubbles and levitate uncontrollably for ten minutes.

**History:** These candies were developed for the more adventurous nobles who wished to have a little fun during their parties. For a time, bubble parties became quite popular among the more eccentric lords and ladies.

name: Animal Biscuits
description:
**Appearance:** A box full of cheap, animal-shaped cookies.

**Enchantment:** When a cookie is eaten, the user gains the ability to communicate with the animal represented by the cookie. The effects last for four hours.

**History:** These cookies were baked <3 3 SP by a woman named Dana Demonds, EN ps) who used them to keep her toddler f ) 0) entertained while she worked in the hrs) . garden. She gifted some to her Lh Aes friends, who encouraged her to sell her magical cookies at the local farmer's market.

name: Cinnamon Fire Candies

The user feels a lttle feverish and their tongue burns for twenty minutes, but they experience no truly harmful events. 250

**History:** These candies were crafted by a sorcerer who was always on the lookout for the spiciest foods. Dissatisfied with what he found, he endeavored to create the hottest candies in the world.

**Enchantment:** After eating a chocolate coin, the user promptly spits out areal solid gold coin.

**History:** No one is sure who enchanted these coins - they were purchased by an adventurer as a sweet treat for the road. He was quite surprised and terrified when he promptly vomited a handful of golden coins.

name: Life Preservers

**Enchantment:** At first, these mints seem to have no effect. However, next time the user takes a fatal blow, they are automatically stabilized and returned to 1 HP.

**History:** This spice grows in a special humid valley on the western slope of the mountains. It is a sacred flower to the temple, and consuming the hallucinogen is a rite of i passage for apprentice monks.

name: Alistair’'s Amazing Allspice
description:
**Appearance:** A handful of dark, gritty powder in a small cloth bag. It has an aromatic, faintly sweet scent.

**Enchantment:** Any food sprinkled with this spice tastes amazing, no matter what it is.

name: Dahlia Pepper Flakes
description:
**Appearance:** A handful of colorful pepper flakes in a small glass bottle.

**Enchantment:** These pepper flakes are incredibly spicy and delicious, and will completely numb the user’s tongue. They become unable to taste anything for 1d4 hours.

**History:** Dahlia peppers are grown by only a few farmers in the desert. The peppers, while delicious, deaden the consumer's tongue, which many consider to be an unpleasant side effect. However, this pepper is also used as something of an anesthetic for those undergoing painful dental procedures

name: Gold Flakes

**Appearance:** A pinch of golden flakes in a tiny velvet-lined box.

**Enchantment:** Anyone who consumes food sprinkled with these golden flakes will become convinced they have just eaten the best meal of their lives, no matter what they have just eaten, and will feel the urge to compliment the chef.

**History:** These golden spice flakes were commissioned by the late queen, who was often concerned with the quality of the castle chef. Not wishing to make a fool of herself and her household, she would sprinkle these flakes into the food of visiting dignitaries.

name: Black Charcoal Sesame
description:
**Appearance:** A small bottle of blackened sesame seeds. They (==> smell faintly of smoke. z

**Enchantment:** This spice tastes lovely, and the user enjoys the food greatly in the moment. However, the user will have no memory of consuming it afterwards.

**History:** For a very long time, farmers avoided growing or harvesting firefruit due to their explosive nature. Many people have been killed by falling firefruit, and only recently have farmers discovered a way to safely harvest the tasty fruit. Many warriors use the seeds as explosive projectiles, though they can be quite expensive to buy due to their dangerous nature. 256

name: Godspeak Vine

**Enchantment:** After eating, this spice causes the user to feel lightheaded and a little manic. Bright sparks dart across their skin and for one hour, anyone who touches the user takes 1d6 lightning damage.

**Enchantment:** When made into a tea, this herb significantly reduces fevers, aches and pains.

**History:** This is a common medicinal herb that is often used in sweet dishes, from jams to tarts to iced creams.
