name: Quickrot Salt
description:
**Appearance:** A handful of black salt in a small wooden pot. It has a vaguely smoky scent.

**Enchantment:** When sprinkled on food, the food will quickly begin to rot. Milk will go sour; bread will mold and meat will grow maggots in a matter of minutes.

**History:** The purpose of this salt is not known. This particular pot of salt was purchased by a thief named Orion Delmise, who was planning on robbing a duke’s household. What he was intending to do with the salt, however, is unknown, as he was arrested before he could put his plan into motion. 258

name: Always Spice
description:
**Appearance:** A generous pinch of pale brown powder in a small paper packet. It smells very faintly of cumin.

**Enchantment:** This spice can be sprinkled over food to prevent it from spoiling. The food lasts three times as long as it would without the spice, remaining perfectly edible until the magic fades.

**History:** This spice comes from roasted and ground leaves of the Always flower, a rather unremarkable white flower that grows along the road in the springtime.

name: Super Ragweed
description:
**Appearance:** A handful of bright yellow florets in a cheesecloth bag. It smells sweet, like fresh-cut grass.

**Enchantment:** For twelve hours after consuming this aromatic spice, the user experiences terrible allergies including cough, runny nose, itchy eyes and some difficulty breathing, however there is a 5% chance that the consumer will not be affected.

**History:** This is a common plant that grows along the road along the western coasts. Most people are allergic to this monstrous flower, and many apothecaries offer magical allergy medication during pollen season. $2 13 a A or [SVE Lil = hy Fic ZENA, (IM i) SPENT 1 2 rat ~ > 1 SN LER 3 259 Grd Chapter 7 - Tools, Equipment and Household Objects -1d100- ° Fi i ib | bw. =F o J <7 Vag 0 EARN a) RAR i RA 3 RAH Ne TER B AF 0 x SN ne hy 261 A "= © Adventuring Equipment i a : y/o ore Vi off

name: Command Rope
description:
**Appearance:** A 50ft. coil of rope, with strands of bright red thread woven in among the fibers.

**Enchantment:** This magical rope will follow simple commands given by the user. Commands can include things like attaching to objects within 20ft, tie itself into intricate knots, or wrapping itself into a neat coil.

**History:** While enchanted ropes can be found in every magical shop in the kingdom, this rope in particular was owned by a warrior named Tiana Dorothy, who unfortunately fell to her death after losing her grip ona cliffside. IRE ge id 2) whe BY el £3 . GA 7) a 9 i Cos ro

name: Odana’s Invisible Tripwire
description:
**Appearance:** A long silver wire with two spikes on either end.

**Enchantment:** When anchored into the wall, this tripwire turns invisible. While it is effective as a regular tripwire, it can also be enchanted with a spell that will go off once the tripwire is triggered.

**History:** This tripwire was crafted by Odana Litherial, a wizard who preferred to fight using invisibility, ranged spells and traps. Her short career was cut short after she accidentally triggered one of her own traps, bringing down an entire cave system around her. 262

name: Giant's Strength Crowbar
description:
**Appearance:** A large crowbar made from a strange bluish metal.

**Enchantment:** This crowbar is large and well-designed, giving the user advantage on all strength checks while prying something opened.

**History:** This crowbar was designed and carried by shipyard captain, William Dennis, who would pry open cargo containers to make sure merchants were actually carrying what they claimed. He went missing after investigating the cargo of a new merchant vessel.

name: Peepaw’s Fishing Tackle
description:
**Appearance:** A small box filled with fishing lures, lines, weights and hooks.

**Enchantment:** This fishing tackle is incredibly lucky, and the user will almost always catch something.

**History:** This fishing tackle was owned by an elderly man named Earl Young, who lived in a small lakeside cabin in the woods. He passed it on to his grandchild when they left to become an adventurer.

name: Saint Clarice's Healing Kit
description:
**Appearance:** A beautiful wooden box held closed with leather straps. Inside is a variety of glass bottles, bandages and steel implements.

**Enchantment:** This kit is full of strong medicines and a touch of magic. The user gains advantage on all medical skill checks.

**History:** This kit was put together by v2 Saint Clarice of Sorata, a cleric who 5 re was known for her kindness and Ff: 3 mn seemingly endless virtue. She spent - her days traveling the world and 7 H healing the sick, helping those she fy could without receiving anything in 7 return, When she was killed during a HB skirmish between gangs, she was / immediately declared a saint. 263

name: Hunting Trap of Runic Lure
description:
**Appearance:** A common hunting trap, painting with golden, glowing runes.

**Enchantment:** When set correctly, this trap lures all living and unsuspecting creatures, including humanoids.

**History:** This trap was crafted by Tim the Banished, a wizard who was outcast from society after he committed a number of ‘magical atrocities. Few know that his crimes were committed by covert command of the king. He lived in the woods during his exile, learning to survive in the wilderness and how to live with the evil he'd done.

name: Dynamite
description:
**Appearance:** A box of 1d12 sticks of explosive powder wrapped in red paper. che 1

**Enchantment:** Ten seconds after the SERA =, fuse is lit, the stick explodes violently ERE es IEP in a 20ft. circle of fiery destruction. |+os LE LZ ol

**History:** These sticks of dynamite FSSxeecs = b||, ZZ" are most often used in mining 4 <.Jfy rn Ee operations, to clear tunnels and = 1 2 caveins. —=ll:

name: Traveler's Tent
description:
**Appearance:** A tiny fold of waxed fabric, secured with twine.

**Enchantment:** This small square of fabric springs into a full-sized, two- person tent when placed on the ground. It is a decent tent - fairly waterproof and windproof, and it can be refolded in less than five minutes.

**History:** This tent was crafted and owned by an adventuring sorcerer named Jun-Mi Thalls, who traveled with a party known for their prowess and strategy in battle. After making a fortune fighting a dragon and stealing its hoard, the party retired and Jun-Mi bought a lovely cottage in the countryside. 264

name: Tadpole Canoe
description:
**Appearance:** A tiny canoe, about the size of a - tadpole, carved carefully from wood. Small : frogs and tadpoles have been intricately it ): s painted along the side. 8 J

**Enchantment:** When the command word is» ~*~ spoken, this tiny boat grows into a full-sized [ie canoe. When the command word is spoken Ne wis again, the boat returns to its original, tiny size. 2

**History:** These boats were often carried by the nomadic people of the temperate southern coast, who would often need to cross rivers and wetlands during their travels. This boat belonged to a woman named Giana Coldwater, a craftswoman and merchant who would travel far and wide to sell her rare and beautifully carved boats.

name: Rope of Convenience
description:
**Appearance:** An average coil of rope.

**Enchantment:** Somehow, this rope always seems to be just as long as the user needs, up to a length of 200.

**History:** This rope was enchanted by Daniella Finnius for her father, a spelunker who always complained about his ropes being just a little too short.

name: Amber Spyglass
description:
**Appearance:** A silver spyglass with amber-tinted glass.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to see incredibly far. Creatures and objects two miles away can be clearly seen, as long as the user's view is unobstructed.

**History:** This spyglass was passed down through generations of captains of the King’s Watch. The last captain to own this spyglass was Captain Olympia Stargazer, an elderly warrior who dedicated most of her time to the protection of the kingdom. After she was killed in battle, the spyglass was never found. 265

name: Any-Weather Tinderbox
description:
**Appearance:** A small metal tinderbox, etched with runes that seem to glow.

**Enchantment:** With this tinderbox, the user can start a fire in any conditions including rain, snow, and strong winds.

**History:** Once, there was a kind smithy who stumbled across a fire elemental huddled in the middle of a rainstorm. The smithy, unable to leave the creature there, carefully brought it home and nursed it back to health. The two became close friends and, when it came time for the fire elemental to leave, it gave this tinderbox to the farmer so that he may have flame wherever he goes.

name: Featherfall Climbing Harness
description:
**Appearance:** An intricate climbing harness, covered in straps and buckles.

**Enchantment:** This is a fully-functional climbing harness. However, if the user falls more than 15ft, the harness will slow their descent and deliver them safely and gently to the ground.

**History:** This harness was worn by Firella Linsen, a famous climber who enjoyed nothing more than climbing the tallest cliffs in the kingdom. Her husband, terrified for her safety, bought her this harness so that she would always come home safely.

name: Expansion Ladder
description:
**Appearance:** A strangely small, two-step f) ladder. Runes have been etched into the ; wood, and paper charms have been stuck | 1S on with wax seals. Ii

**Enchantment:** When the two rungs are . 9 pulled in opposite directions, this ladder G5 expands. With much splintering and “N77 S5/0 snapping, this ladder can grow into a 20ft. 4 ladder with ease. t canbe collapsed simply [1] E by pressing the top rung downward. IB 266

**History:** This ladder was used by the carpenters at DeLuth Carpentry, a popular company that builds quality homes and barns. No one is sure why or how, but bandits struck the headquarters in the middle of the night and made off with nails, hammers, exotic lumber and a few expanding ladders.

name: Fire Thermos Tg
description:
**Appearance:** A large steel thermos, sealed with hefty ~~ /.3  %| latches. The outside has been stained black by smoke i and fire. 5

**Enchantment:** Anything placed inside this thermos |= % : will remain at ts initial temperature until removed. ~~ [3 % oy A 5

**History:** Many of these thermoses were given as gifts | + {3) 7° to the employees of Tillman's Mining Company. This a7 2s thermos was owned by Tinjin Quintin, a worker who | {33 23{ 77 often used the thermos to sneak precious stones out [§3 2 15] of the mine. TREY

name: Permanent Pitons
description:
**Appearance:** A sack of 1d12 steel pitons. They seem strangely heavy, and each one has a large rune stamped on the end.

**Enchantment:** Once placed into a cliff or wall, these pitons cannot be removed by any means other than purposefully pulling them from their anchor. They cannot accidentally fall out of whatever surface they were driven into, no matter how hard the strain.

**History:** These pitons are a favorite among climbers, as many have fallen to their death after carelessly placing a piton. These were used by Gillian Gray, a climber known for scaling the Devil's Shin, an incredibly steep and unforgiving cliff face. ; —E8 Zs foe @ FSS 267

name: Everglade Waterskin
description:
**Appearance:** A waterskin made from bright blue leather.

**Enchantment:** This waterskin is always filled to the brim with fresh water, no matter how much the user consumes.

**History:** This waterskin was enchanted by Queeno Orpy, a wizard who spent his life researching the plane of fire. She finally decided that she could learn no more from the history books - she had to visit it herself. She donned fireproof clothing and crafted the Everglade Waterskin, and leapt into the plane of fire. After a week, she returned, singed but unharmed. Her book on the subject became the leading academic study guide.

name: Bullseye Grappling Hook
description:
**Appearance:** A wickedly sharp grappling hook on the end of a long rope.

**Enchantment:** When using this grappling hook, the user gains advantage on all checks made to throw it, as it seems to fly almost willingly towards the target. When the command word is spoken, the hook will un-anchor itself and return to the user's hand.

**History:** This grappling hook was carried by Nassen Forrona, an assassin and mercenary who was known for running jumping, climbing and swinging through the capital city with the help of his magical grappling hook.

name: Home-Again Compass
description:
**Appearance:** A small silver compass with an ivory face.

**Enchantment:** This compass will lead the user towards any place they desire, as long as it is a place they have visited before. The user must simply call out the name of the place, and the compass will lead them directly there.

**History:** This compass was given to a young adventurer by his mother, 50 he could always find his way home. 268

name: Target Whistle
description:
**Appearance:** A small brass whistle with a beaded charm hanging from one end.

**Enchantment:** When blown, this whistle can only be heard by chosen targets. The user can select any number of creatures within eyesight to hear the piercing shriek of the whistle.

**History:** This whistle was used by Captain Wellonius Dethorford, a rich noble who spent his days hunting with his many dogs. After injuring his ankle in a fall, he retired from hunting and passed the whistle on to his grandson, who refused to hunt and instead sold the whistle to pay for wine. i 3 0 4 fins a] = ° N ei vA (oa Gg Tis lpr N pe : A £d 2 a & [4 © | - ] . 6 J ‘6 269 cA 5) | A . i H Lights and Lamps -1d10-

name: Regrowth Candle
description:
**Appearance:** An average, twelve-inch beeswax candle.

**Enchantment:** When the burned candle stub is left alone, it will slowly begin to regrow, returning to full-size after one day of growth.

**History:** While a little pricy, folks often save up to purchase these candles. Overall, it is a cheaper investment than constantly buying candles. This one was bought by Linelle Orist, an artist who would often paint late into the night.

name: Automatic Torch
description:
**Appearance:** A simple wooden torch with a leather grip and a metal cage on one end to keep the fuel in place.

**Enchantment:** This torch will light and extinguish automatically when the user utters a simple command word. The torch can be ignited from up to 60ft. away.

**History:** These torches can often be found in the cellars and dungeons of rich lords and ladies. When they descend into the darkness, they can simply utter the command phrase to lightall of the torches at once with ease. This torch was stolen from a lord in the midwest, by a thief who was discovered mid-heist and needed to make a quick getaway.

name: Everburn Lantern
description:
**Appearance:** A spherical lantern of shining brass, with tiny runes etched along the bottom.

**Enchantment:** After being lit, this lantern cannot be snuffed out by water, wind or dust. It can’t run out of fuel, and will keep burning until the user purposefully extinguishes the flame. 270

**History:** These rather expensive lanterns were often used by sailors and merchants, and anyone who was often out in poor weather. This lantern was owned by Delphius Drim, a sailor onboard the cargo ship The Regal Regard. When his ship was taken by pirates, he jumped overboard and swam for two days with only this lantern to light his way in the terrifying seas. He survived to tell the tale, and never set foot in the ocean again. a gr >» 7 's .- =

name: Mysight Lantern
description:
**Appearance:** A simple lantern etched with magical runes.

**Enchantment:** The light from this lantern can only be seen by the person carrying it. To all others, it will appear unlit.

**History:** This lantern was carried by a thief named Houston Lord, who would use the light to quietly navigate sleeping households. They were arrested, however, after they loudly dropped the lantern while stealing a pair of earrings off a sleeping duchess.

name: Darkness Lantern
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy lantern made of brass, 7 stained black by some kind of smoke. / Q.

**Enchantment:** Instead of emitting light, when > the shades are opened, this lantern radiates a Ji) thick, magical darkness that completely fills a / Rr 20x20ft. space. az \Y

**History:** This lantern was by an assassin, /] V4 whose name has long since been forgotten. | PA \ After shrouding the ancient king's room in Suey (J darkness, he cut the king's throat and left him ATE to die on the hearthstones ina cloud of black ~~ [2 2 smoke. Neder] 27m

name: Saint's Lantern
description:
**Appearance:** A delicate golden lantern, set with pale opals and etched with simple holy runes.

**Enchantment:** When lit, this lantern emits holy light that boils and burns the skin of undead creatures, ghouls, demons, and those with strong evil auras.

**History:** This lantern was carried by Saint Agnes, a priest who was known for her stern motherly nature. She would walk the roads at night, helping those she could while carrying this lantern to guide her. After years of giving magical healing and holy blessings, her lantern became a magical focus.

name: Lantern of Truth
description:
**Appearance:** A lantern with walls made of thick panes of crystal.

**Enchantment:** When lit, the light cast by this lantern banishes all untruths. All illusions illuminated by this lanturn sizzle and smoke before fading away.

**History:** This lantern was carried by Sir Dally 0'Ron, an ancient witch hunter who would search through the villages at night, ‘hunting for the faintest whiff of witchcraft. His career was cut short when the women of the town gathered together and drowned him in a horse trough.

name: Guilera’s Sunlight Lantern
description:
**Appearance:** A spherical lantern made of gold, with sunlines etched across the surface.

**Enchantment:** When lit, this light emits strong UV rays. Even short- term exposure to this light causes painful burns and boils.

**History:** This lantern was originally developed by Princess Guilera, who loved to grow plants, though none would grow in the dark palace. She placed her plants under this strong light, and was delighted when they flourished under its bright beam. After she passed, the lantern was placed in the castle treasury. m2

name: Neverburn Candles
description:
**Appearance:** A back of 1d12, twelve-inch candles tied into a bundle.

**Enchantment:** When lit, the flame from this candle cannot burn anything. The flame can be touched with bare hands completely without harm, and it cannot catch fire to anything else, no matter how flammable.

**History:** These candles were developed by a sorcerer after his young daughter knocked over a candle, nearly burning the house down. They became popular among those with children, clumsy partners or excited pets. << . 5 ® 1 jel 1 my TN NRE =, A 2) viet SHA li >

name: Lantern of Blinding
description:
**Appearance:** A small lantern with a thick lens that can be rotated and twisted to change the focus of the beam.

**Enchantment:** The light emitted from this lantern is incredibly bright. When focused on the eyes of a creature, that creature has a high chance of being blinded for 1d6 rounds.

**History:** No one is exactly sure who made this lantern or why. It was last owned by an archeologist, who used its bright beam to examine cave paintings deep underground. 273 9 75 : ar. wy) . 5 v kdl “7” Blankets, Pillows and Bedrolls 3; ~ [ - -1d10- \ {7 LD \7 4

name: Blanket of Warmth
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy blanket of olive-green wool,

**Enchantment:** This blanket keeps the user warm, no matter the weather.

**History:** This blanket was woven by an elderly man named Gerard O'Rielly. He gave it to his grandson, who left to join the king's army. After several years, he finally returned from the war and started a family of his own, and he would tell heroic stories to his daughter under the same blanket that kept him warm on the battlefield.

name: Breeze Blanket
description:
**Appearance:** A light blanket made from several layers of pale blue cotton.

**Enchantment:** This blanket keeps the user comfortable cool, no matter the weather.

**History:** This blanket was woven by a woman who lived alone in the desert, where she hunted for precious stones in the shallow caves. She would use this blanket to keep herself cool in the hot desert nights, then travel miles and miles to the nearest city to sell her wares.

name: Invisibility Blanket
description:
**Appearance:** A gray woolen blanket, woven with brown geometric patterns.

**Enchantment:** After falling asleep, the user and the blanket become completely invisible until they wake. 274

**History:** This blanket was enchanted by a merchant who was afraid of being attacked while he slept. He was eventually robbed, and the blanket was stolen. The thieves had no idea of the blanket's power, and so the magical artifact went unused for many years until it was bought onthe black market by a spell-blade who recognized its magic.

name: Feather-Bed Bedroll
description:
**Appearance:** A thick, cushy bedroll stuffed with goose down.

**Enchantment:** This bedroll allows the user to sleep comfortably on almost any surface. From stone floors to gravel paths to dirty dungeons, the user will always have a pleasant night's sleep.

**History:** This blanket belonged to a noble man, who always brought it with him on his journeys. He was completely devastated when he accidentally left it at an inn after spending the night there.

name: Morpheus Pillow
description:
**Appearance:** A pillow filled with feathers and fragrant herbs.

**Enchantment:** This pillow cures insomnia. Anyone who sleeps with this pillow will experience a restful night's sleep.

**History:** These pillows are rather common, and can be found all over the kingdom. The original design was crafted by an herbalist named Daisy Fenn, a woman who often suffered from crippling insomnia,

name: Easy-Rest Pillow A a

**History:** This pillow was commissioned by ~~ <&\ \ Hrs an old knight, who often had terrible Aas dreams of the many wars he fought. — 275

name: Blanket of Watchfulness
description:
**Appearance:** A blanket of violet fleece, woven with a huge golden eye.

**Enchantment:** When the user sleeps under this blanket, the golden eye comes to life, darting this way and that. It keeps a close watch, and alarms the user if something sneaks up on them,

**History:** This blanket was woven by a ROE tly wizard named Ferris Holden. Hewasa ~~; / 237 T): RA aa famous wizard, known for his many 7 ¢ ¢ 1}: A experiments and leading research on NF Bt T, : : NV 7 Ne magical anomalies. Rd EL

name: Partner Blanket
description:
**Appearance:** A large quilt made from pale yellow and floral panels.

**Enchantment:** When two people sleep under this blanket, it prevents either person from stealing the blanket from the other. It will comfortably cover the two of them, no matter how much they toss and turn.

**History:** This blanket was enchanted by a warlock, after he kept stealing the blanket from his husband in his sleep.

name: Blanket of Calm
description:
**Appearance:** A large, heavy blanket, weighted with pockets of heavy crystal beads.

**Enchantment:** When draped over their shoulders, this blanket calms the user. It soothes their nerves, and disperses any magical charms that may be affecting them.

**History:** This blanket was originally created by a sorcerer, who suffered from anxiety. She would often wear this blanket after duels and battles, to disperse any magic that might be lingering around her. 276

name: Blanket of Recovery
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy red blanket, knitted from sweet-smelling wool.

**Enchantment:** When using this blanket, the user sleeps very deeply and will recover twice as fast from any illness or injury they may have.

**History:** These blankets were knitted by the Priests of the Sacred Body, a temple known for their medical abilities. Their temples are often filled with those seeking medical attention, and this blanket was designed to help those in need recover faster.
