name: Silver Mirror of Truesight
description:
**Appearance:** A dinner-plate-sized mirror that s set in a silver, circular frame.

**Enchantment:** This mirror reflects all things, showing them as they truly are. Vampires, ghosts and other such creatures can be seen in the mirror, while illusions and magical trickery cannot be seen.

**History:** This mirror was crafted by an enchantress named Cinthia Storm, who setit near her front door so that she would be alerted to any ‘magical illusions or charms that might step through her door. Once, she saw that a visitor was actually a demon in disguise. But the demon was already in her home and by the time Cinthia conjured up her weapons, the creature was already upon her.

name: Wellness Washboard
description:
**Appearance:** A simple washboard with runes etched into the wooden handles.

**Enchantment:** This washboard requires no soap or water. The dirty article must simply be scrubbed against the board, becoming perfectly clean in almost no time at all. pe

**History:** This washboard was given by 1 ig the king to his head laundry-mistress, as IT pryys a gift for her thirty years of service. She TIT y was charmed by the gift, and worked “ N—— happily at the castle for the rest of her £1) I TYTyTp days. After she passed, the washboard |! JA was given to the next laundry-mistress, {30ST who lasted only a few years before she || I RY quitand sold the magical washboard. [1 {CLIT fi 278

name: Fire Starting Fire Poker
description:
**Appearance:** A long, wrought-iron fire poker with a long pair of spikes atone end.

**Enchantment:** The user can ignite flammable objects simply by placing the fire poker against the desired object, and uttering the command word.

**History:** This fire poker was purchased by Amalie Lorenso, the castle's fire-starter. In the evening, when the sun began to set and a chill began to settle over the cold stone castle, Amalie would methodically go through each room and seta fire in the waiting fireplace. She was forced to leave her job, however, when she accidentally set some curtains ablaze. my I =" SE em — in i xi = rr i = —_—T=a ==

name: Self-Standing Broom
description:
**Appearance:** A simple broom with rune-etched beads woven into the end.

**Enchantment:** When the broom is set upright and the command word is spoken, this broom will begin to sweep on its own. It is quick and efficient, and will move from room to room, sweeping until it is instructed to stop.

**History:** This broom was the quick work of a wizard name Elonius Sharp, a man who was so pressed for time that he could not afford to clean his tower properly. Instead he enchanted a number of objects to do the work for him. 279

name: Bonfire Candle Snuffer
description:
**Appearance:** A silver candle snuffer on the end of a long, delicate handle.

**Enchantment:** This candle snuffer is capable of putting out fires up to Sit. tall.

**History:** This candle snuffer was purchased by a paranoid librarian; whose greatest fear was that one of the many candles in the library would be tipped over and destroy her beloved collection. Her paranoia was reward when one day, a candle was indeed knocked over. She smothered the blaze and banned the clumsy patron, soon switching to safer oil lamps. A) ~~

name: Void Bin
description:
**Appearance:** A small tin garbage bin, _ m= with the word ‘VOID’ stamped on the PaUTIYID> side in large red letters. Ee 1

**Enchantment:** Anything placed in this 3 small bin is immediately teleported % away. It is impossible to tell where it \ H goes, and nothing has ever returned. N ‘

**History:** No one is exactly sure where lo: this bin came from, or how it came to 4 be. It was purchased for a copper piece Sibe from a bankrupt company estate sale, Sem = 1.7 and nothing else is known about it. 280

name: Photo of Goldeen Smith - Sentient
description:
**Appearance:** A small framed picture of a dirty man, covered in coal dust. A pickaxe is clutched in one hand, and a ‘mining lantern is strapped to his forehead.

**Enchantment:** This picture seems to be alive. The man inside moves and grins often, and will easily offer advice on caving, mining and dungeoneering. He can accurately identify common minerals, and seems very knowledgeable on everything he decides to comment on,

**History:** The man in this photo was Goldeen Smith, a man who spent seventy of his ninety years working in a small coal mine. He loved mining so much that, after he died, his soul refused to leave. Now he spends his days inside this photograph, happily giving advice to miners and adventurers alike.

name: Lighter
description:
**Appearance:** A small glass vial of oil with a strange sparking mechanism attached.

**Enchantment:** This item has no magic; however, when the sparking mechanism is flicked, a small flame appears. The vial of oil can be refilled, and the device is water-resistant.

**History:** These lighters, while uncommon, can be found all over the kingdom. This one was owned by a ranger named Donovan Hues, an adventurer who would often smoke his pipe as he walked along the country roads. =} Nay Es SE : NL i <hN AW i NY [i 281

name: Pure Water Pail
description:
**Appearance:** A rather dinged-up bucket made from tin. At the bottom, arune has been hastily slathered on in white paint.

**Enchantment:** All water that is placed into this bucket becomes pure and perfectly potable.

**History:** Many of these buckets were hastily crafted by a local hedge- mage after a heavy rain flooded the town well with tainted water. The mage was hailed as a hero, and now entertains a booming enchanting business in the town that he helped through disaster.

name: Air Plant
description:
**Appearance:** A leafy plant in a small terracotta pot.

**Enchantment:** When watered and kept healthy, this small plant will absorb and cleanse impurities in the air. It will absorb everything from dust to poison gas, and will keep the user safe as long as it is kept close.

**History:** These plants, known as Magicia Imperfecta Schefflera, is coveted for its ability to purify the air. It can be found in many households - it is easy to take care of and is quite hardy. This plant was owned by Davis Blue, a traveling scribe who suffered from particularly bad seasonal allergies. e ANY \ vd Mag EEN WSN 3 SR) < | H | ~\ c E— —\s A= i ta— _— 282 Kitchenware pr — 2 EVN { eT, 21) -1d10- a Y Rm

name: Leafless Teapot
description:
**Appearance:** A delicate, floral teapot made from white porcelain.

**Enchantment:** This teapot can make tea without tea leaves. The user must simply add water, closes the lid and allow it to steep for three minutes. It is a new type of tea every time, and it is always quite tasty.

**History:** This teapot was owned by Lady Doralia Whitehaven, an elderly duchess who enjoyed nothing more than a good cup of tea. She would often travel the world, searching out new and exotic varieties to try, and eventually stumbled upon this enchanted teapot in a distant magical market.

name: Forget-Me-Not Teacup
description:
**Appearance:** A delicate, floral teacup rimmed with gold.

**Enchantment:** This teacup will keep tea, coffee, or any other beverages hotand fresh until consumed.

**History:** This teacup was owned by a woman named Madeline Hale, a scribe who would often make cups of tea only to forget about them entirely, remembering them only when they were stone cold.

name: Ice Chest
description:
**Appearance:** An iron box with heavy latches. Inside, the walls are coated in ice and a heavy fog floats off the frozen surface.

**Enchantment:** The inside of this box is permanently frozen. Anything placed inside this box will be kept very, very cold until removed.

**History:** This box was enchanted by a necromancer named Gornish Garfield, who would often use it to store specimens until he was ready to use them. 283

name: Bread Box
description:
**Appearance:** A light, wooden box that is gently warm to the touch and smells of freshly baked bread.

**Enchantment:** The inside of this box is humid and warm. Any food placed inside will remain warm and fresh until removed.

**History:** This box was crafted by an enchanter for his wife, who would spend long days working in the cornfields. He would often pack her lunch, and wished he had a way to keep her food fresh and warm for her. That sparked an idea in his mind, and he quickly made this lovely box.

name: Fire-less Frypan
description:
**Appearance:** A cast-iron pan with a fire rune etched on the bottom.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, the rune on the bottom of this pan begins to glow with heat, allowing the user to cook without a stove or fire.

**History:** This pan was owned by Grandma Pancake, a street vender who was beloved by the locals. She would haul her cart into town in the early morning and cook pancakes for all the hungry farmhands before they went off to work. No one is sure what her real name actually is, or where her magical pans came from.

name: Knife of Sharpness
description:
**Appearance:** A simple kitchen knife. A single, tiny rune has been etched on the blade near the handle.

**Enchantment:** This knife never dulls.

**History:** These knives are common in the restaurant industry, and are often given as gifts. This knife in particular was originally owned by Kusai Kimberly, the head chef of an ocean-side restaurant. SST or ER EX Sy eal) 284

name: Impenetrable Cutting Board
description:
**Appearance:** A small wooden cutting board, laced with chopping marks.

**Enchantment:** Nothing magical or mortal can pass through this cutting board. Neither blade nor fire nor magic can harm the seemingly delicate wooden surface.

**History:** This cutting board was owned by a world-renowned chef named Persephone Plip. When an angry rival tried to assassinate her, the cutting board stopped the knife in its tracks and saved her life,

name: Ever Changing Spice Bag
description:
**Appearance:** A tiny leather pouch that smells strongly of spices.

**Enchantment:** This pouch contains a tablespoon of spice that changes every day at dawn. Spices can range from anything from salt, pepper or paprika, to turmeric, graham marsala, or cocoa. There is a 10% chance that it could be a magical spice - see page 252.

**History:** This spice bag was given to Winnie Lillith, a woman who loved nothing more than cooking. She was a seamstress, who would often dream up recipes while performing her rather monotonous work. After saving for years, she finally had enough to open a tiny restaurant that quickly became the best restaurant in town.

name: Two-Day Wine Barrel
description:
**Appearance:** A small barrel made from oak slats and iron rings.

**Enchantment:** When fruit, spices and water are placed into this barrel and sealed, it will become a well-aged wine within two days.

**History:** This barrel was carried by Lewis Bernstein, a traveling merchant who loved nothing more than a glass of wine after a hard day’s work. It was tiresome to carry his wine collection with him, so he would instead bring this barrel and experiment with recipes while traveling from town to town. 285

name: Daniel's Potato Peeler
description:
**Appearance:** A small, simple vegetable peeler with a well-worn handle.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, this peeler will begin peeling vegetables on its own.

**History:** Once, there was a sorcerer student named Daniel Ubrick. He was a troublesome boy and would often find himself peeling potatoes in the kitchen as punishment for some mischief or other. He disliked the chore so much that he enchanted the peeler, simultaneously impressing and infuriating his headmaster. . ) j I i] AYA \ bo << i x v N \ \ , ° 286 Tools Fy -1d10- 29% et ze

name: Diamond Chisel
description:
**Appearance:** A sharp chisel with a diamond edge.

**Enchantment:** This diamond chisel can chip through anything, natural or magical.

**History:** This chisel was crafted by a dwarf smith many years ago. It was carried by Dallion Yith, a warrior who famously broke the Traitor God Eaeral’s magical bonds and freed him.

name: Hammer of Giant's Strength
description:
**Appearance:** A large carpenters hammer, made from pale stone and dark wood.

**Enchantment:** This hammer bestows great strength upon the user.

**History:** This hammer was carried by Frine Earthstone, a famous dwarven carpenter who lived eons ago. She built the beautiful Capital Chapel, which stands testament to her skill to this day.

name: Spade of Fertile Earth
description:
**Appearance:** A space with a golden blade, etched with delicate crawling vines.

**Enchantment:** This spade blesses any earth it touches. All plants grown with the aid of this spade grow quickly and well.

**History:** This spade was carried by Foxglove, a mysterious wandering cleric who spent her days planting trees and fruit-bearing plants along the roadside. Though much of her life is a mystery, she was bestowed a sainthood by the temple after her death. 287

name: Pliers of Removal
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of heavy iron pliers, the handles wrapped in worn red leather.

**Enchantment:** Even the most stuck objects are easy to remove with these pliers. Anything from rusty nails to magical bindings can be removed or separated with relative ease.

**History:** These pliers were used by Omagius Bone, the royal dentist of long ago. The late king and his children often suffered from crooked, rotten or cracked teeth, and his cure was simply to remove the offending tooth which was done easily, if not painlessly, with the aid of these pliers.

name: Lucky Fishing Pole
description:
**Appearance:** A long, collapsible fishing pole made from bamboo and brass bracings.

**Enchantment:** The user becomes incredibly lucky, and will usually land alarge, healthy fish.

**History:** This pole belonged to a famous competitive fisherman named 01d Bass Bill, who would take home the prize of every competition. Only after he died did they realize his pole was enchanted, and his certificates ‘were revoked post-mortem.

name: Axe of Harm
description:
**Appearance:** A large woodcutter’s axe. A strange rune has been etched into the iron blade.

**Enchantment:** No matter what this axe is used for, the user will almost always hurt themselves with it before the day is done. Wounds can vary from mild to severe, but blood is almost always drawn.

**History:** No one is sure where this axe came from or why it was made. A young orphaned boy stole it from a cabin far out in the woods so that he might cut himself firewood and protect himself, only to mortally injure himself with it almost immediately. He stumbled to a temple where the priests treated him and cast the cursed axe aside. 288

name: Safety Tongs
description:
**Appearance:** A set of crucible tongs made from a heavy, purple metal.

**Enchantment:** These crucible tongs can be used to safely grab anything from molten metal to volatile magical § artifacts. These tongs cannot grow too 1 warm or too cold, they are not i conductive, and will not set-off or | disrupt magical artifacts.

**History:** These tongs were owned by a warlock named simply Gavin, who became known for his volatile magical experiments. His promising career was cut short when he accidentally grabbed a packed cube of gunpowder with his iron calipers instead of his magical ones, blowing up his whole lab in the process.

name: One-Strike Hammer
description:
**Appearance:** An iron claw hammer with a shimmering brass head.

**Enchantment:** This hammer will drive in nails into wood and stone with one strike, every time.

**History:** This hammer was carried by Rowana Patel, a ship carpenter who single-handedly built dozens of stunningly beautiful ships. Her fascination with ships began as a hobby - one that she would pursue during her free time. As she grew more and more skilled, the queen finally took notice and gave Patel a crew of carpenters and apprentices, commissioning from her the most beautiful three-masted ship that still sails the seas to this day. 289

name: Infinite Tape Measure
description:
**Appearance:** A retractable tape measure in a steel case etched with magical runes.

**Enchantment:** This tape measure seems to go on infinitely, and will always snap back into its case when released.

**History:** This tape measure was given to carpenter Phil Andrews as a gift by his children, who often saw him struggling with his measuring sticks.

name: Snip-Clip Scissors
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of large silver scissors, with runes etched into the twin blades. A violet ribbon has been tied around the handle.

**Enchantment:** These scissors can easily cut through all natural, mortal materials. Sheets of iron, thick branches or small stones pose no difficulty to these shears, which cut through them with ease.

**History:** These scissors were crafted by an enchanter named Dean Ordana, a tailor who specialized in magical and enchanted clothing. He found many enchanted fabrics difficult to cut, and so he crafted these magical scissors. A 0) . Ns $ 2) AT 7) SN oan) 8 rg Yoie AN \ cif \ fe 200 i « : TL Saddles and Tack n cd) — -1d10- | p we REE

name: Sorcerer's Saddle
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy, comfortable saddle made from a very dark purple leather. Golden geometric designs trace the edges, and the fastenings and buckles are made from intricately-worked gold.

**Enchantment:** This saddle surrounds the horse with invisible magical armor, giving it strong armor class bonuses without impeding its movement.

**History:** These saddles were used by of the many magic users in the king's army. This saddle was owned by a warlock named Thimble Tythes, a young man who joined the army in order to continue his magical schooling. He made it through unscathed, however Tythes refused to use magic after the War of the Two Rivers, during which many sorcerers brutally killed each other.

name: Saddle Blanket of Comfort
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy woolen saddle blanket, woven from cream- colored yarn. Red and brown geometric designs have been woven into the blanket, which is also speckled with flecks of dirt and hay.

**Enchantment:** This blanket will keep the horse at a comfortable temperature, no matter the weather.

**History:** This blanket was owned by an old ranger who wandered the wilds, taking down bandits and wolves and keeping the roads safe as often as he could. He loved his horse more than anything in the world, as she was his only friend during their lonesome travels. When she finally passed, he spent three days burying her, and the old ranger left her saddle and blanket on a stone over her faithful heart to mark her place of rest. 291

name: Horseshoes of the Wind
description:
**Appearance:** A set of simple horseshoes, etched with magical runes.

**Enchantment:** When affixed to the horse's hooves, these shoes allow them to run fast and far without E) tiring, f Ji (1 y

**History:** These shoes are commonly worn by racing |g, A horses, though they can also be found on the hooves * § 1 # 4 of war horses or messenger ponies, or anyone who Nari ; values speed and strength enough to purchase aset 4 N re of these expensive shoes. bd

name: Horse Brush of the Glistening Coat
description:
**Appearance:** A spectacularly elegant horse brush made from polished ebony, with boar-bristles and a red leather grip.

**Enchantment:** This brush causes the horse's coat and mane to gleam beautifully, making even the most wretched beast look like a prize- winner. The horse also feels rejuvenated and refreshed after being cleaned with this brush.

**History:** This brush was owned by a stable-master known for his prize- ‘winning stallions. He made his fortune in the races, but soon retired to focus on breeding the finest stock in the world. This brush was stolen along with his finest mare by the young girl tasked with her care.

name: Stay-Put Saddle
description:
**Appearance:** A deep saddle made from burnished caramel leather.

**Enchantment:** This saddle is very, very difficult to fall out of. The user cannot be thrown or pulled from the saddle, unless the user purposefully hurls themselves from the horse's back.

**History:** These saddles are commonly used for riders with little-to-no experience. This saddle belonged to a stable in the south, which was known for its excellent riding tutors. 292

name: Bridle of Calm
description:
**Appearance:** A bridle made of soft gray leather. Small, quiet chimes have been C : affixed along the straps. \

**Enchantment:** The horse feels calmed, and they become very difficult to spook or startle.

**History:** This bridle was made by a young farmer, after he found a lovely horse wandering out in the forest. She was easily spooked and startled, and so the farmer spent many long nights crafting a harness with soothing bells. After weeks of building trust, the horse finally relented and the two became close friends.

name: Boots of Ease
description:
**Appearance:** A set of four horse boots made from stiff leather lined with wool. The leather has been etched with small pictures of leaves and vines.

**Enchantment:** When worn, these boots allows the horse to move through difficult terrain with ease.

**History:** These boots were used by a cartographer, who would often trek through the difficult, swampy lands to the far south in order to create accurate and reliable maps.

name: Horse Armor of Protection
description:
**Appearance:** A set of silver horse armor, etched with elegant lines and fastened with bright red ribbons.

**Enchantment:** This armor grants the horse a high armor class bonus, In addition, any strike that would kill the horse instead drops them to 1 hit point. This effect can only be used once per day.

**History:** Once, there was a warrior named Ellis MontBlanc. After her beloved horse was beheaded by a mighty and cruel foe, she swore that such a thing would never happen again, and had this armor crafted for her new mount. 293

name: Thunder Hoof Shoes
description:
**Appearance:** A set of polished steel horse shoes, etched with jagged lines of lightning.

**Enchantment:** When worn, the horse's kicks become devastating electrical attacks that deal an additional 2d6 lightning damage, letting out a thunderous boom with every strike.

**History:** These horse shoes were owned by a young warrior named Lightning Max who, though small for her age, was known for being a strong and clever mercenary.

name: Saddle of Strength
description:
**Appearance:** A hefty, sturdy saddle made from thick brown leather. It is dotted with peculiar iron braces and hinges, and etched with runes for structural support.

**Enchantment:** This =X saddle allows the horse (Yes ZF NY to comfortably carry LARS CENA twice its maximum | En weight load. “1 RSE LN i LN Jn 3

**History:** This saddlewas [= (322 \\ 3 3 3) commissioned by a huge f{==®).\, . NZ) warrior nicknamed The $= OPA I= isso) Mountain Giant, who : 2A =e was very tall and very 1 Ror WEL wide and could crush a Shit 3 horse's back even I] without his armor on. It } H took many wizards 7 | Bi hours of planning and ox i work, but they finally ( ) =i discovered a way to {ne allow this giant of aman 1777} to ride a horse comfortably into battle. == 294 Artisan’s Tools -1d20- > m——— i cmc. : DY WR 6 (

name: Eternal Paints
description:
**Appearance:** A long box filled with small bottles of paint. There are 12 hues - bright and beautifully pigmented.

**Enchantment:** No matter how much paint is used, they never seem to run out.

**History:** These paints were owned by a young lord who loved to paint. He would often run out of certain colors and so his father gave him these eternal paints, so he would always have the supplies he needed.

name: Thimble Needle
description:
**Appearance:** An average iron needle.

**Enchantment:** This sewing needle cannot pierce living flesh.

**History:** This needle was enchanted by a wizard for his daughter, who loved to sew and craft despite her young age. Terrified his daughter might prick herself, he crafted her this special needle so she could continue to do what she loved without fear of injury.

name: Insta-Dry Calligraphy Pen
description:
**Appearance:** A calligraphy pen with a marbled black barrel and a golden nib.

**Enchantment:** The ink from this pen dries instantly - nothing written with this pen will smear.

**History:** This pen was owned by a scribe named Telfinius Tart, a young man who worked copying ancient books in the temple library. As a left- handed writer, he often smeared his writing as he penned carefully into his valuable books. Tired of ruining so many pages, he finally commissioned this magical pen. 205

name: Jeweler’ Tweezers
description:
**Appearance:** A small set of silver tweezers, engraved with golden runes.

**Enchantment:** These tweezers gives the user incredibly steady hands. The enchantment will affect the user as long as they have the tweezers on their person.

**History:** These tweezers were used by Downtown 5) Jewelers, a small silversmith studio in the capital 5 city. Itwas a quiet business for many years before Fe they crafted a crown - a gift for the new princess. d It was so beautiful that the entire kingdom was 7 amazed, and ever since then the studio's business has been booming. A pair of tweezers are given to every jeweler after they finish their eight-year apprenticeship.

name: Living Ink Needle
description:
**Appearance:** A long, shining tattoo needle on the end of a silver rod.

**Enchantment:** Any tattoos crafted with this needle seem to come to life | ~ birds will fly, flowers will sway in Pa - ° B an invisible breeze, flames will 7) ol) flicker and spark, moving over the _ go 0 7 user's skin as if alive. Se hs () @ SN

**History:** This needle was used by a [3 2 A strange wizard named Peter le N Highborn. Instead of using a book or : wt RC scroll to keep his spells, he instead | chose to tattoo them into his skin, where they would dance and fly across his body like living creatures. He became known for his unique spellcasting methods, and was considered one of the most dangerous mercenaries in the business. 296

name: Vanishing Lockpicks
description:
**Appearance:** A leather wallet full of lockpicks, hooks, files and shims.

**Enchantment:** For some strange reason, these lockpicks cannot be found by anyone other than the one carrying them. If the user is frisked and searched, however thoroughly, the lockpicks will never be discovered. oT

**History:** Lockpicks like these are a ; N= valuable commodity among thieves. A == This set was owned by a young thief ~~ { Ng who discovered their magic only HTT 4p 2) after she was arrested for stealing E 3 YL 3 2) 2) eggs from a cafe. CRT TT Fo. pI

name: Giovanni's Easel
description:
**Appearance:** A wooden easel covered in colorful piles of oil paint in a beautiful variety of color.

**Enchantment:** Paints placed on this easel take twice as long to dry.

**History:** This easel was owned by famous painter, Giovanni Inkheart. He lived many hundreds of years ago, and his work is so beloved that the castle has an entire gallery dedicated to his most famous pieces. After his death, his art, tools and even his clothing was snapped up by collectors. This easel is by far the most coveted tool of his, due to its gentle magical properties.

name: Iron Journal
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy journal with a thick, leather cover. Each page has been stamped with a tiny rune in dark blue ink.

**Enchantment:** This journal cannot be destroyed by natural means. Age, water, fire and dust have no effect on the paper.

**History:** These journals are produced in a small town in the north by a group of enchanters and master bookbinders. Hundreds are made every year, and they are quickly bought by wizards, scribes and alchemists who wish to keep their work safe. 297

name: Shatter Glaze
description:
**Appearance:** A small box holding six bottles with cork stoppers. Inside of each pot is a thick, colorful liquid.

**Enchantment:** These bottles contain pottery glaze in six different colors. When it is used on a pot or dish, the gentle magic in the glaze makes it very difficult to break.

**History:** This glaze can be found in almost every potter's shop. This set was owned by an adventurer named Finbar Holdstead, a traveling mercenary who would craft small animal figurines from clay, using kilns in the towns he passed through. Oa Cen Pe ANE SEE, Ai Te Ed

name: Photograph Pencil
description:
**Appearance:** A pencil with runes etched down the wooden sides. It has been sharpened down to about half its original size.

**Enchantment:** When set upright on a piece of paper, the user can utter the command word and indicate a subject within thirty feet. The pencil will automatically recreate a very good likeness of the creature or object in a sketchy, dreamy style.

**History:** These pencils are rarely used by artists, and are usually considered playthings for high-born children as they require no artistic skill. This pencil in particular, however, was owned by a traveling thief who particularly enjoyed journaling. While he could write well enough, he couldn't draw at all. And so, he would use this pencil to sketch his campsites and anything he found particularly interesting along the roadside. 298

name: Embroidery Life Thread
description:
**Appearance:** A small basket filled with needles, thimbles and 1d20 spindles of brightly colored embroidery thread.

**Enchantment:** Anything embroidered with this thread seem to come to life ~ birds will fly, flowers will sway in an invisible breeze, flames will flicker and spark, moving over the fabric as if alive.

**History:** This embroidery thread was originally enchanted by a wizard who had recently become a mother. She would sew small birds and flowers into the hem of her dress, and the baby would spend hours watching the little things dip and sway and flutter across the fabric while her mother worked.

name: Spellwoven Thread
description:
**Appearance:** A small tin box - inside is a heavy iron needle, a leather thimble and 120 spindles of brightly colored embroidery thread.

**Enchantment:** This thread can be used to store spells, in the form of embroidered images. The user can embroider as many spells as they wish into their clothing instead of casting them, after which they can cast them at any time without expending the spell slot.

**History:** This thread was used by a highborn assassin, who would stitch her spells into her dress instead of a spellbook. They were easier to sneak into parties and court occasions, allowing her to carefully and quietly assassinate her target right under the noses of the other nobles.

name: Woodcarver's Blade
description:
**Appearance:** An old, worn whittling knife with a slightly rusty blade.

**Enchantment:** Despite the rust on this blade, it cannot grow dull and it will never slip and cut the user.

**History:** This blade was enchanted by a wizard who decided, after a lifetime of sorcery in the service of the king, to retire. He spent his remaining years on his back porch, whittling little statues of fantastical creatures and giving them away to the local kids whenever they came by. 209

name: Perfectionist Chisel
description:
**Appearance:** A delicate marble chisel made from a strange green metal, with a simple sturdy handle.

**Enchantment:** This chisel will never chip too far or slip and make a mistake in delicate stonework.

**History:** This chisel was crafted from the scale of a huge, ancient dragon that was defeated after it attacked the capital city. Its massive body fell, crushing the workshop of a humble sculptor. However, after making a scale from its hide, he went on to make fantastically detailed sculptures that spurred his name to fame.

name: No-Stick Sticky Glue
description:
**Appearance:** A small glass bottle filled with thick paste. The lid is difficult to get off.

**Enchantment:** This glue is incredibly sticky and very strong; however, it will never stick to the user’s fingers.

**History:** Gallons of this glue was purchased by Sainsborough and Sons, abookbinding company that specializes in the repair of old and decrepit tomes. The delivery was waylald by highwaymen who were rather disappointed to find that the huge caravan was carrying only glue, but they stole what they could carry and sent the wagon on its way.

name: Sculpting Clay
description:
**Appearance:** A 12x12 inch block of grey clay. It has the strong smell of wet stone, and is quite firm.

**Enchantment:** The user can touch the clay, utter the command word and then indicate anything within eyesight. The block of clay will begin to shed small shavings and, after ten minutes, it will form into a nearly perfect 3D recreation of the target.

**History:** Clay like this is quite cheap to buy, but most sculptors scoff at the idea of using such magic. Instead, this clay is often used by those who can't afford to hire an artist, usually to sculpt the face of a beloved family member or pet. 300

name: Copycat Brush
description:
**Appearance:** A paintbrush with short, fine bristles. The handle is made from a pale wood, but it's barely visible beneath a coating of colorful paint smears.

**Enchantment:** When set to a canvas or paper, the user can indicate any painting within 15ft. The brush will set to work, darting around the page ofits own volition. After twenty minutes, it will produce a fairly accurate copy of the original artwork.

**History:** This brush was used by a woman named Stelezar Steel, a famous art thief who stole hundreds of paintings during her long and productive career. She eventually sold all of her paintings and retired, but her legacy lived on. She was so famous that the copies she produced are nearly as valuable as the originals. rT A DEE Po comm LOCI —e= 0 em

name: Diana's Brush
description:
**Appearance:** An older high-end paintbrush, with a dark green handle and a slightly frayed tip. The name ‘Diana’ has been painting on the side in white,

**Enchantment:** Whenever this brush is used to paint, the painting will always turn out to be portrait of the same woman. She has brown hair and a dreamy look to her dark eyes. No matter how hard the user attempts to paint something else, the painting will always include this strange woman. The user feels a little melancholy when painting with this brush.

**History:** No one is sure who this woman is or where this paintbrush came from. 301

name: Prophet's Loom
description:
**Appearance:** A small lap loom made from polished light wood.

**Enchantment:** When a tapestry is woven in this loom, there is a 50% chance that it will contain a prophetic design that relates to the user's future.

**History:** This loom was often seen in the lap of Saint Irrilias Greydown, a priestess known for her ability to see into the future. She would weave away at her loom, only to be occasionally struck by fits of prophetic visions. A young cleric remained at her side at all times, pen and paper ready to record her prophecies at a moment's notice. Fooaanzannaiy BEEN On fi - ix) f S90) 0) Lf, Of ———— aE | i==2===1) | aN : > 7 |TEHIY \e I Sh AR RRASRA! |: . 3 SAFRAN | b llie==sl) _

name: Endless Paper
description:
**Appearance:** A large roll of fibrous pale paper.

**Enchantment:** No matter how much paper is unspooled, it never seems to run out.

**History:** This paper was enchanted by a scribe, who often found himself running out of parchment. He magically linked the spool to the life of an ancient forest - whenever the paper is used, the leaves and dead branches and reeds on the forest floor magically transform into more paper, appearing on the spool no matter how far from the forest it is. 302 Chapter 8 - Containers -1d100- Nd 7 2 FRI SE AR E : < 4 x = Co ry Boxes gq [T= 1% -1d20- Yom =2 — Me

name: Stasis Box
description:
**Appearance:** A small, 12x12in. box made of dark wood with a swinging lid and silver hinges.

**Enchantment:** Anything placed inside is frozen in time, remaining in complete stasis until itis removed.

**History:** This box was carried by a traveling medic named Oinga Luan, who would often place severed limbs inside this box until they could be reattached.

name: Box of Unequal Dimensions
description:
**Appearance:** A 10x12in. box made of red, polished wood.

**Enchantment:** On the inside, this box is three times as large.

**History:** Boxes such as this are often used by richer merchants, who use them to easily transport large quantities of goods. This box was owned by an elderly merchant named Yip Lissel, who was robbed along the king's highway only a few months ago.

name: Unbreakable Chest
description:
**Appearance:** A large, 2x3ft. box made of oak, with heavy iron bands and hinges.

**Enchantment:** This box is indestructible.

**History:** This chest was owned by a duke name Lord Hellibor. He seemed an average man, but he was ensconced in a tangle of dark magic. He made many deals with terrible spirits to gain power, riches, women, and eternal life. None of that helped him when a stray demon set fire to his house, burning the whole place to the ground. This chest was the only thing that still remained. 304

name: Animal Box
description:
**Appearance:** A wooden 3x3ft. box made of rough wooden planks. Holes have been drilled into the sides - the box occasionally rocks and emits aterrible growl, as if a feral animal is trapped inside.

**Enchantment:** Despite the sounds, this box is entirely empty. It simply emits frightening sounds, discouraging anyone from opening it.

**History:** This box was the clever invention of Dias Thrilpeak, a smuggler who spent his days sneaking black-market goods from town to town. The box rocks and yowls, and he would claim that the box contained a rabid dog. Years passed without anyone suspecting his ruse, until he stumbled across a guard he had met on the road before. Dias was arrested, and his smuggling career prematurely ended.

name: Box of the Perfect Fit
description:
**Appearance:** A 1x3ft. box made of sanded yew planks, with brass hinges.

**Enchantment:** This box will shrink or expand up to 3ft. in any direction to create a perfect fit for whatever is placed inside.

**History:** Boxes like this were often used by merchants who traveled with delicate, fragile goods such as pottery or furniture.

name: Self-Lock Lockbox
description:
**Appearance:** A small and elegant 6x10in. box, made of polished steel with an inlay of gems.

**Enchantment:** When something is placed inside this box and the lid is shut, it can only be opened again by the person who placed the item inside. After the item is removed, it can be opened by anyone until another item is placed inside.

**History:** This box was carried by a silversmith, who would often make deliveries to noble households across the city. He was robbed many times, but the thieves were never able to get the chest open before they were tracked down by the city guard. 305

name: Box of Useful Things
description:
**Appearance:** A 6x10in. box, made of rough redwood with brass hinges.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, a random item appears inside this box. -1d20-

name: A 20ft. coil of rope. 11. A pot of ink.
A small mirror. 12. Bandages and wound balm.
A sewing kit. 15. A small hunting trap.
A small pouch of soft wax. 16. A small pouch of spice.
A six-inch knife. 17. A spool of twine.
A small bottle of whiskey. 18. A telescope.
Asilver coin. 19. A map of the area.
A scroll of paper and a pen. 20. A piece of chalk.
description: **History:** This box was made from the reclaimed wood of a witch's hut, that burned down and collapsed many years ago. All the magic performed by the witch over the years seeped into the walls, causing anything made with the wood to become gently magical. 3 ’ 7

name: Box of Need
description:
**Appearance:** A 6x10in. box made from polished, dark mahogany with golden hinges.

**Enchantment:** Once per week, the user can place their hand on the box and summon any non-magical item they have dire need of, such as rope, candles, blankets, food, and so on. Gold and jewels cannot be summoned, though silver or copper coins will appear when needed. As long as it can fit in the box, it will appear.

**History:** This box was the subject of many legends. Some say there was a blessed woman who walked the roads hundreds of years ago, giving away everything she had. A god, seeing the woman's kindness, gave her this box of blessings so that she would never want for anything,

name: Lead-Lined Box
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy 12x12in. box made of thick oak planks. Inside, the box is lined with a dull metal.

**Enchantment:** This box can safely store anything. Fire, acid, magic - this box is impenetrable on the inside.

**History:** This box was used by a traveling alchemist who would often walk the roads with a collection of dangerous, volatile chemicals. This box and its magic saved his life on many occasions, when caustic or explosive chemicals came into contact with one another.

name: Folding Box
description:
**Appearance:** A peculiar 2x3ft. box with strangely thin sides.

**Enchantment:** This cleverly made box can be folded down to the size of a paperback book with ease.

**History:** This box was made by Tilliana Blue, an architect and designer who enjoyed dabbling in origami and clever woodwork. She was made popular by her devious wooden puzzles and uniquely designed furniture. 307

name: Unbreakable Box
description:
**Appearance:** An average 2x2ft. crate made of rough, splintery oak planks.

**Enchantment:** Anything placed inside becomes incapable of breaking. No matter how fragile itis, if itis placed inside the box it will not break unless the box is broken.

**History:** Boxes like this, while expensive, are most commonly found with merchants who travel with incredibly fragile merchandize.

name: Box of Disappearance
description:
**Appearance:** A 2x4ft. box made of polished ebony.

**Enchantment:** Anything put inside this box disappears mysteriously after the lid is closed.

**History:** This box was designed, constructed and enchanted by a talented wizard, though why it was created or where the items disappear to is unknown. One brave adventurer jumped into the box himself and, sure enough, disappeared after the lid was closed. He was never seen again.

name: Music Box of Calm
description:
**Appearance:** A small silver jewelry box. The inside is lined with red velvet, and features a tiny ballerina that spins slowly as gentle, calming music plays.

**Enchantment:** The music played by this * ™SN box has an intense calming, heartening AN effect. All who hear it become immune to ¢ ) magical fear, and feel much braver in its NJ] proximity. \y 054

**History:** This music box was enchanted by << CXZ ETT 55 a wizard for his young daughter, who was d= afraid of the dark. The music carried her "332,42 RUS through many frightening nights and, when “20 G 42% she grew up, she gave it to her own child. 8 308

name: Lunchbox
description:
**Appearance:** A tin lunch box with a red leather handle. pe

**Enchantment:** After an assortment Yi / ~~ of ingredients are placed inside, the = ~) user closes the ld. Steam issues out (NRL pl! from the sides for ten minutes and, |: —1 = when the lid is open, the ingredients | % . | have been assembled into a lovely |+ hot meal. H J od $i:

**History:** This lunchbox was used by H asmith who didn’t have enough time d= to prepare herself a hot lunch every day.

name: Freeze Box
description:
**Appearance:** An iron 1x1ft. box with a heavy latch. The outside is very cold to the touch.

**Enchantment:** Anything placed inside is instantly frozen after the lid is closed.

**History:** This box was enchanted by a necromancer named Jose Santa, who was known for his cruel experiments. He would often keep specimens frozen in this box until he was ready to us them.

name: False Bottom Box
description:
**Appearance:** An average 3x3ft. crate made of rough oak planks.

**Enchantment:** This box has a very clever false bottom that is nearly impossible to find unless you know what you're looking for.

**History:** Boxes like these are often used by smugglers, but few false- bottom boxes are as cleverly made. This box was used by famous smuggler Tully Smoothtongue before he was murdered. 300

name: Begone Box
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy, steel 2x2ft. box with a heavy latch. Runes of fire have been etched along the inside of the box.

**Enchantment:** Anything placed inside is instantly incinerated after the lidis closed.

**History:** This box was used by the Tarmian Priests, a group of medics who specialized in illness and disease. They would use this incineration box to safely dispose of contaminated or hazardous materials.

name: Box of Stabilization
description:
**Appearance:** A 1x2ft. box made of pale red acacia wood. Runes of Vs pausing, halting and rest have rt AE been etched along the polished (ar «= surface. XS = 2 SL Z

**Enchantment:** Any magical object | & ?, placed inside this box becomes “X_ [\ YY Al dormant and stable, remaining ' safely in stasis until it is removed. Ss ed

**History:** This box was used by Patricia Darksky, a mercenary who specialized in find and retrieving dangerous magical artifacts. Her career was cut short, however, after she removed a volatile magical tome from the box, which exploded the moment it left the confines of the box.

name: Box of Inconsistent Duplication
description:
**Appearance:** A 2x3ft. wooden chest with tarnished iron latches.

**Enchantment:** When an item is placed into this chest, there is a 15% chance the object will duplicate 1d4 times after the lid is closed.

**History:** This box was crafted in a common workshop in a small midwest town. No one is exactly sure why it is magical or how the magic works ~ the few wizards who have examined the chest have all been completely confounded. 310 Bags har h Lo voi! Chel Ee PRR

name: Bag of Cavernous Interior
description:
**Appearance:** A leather bag with an interior that is much darker and echoey than it should be.

**Enchantment:** This bag is much larger on the inside than it is on the outside. It can easily carry up to 10001bs,, though the bag will not feel a pound heavier even when full to the brim.

**History:** These bags are common among higher ranking adventurers, who often collect more treasure than they can carry. This bag in particular was owned by a mercenary named Olfinius Ironhand, and famously used to pillage the hoard of an ancient green dragon.

name: Easy Burden Backpack
description:
**Appearance:** A simple backpack made from tan leather.

**Enchantment:** No matter how full, this backpack will never weigh more than ten pounds.

**History:** This pack was owned by an adventurer named Melvin, who often suffered from back pain.

name: Bag of Belphinneus
description:
**Appearance:** A small sackcloth bag that has been tied shut with a red ribbon. The name ‘Belphinneus’ has been embroidered on the side.

**Enchantment:** This bag simply cannot be opened by magical or non- magical means. There seems to be something inside, but it’s hard to tell what itis.

**History:** No one is entirely sure where this bag came from. The name of an ancient wizard, ‘Belphinneus’ has been embroidered on the side, but no one knows what's inside. 3m

name: Waterdrake Wineskin
description:
**Appearance:** A wineskin made from a strange, aqua-blue leather.

**Enchantment:** This wineskin can easily hold any liquid. From icy water to caustic acid, even boiling lava can be comfortably transported in this wineskin.

**History:** This wineskin was made from the hide of a waterdrake, after itwas slain by a heroic warrior whose name was forgotten to time. After a ferocious twelve-hour battle, she stripped the dragon of its hide and went on her way.

name: Everlasting Feed Bag
description:
**Appearance:** A horses feed bag, with hooks that allow it to be attached toa horse's bridle.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, this bag fills to the brim with coarse, sweet oats.

**History:** This bag was owned by Stuart Kirkland, a proud noble who enjoyed nothing more than traveling across the kingdom with no one but his horse to keep him company. One evening, he made camp on the side of the road. In the night, thieves stole everything he had, Including his beloved horse.

name: Thief's Coin Purse
description:
**Appearance:** An average coin purse made of red velvet with a golden clasp.

**Enchantment:** Anything put into this bag is immediately transported into the pocket of the attuned user.

**History:** This bag was owned by a devilishly i beautiful thief named Amanda Locks, a woman who 3 was known for seducing men and women out of their A money. She made enough money to take her from NR rags to riches, and no one ever managed to pina {_ N | crime on her. — 312

name: Twin Purses
description:
**Appearance:** A set of blue silken purses, embroidered with white flowers.

**Enchantment:** Anything placed in one bag can be retrieved from the other.

**History:** These purses were owned by a set of twins, who shared everything, They shared their lives, their homes, their meals, even their money. They were together always and, while many deemed it odd, they were content.

name: Bite-Back Bag
description:
**Appearance:** A leather satchel. The mouth of the bag is lined with teeth, and it snaps at /~ anyone that comes close. i Be J

**Enchantment:** This bag contains the soul of \ a dog. It will bite and snap at anyone who N\ comes close, only opening after the user B gain's its trust. Any meat placed inside the bag disappears mysteriously - otherwise, it ja Y behaves as a normal satchel. Fe ER :

**History:** This bag was crafted from the hide ~~ © \: Ry R of a dire hound after it was slain by a % { ‘mercenary. Its soul possessed the bag and bit 7: oat) the mercenary, who felt terrible for killing Co the poor creature. He spent weeks Ser befriending the dog's soul.

name: Cat Bag
description:
**Appearance:** A large, sackcloth bag with a flour company emblem stamped on one side.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, a screaming, yowling cat will frantically claw its way out of the bag.

**History:** No one is entirely sure what this bag is. Common belief is that this bag was some kind of failed experiment of some kind. 313

name: Bag of the Breeze
description:
**Appearance:** A small leather bag that jumps and bounces, as if something is trapped inside.

**Enchantment:** This bag contains a trapped air elemental. When the bag is opened a little, a cool gentle breeze issues out. Once per day, the user can fully open the bag to release a 60ft. cone of gale-force winds.

**History:** Once, there was a wizard who lived atop a beautiful hill. One day, a terrible wind blew across the mountain, nearly ripping his home from the earth. For sixty days, the gale blew, tormenting the wizard to no end. Finally, he'd had enough and he trapped the breeze, which turned out to be a rather feisty air elemental.

name: No-Sprout Potato Sack
description:
**Appearance:** A simple, rough-cut potato sack.

**Enchantment:** Any living thing placed into this bag, be it fauna or flora, will § T= cease growing. le 5 i005 OVATE lS =

**History:** This sack was enchanted by a Qe = farmer, who was tired of his potatoes Ir a B) Yh sprouting in his root cellar. His mother NN was a hedge mage and, using what he Rez learned from her, he crafted his potato [+ J ¥ 7 sack. When he passed, the sack was [Qo «5 NF thrown out with the rest of the rubbish. ~~: W “.&

name: Mulch Sack
description:
**Appearance:** A large sack that is caked with dirt and woodchips.

**Enchantment:** Anything placed inside this bag decays twenty-times faster than normal.

**History:** This sack was carried by a farmer named Hosan Bint. She would pull weeds from her field and toss them into the sack - after an hour or two, the weeds would decay into fresh soil, which she would scatter back over her fields. 314

name: Component Bag
description:
**Appearance:** A pouch made of blue silk, embroidered with the initials RUM.

**Enchantment:** This bag seems empty at first; however, the user can reach in and pull out any spell components they may need. Ingredients can range from ash to bat wings, newt’s tongue or frog eyes, but they can only retrieve items that are valued at less than five gold pieces.

**History:** These bags are given as gifts to every magic-user that graduates from the Royal University of Magic. This bag was given to a young wizard named Gamora Gimmins, the first student to complete the eight-year program in just over four years. He was immediately hired by the Wizard's Guild, where he began his career as a very successful adventurer.

name: Grounds Bag
description:
**Appearance:** A sack the size of a bread loaf. The words ‘Castle Grounds’ have been stamped on the side in red ink, and the bag smells strongly of coffee.

**Enchantment:** The user can place any non-magical, non-living item into this bag. After rolling the bag in their hands for one minute, the item inside will have been reduced to a fine powder.

**History:** This small bag was owned by a small coffee shop called Castle Grounds, where baristas would use the magical bag to grind coffee beans.

name: Bag of Magic
description:
**Appearance:** A small drawstring bag made from bright red canvas.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to pull out confetti, doves, sparks, colored flames, flowers, and other simple tricks at will.

**History:** This bag was carried by Damien Glass, a young man who wanted nothing more than to become a famous street magician. He left home and traveled from town to town on his way to the capital city, performing small tricks for children. 315

name: Ghost Bag
description:
**Appearance:** A bag made of silvery purple satin, fastened with opal beads. A; meer

**Enchantment:** There are hundreds of 8 spirits trapped inside this bag. If it's A N= opened, the spirits will explode out, < brutally attacking anything within 60ft. for = oh one minute before fading into the void. = \

**History:** This bag was used by a “ao _ 2 necromancer who wasn't sure what to do with the souls of his victims. Instead of letting them pass on or remain on earth to haunt him, he decided to seal them away. He intended on released them eventually, but he was killed before he could do so.

name: Whisper Bag
description:
**Appearance:** A flat-bottomed bag made from black leather.

**Enchantment:** When opened, incoherent whispers issue forth out of the dark depths. Anything placed into the bag becomes chilled and slightly damp.

**History:** No one s entirely sure where this bag came from, or who made it.

name: Planar Bag
description:
**Appearance:** A large bag made from heavy blue and silver leather, with thick silver buckles.

**Enchantment:** The bottom of this bag opens up into a different plane. Once per week, the user can utter the command word to change which plane it leads to.

**History:** This bag was crafted by a mysterious merchant named Agatha Bills. She specialized in rare magical items and often had customers in different planes. This bag allowed her to reach through into different planes, making deals with the denizens that live there. 316

name: Waterproof Bag
description:
**Appearance:** A rucksack made from thick leather. It has a peculiar sheen - it aopears perpetually wet, even though it's completely dry to the touch.

**Enchantment:** This bag is completely waterproof. Anything placed inside will remain dry, no matter the circumstances.

**History:** This bag was owned by pirate Captain Eve Wildeye, a brutal ‘warrior known for ambushing ships during terrible storms. She would store her delicate documents and books in this bag to protect them from rain and seawater, and it drifted safely to shore after the Queen's Fleet sunk Wildeye's ship.

name: Doubles Coin Purse
description:
**Appearance:** A coin purse made from olive green leather with golden clasps.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, this bag will duplicate one non-magical item that is placed into the bag.

**History:** Though it is not known who made this bag, it's magic was discovered by a humble beggar who stumbled across the little purse in the street. By placing his single coin into the bag, he managed to double his money. After a few patient weeks, the beggar was able to build a decent life for himself. name: Water Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** A glass bottle full of clean water. A black stone etched with magical runes rattles around in the bottom,

**Enchantment:** This bottle is always full to the brim with fresh, clean water. Once per day, the user can utter the command word to cause a powerful, 15ft geyser of water.

**History:** This bottle was owned by Tom Redfield, a tennis player famous for winning four tournaments in a row. After he retired, his equipment was quickly stolen or purchased by fans and collectors.

name: Bug Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** A wide-mouthed bottle with a peculiar, pale white cork.

**Enchantment:** Bugs placed in this bottle will not suffocate. At the moment, there are two dozen fireflies shining brightly inside.

**History:** A dozen of these bottles were owned by Polly Arnold, a scribe who specialized in researching insects.

name: Bottle of Health
description:
**Appearance:** A small silver flask with a holy symbol etched into the front.

**Enchantment:** When a liquid is placed into the bottle, it becomes a 1d8+4 health potion after 24 hours.

**History:** This bottle was the experiment of Saint Gurathor Bins, a cleric in service to the temple. In his free time, he would often try enchanting objects with rituals read in the temple books. He attempted to channel the holy spirit nto this flask and, while it worked, it didn't have the exact effect he was looking for. ats

name: Spirit Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate golden bottle, etched with hundreds of runes. The cork has been sealed with layers and layers of red wax.

**Enchantment:** The spirit of an ancient demon is trapped inside this bottle. She can communicate telepathically with anyone who holds the bottle, and will grant one wish to the one who frees her.

**History:** The spirit inside this bottle was once a powerful demon, who escaped the clutches of Hell and rampaged across the earth. Desperate to defeat the creature, hundreds of warlocks came together to suppress the demon’s magic, forcing her inside this magical bottle.

name: Blood Bottle ald
description:
**Appearance:** A large, ornate bottle made from bss tarnished silver. The face of a snarling man has = been worked into the front. J It,

**Enchantment:** When this bottle is empty, it on will automatically and painlessly fill with the yz N\, blood of whoever is holding it, causing 1d8 1} 7 io) damage. 4 Rg /( ©

**History:** This bottle belonged to the Third : MH Hand; a cult dedicated to the Unholy God. & Blood was an important part of their dark = wr magic, and bleeding to death was seen as a Sx righteous way to die. ~& 0)

name: Bottle of Mists
description:
**Appearance:** A bottle filled with swirling, mysterious mist.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can uncap the bottle and release a thick fog cloud that completely fills a 20x20ft. space.

**History:** This bottle was carried by Matthis Yielding, a thief who would break into rich homes, filling the house with fog to obscure his movements as he grabbed what he could and made his escape. 319

name: Tasting Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** A small bottle made from gold, inlaid with gems and jewels. It appears to be a plain milk bottle. el However, inside is an intact deck of cards. 3

**Enchantment:** A new, different and sometimes exotic alcohol appears in the bottle once per day. Somehow, there is a deck of cards = inside this bottle. The deck could not have fit through = the mouth of the bottle leaving many confused as to | 2> how it got there. It gives off a faint magical aura. [5 Ds

**History:** This bottle was a gift to a noble, who was known in his circle of friends to have a taste for drinking. Because of its ornate bottle, it was stolen when the house was broken into. 748. Impossible Bottle of Cards #7). fim This bottle was discovered sitting on the RY doorstep of the king's sorcerer. Despite his attempts & to learn the bottle’s origin and owner, nothing turned up. Despite many attempts, no one has been able to ny remove the cards without damaging the bottle.

name: Bottle of Choking
description:
**Appearance:** A glass bottle filled with a nasty, putrid green mist that swirls languorously.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can uncork the bottle releasing a cloud of gas that fills a 20x20ft. space. The gas, which smells putrid and rotten, causes everyone who breathes it to start coughing violently.

**History:** This bottle was originally developed as a means of crowd control on the battlefield, though few were actually used. 320

name: Soul Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate, elegant bottle made from dark blue glass with intricate silver detailing.

**Enchantment:** If a living being dies within 20ft. of the user, they user can utter the command word and funnel the creature's soul into this bottle, where it will remain for twenty-four hours until it fades into the afterlife.

**History:** This bottle was used by the Clerics of Saint Tobias, a group of healers known for their extreme methods. If their patient passed away, they would capture their soul in this bottle, continuing their attempts to heal the body. If they were successful, the soul would return to the body ~ if they failed, the soul would be ritually released into the afterlife.

name: Unbreakable Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** A plain glass bottle with a rune scratched into the side.

**Enchantment:** This bottle is completely unbreakable.

**History:** This bottle was carried by an adventurer named Gladis Gloria, a monk who was tired of breaking her potions when tackling her enemies.

name: Messenger Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** A rectangular bottle made from green glass, with magical runes painted on one side in white paint. P: P Pacat

**Enchantment:** The user can speak into the hand bottle and close the cap. When the cork is H removed or the bottle broken, the phrase will 47 repeat. The user can record a message up to £7 TTT one minute in length. k TT i

**History:** These bottles were often used torelay |¥ | == ) precise messages. This bottle was carried bya |3 = young messenger, who made her living by |: | running packages and messages all over the |: o | city. Fed tess 0 N— 321

name: Banshee Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** A plain glass bottle with mist swirling inside. Occasionally the mist morphs into the face of a tormented woman, who shrieks silently before disappearing. The cork has been sealed with a daub of golden wax.

**Enchantment:** This bottle contains the sealed spirit of a banshee. When the top is removed or the bottle is broken, the banshee will escape and shriek deafeningly, attacking anyone nearby before fleeing.

**History:** Once, there was a young boy. After selling their house in the city, the boy and his family moved out into an ancient manner outin the countryside. The boy felt a chill whenever he was alone in his room and, on the first night, he heard a woman screaming in his closet. Terrified, he told his parents who called for a priest, who sealed the banshee into this bottle and took it away. 0) “Aq ey NC , [5 2) he 1 hy VR mn cde nd SOA. 17 % ( © J "e J . © Gy Ro Seam

name: Bottle of Silence
description:
**Appearance:** A small spherical bottle made of glass with ornate gold detailing.

**Enchantment:** The user can indicate a target within 20ft, and utter the command word. The target becomes silenced as their voice becomes sealed in the bottle. Anything they attempt to say can be very faintly heard inside the bottle. This bottle can be used once per day, and the effects last for ten minutes.

**History:** This bottle was kept in the king's court, and used to silence courtiers who could not hold their tongues. When the king passed and the prince rose to the throne, he had the bottle removed from the court as he believed it to be in poor taste. 322

name: Storm Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** A large spherical bottle with a golden cap. Inside, tiny bolts of lightning stab out of roiling clouds.

**Enchantment:** When the lid is removed or the bottle is broken, a terrible thunderstorm flows up into the sky. The storm will rage for 1d6 hours, with heavy rain and frequent lightning. If opened inside, the storm will fil the available space.

**History:** Once, many years ago, a drought swept across the land. An enchanter crafted a few of these storm bottles for farmers and gardeners whose livelihoods depended on frequent rain.

name: Fireball Cocktail
description:
**Appearance:** A whiskey bottle half-full of an amber, caustic-smelling alcohol. A cloth tag has been shoved into the mouth of the bottle and sealed with wax.

**Enchantment:** When the tag is lit and the bottle thrown, the cocktail will explode into a sticky fireball on impact. It sticks to the target, and burns violently for five minutes.

**History:** This cocktail was originally intended to be a tasty drink, but the bartender soon realized it was too volatile for those with even the strongest constitutions. Troublemakers and mercenaries continued to purchase bottles of the stuff, but few of them intended to drink the brew.

name: Pigeon Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** Along narrow bottle made of weather-beaten blue glass.

**Enchantment:** When a piece of paper is placed into the bottle, the user can speak the name of someone they know. The paper message will disappear with aloud ‘pop’, and appear in front of the chosen individual, no matter how far away they happen to be.

**History:** Bottles such as these are often used by nobles and businessmen who need a reliable and secretive way to send messages. ‘This bottle was owned by a duke named Bellum Groosh, a man who was eventually arrested for conspiracy. 323

name: Bottle of Moss
description:
**Appearance:** A spherical glass bottle that has =], been sealed and filled with water. A small ball of [eT 4 moss rolls happily around on the bottom of the eZ bottle. \

**Enchantment:** This moss ball carries an || . ;, overwhelming sense of calm. When held in one : iy hand, the user gains advantage on all NCYOAB concentration checks and will saves. Se

**History:** This moss ball was lovingly cared for by an elderly wizard named Tabatha Fairwaith, who spent much of her free time meditating. She was known among the mercenary community for having an iron- will and laser focus, which she put to use while hunting bandits.

name: Poisoner’s Flask
description:
**Appearance:** An average silver hip flask.

**Enchantment:** Anything placed inside becomes poisonous after five minutes.

**History:** This flask was carried by an assassin named Jeb Crimps, who would often disguise himself as a guard, noble or commoner, commiserate with his target, then offer them a drink of whiskey.

name: Mist Bottle
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate crystal bottle with a rose gold atomizer.

**Enchantment:** Potions, poisons and other liquids can be placed inside this bottle. When the atomizer is pressed, the liquid is transformed into a cloud of gas that can be breathed. All potions, poisons and magical liquids retain all effects.

**History:** This bottle was originally meant for perfumes, though it quickly became popular among the medical community as a way to administer medicine to uncooperative or unconscious patients. 324 gammy Er Jars poral RT A TT a. ERR

name: Seedling Jar
description:
**Appearance:** A small jar of rich, dark soil.

**Enchantment:** Any seeds placed in this jar of dirt sprout instantly.

**History:** A collection of these simple jars were owned by an herbalist who loved nothing more than tending to her garden. She would sprout seeds in the spring, planting the seedlings as soon as the last frost had passed over the land.

name: Jam Jar
description:
**Appearance:** A small jam jar with a decorative silver lid.

**Enchantment:** Anything edible placed into this jar transforms into a delicious jam overnight.

**History:** This jar was carried by an adventurer named Hammond Yellowtail. After saving a woman from bandits on the highway, the woman, who was on her way to sell her homemade jam at market, gave the warrior a jar as thanks.

name: Lava Beaker
description:
**Appearance:** A thick-walled clay jar, decorated with red and white geometric designs. The inside of this jar appears to be quite scorched.

**Enchantment:** This jar can safely withstand any temperature without breaking or transferring heat.

**History:** Jars such as this are quite common. This one was owned by a scribe, who was very interested in the plane of fire, and would often gather flaming-hot specimens that would shatter any other vessel. 325

description:
**Appearance:** A clay urn with a lid formed into the shape of an eagle's head. ~

**Enchantment:** When the ashes of a cremated AL N creature are placed inside this urn, their soul is <. >. aN immediately reincarnated. % J \ AY A\N

name: Spell Jar
description:
**Appearance:** A decorative jar made from pale, opalescent glass.

**Enchantment:** A single spell can be stored inside. When the jar is opened, the spell is immediately cast.

**History:** This jar was originally designed to carry healing or other beneficial spells to non-magical individuals. This one, however, was purchased by a noble who experienced a string of robberies. He placed an explosive spell in the jar and, when the thief pried the lid off, she was blasted into oblivion.

name: Firefly Jar
description:
**Appearance:** A common jar made of clear glass, with a checkered cloth lid.

**Enchantment:** 2d20 fireflies appear in this jar every day at dusk.

**History:** No one is entirely sure why this jar is magical. It was originally used to store walnuts, but was quickly abandoned when the owner had to consistently remove fireflies from her snacks 326

name: Vacuum Jar
description:
**Appearance:** A large jar with thin wisps of smoke twirling restlessly inside.

**Enchantment:** This jar creates a strong vacuum when opened. Anything pulled inside seems to disappear into thin air.

**History:** This jar was owned by a bakery, who would use the magic to suck up crumbs and ash from the far reaches of the oven. It was quickly tucked into storage after a careless employee accidentally sucked up the bakery’s cat.

name: Everfresh Vase
description:
**Appearance:** A simple vase made of pale blue glass. A magic rune has been skillfully etched into the bottom.

**Enchantment:** When cut flowers are placed into this jar with a little water, the plants will remain bright, vibrant and healthy for months on end.

**History:** This jar was given as a gift to the wife of a noble. She was a beautiful woman of delicate health, though she would make trips into town to buy fresh-cut flowers. The town was so enamored with this woman and her kindness that they gave her this jar, so that she might always have beauty in her life. 327

name: Weather Jar
description:
**Appearance:** A small spherical bottle, sealed with wax. A rune has been skillfully pressed into the wax.

**Enchantment:** This jar always displays the local weather. If itis sunny, a small sun will appear inside the jar. If it is stormy, a small rain cloud will appear, and so on.

**History:** This jar was enchanted by a young noble woman. Her parents insisted that she learn embroidery and calligraphy and other ‘skills every young woman should possess’, but in her free time she would sneak off to the library and read books on magic. name: Scabbard of Cleaning
description:
**Appearance:** A sheath made of dark blue leather, with silver detailing.

**Enchantment:** No matter how dirty the sword is, it is automatically cleaned to a polished shine when sheathed.

**History:** This scabbard was carried by famous headhunter and mercenary, Filamena Fitsgivens, who would often forget to clean her blade after cutting off the heads of her victims. After she retired, she bestowed her sword and Scabbard of Cleaning upon her beloved granddaughter, who wanted to become a caravan guard when she grew up.

name: Bard's Band Case
description:
**Appearance:** A violin case made from fine black leather, with silver latches.

**Enchantment:** This small violin case can magically carry up to five instruments of any size.

**History:** This case was created by a bard named John Songwriter, who traveled with a band of four other musicians. They lived a merry life, traveling from inn to inn with nothing but their horses and a single violin case that carried all of their instruments. The five, who were known as the Damned Five, were devastated when the magical case and all of their instruments were stolen. 329

name: Indestructible Instrument Case
description:
**Appearance:** A hard-shell instrument case made of oak and dark red leather with brass fittings.

**Enchantment:** This instrument case is indestructible - it cannot be crushed, bashed, burned, and it seems to be completely waterproof.

**History:** Once, there was a bard named Oliver Divine, who often strayed through dangerous places to find inspiration for his newest songs. He wandered the world, and even traveled through a number of different planes. While walking through the planes of hell his violin caught fire - devastated, he moved next to the ethereal plane, where he purchased this case 50 he would never suffer such a loss again.

name: Case of Perfect Tune
description:
**Appearance:** A decorative instrument case made from bright red leather, with yellow tassels and silver fittings.

**Enchantment:** Any instrument placed into this case will be magically and perfectly tuned.

**History:** This case was carried by a proud bard named Finbar Boar, who wanted to be prepared to play at any moment. It came in handy when one day, he decided to spend the night in an inn, only to discover the queen herself was residing there. He whipped out his instrument and struck up a tune that pleased her so much, he was immediately hired as a court musician.

name: Scabbard of Many Blades
description:
**Appearance:** A scabbard made from pale leather, with silver fittings and tourmaline gems.

**Enchantment:** Up to five bladed weapons can be magically sheathed in this scabbard, though it only ever appears to hold one blade.

**History:** This scabbard was carried by Girard Holst, a mercenary who specialized in ghost, demon and witch hunting. He carried specialized blades for each type of creature, be ita silver blade, obsidian, holy gold, or even willow-wood sword. 330

name: Ghostly Quiver
description:
**Appearance:** A quiver made from pale brown leather, with elegant red stitching.

**Enchantment:** This quiver is full of ghostly arrows that become solid when grabbed. The arrows remain solid for five minutes before fading away and reappearing in the quiver.

**History:** This quiver was carried by Gauche Elfman, a famously talented archer who roamed the kingdom in search of the legendary Bow of Song. After searching for decades and never finding what he was looking for, Gauche retired to the countryside where he lived the rest of his life in peace. 77 - HR > > wl JAS 1 Va eT, Neo SRE ETE A | Wass men OND Ces

name: Quiver of Eternal Arrows
description:
**Appearance:** A simple quiver made from olive green leather, with yellow leather leaves stitched around the top and bottom.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can pull a leafy, vine- covered arrow from the quiver. Any enemy struck by these arrows will be grappled by frantically growing vines.

**History:** This quiver was designed by an enchanter named Saint Wren Oldivar, a man who was well known for his advances in planar magic. His products are incredibly expensive and coveted, and he lives to this day in a large tower in the south where he continues his experiments to this day. 331

name: Poison Scabbard
description:
**Appearance:** A scabbard made from bright green leather, decorated with long white fangs.

**Enchantment:** Any blade sheathed in this scabbard becomes poisonous for ten minutes after it is drawn again.

**History:** Once, there was a quiet town on the southern coast. Long ago, a huge storm slammed the town and a huge, monstrous serpent was washed far up the beach. It was terribly angry, and attacked the village as thunder and lightning stabbed the sky. A mercenary, who had been quietly sleeping in the inn, was awakened by the serpent’s rage, and fought the beast for hours. Finally, the massive snake was defeated. The local smith crafted this scabbard from the beast’s hide and gave it to the mercenary as a sign of gratitude. 7 =. of Ny a Ia Rp -Us ay td Oi = va E+ —B_e a] LE U > N nt a“ " ee $1)
