Quiver of the Elements
description:
**Appearance:** A quiver decorated with silver fittings. Three gems of yellow, blue and red have been fit in ornate settings around the top.

**Enchantment:** The three gems correspond to the elements fire, frost and lightning. Once per day, the user can switch between these elemental stones. Depending on which stone is chosen, the quiver will imbue the arrows with an additional 1d6 fire, frost or electric damage.

**History:** Long ago, there was a warlock who learned how to crystalize magic. Her name has been lost to time, but she made many of these crystals throughout her life, many of which were used to enchant objects such as this quiver. Due to their rather volatile nature, the warlocK’s life was cut short in a magical accident, and many of the crystals have been lost. 332

name: Mouse's Instrument Case
description:
**Appearance:** This seems to be a miniature 4 9) instrument case, made of black leather. It's no bd bigger than a small loaf of bread. ¢

**Enchantment:** Though this case is very small, any = full-sized instrument can somehow fit easily 5) inside. ee PM

**History:** This instrument case was owned by a traveling bard, who seemed to get on people's bad side with terrifying regularity. After angering a particularly powerful wizard, the bard was forced to shield himself from the wizard's spells with his own instrument case, which shrank to the size of a bread loaf.

name: Waterproof Scroll Case
description:
**Appearance:** A large scroll case made from amber leather, with runes sewn along the seam in blue thread.

**Enchantment:** This scroll case is completely waterproof, and cannot be damaged by non-magical means. A magical, golden aura surrounds the case whenever threatened by non-magical danger.

**History:** This scroll case was carried by Saint Ubar Den, a scribe who would travel far and wide to provide legal services and write letters for everyone who asked.

name: Locking Scroll Case
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy leather scroll case, reinforced with steel ribs.

**Enchantment:** This scroll case can be locked. When the command word is uttered, the user can seta password of their choosing. After the lid is closed, it can only be opened again when the password is spoken aloud.

**History:** This scroll case was carried by Alfie Wolfson, the king's messenger. It was a frightening job, as these messengers were often kidnapped and tortured until they opened the case. However. Alfie was a staunch servant and perished rather than give up the king’s valuable documents. 333

name: Dimensional Writing Case
description:
**Appearance:** A mahogany writing case, filled with blank paper, pens and pots of ink.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, this writing case disappears into its own pocket dimension. When the command word is spoken again, it will pop into existence in front of the attuned user.

**History:** This case was carried by Saint Ubar Den, a scribe who would travel far and wide to provide legal services and write letters for everyone, even those who could not afford it. After he was murdered on the road, the case was discovered by a thief, who used it to smuggle his fake identification papers and all the supplies he used to craft them.

name: Dimensional Scabbard
description:
**Appearance:** A sword scabbard made from navy blue leather, with simple silver fittings. The leather is a little charred and scratched.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, this scabbard and the sword inside simply disappear into their own pocket dimension. When the command word is spoken again, they will pop into existence in front of the attuned user.

**History:** This scabbard was owned by Lady Sunset, a knight who was known far and wide for her just and noble ways. She and her company of soldiers would rescue men, women and children in abusive or dangerous situations, protecting them until they were ready to make it on their own. Lady Sunset never carried her blade at her side, to avoid frightening or provoking people unnecessarily.

name: Razor Scabbard
description:
**Appearance:** A knife sheath made from rough ebony with simple silver fittings.

**Enchantment:** Any knife or dagger placed in this sheath will remain razor sharp.

**History:** This scabbard was given as a gift to a leather-smith, whose blades were always going dull. 334

name: Scabbard of Loyalty
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate, golden sheath with twin rubies set near the top.

**Enchantment:** When a sword is placed into the scabbard, it cannot be drawn by anyone except the attuned user.

**History:** This scabbard was crafted to house the execution blade, a dark and grim sword used by the king when he needed to personally behead someone. Eventually, when the king passed, his daughter refused to carry on the tradition and had the blade stored away, using the blade instead as a symbol of peace.

name: Poisoner’s Case
description:
**Appearance:** A small leather case, filled with an array of bottles labeled with the name of a deadly poison.

**Enchantment:** This case cannot be found on the user’s person. As long as it is tucked away in a backpack or pocket, no frisking or searching will reveal the case's location.

**History:** This case was carried by Ytilda Orenroot, an assassin who was known for poisoning her victims during the night. They would go to sleep as normal, and simply never wake up. She was stealthy, though she was eventually caught when her poison failed to kill a particularly hearty woman. — Ho.

name: Forget-Me-Not Scabbard
description:
**Appearance:** A scabbard made from pale yellow leather, with brass fittings and a large round opal set near the top.

**Enchantment:** When the user’s sword is lost, misplaced, or separated from them in any way, it will magically return to the sheath after ten minutes.

**History:** Once, there was a captain named Garry Thomas. He was beloved by his soldiers, and he was fondly known as ‘Old Sword Flinger’, for his tendency to throw his blade in the heat of battle. 335

name: Vampiric Scabbard
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy sheath made from blood-red leather, with ornate and tarnished silver fittings.

**Enchantment:** This scabbard drinks blood and rewards the user with attack bonuses. When a bloody sword is sheathed in this scabbard, the blade will do an additional 1d6 necrotic damage when next drawn. When a dry sword is sheathed, the scabbard will magically steal the user's blood, doing 1d4 damage every time.

**History:** Once, a terrible red demon broke free from the chains of hell and rampaged across the countryside, draining the blood of every living thing he came across. A brave soldier named Odias Tribbens faced him and, even as the demon was sucking the blood from his body, he plunged his sword into its heart, and was gifted this demon-hide scabbard by the grateful townsfolk. ji fel A St a 2 13

name: Olar’s Medicine Case
description:
**Appearance:** A large medicine box made from dark, polished wood that is rather worn and scratched around the corners. The latch is brass, and inside there are a number of little labeled bottles tucked away into leather loops.

**Enchantment:** This medicine box always seems to have a little bit of everything. Anything needed treat wounds or mundane illnesses can be found inside this box, which never quite seems to run out of medicines.

**History:** This box was carried by Olar, an elderly priest who enjoyed nothing more than walking the country roads, gathering trailside herbs and spending the night in a small town to peddle his services. 336 = re omg 5 A = a Miscellaneous Containers 2 { A -1d10- ETE TR | le E 3 Se BEE if te

name: Fresh Bread Basket
description:
**Appearance:** A basket woven from red pine needles and thick yellow thread.

**Enchantment:** Any bread placed in this basket will remain warm and fresh all day.

**History:** These baskets can be found in every bakery worth its salt. This basketin particular was owned by a little bakery named The Flour Shop, which was known for its amazing raisin bread. P ~ 3 aan dr RY SER 7 NN S . XS ——= Ree a PE

name: Salt Barrel
description:
**Appearance:** A somewhat small barrel made from oak planks. Salt is crusted along the seams.

**Enchantment:** This barrel immediately salts and preserves anything placed inside. This magic only seems to have effect on fruits, vegetables and animal products.

**History:** This barrel was carried in the wagon of Dogarth Steed, a druid who traveled the world, avoiding human contact when possible and exploring the magic that nature had to offer. He would catch and forage all of his food, preserving what he could spare for the harsh winters. 337

name: Air-Flow Barrel

name: Fish Bucket
description:
**Appearance:** A common bucket.

**Enchantment:** This bucket seems completely average. However, when itis filled with water, a fish will appear inside every day at sunset. Fish can range in type and size, but it will always be edible.

**History:** No one is entirely sure how this bucket works or why it came to be. It was owned by a farmer named Dillion Gosh who, whenever questioned about the bucket, would simply say, ‘that’s my fish bucket".

name: Bucket of Clean Water
description:
**Appearance:** A common bucket with a strange black stone bolted to the bottom.

**Enchantment:** Any water placed into this bucket will be purified and perfectly healthy to drink, thought tastes strongly of dirt and wet stone.

**History:** This bucket was ceremoniously used by the Priests of the Well, a temple built around a holy well that was supposedly dug by a goddess when she walked the earth in her mortal form. The bucket was dipped into the well and purified. The priests drank from the well every day, which bestowed holy powers upon them. 338

name: Apothecary Basket
description:
**Appearance:** A wide, flattened wicker basket.

**Enchantment:** Anything placed into the basket dries incredibly quickly.

**History:** This basket was used by an apothecary named Rose Lilson, who tended her overgrown garden with the love of a mother. She would place herbs in her basket and allow them to dry before grinding them into fresh medicines for her loyal customers.

name: Suffocation Barrel
description:
**Appearance:** A common barrel. Red lines of paint circle the barrel at even intervals, and a strange rune has been painted on the lid.

**Enchantment:** When the lid is closed, all of the air in this barrel is immediately sucked away, leaving a nearly perfect vacuum seal.

**History:** Though this barrel was originally used for preserving fish and other goods, its use soon became synonymous with cults, who would often ritualistically suffocate members before entombing the vacuum- packed cobrpse in their temple walls.

name: Terrarium of Sacred Water
description:
**Appearance:** A small glass box, fastened with silver along the seams. Clumps of moss and a tiny venus flytrap are growing contentedly inside.

**Enchantment:** This terrarium remains at a constant state of high humidity, and will automatically water any plants placed inside. Plants seem to thrive inside this small terrarium,

**History:** This box is dimensionally me" 1 _ =) linked to the Sacred Springs, a hot water Hi spring at the base of a volcano known | op sul 93 | © 4 for its healing waters and lush, vibrant HE: H and exotic flora. This box was enchanted _ Zh by a cleric who was enthralled by the | SE = |) unique plant-life, and wished to take a hey Ld Lo > bit of them home to his temple. Se 339

name: Eater-Beetle Basket
description:
**Appearance:** A large basket with a tight-fitting lid. Inside, a hundred large red beetles skitter this way and that.

**Enchantment:** These beetles will eat any soft organic mater placed inside, but will leave bones, seeds and shells pristinely intact.

**History:** These beetles are most commonly used by scribes and researchers who wish to clear the dead flesh from bones in order to study them. This basket, however, was purchased by a farmer who wished to clear away the evidence of her husbands murder before she pawned it off on the black market. px Ti J Bg Ns /% (i ; fl o A ’ 4 ~) Ay a hit sh, 2 by oI fe

name: Basket of Gold-Finding
description:
**Appearance:** A wide gold panning basket made from loosely woven wire.

**Enchantment:** Anything invaluable placed in this basket, such as sand, lead or imitation gold, simply falls through the bottom, leaving only real precious metals and gems behind.

**History:** These baskets are most often seen in banks, allowing them to test the validity of coins and gems. However, this basket was owned by a gold-hunter named Dobias Smitten, who dedicated his life to becoming rich. He spent years panning the mineral-rich rivers of the south. For most of his life, he found nothing, Then, one day, he miraculously panned a fistful of diamonds. Immediately he sold all of his mining supplies and bought a manor, where he lived happily for the rest of his days. 340 Chapter 9 - Trinkets and Knickknacks -1d100- \ . 1 \ ; \ TN @ \) PL ast QQ LAE. name: Hourglass of Time
description:
**Appearance:** A six-inch tall hourglass, filled with white sand that flows strangely.

**Enchantment:** When flipped upside down, time seems to flow backwards. The user can rewind up to one minute of time, once per month. If the hourglass is broken, time stands still for everyone but the user for sixty minutes.

**History:** The sand in this hourglass was taken from the Lake of Time, a rather peculiar spring on a remote island where time seems to flow differently, and occasionally stands still Ese

name: Fednaw’s Familiar
description:
**Appearance:** A masterfully taxidermized tabby cat with mismatched eyes.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, this stuffed cat comes to life. It acts, moves and sounds like a living cat, and will obey the user's commands if it's fond of them.

**History:** This cat once belonged to a wizard named Fednaw. He was an interesting man, rather peculiar in his manner. He specialized in enchantment but, after his beloved cat passed away, he began to dabble in necromancy. He combined the two magics to bring a semblance of life back into his dear friend. 342

name: Broken Watch
description:

name: Purr Stole
description:
**Appearance:** A grey fur stole, speckled with black spots.

**Enchantment:** This stole is perpetually warm, and purrs comfortingly when stroked.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be. —T ly 4 ON in == RY 9

name: Sunset Gem
description:
**Appearance:** A small gem in a velvet-lined box.

**Enchantment:** During the day, this gem appears to be a brilliant ruby. As the sun sets, it fades into a deeply blue sapphire.

**History:** Once, a hundred years ago, there was a bright flash in the sky as a star fell from the heavens. It fell to earth as a ball of fire that many believed to be a sign of the end times. One brave dwarf approached the meteor, and chiseled away the earth to reveal this shining gem that changes with the sun. 343

name: Prayer Flags
description:
**Appearance:** A string of tattered, brightly colored prayer flags.

**Enchantment:** These prayer flags constantly sway and rustle in an invisible breeze. When the weather is particularly windy, a strange low hum fills the air - anyone who hears the hum feels strangely spiritual.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Peculiar Key Ring
description:
**Appearance:** A ring of 1412 hand-filed keys.

**Enchantment:** This object does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Human Hide Journal
description:
**Appearance:** A blank journal bound in crunchy, thin leather.

**Enchantment:** This object does not appear to be enchanted, though it does appear to be made of human skin.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Glass Eye

**Enchantment:** This object does not Ne appear to be enchanted. ~~

name: Backturn Watch
description:
**Appearance:** A brass pocket watch, inscribed with the image of a splashing fish.

**Enchantment:** The hands on this watch only move backwards. An investigation of the internal workings will reveal perfectly average and fully-functional clock gears.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Lord's Nail Clippers
description:
**Appearance:** A set of ornate silver nail clippers.

**Enchantment:** These small nail clippers can easily slice through all mortal materials.

**History:** These nail clippers were owned by a lord named Dawthorn Daws, a drunkard who gave them to a bartender after he didn't have enough gold to pay his tab.

name: Bell Stone
description:
**Appearance:** A fist-sized, light grey river stone.

**Enchantment:** When smacked or knocked sharply, this stone emits a crystalline ringing sound, like a large bell or gong.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Reform Flute
description:
**Appearance:** A fine, crystal drinking flute with an elegantly flared cup.

**Enchantment:** This cup quickly reforms when shattered.

**History:** This cup was one in a set of twelve glasses that reformed when shattered. They were purchased by a lord who was known for throwing rambunctious parties. 345

name: Poison Pen
description:
**Appearance:** A fine pen with a golden nib, and a barrel made from polished redwood.

**Enchantment:** The ink in this pen is incredibly poisonous.

**History:** This pen was created by an assassin whose name has been lost to time. The victim was Pilinor Hum, a scribe famous for a series of rather controversial political papers. He was often seen sucking on the end of his pen, and was eventually found dead with ink on his lips.

name: Statuette of Woman with Vase
description:
**Appearance:** A small marble statuette of a beautiful woman emptying water from a vase. A small, black marble statuette of a beautiful man holding askull

**Enchantment:** Anyone who sleeps within 10ft. of this statuette has the same peaceful dream of a shrine next to a waterfall. Anyone who sleeps within 10ft. of this statuette has the same nightmare of a loved one getting killed in various horrifying ways.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be. a § (XA ] Z 3) 1 7 | { d KH — I HEN AAAS GY) a =n £ > Ts) ir 817. Nightmare Statuette TS No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be. 346

name: Eye Lenses
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of solid black sclera contact lenses in a padded wooden case.

**Enchantment:** This object does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** These eye lenses were commissioned by Horrin Jade, a man who planned on disguising himself as a tiefling in order to gain access to the exclusive Tiefling council. He intended to expose their evil plans, but was severely disappointed when the elders discussed nothing but park funding.

name: Clumsy Cabinet Knob
description:
**Appearance:** A solid gold cabinet knob, wrought in the shape of a decorative leaf.

**Enchantment:** While carrying this knob, the user becomes much more likely to drop things.

**History:** This cabinet was once installed in the house of Dora Tows. No one is exactly sure how or why the knob became magical - some say Dora was cursed by an angry fairy, so all of her cabinets’ knobs would be eternally loose. 347

name: Grapefruit Spoon
description:
**Appearance:** A silver, serrated grapefruit spoon.

**Enchantment:** Everything eaten with this spoon tastes vaguely of citrus.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Spirit Glue
description:
**Appearance:** A small bottle of glue, intended to fasten prosthetics to skin.

**Enchantment:** This object does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Citronella Candle
description:

**History:** This toy was crafted in the off-time of a famous watchmaker. While he enjoyed making watches, and the income that came with it, his real passion lay in tiny toys and unique trinkets. Fire Lyre This lyre was carved from the trunk of the Fire Wood Tree, a huge redwood that was the largest tree in the kingdom. When a fire tore through the forest, the weakened tree fell to the ground. Mourning the loss of such a noble giant, a woodcarver fashioned its body into this lyre.

name: Abigail's Lute of Inspiration
description:
**Appearance:** A lute made from pale wood, with small mother of pearl runes set into the frets.

**Enchantment:** When this lute is played, all allies within earshot gain +1d4 to their 20 rolls.

**History:** This lute belonged to Abigail Finch, a beloved bard who traveled the world, writing songs and delving deep into dangerous dungeons.

name: Unsettling Hurdy Gurdy
description:
**Appearance:** A rather large hurdy gurdy that has been painted with dull, clashing colors.

**Enchantment:** This hurdy gurdy is always slightly off-tune. Its music is decidedly off-putting, and anyone who hears it becomes very unsettled.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be. 374

name: Piercing Violin
description:
**Appearance:** A violin made from a dark wood. Its fittings are gold, and the strings are brightly silver.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can strike a piercing note on this violin. Everyone within earshot takes 2d6 piercing damage, and will begin to bleed from their ears.

**History:** This violin was owned by Davis irard, a battle bard known for his violent music. His music could please, or deafen. His tunes could be danced to, or fought with. His melodies had many ways of bringing tears to peoples’ eyes.

name: Thunder Drums
description:
**Appearance:** A set of small drums, made from dark leather and pale wood. Golden runes have been set into the wood.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can pound on the drums, emitting a tumultuous thunder and causing lightning to strike a single target for 3d12 damage.

**History:** This drum was made from the rare Steelwood - a wood so hard thatit is nearly impossible to cut, let alone carve. This drum was carved using powerful spells over a hundred years ago, and has been carried by many bards since.

name: Perfect Tune Mandolin
description:
**Appearance:** A mandolin, made from blue-gray wood with silver frets.

**Enchantment:** This mandolin is always perfectly in-tune.

**History:** This mandolin was carried by a bard named Frederic Bean, who was always ready and willing to strike up a tune for anyone who had a fancy to listen. 375

name: Jig Clarinet
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate clarinet, with silver runes set into the mouthpiece.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can play this clarinet and select a target. If the target fails a will save, then they will begin dancing, and cannot stop until the music ceases.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be. — SETH ttt, peer) z 3

name: Soul Guitar
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate guitar, with a dozen bone runes set into the fingerboard.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can strike up a sad, gentle tune. Any corpse within earshot will regain its voice, and can be conversed ‘with until the music ceases.

**History:** This guitar was often used in funerals for those who died unexpectedly. It allowed for loved ones to say their goodbyes, for wills tobe settled, and funeral rites discussed, all in a respectful and beautiful ceremony.

name: Magic Hand Fiddle
description:
**Appearance:** A sprightly fiddle made from pale red wood.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can strike up a tune and cast the mage hand spell.

**History:** This fiddle was carried by Beau Fitz, a bard who would entrance her audience with beautiful music, all while stealing their coin purses from right under their noses. 378

name: Lucid Flute
description:
**Appearance:** A silver flute, with ornate charms worked intricately into the metal.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can control a 10ft. cube of water with the ebb and flow of their music. Peculiarly, anyone who hears this music while sleeping will be suddenly stricken with lucid dreams.

**History:** This flute was kept in the Shrine of Water - a sacred fountain shrine. Priests would use the flute to perform daily rituals, until it was stolen by a rogue cleric who left the priestly life to become an adventurer. {= ) [4 =EF > ¥ u 3 Ee B ©

name: Rain Stick
description:
**Appearance:** A rain stick, made from a dried cactus and decorated with bright geometric designs.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, this simple instrument can be used to summon a rain shower that lasts for 1d4 hours. This effect can be used both indoors and outdoors.

**History:** No one knows exactly where this instrument came from, though many believe it was made thousands of years ago, and used by the local priests to summon rain during the dry seasons.

name: Weeping Fiddle
description:
**Appearance:** A waspy haegeum fiddle, with an ebony sound box and silken strings.

**Enchantment:** This instrument sounds incredibly mournful and tortured. Anyone who hears it must struggle to keep from sobbing.

**History:** This instrument is commonly played by Priests of the White Moon, who are known for their ornate and beautiful funerary ceremonies. arr

name: Barbarian Brass
description:
**Appearance:** A French horn, with ornately tied red tassels hanging from the handle. An ocarina that appears to be made from a single stone. A mother-of-pearl rune has been set near the mouthpiece.

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can play this trumpet and select a living target within earshot. The target will become enraged, and wil attack anything nearby for 1d10 rounds. Once per day, the user can control a 5ft. cube of dirt or stone with the ebb and flow of their music.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be. 914, Ocarina Stone Ocarina Stones such as this have been found scattered along the southern coast for hundreds of years. No one knows exactly how these incredibly instruments are made - the process has long been forgotten and so the instruments are quite coveted by collectors. TZ

name: Thousand Melodies Zi
description:
**Appearance:** A melodica, with ivory C= Ps keys and a bright silver mouthpiece. ~ ¢ (= A

**Enchantment:** This melodica can = i) mimic the sound of any other Ae instrument. YW = A

**History:** This melodica was carried by Ce) © Samantha Simmins, a traveling bard == A who was known for her one-man mh comedy shows and cleverly satirical = R songs. EZ if p—— - 378

name: Twin Violin
description:
**Appearance:** A violin made from a strange, dark gray wood.

**Enchantment:** Whenever this violin is played, a second violin will quietly join in with a ghostly harmony.

**History:** This violin is half of a pair. They were owned by twins Diala and Dolan, who played their violins together as if they were one being. When Dolan passed away, Diala played on for a few years before fading away into death herself.

name: Awful Accordion
description:
**Appearance:** A simple accordion. The keys feel a little loose, but it is fully functional,

**Enchantment:** Three times per day, the user can play a terribly off-tune song. Everyone within earshot will instinctually move away from the source of the music.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Ghostly Glockenspiel
description:
**Appearance:** A glockenspiel with dull i silver keys. 4 2. [a=zd)

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user B = can strike a soul-wrenching chord. A Pa ary] | ghostly bard will appear in front of the 2 i et i user, ready to play inspiring music and — i Jf fight alongside the user. 3 i © i

**History:** This glockenspiel belonged to a —al | handsome bard named Vivian be i Beauregard. She was quite the sight, and Pte off many men longed for her hand. But she " i wasn't interested. Instead, she spent her Pan] days writing sad love songs for the [fel To woman she loved, but could never wed. . ~~ N 379

name: Pan Pipes of the Wilds
description:
**Appearance:** A set of pan pipes, bound together with golden thread.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can play an enchanting tune and cause nearby bugs and wild animals to swarm an enemy of their choosing.

**History:** These pipes were carried by Peter, a young farm boy who had a special way with the animals. The local village began to wonder if the boy was human atall, or if he was the human form of the wild god. Soon after the rumors began to spread, the boy disappeared.

name: Sandstorm Sitar
description:
**Appearance:** A sitar made from polished oak wood. Amber runes have been set along the brass frets. A pinch of sand seems to rustle around inside the body of the instrument.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can play a lilting tune on this sitar to summon a powerful sandstorm.

**History:** This sitar was crafted by a merchant named Aarav Ravi, a bard who often wandered the deserts of far-off lands, writing songs about the everchanging dunes and the way the moon played over the sparkling sands. i HH . -. PH PT = CLS Pr Ry

name: Half-Finished Wand
description:
**Appearance:** A yew stick, half carved into an elegant wand.

**Enchantment:** This wand was originally intended to enhance the user's magic. The user has a 50% chance of doing twice the damage. However, if they fail, the enhanced spell backfires and the user takes the damage instead.

**History:** Once, there was a famous wandmaker named Ged Geronius. He had a small shop on the road between the capital city and the sea, and wizards came from all over the world to buy his wares. This wand, however, wasn't even finished before it was stolen by a young girl who was determined to run away from home and become a magician. Things didn't end well.

name: Seer’s Crystal Ball
description:
**Appearance:** A sphere made from cloudy crystal, with a stand made from ebony and red velvet.

**Enchantment:** Anyone who gazes into the ball has a 10% chance of seeing a vision of their future.

**History:** This crystal ball belonged to a talented fortune-teller by the name of Holston Bower, who lived hundreds of years ago. Many believe him to be the most accurate seer of all time, and nobles and kings, lords and ladies would seek out his sage wisdom. After he foresaw his own death, he sold everything he owned and spent the rest of his life in luxury on the southern coast. 381

name: Pen of Poor Dictation
description:
**Appearance:** A voluminous white quill with a silver nib.

**Enchantment:** When directed, this pen will magically begin to dictate everything said by the user. However, most if it is completely misspelled.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be. Te Ye 3 i [AN D MRR ON) Pr = EN [a o FE Sow - B)

name: Isolate Knife
description:
**Appearance:** A wood-carving knife, with a handle made from a strange black wood.

**Enchantment:** This knife does not conduct magic. Magic is completely incapable of passing through this blade.

**History:** This knife was owned by a wandmaker named Ged Geronius. He had a small shop on the road between the capital city and the sea, and wizards came from all over the world to buy his wares.

name: Isolate Gloves
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of thin, silken gloves with runes of negation embroidered into the hem.

**Enchantment:** These gloves do not conduct magic. Magic cannot pass through the gloves, neither from the inside nor the outside.

**History:** These gloves were worn by a noble woman who was secretly the daughter of a red dragon. Her magic was innate and, because she was not taught, she could not control it. Instead of struggling to control the flames that often flared from her fingertips, she decided to wear these gloves, day and night. 382

name: Werther’s Poorly Made Wand
description:
**Appearance:** A crooked wand made from poorly-stained oak. A disheveled feather hangs from the handle.

**Enchantment:** When attempting to casta spell, the user must roll 1d10. -1d10- 1-3. Nothing happens. 4-5. The spell backfires. 6-7. The wand casts a completely different spell. 8-9. The spell is twice as powerful.

name: The wand explodes.
description: **History:** This wand was made by a young woman named Laurel Werther, who wished to become a warlock. However, her family could not afford to send her to school, so Laurel taught herself. She made this wand after studying a guide, and nearly burned the village down after experimenting with it. AEE ®. ® S A @ .

name: Visionary Stones
description:
**Appearance:** A set of amethyst runestones in a black velvet bag.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can toss these stones to the ground. The runes marked upon them will give vague but accurate hints about the user’s future. However, reading them properly can take years of practice.

**History:** These stones were gathered from a riverbed, etched, then used by an elderly woman simply known in her village as ‘The Visionary’. She was a source of wisdom in the community, and many came to her for advice. 383

name: Fool's Casting Stones
description:
**Appearance:** A set of beautiful ruby casting stones ina white velvet bag.

**Enchantment:** When thrown on the ground, the runes on these stones will always give inaccurate predictions of the future, no matter who throws them.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Magic Mixing Bowl
description:
**Appearance:** A shallow silver bowl, with hundreds of small runes etched in a spiral along the bottom.

**Enchantment:** This bowl can be used to mix, combine and create new spells. The user simply casts spells into the bowl, which safely catches and combines the magic. New spells can be created at the game master’s discretion. -1d6- 1-3. Failure. Spell is not created. 4-5. Success. Spell Is created. 6. Success, however the bowl is damaged.

**History:** These bowls are rare and incredibly expensive. They are often destroyed by overzealous wizards, and so can be hard to find. This bowl was owned by a talented alchemist who created many healing spells before retiring.

name: Boil Beaker
description:
**Appearance:** A glass beaker with a slightly charred bottom.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, i=] this beaker will quickly bring any liquid to a boil. HE

**History:** This beaker was owned by Jouston James, a nN HOR traveling alchemist who enjoyed crafting potions and ~~ {t;, " fd experimenting with local substances. 3 384

name: Shatter Sphere
description:
**Appearance:** An empty glass sphere, with a small golden hatch on one side.

**Enchantment:** The user can expend spell slots, filling this orb with up to five spells. The spells will remain in the orb until it is broken - after which, all spells are cast at once.

**History:** Many of these spheres were used in the holy wars. They were handed out to soldiers, who would pelt the opposing armies with spell bombs. Few remain intact, making them expensive and rare.

name: Self-Grinding Mortar
description:
**Appearance:** A well-worn mortar and pestle made from white marble.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, this mortar and pestle will begin grinding herbs on its own.

**History:** This mortar and pestle was owned by an apothecary in a large northern village. She was an eleventh-generation herbalist, and her shop was many of hundreds of years old. One day, she decided she'd had enough herbalism, and sold her shop to pursue her dreams as a bard.

name: Weighted Scales
description:
**Appearance:** A set of brass scales. : A o

**Enchantment:** This A; object does not appear to BF Sr be enchanted; however, ZI one side appears to be ae je heavier than the other. =

**History:** This scale was : used by Mayor Hobart (===) . N Jum, who was arrested for stealing a portion of the a town's yearly taxes. = 385

name: Point Crucible
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy crucible with a large, rough rune carved in the bottom.

**Enchantment:** Anything magical or nonmagical placed into this crucible will melt within 1d10 minutes.

**History:** This crucible was owned by Jouston James, a traveling alchemist who enjoyed crafting potions and experimenting with local substances.

name: Dowsing Rod of Finding
description:
**Appearance:** A golden, collapsible dowsing rod. A dowsing rod made from £¢ copper wire and oak sticks. el

**Enchantment:** This dowsing rod has a 75% chance of successfully leading the user towards their target. This rod will always lead ZA <2 the user towards the nearest source of water. e =

**History:** This dowsing rod was used by Gorran, a fortune-teller and dowser who was commonly believed to be a hack, despite his successes. Because of this belief and his rather sleazy nature, he was usually only hired by those who were desperate enough. ° This rod is hundreds of years old, and was used by the priests of the local church to help farmers dig wells on their land. 386

name: Cauterizing Scissors
description:
**Appearance:** A pair of iron scissors that are a little warm to the touch,

**Enchantment:** These scissors seal the ends of anything it cuts. For example, when herbs are cut, it magically seals the stem to prolong the life of the cutting. When veins are cut, they are quickly cauterized to prevent further blood loss.

**History:** These scissors were developed by an herbalist as a way to prolong the life of herb cuttings, but the design was quickly adopted by doctors and medics in the use of surgery and amputation,

name: Pierce-Less Needle
description:
**Appearance:** A glass syringe withouta needle. The glass barrel is faintly etched with runes.

**Enchantment:** This syringe can deliver medication without piercing the skin. The user must simply press the tip against the patient's skin and press the plunger, and it will painlessly deliver medication into the patient's body.

**History:** This syringe was crafted by a doctor as a way to painlessly give children medication.

name: Purification Bowl
description:
**Appearance:** A wide, shallow porcelain bowl that is sectioned into many little divots surrounding a central dish, much like a flower.

**Enchantment:** When a substance such as water, sand, certain potions, etc, is placed into the center, itis slowly purified and separated into its discrete components.

**History:** This bowl was used by an alchemist, fy ___ ol who would study AMIXTITITSN a farmland soil. Farmers ~~ ("<= NY A> would often hire him = A Ls after their crops failed. dee al 387

name: Eternal Incense Censor
description:
**Appearance:** A decorative incense censor on a chain. A single grain of rice in an ornate glass and gold vial.

**Enchantment:** Anything placed into this censor burns twice as long as it normally would. Though this grain of rice registers as faintly magical, it does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** This censor was owned by a magician, who would often perform long and intricate rituals. It was imperative that the incense keep burning throughout her rituals, as it would be disastrous if they were to burn out. © 3 N ! v Q O de Gao p {4 2 ~ PI keets = Nem (D_ \ (6 \Y = $F PEER, 4 4 y : | AN he ] 388 vl o % 0" o Holy Relics and Artifacts A ed a 5] he 3 1d20- #2 A ¥ 2) / < b i H 3] 9 \Z y © PRY DL IT 941. Saint Armund'’s Rice This grain of rice was the first grain harvested after ten years of drought. Saint Armund came to the suffering land, and wept tears of sorrow on the dry soil. Inmediately, rainclouds filled the sky and wept with the Saint, and the land was dry no more.

name: Amulet of Gold
description:
**Appearance:** A simple holy sigil on a chain.

**Enchantment:** This amulet carries a strong holy aura. It will burn the skin of any demon that lays hands upon it.

**History:** This amulet was kept safe by the Priests of the Valley, who claim that a goddess came down from the sky and blessed this amulet herself.

name: Saint Dahlia’s Teeth
description:
**Appearance:** A set of real human teeth embedded in a heavy, golden skull

**Enchantment:** Anyone who holds this skull is cannot tell a lie.

**History:** These teeth belonged to a woman named Dahlia Buds, a priestess who was known to be able to settle any dispute. She could see to the heart of all matters, and truth arose around her like flowers in the springtime. After her death, she was declared a saint and her teeth were entombed in this golden skull. 389

name: Finger of King Howler
description:
**Appearance:** A gnarled, wrinkled finger in a decorative jar. A large signet ring is stuck on the shriveled finger.

**Enchantment:** This object does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** This finger belonged to King Howler III, who sat on the throne hundreds of years ago. He was quick to anger, and it was common belief that anyone he pointed at would be immediately beheaded. When he was dethroned by an angry mob, he was beheaded and his chopped off his finger. Legend has it that, if the amputated finger points at someone, they will die within three days.

name: Blood of the Sun God
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy, ornate vial with a smear of dried blood inside.

**Enchantment:** Though this vial registers as faintly magical, it does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** Once, there was a handsome man named Claro. He simply showed up in town one day, offering aid where he could and laughing merrily with the townsfolk. No one knew where the lad came from, but his presence was a blessing to the town. Many believed him to be the mortal form of the sun god, though no one can say where these rumors started.

name: Weeping Goddess
description:
**Appearance:** A six-inch statue of a goddess, carved from aged ivory.

**Enchantment:** Tears will pour from the eyes of this statuette whenever itis within one 100ft. of an unholy creature.

**History:** This statue depicts the goddess of the moon; the goddess of purity of heart and intention. The statuette first began to weep when a man came to the temple, begging to be accepted as a priest. The statuette wept in his presence, and the priest refused the man. Ever since that day, new initiates were required to kiss the statuette before they were allowed a priesthood. 390

name: Knife of Saint Bordin’s Blood
description:
**Appearance:** An incredibly old kitchen knife. Occasionally, a drop of blood will drip down the blade.

**Enchantment:** Anyone injured by this blade has a 25% chance of being immediately stricken with a terrible fever.

**History:** Once, there was a priest named Bordin. He was diligent and learned, but one day he fell terribly ill. His fever caused him terrible hallucinations, and during one particularly violent vision, he took up a knife and struck the cleric who was treating him. The other priests were horrified at first, then amazed when the cleric shimmered, revealing his true demonic form. Bordin eventually recovered, and was declared a saint.

name: Heads Up Coin
description:
**Appearance:** An ancient golden coin. A small vial of dark earth on a pr | decorative chain. Er 7

**Enchantment:** This coin always lands heads up. This object does not appear to Y a be enchanted.

**History:** Once, a god walked the earth in the form of a beggar. Everyone passed him by without giving him a second glance, except for one woman - a young lady who tool pity on the disheveled man. She gave him the only coin she had and the god smiled, and blessed the woman. Priests believe this is that very coin. 949. Vial of Holy Soil pa \ ) a 1 This soil was collected from the base of the Twelve Shrines, a sacred place dedicated to the original twelve gods and goddesses. Many people make pilgrimages to / this shrine, and some carry vials of soil asa reminder of their spiritual journey. 391

name: Goblet of Ash - Cursed
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate silver goblet, set with a dozen rubies and as ‘many diamonds.

**Enchantment:** Anyone who drinks out of this goblet will be cursed. From then on, everything they eat or drink will crumble to ash in their mouths until the curse is removed.

**History:** This was the chalice of a proud and vile king. He believed his reign to be perfect, though thousands of citizens starved every day. Innocent men were imprisoned, and crooked tax collectors roamed the land bearing his name. Then a god came to him and cursed him. As long as he was king, everything would turn to ash in his mouth and he would feel the hunger of his people. The king held on for four days until he relented, and gave up the crown.

name: Bread of Plenty
description:
**Appearance:** A greasy, dusty crust of bread in an ornate glass box, decorated with golden vines and ruby flowers.

**Enchantment:** Though this bread registers as faintly magical, it does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** Nine hundred years ago, the kingdom was starving. Droughts wracked the lands, and nothing would grow. The plants were dead and the animals were dying. The kingdom was wasting away. Taking pity on the mournful people, a god descended from the heavens and gave to each citizen aloaf of dark bread. They ate and were full, and it gave them the strength they needed to survive the oncoming days of drought. When the rains finally came, the people rejoiced and gave thanks. . [2 * : Te. . name: Rose's Unwilting Flower
description:
**Appearance:** A perfect rose blossom in a small glass and gold dome.

**Enchantment:** This rose wilts over the course of the day, blooming once again under the light of the moon. ee

**History:** Once, there was a woman named Rose, "+ 4 N who was so beautiful that many believed her { “ presence to be a gift from the gods. Many who E35 looked upon her wept, and were overcome with : emotion. Many asked for her hand in marriage, but hos she refused them all, for Rose was in love with the | _. - priestess, whom she could never marry. She | *. Lt plucked a rose and left it at the steps of the temple. 3 The priestess treasured the flower - legend says fort that the rose will continue to bloom until the two § = Sz | are no longer in love. a =

name: Lock of Saint Oberias
description:
**Appearance:** A lock of white hair in a silver locket, etched with holy symbols.

**Enchantment:** Anyone who wears this locket is immune to fire damage.

**History:** Once, there was a priest named brother Oberias. One day, he was walking down the road when he saw a house in flames. Hearing screaming from inside, he charged into the flames without care for his own safety. Everyone believed him dead; however, moments later he emerged from the flames with a child in his arms. His clothes were burned away and his skin was caked in smoke, but he and the child were completely untouched by the flames. _— 393

name: Gaius's Glasses
description:
**Appearance:** An ancient pair of round-rimmed glasses with scratched lenses.

**Enchantment:** This object does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** Once, many of hundreds of years ago, there was a man named Gaius. He was a scribe, and his eyes often troubled him. Finally, he could no longer read, nor see well enough to write. He prayed to the gods to give him back his sight, so he may continue his work. Legend says that a woman came to him, and removed these glasses from his face. She kissed him on the forehead and, in that moment, his eyesight was returned to him.

name: Bowl of Need
description:
**Appearance:** An ancient wooden bowl.

**Enchantment:** When held, the bowl can sense what the user truly needs. If itis something simple and nonmagical, such as a bowl of soup ora needle and thread, it appears quietly in the bottom of the bowl, as ifithas been there all along.

**History:** Once, there was a beggar who was sitting along the city streets. He was gaunt and hungry, and had nothing but a wooden bowl to his name. A goddess was walking along the road - seeing the beggar's suffering, the goddess touched the bowl with one elegant finger. It filled ‘with hearty soup, and the beggar never went hungry again.

name: Holy Water
description:
**Appearance:** Alarge bottle of holy water with a golden cap. Aloose holy sigil sits in the bottom of the bottle.

**Enchantment:** A simple vial of holy water.

**History:** Holy water can be purchased at almost any church or temple. This ornate bottle was carried by Godiva Dahl, a superstitious noble woman who was known for constantly crossing herself with holy water. 304

name: Seven Rivers Scroll
description:
**Appearance:** An ancient scroll sealed in an ornate gold and glass tube.

**Enchantment:** Though this scroll registers as faintly magical, it does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** Legend says this scroll was one of the three scrolls delivered to the Head Priest Junna thousands of years ago. Since then, this sacred artifact was kept in the capital city sepulcher, but the scroll along with many other holy treasures were stolen by a thief posing as a clerical scribe ten years ago. name: Book of the Unholy Prince
description:
**Appearance:** A large, ancient book that looks as if it may fall apart at any moment. It has been carefully wrapped in white canvas, and inside the pages are covered in archaic and crammed sigils. It appears to be slightly charred and water stained.

**Enchantment:** This book carries a faintly unholy and malicious aura. Nothing can harm this book.

**History:** Legend says this book was the sacred scriptures of the Unholy Prince - priests have been trying to destroy this book for hundreds of years, though nothing could scrub the evil words from the world. Instead, they sealed it in an iron cage beneath the church, where it was eventually stolen by an unknown thief. 305

name: Lamp of the Sun
description:
**Appearance:** An archaic brass oil lamp, with a small blue flame flickering inside.

**Enchantment:** The flame in this oil lamp cannot be snuffed out. It will burn for eternity.

**History:** Once, hundreds of years ago, the moon passed over the sun and cast the world into darkness. Everyone was terrified, believing it to be the end of the world. The priests lit an oil lamp and prayed - to their awe, the lamp never went out. Two days later, the sun re-emerged and the lamp was left to burn for all eternity. , & . A Nye : . name: Laurels of Saint Ivy
Lucky Cricket hi
description:
**Appearance:** A small black cricket in a bamboo cage, filled with leaves and decorative stones.

**Enchantment:** Anyone who carries this cricket will have good luck.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to e. —— TE

name: Fast Grow Seeds
description:
**Appearance:** 1420 assorted seeds in a paper packet.

**Enchantment:** When planted, a random plant will grow fully in 1d20 minutes. -1d10-

name: Basil. 10. Orchid.
description: **History:** These seeds were enchanted by an herbalist who dabbled in magic. She would often sell her patients seeds, so they could grow their own medicine at home ata far cheaper price. 397

name: Living Hoya
description:
**Appearance:** A healthy . 3 hoya plant in a terracotta ® i 3 pot. NO Sn Ta wy AG 7

**Enchantment:** This plant SAE, = LOZ Vout Mo seems to be sentient. It FOL hy ENE hte } sways, moves and squeaks Td in reaction to things. After a . NI while, the user will begin to cB understand the plant's Ee > meaning. Must be watered - twice a month.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Liar's Leaves
description:
**Appearance:** Ten healthy green oak leaves in a small bag.

**Enchantment:** When a leaf is placed into the palm of someone's hand, it will immediately wilt after they tell a lie.

**History:** Liar's leaves are an ancient magic used by the people of the temperate southern islands. When someone was suspected of committing a crime, they were brought before an elder and a liar's leaf placed into their hand. If they were honest in their innocence, they were released. If they were lying, they would be punished appropriately.

name: Basket of Tranquility
description:
**Appearance:** A small, simple wicker cage containing a single lovely lotus flower and a languorous praying mantis.

**Enchantment:** While carrying this cage, the user gains advantage on all concentration rolls.

**History:** Small baskets containing peaceful plants and bugs are often carried by the Priests of the River, who specialized in meditation and awareness of the world around them. 398

name: Jar of Bees rN
description:
**Appearance:** A jar of 2d100 bees. Ye

**Enchantment:** When released, the bees will [:&g¢ ¥ swarm. The user can command the bees for one | ®c2s CA hour if they know the command word. Sr

**History:** No one knows where this object came | # #® from, or why it came to be. hp

name: Photosynthesis Wreath
description:
**Appearance:** A laurel wreath made from large healthy leaves.

**Enchantment:** The leaves in this wreath flourish in the sunlight. When worn in the sun, the user regains 1d8 hit points per hour. This wreath also changes to reflect the current season.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Stick Bug of Disguise
description:
**Appearance:** A long, lazy stick bug in a jar.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can blend in perfectly with their surroundings. The effect lasts for ten minutes.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Grasshopper of Jumping
description:
**Appearance:** A large, chunky grasshopper in a jar.

**Enchantment:** When carried, this jar allows the user to jump three times their normal jumping distance.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be. 399

name: Jar of Butterfly Swarm
description:
**Appearance:** A beautiful monarch butterfly in a jar. A set of two bone dice.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, this jar allows the user to transform into a swarm of butterflies. The effects last for one hour, or until the user decides to revert back to their original form. These dice have an 80% chance of rolling sevens.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be. NEL > El . w “Ae. . . (7 & ~.s WAS /, oF EOS p 1 ak | py N\ Te: ° a SENG 00 AR \ CA o- fer, 8, i {I real t [Dow WY i 400 Cards, Dice and Gaming . -1d10- FA RQ Tm A AYN o GAY \x > & ages oIN AS yr 971. Lucky Sevens Dice > These dice were carried by Oberon Throws, a famous craps player. Many believed he was a cheater, though no signs of magic were ever detected on his person. Some believe that his natural luck rubbed off on these dice, which he carried with him everywhere,

name: Honest Cards
description:
**Appearance:** A set of playing cards, with the image of a winking sun on the back of each card.

**Enchantment:** These cards cannot be used to cheat, no matter how hard one tries.

**History:** These cards are commonly found in large gambling dens to keep the players honest.

name: Tarot Cards
description:
**Appearance:** A set of well-worn and beautifully illustrated tarot cards.

**Enchantment:** Once per day, the user can randomly draw a tarot card. The card drawn will somehow indicate the user's future.

**History:** These cards were owned by Madame Onarra Sigh, an elderly fortune-teller who owned a shop along the west-coast docks. After many years of telling fortunes, she drew The Tower. Understanding what that meant, she passed her shop on to her apprentice and died in a terrible accident the next day. 401

name: Magician's Cards
description:
**Appearance:** A set of apparently common playing cards.

**Enchantment:** When attuned to Ie this deck of cards, the user can ZANE A) 7 telepathically sense which card is {\ A FN which without seeing them. IY) SNR fing NIA

**History:** These cards were owned =f by Simon Samuel, a street magician =f Lardd who made his money by &=7/RE performing ‘magical card tricks’ ASA that, more often than not, would = = fool onlookers out of their coin.

name: Complicated Card Game
description:
**Appearance:** An interesting card game, with ten sets of twelve cards and a folded instructional pamphlet.

**Enchantment:** Though this card game does not register as magical, itis incredibly complicated. The user only has a 10% chance of successfully learning the rules of the game.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Lucky Dice
description:
**Appearance:** A set of brightly polished ivory dice.

**Enchantment:** Though these dice do not register as magical, they are incredibly lucky. The user has a 70% chance of rolling the best numbers possible.

**History:** These dice were owned by a casual gambler named Sarah Trout. At first, the other players chalked it up to beginner's luck. However, as she continued to win, their jokes turned to suspicion. She was soon kicked out of the gambling den, but not until after she'd racked up thousands in winnings. 402

name: Unlucky Dice
description:
**Appearance:** A set of bone dice stained with age.

**Enchantment:** These dice are incredibly unlucky. The user has a 90% chance of rolling the worst numbers possible.

**History:** These dice were owned by an amateur dice player, who wanted nothing more than to make it big at the gaming tables. Within his first hour of play, he lost everything he had to his name, right down to the clothes on his back.

name: Strange Tarot Cards
description:
**Appearance:** A set of strange tarot cards in a system no one has seen before, written in a language that no one can read.

**Enchantment:** This object does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Single Player Chess Board
description:
**Appearance:** A small chess board in a traveling case.

**Enchantment:** Allows the user to play chess against a ghostly, invisible opponent.

**History:** This chess board was owned by a bard, who was often alone on the road for weeks at a time.

name: Shuffling Cards
description:
**Appearance:** A set of expensive luxury playing cards.

**Enchantment:** These cards will float magically in the air, shuffling themselves before automatically dealing out to the players.

**History:** These cards are usually only found in the households of nobles. This set was owned by a woman named Guntha Juniper, who was known for her love of card games and champagne. 403 AN Maps, Compasses and Navigation EAP IES -1d10- bt AH ROR BR —_— =I me

name: Cloudless Sextant
description:
**Appearance:** A simple brass sextant in a leather case.

**Enchantment:** When gazing through the scope, the user can peer through all obstacles such as clouds, roofs or light tree cover, allowing them to get a grasp of their location no matter the conditions.

**History:** This sextant was owned by a captain of the merchant vessel Pride, that often sailed along tropical, rainy coastlines.

name: Loyalties Map
description:
**Appearance:** A map of the world, with sections of land color-coded by territorial rights.

**Enchantment:** This map changes, updating as kingdoms take over different territories.

**History:** This map was owned by the king's battle commander, many decades ago when war ravaged the land.

name: Makeshift Compass
description:
**Appearance:** A small sealed jar. Inside, a needle in a cork floats lazily around in two inches of water. It is functional, if a bit finicky.

**Enchantment:** Though this compass registers as faintly magical, it does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be. 404

name: Driver's Map
description:
**Appearance:** A map of the kingdom, with all the roads marked in bright red ink.

**Enchantment:** The user must simply state where they wish to go, then tap the map firmly. The quickest route to their destination will become highlighted in gold. This only works for commonly known locations,

**History:** Because of the difficulty in enchanting such a map, very few of these were ever made. They were owned by rich merchants and cab drivers — this map in particular belonged to the driver of a rich lord, who was quite fond of him.

name: Standfast Compass
description:
**Appearance:** A heavy silver compass with a crystal face. Hy

**Enchantment:** This compass cannot be affected by magnetic fields, magic, or any 7. N other outside forces. ho ) € )

**History:** This compass was carried by a \ i battlemage who specialized in lightning ° Ke Es ‘magic. She bought this compass, tired of her ~, NS magic interfering with her navigation. faa

name: Explorer's Map
description:
**Appearance:** A large, completely blank map.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is spoken, the map will automatically begin to fill out as the user explores the area. This map can record a five-hundred-by-five-hundred-mile square of land before itreaches the borders of the paper.

**History:** These maps were enchanted and carried by Frostwaith Harra, a well-respected cartographer. While she loved exploring more than life itself, she detested sitting down to draw maps. 405

name: Erratic Compass
description:
**Appearance:** A simple brass compass. The needle darts this way and that, seemingly at random.

**Enchantment:** Though this compass registers as faintly magical, it does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Follow-Your-Heart Compass
description:
**Appearance:** An ornate golden compass with rubies set into the face.

**Enchantment:** This compass points in the direction the user believes to be north.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Cyclical Compass
description:
**Appearance:** A sturdy, finely made compass. The needle simply spins in circles at varying speeds.

**Enchantment:** This object does not appear to be enchanted.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Perfect Sense Compass
description:
**Appearance:** A simple, elegant silver compass.

**Enchantment:** While this compass is on the user's person, they will ‘have a perfect and consistent sense of direction.

**History:** This compass was given as a gift to the son of a lord. The boy had a terrible sense of direction, and was constantly getting lost even in the familiar streets of his home city. Partly practical, partly prank, his father had this compass enchanted for the boy's birthday. 406 Furniture [Ne — Pra 0} Teatit jo Cn

name: Foldable Bed
description:
**Appearance:** A small wooden cube. When activated, it appears to be a large, luxurious four-poster bed.

**Enchantment:** At first, this item appears to be a small wooden cube. When the command word is spoken, it quickly inflates into a large, heavy, beautiful four poster bed. When the command word is uttered again, the bed returns to its small cube form.

**History:** These items were created for nobles who were forced to travel long distances or spend a lot of time on the road, so they would never be without their creature comforts.

name: Pet Fence
description:
**Appearance:** A folded, foot-tall high fence made of golden wire.

**Enchantment:** Common, non-sapient creatures cannot pass over this small golden fence. An invisible wall of magic seems to prevent them from going over, no matter how hard they try.

**History:** This fence was commissioned by a noble, who loved nothing more than his tiny, pampered, perfectly-bratty dog. He would take the pup out on trips to the countryside, where he would set up this little fence and allow the dog to roll around in the fresh grass to her little heart's content. 407

name: Foldable Armchair
description:
**Appearance:** A small wooden cube. When activated, it appears to be a large, luxurious armchair. ey A small wooden cube. When activated, it appears to be a large dining table made from beautifully polished mahogany. The surface of the table is a little scratched, and circular burn marks mar the otherwise perfect surface.

**Enchantment:** At first, this item = re appears to be a small wooden cube. ( { | When the command word is spoken, LY it quickly inflates into a large, heavy, Ie » Ee) beautiful armchair. **History:** These items were created for nobles who were forced to travel long distances or spend a lot of time on the road, so they would never be without their creature comforts. 994, Folding Table These items were created for nobles who were forced to travel long distances or spend a lot of time on the road, so they would never be without their creature comforts. However, this table was owned by a traveling magician, who refused to work on anything other than the finest wooden table. 408

name: Chest of Hunger
description:
**Appearance:** A large chest made from polished oak, with heavy silver latches. A faint growling, like that of a dog, seems to emanate from inside.

**Enchantment:** When this chest is opened, the user can clearly see two sets of sharp teeth along the edges of this chest. If the chest is opened by someone unfamiliar, it will attempt to bite them. The user must feed the chest meat or blood on a regular basis in order to gain its favor.

**History:** This chest was designed by an elderly wizard, who was very afraid of his apprentices stealing his most valuable secrets.

name: Armchair of Easy Passing
description:
**Appearance:** A soft armchair that looks incredibly comfortable and incredibly inviting.

**Enchantment:** Anyone who sees this chair must roll a will save, or else they will feel compelled to sit down. Once seated, they quickly become sleepy and peaceful as the armchair slowly, ever so slowly, starts to consume them. After one hour, the user will be completely consumed. If another person attempts to remove the sleeping user from the chair, they will find that the user's skin has adhered to the surface of the armchair.

**History:** No one knows where this object came from, or why it came to be.

name: Following Stool
description:
**Appearance:** An ornately upholstered stool made from polished oak.

**Enchantment:** This stool will squeak and yip like a small dog as it walks behind the user at a respectful distance. The user can utter the command word, causing the stool to sit, stay, follow, or come closer.

**History:** This stool was owned by Rognar Booth, a noble who tired easy and often needed to sit down. This stool would follow him everywhere he went, even out into town. 409

name: Study Lamp
description:
**Appearance:** A table lamp with a colorful glass shade.

**Enchantment:** When the command word is uttered, this lamp will float gently off the table and follow just behind the user's shoulder, casting light on them wherever they go.

**History:** A few of these lamps can still be found in the royal library, where they are often used by those studying or working late through the night.

name: Clap Lamp
description:
**Appearance:** A seemingly simple oil lamp with a colorful glass shade.

**Enchantment:** The user must simply clap twice to lit or extinguish this lamp.

**History:** These lamps are exceptionally popular among the aged lords and ladies, who disliked getting out of the warm safety of bed to extinguish candles before bed.

name: Dimensional Drawers
description:
**Appearance:** A chest of drawers made from polished ebony, inlaid with mother-of-pearl runes.

**Enchantment:** This chest of drawers reeks of dimensional magic. When the attuned user snaps, the drawers and everything inside disappear into a bubble dimension, where they are safe from all but the most powerful dimension hoppers. When the user snaps again, the drawers pop into existence right in front of them.

**History:** These drawers were enchanted by a very powerful warlock, who drifted through dimensions like a bird drifting through clouds. He needed a way to keep all of his possessions close at hand, and spent two years crafting this incredibly magical, incredibly volatile, incredibly expensive chest of drawers. 4) A T_T OE © 0 410 & NSP = NSF =i 412 About the Author Madeline Hale was born on the west coast of Michigan during the coldest part of the year. Most sentient items are weapons. Other kinds of item
can manifest sentience, but consumable items such as
| potions and scrolls are never sentient
i Sentient magic items function as NPCs under the
DM's control. Any activated property of the item is
under the item's control, not its wielder's. As long as
the wielder maintains a good relationship with the
item, the wielder can access those properties normal
If the relationship is strained, the item can suppress.
its activated properties or even turn them against
the welder.
